Authors: Rajaei A., Rangarajan L.
Title: Classification of radiology images using histogram and moments of segmented region
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Manasagangothri, Mysore-570 006, Karnataka, India
Authors with affiliations: Rajaei, A., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Manasagangothri, Mysore-570 006, Karnataka, India; Rangarajan, L., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Manasagangothri, Mysore-570 006, Karnataka, India
Abstract: In this paper, we present a method for classification of medical radiology images. Canny edge is used to segment the body organ of the images. The feature namely histogram is extracted from the largest segmented region. Moreover, few central moments are also computed from the histogram feature. We employ K-Nearest Neighbor classifier to classify radiology imaging modalities as X-ray, MRI and CT. Experiments are conducted on medical database containing 4,500 radiology images. We achieve 97.28% classification accuracy which presents the efficiency of our proposed approach.

Authors: Chethan H.K., Hemantha Kumar G., Ranjit K.N.
Title: An approach towards illumination reduction and comparative analysis of feature extraction methods for camera captured documents
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Karnataka 570006, India
Authors with affiliations: Chethan, H.K., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Karnataka 570006, India; Hemantha Kumar, G., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Karnataka 570006, India; Ranjit, K.N., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Karnataka 570006, India
Abstract: When acquiring document image using portable camera like mobile and other devices like HIDs (Hand Held Imaging Devices) in uncontrolled environment, will often exhibits various forms of distortions to captured image, Which degrades the data quality of the image due to illumination. Therefor, Preprocessing and feature extraction are very important steps for the classification. In this paper, We propose a novel methodology for Illumination correction and data quality improvement for captured documents. The proposed methodology uses Homomorphic and Morphological filtering techniques to reduce illumination in the pre-processing step and later a comparative analysis of different feature extraction method was performed to select the best feature extraction method for Camera captured documents and finally we employ Multiclass SVM for classification which gives high recall rate. Experimental results on captured documents shows that results obtained are encouragingly reliable, effective and efficient compared with the existing proven methodology.

Authors: Bhat G.V., Achary K.K.
Title: Face recognition with single training image per person using 2DLDA in DCT space
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Dept. of Electronics, Canara Engineering College, Mangalore, Karanataka, India; Dept. of Statistics, Mangalore University, Managalagangothri, Karanataka, India
Authors with affiliations: Bhat, G.V., Dept. of Electronics, Canara Engineering College, Mangalore, Karanataka, India; Achary, K.K., Dept. of Statistics, Mangalore University, Managalagangothri, Karanataka, India
Abstract: Face recognition methods based on two-Dimensional Linear Discriminant Analysis (2DLDA) have been used for feature extraction in face recognition problem in the past decade, a modified version of this algorithm (modified-2DLDA) has been recently proposed for scenarios where there is single training image per person. In this paper, we evaluate the performance the modified-2DLDA in the weighted low frequency Discrete Cosine Transform (DCT) domain under single image training sample per person scenario. In the proposed method the dimensionality of the original face image is reduced by using the mid-frequency coefficients of 2D-DCT for feature extraction of face images. Next, the selected features are classified using modified-2DLDA. Experiments on the four standard face database show that modified-2DLDA evaluated in low frequency two-Dimensional DCT (2D-DCT) domain is much more accurate than spatial domain. Furthermore, it is shown that the accuracy of the algorithm can be further improved by weighing the low frequency 2D-DCT coefficients using a 2D-Gaussian function.

Authors: Gupta S.
Title: Analysing expert system mechanism
Source title: Proceedings of the 2011 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Information Technology, Maharaja Surajmal Institute Of Technology, Guru Gobind Singh Indraprastha University, New Delhi, India
Authors with affiliations: Gupta, S., Department of Information Technology, Maharaja Surajmal Institute Of Technology, Guru Gobind Singh Indraprastha University, New Delhi, India
Abstract: No matter which area of business one is engaged in, expert systems can be used to fulfill the need for higher productivity and reliability of decisions. Expert systems are most valuable to organizations that have a high-level of know-how experience and expertise that cannot be easily transferred to other members. They are designed to carry the intelligence and information found in the intellect of experts and provide this knowledge to other members of the organization for problem-solving purposes. An expert system is a set of programs (or a software) that manipulates encoded knowledge to solve problems or uncertainties in a specialized domain that normally requires human expertise. An expert system in essence captures the life-time experience of knowledge domain experts and reasons through this knowledge to solve problems. Today, when there is an increasing need for producing optimal and consistent solutions to problems in organizations, expert systems can make a significant contribution by making expertise available to the decision makers and technicians who need reliable answers quickly. This technical paper aims at providing an insight into the underlying technology of an expert system. Deployment of expert systems for financial analysis and air traffic management have been chosen to illustrate the techniques employed by an expert system in problem solving.
Author Keywords: Air traffic management; Expert systems; Financial analysis; Knowledge domain experts
Index Keywords: Air Traffic Management; Decision makers; Financial analysis; Human expertise; Knowledge domains; Life-times; Problem solving; Technology transfer; Expert systems

Authors: Dongre V.B., Gandhi R.S., Ruhil A.P., Gupta R.K., Singh R.K.
Title: Prediction of first lactation 305-day milk yield based on weekly test day records using artificial neural networks in Sahiwal Cattle
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Animal Genetics and Breeding, Division of Dairy Cattle Breeding, National Dairy Research Institute, Karnal-132001, India; Division of Dairy Cattle Breeding, National Dairy Research Institute, Karnal-132001, India; Computer Centre, National Dairy Research Institute, Karnal-132001, India; Livestock Production and Management Division, National Dairy Research Institute, Karnal-132001, India
Authors with affiliations: Dongre, V.B., Animal Genetics and Breeding, Division of Dairy Cattle Breeding, National Dairy Research Institute, Karnal-132001, India; Gandhi, R.S., Division of Dairy Cattle Breeding, National Dairy Research Institute, Karnal-132001, India; Ruhil, A.P., Computer Centre, National Dairy Research Institute, Karnal-132001, India; Gupta, R.K., Livestock Production and Management Division, National Dairy Research Institute, Karnal-132001, India; Singh, R.K., Animal Genetics and Breeding, Division of Dairy Cattle Breeding, National Dairy Research Institute, Karnal-132001, India
Abstract: In the present study, first lactation 305 day lactation milk yield (FL305DMY) was predicted by back propagation artificial neural network using weekly test day milk yields records of 593 Sahiwal cows. A total of six test day milk yields were used in neural networks to train using three back propagation algorithms viz. Bayesian regularization (BR), scaled conjugate gradient (SCG) and Levenberg-Marquardt (LM). Results showed that the prediction accuracy of all the models were increased with the addition of test day milk yields as input variables. Comparison of different algorithms revealed that performance of Bayesian regularization was better than others. The neural network models were able to predict FL305DMY with more than 80% accuracy at an early stage i.e. by 18th week of lactation. Further comparison was made between MLR and ANN for prediction accuracy and was empirically found that ANN was better that MLR for prediction of FL305DMY in Sahiwal cows. Therefore, it is recommended that ANN should be used for prediction of FL305DMY in Sahiwal cows.
Author Keywords: Artificial neural networks; Back propagation networks; First lactation 305-day milk yield; Sahiwal cow; Weekly test day records

Authors: Vani V., Pradeep Kumar R., Mohan S., Livingston E.
Title: Application and evaluation of Open Wonderland in constructing web based 3D Virtual World: A case study
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of IT, Dr. N.G.P. IT, Coimbatore, India; Department of CSE, Adithya IT, Coimbatore, India; Department of CSE, Dr. N.G.P. IT, Coimbatore, India; Karunya University, Coimbatore, India
Authors with affiliations: Vani, V., Department of IT, Dr. N.G.P. IT, Coimbatore, India; Pradeep Kumar, R., Department of CSE, Adithya IT, Coimbatore, India; Mohan, S., Department of CSE, Dr. N.G.P. IT, Coimbatore, India; Livingston, E., Karunya University, Coimbatore, India
Abstract: Today 3D Virtual Worlds are used for many applications. They are used in education, games, online 3D chatting, virtual conferencing and in many more applications. Over the last few years, the number of virtual reality users is increasing in a rapid rate. Unlike web conferencing, phone calls, or video communication, virtual world technology enables multiple simultaneous activities. This makes virtual worlds more like the real world than any other communication technology. Many tools and technologies support the creation of 3D virtual world. One of such tools is Open Wonderland (OWL) which has taken an edge over any other tool because of open source research community. Open Wonderland is a hundred percentage Java tool specifically developed for the creation of 3D immersive virtual worlds. This paper explores the possibility of creating a web based 3D world in a multiuser virtual environment. An investigation has been made to study the performance metrics in a real time environment. A case study on creation of a 3D Virtual world of 'International Prayer centre (IPC)' called Bethesda, using Open Wonderland with necessary customization of Java, Java 3D API(J3D) and Java Media Framework(JMF) shows that the proposed work can effectively be used for constructing web based 3D virtual world in a multiuser environment. The performance of Open Wonderland is evaluated based on the implementation of 3D virtual world.

Authors: Arya K.V., Pal K.
Title: An efficient face recognition system using ICA and moment invariants
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: ABV-IIITM, Gwalior-474010, India; Future Institute of Engineering and Technology, Bareilly - 243001, India
Authors with affiliations: Arya, K.V., ABV-IIITM, Gwalior-474010, India; Pal, K., Future Institute of Engineering and Technology, Bareilly - 243001, India
Abstract: This paper presents the integrated approach of independent component analysis (ICA) and moment invariants (MI) method for face recognition. Firstly, ICA is used for extracting global features of the face image for finding the minimum error. If error is less than the given threshold then the system will accept the face image using the classification results otherwise the moment invariants method is used for the local feature analysis of the face image for improving the recognition rate over ICA. The experiments have been carried out using ORL face database and IIT Kanpur face database and the results show that the proposed method is robust.

Authors: Guru D.S., Mallikarjuna P.B., Manjunath S., Shenoi M.M.
Title: Cured tobacco leaves grading: An approach based on inter-valued data
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Studies in Computer Science, Manasagangothri, University of Mysore, Mysore-570006, Karnataka, India; Central Tobacco Research Institute, Research Station, Hunsur-571105, Mysore, Karnataka, India
Authors with affiliations: Guru, D.S., Department of Studies in Computer Science, Manasagangothri, University of Mysore, Mysore-570006, Karnataka, India; Mallikarjuna, P.B., Department of Studies in Computer Science, Manasagangothri, University of Mysore, Mysore-570006, Karnataka, India; Manjunath, S., Department of Studies in Computer Science, Manasagangothri, University of Mysore, Mysore-570006, Karnataka, India; Shenoi, M.M., Central Tobacco Research Institute, Research Station, Hunsur-571105, Mysore, Karnataka, India
Abstract: In this paper, we propose a new model to grade cured tobacco leaves using symbolic data. Color features such as average and standard deviation of hue of tobacco leaves are extracted using the Munsell color system. The extracted features of each grade are aggregated and represented in the form of inter-valued type data and stored in the knowledgebase. For a given test sample of a cured tobacco leaf, the features which are of crisp type are extracted and compared with the representatives stored in the knowledgebase. A symbolic classifier has been used for comparison purpose. In order to corroborate the efficacy of the proposed model, we have conducted experimentation on our own dataset consisting of 887 sample images of 12 different grades of cured tobacco leaves. We have studied the effect of grading accuracy under varying size of database and achieved an average grading accuracy of about 91%. We have also presented a qualitative comparative analysis of the proposed model with other state of the art models to study the elegance of the proposed model.

Authors: Nanda P.K., Sucheta P.
Title: Color image segmentation using Constrained Compound Markov Random Field Model and homotopy continuation method
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Dept. of Electronics and Communication Engineering I.T.E.R, Siksha 'O' Anusandhan University, Jagmohan Nagar, Khandagiri Bhubaneswar, Orissa, India; Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Padmanava College of Engineering, Rourkela, Orissa, India
Authors with affiliations: Nanda, P.K., Dept. of Electronics and Communication Engineering I.T.E.R, Siksha 'O' Anusandhan University, Jagmohan Nagar, Khandagiri Bhubaneswar, Orissa, India; Sucheta, P., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Padmanava College of Engineering, Rourkela, Orissa, India
Abstract: The problem of color image segmentation has been addressed for quite some time, but the challenges are still on the issues of modeling color images. In this regard, we propose a Compound Markov Random Field (COMRF) model to take care of inter-color-plane and intra-color-plane interactions as well. The color image segmentation problem has been formulated in an unsupervised framework using the COMRF color image modeling. We have proposed Constrained Compound Markov Random Field Model (CCOMRF) to model the color images. In this framework, the image labels and model parameters are estimated alternately to obtain segmentation. The problem of model parameter estimation has been formulated in Maximum Conditional Pseudo Likelihood (MCPL) framework. Since the MCPL estimation problem is nonlinear in nature, a homotopy continuation based algorithm has been developed to obtain the estimates of model parameters. The image label estimation is formulated using Maximum a Posteriori criterion and the MAP estimates are obtained using hybrid algorithm, a combination of SA and ICM algorithm. The unsupervised algorithm consisting of estimation of model parameters and estimation of image labels converge to partial optimal set of model parameters which in turn yields image labels and hence image segmentation. The performance of the proposed COMRF model has been compared with MRF model and Kato 's method and found to exhibit improved performance.

Authors: Imran M., Rao A., Hemanthakumar G.
Title: Extreme subjectivity of multimodal biometrics solutions: Role of strong and weak modalities / features information
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: DoS in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, India; Freelance Academician, 165, 11th main, S. Puram, Mysore, India

Abstract: Multimodal biometrics is being deployed worldwide to cover for increased levels of risk and fraud. Unfortunately the choice of modalities and schemes of implementation show large variation of results. All these are also subjective and dependant on a variety of factors to realize at acceptable levels of threshold. The paper deliberates some of these through choice of five modalities and also experiments using these on five databases. The results bring out some inconsistencies unobserved so far. Based on the results here one can conclude that many of large scale Multimodal biometric systems that are being deployed seem to be conservatively designed.

Authors: Deepika J., Mahalakshmi G.S.
Title: Comparative evaluation of text similarity detection in research publications
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Anna University, Chennai 600 025, India
Authors with affiliations: Deepika, J., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Anna University, Chennai 600 025, India; Mahalakshmi, G.S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Anna University, Chennai 600 025, India
Abstract: Enormous amount of information exists in web in the form of research publications. These research publications are considered to be the 'trusted resources' for people working under research ground. Hence detecting similarity index among these research publications is taken as an important measure which contributes towards its quality. In this paper, we make a wide survey for detecting text similarity in research publications thereby providing the comparative analysis of various text similarity approaches such as statistical approach, corpus based approach and ontological approach. We have also proposed a novel approach based on Fuzzy Cognitive Maps (FCM) in which the concepts relating to the terms present in the document are evolved from offline ontology. FCMs thus constructed are compared to evaluate the similarity index automated. The algorithms are tested over research publications (accessed online) spreading over both reputed as well as new, open-access journals, which belong to a 'Computer Networks' research domain. Though several standard algorithms are less powerful in detecting the idea plagiarism involved in research publications, empirical investigations recommend that FCM outperforms the above-mentioned approaches in text similarity detection on various perspectives.

Authors: Munot M., Joshi M., Mitra P.
Title: Genetic algorithm incorporates with rough set theory: Application to automated karyotyping
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering, Pune Institute of Computer Technology, Pune, India; Department of Electronics and R and D, College of Engineering, Pune, India; Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India
Authors with affiliations: Munot, M., Department of Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering, Pune Institute of Computer Technology, Pune, India; Joshi, M., Department of Electronics and R and D, College of Engineering, Pune, India; Mitra, P., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India
Abstract: The karyotyping is a visual representation of the 46 human chromosomes, paired in various classes and arranged in decreasing order of size. This paper proposes a novel approach of karyotyping to improve the classification accuracy as compared to artificial neural networks. The proposed method uses rough sets to segment the chromosomes and the extracted features: area and density profile, are used to classify them in different classes (A-G) using genetic algorithm. Real images from a genetic lab, acquired by Evolution" VF color cooled camera and manually paired by experts were used as a ground truth to assess the performance of the proposed method. The improved classification accuracy ranges from 91.30 % to 95.65 % as compared to 78.26 %, obtained using artificial neural network.

Authors: Namita T., Sahadeo P.
Title: An ID-based designated verifier proxy signature scheme without bilinear pairing
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Mathematics, Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology, Allahabad-211004, India
Authors with affiliations: Namita, T., Department of Mathematics, Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology, Allahabad-211004, India; Sahadeo, P., Department of Mathematics, Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology, Allahabad-211004, India
Abstract: Identity (ID)-based cryptosystem simplifies the key management and revocation problem. Proxy signature is an active cryptographic research area in which many ID-based proxy signatures using bilinear pairing have been proposed. But the relative computation cost of the pairing is more than ten times higher than that of the scalar multiplication over elliptic curve group. As a variant of proxy signature, many ID-based designated verifier proxy signature (IBDVPS) schemes are also proposed in which the designated verifier alone can check the validity of the proxy signatures but most of the schemes belong to pairing based cryptography. In order to settle the problem who PKG causes, and save the running time and the size of the signature, we propose an IBDVPS scheme without bilinear pairings and also prove the security in random oracle model. With the running time being saved greatly, our scheme is more practical than previous related schemes for practical application.
Author Keywords: Bilinear pairings; Designated verifier; Digital signature; Elliptic curve discrete log problem; Identity-based proxy signature
Index Keywords: Bilinear pairing; Computation costs; Designated verifiers; Designated-verifier proxy signatures; Elliptic curve; ID-based; Key management; Pairing-based cryptography; Proxy signatures; Random Oracle model; Running time; Scalar multiplication; Artificial intelligence; Authentication; Cryptography; Network security; Electronic document identification systems

Authors: Bhattacharya S., Roy S.
Title: Intelligent scaffolding system based on fuzzy agent for an e-learning environment
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Techno India College of Technology, Rajarhat, Kolkata - 153, India; NITTTR (Kolkata), Saltlake, Kolkata, India
Authors with affiliations: Bhattacharya, S., Techno India College of Technology, Rajarhat, Kolkata - 153, India; Roy, S., NITTTR (Kolkata), Saltlake, Kolkata, India
Abstract: This paper presents an intelligent scaffolding system to assist an e-learner achieve his/her learning objective with respect to problem solving skill development. A fuzzy rule based agent is employed to implement the system. Three diagnostic parameters, e.g., belief, behavior, and attitude are estimated by the fuzzy agent on the basis of feedback from the learner. The post-learning cognitive state of the learner is assessed through such psychological parameters as satisfied, amazed, foggy and depressed. These levels are used as inputs to the fuzzy agent. The system is tested on large number of class XI standard school going students. Results indicate that the proposed system has been able to provide an effective and joyful learning experience to the user.

Abstract: Software process model for agricultural productivity refers to the various steps that required to be executed for development of a web based software model for computing agricultural productivity. Waterfall model has been used in this paper to explain the software development process. The paper presents the specific output of various steps of waterfall model for computation of agricultural productivity model with the help of sequence diagram, user case diagram and data flow diagram. Input design, output design and database design are presented in tabular formats. Implementation, testing plans and integration strategy of various modules is also required to be planned before coding of the TFP software is initiated.

Authors: Gopalakrishnan K., Ramakrishnan S.
Title: Adaptive learning approach using learning automata for dialogue management optimization
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, Pondicherry University, Karaikal Campus, Karaikal, India; Department of Computer Science, AVVM Sri Pushpam College, Thanjavur, India
Authors with affiliations: Gopalakrishnan, K., Department of Computer Science, Pondicherry University, Karaikal Campus, Karaikal, India; Ramakrishnan, S., Department of Computer Science, AVVM Sri Pushpam College, Thanjavur, India
Abstract: Application of statistical methodology to model dialogue strategy in spoken dialogue system is a growing research area. In spoken dialogue system, Markov Decision Processes (MDPs) provide a formal framework for making dialogue management decisions under uncertainty to learn the value of taking an action from each possible state in order to maximize the total reward. However, these MDP systems have large number of states and action space makes practical solution intractable. This paper investigates an adaptive learning method with sampling practice to compute an optimal solution to control dialogue strategy based on learning automata. The proposed approach exhibits a better performance with regards to the learning speed, good exploitation in its update and scalability to larger problems.
Author Keywords: Human-computer interaction; Learning automata; Markov decision process; Spoken dialogue management

Authors: Talasila J.K., Sircar P.
Title: Parameterizing speech phonemes by exponential sinusoidal model
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, Kanpur 208016, India
Authors with affiliations: Talasila, J.K., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, Kanpur 208016, India; Sircar, P., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, Kanpur 208016, India
Abstract: The exponential sinusoidal model (ESM) for parameterizing speech signals is proposed in this paper. The main feature of the ESM is that the amplitude of each sinusoidal component is allowed to vary exponentially with time. A novel variable segmentation strategy is applied first to separate individual transients of a voiced phoneme, which can then be fitted with the ESM. The epoch of a transient is used to separate each speech segment, and the estimation of the ESM parameters is carried out by utilizing the accumulated autocorrelation functions (AACFs) of the speech segment. It is demonstrated that the proposed epoch-ESM representation can be used in analysis-synthesis of voiced phonemes with high accuracy and low computational complexity.
Author Keywords: Exponential sinusoidal model; Low complexity speech coder; Parametric modeling; Speech phonemes

Title: Incorporating temporal planning within a BDI architecture

Affiliations: Department of Computer and Information Sciences, University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad - 500046, India; NICTA, Queensland Research Laboratory, Brisbane, Australia

Abstract: In this paper we make two important contributions (1) we extend the basic BDI architecture so as to include an action-base with temporal durations (2) extend the existing classical planning cycle in BDI with temporal planning using our GeneratePlan method. The main motivation is to make BDI-like systems capable of handling plan failures in a much more efficient way by extracting plans when relevant plans are not found in the plan library. To show the feasibility of our method we implemented our planning algorithms with respect to a travel planning scenario.

Authors: Lal S., Kulkarni P., Singh A.
Title: Instance based dynamic feature selection for network traffic monitoring
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Defence Institute of Advanced Technology, Deemed University Girinagar, Sinhgad Road, Pune-411025, Maharashtra, India; EKLaT Research, Pune, India; TBRL, Chandigarh-160030, India
Authors with affiliations: Lal, S., Defence Institute of Advanced Technology, Deemed University Girinagar, Sinhgad Road, Pune-411025, Maharashtra, India; Kulkarni, P., EKLaT Research, Pune, India; Singh, A., TBRL, Chandigarh-160030, India
Abstract: In network security, traffic monitoring plays an important role. Network traffic generates huge data in real time. Number of records as well as parameters/features to be monitored is large. Feature selection and ranking plays important role in classification. Existence of irrelevant parameter results in poor performance. Ignoring a relevant parameter on the other hand will result in loss of information and hence accuracy. Prevailing techniques construct "static reduced feature sets?, which is used for classifiers. None of the feature selection method generates optimal reduced set. In this paper a novel approach is presented for selecting subset of features based on individual test cases. The success of algorithm is demonstrated on KDD-CUP99 data. During learning phase, training sample is partitioned based on value of the respective parameter. This results in generation of equivalence classes respective to 'm' parameters. While classifying the test case, each parameter value results in one set from each equivalence class generated during learning. Parameters are ranked based on the ascending cardinality of 'm' such partial solution sets. Intersection of sets, thus obtained will result in set of objects satisfying the test case parameters. Algorithm terminates when either a pure class or a null result is obtained or when all parameters exhaust with confused decision. For a 'm' parameter problem with 'n' training samples, learning complexity of the algorithm is O(mn2), average classification takes O(m(log2n)2) time. Incremental learning complexity is O(m). The proposed algorithm shows improvement in performance and accuracy.
Author Keywords: Classification; Feature selection; Learning; Network traffic
Index Keywords: Cardinalities; Feature selection methods; Feature sets; Incremental learning; Learning; Learning complexity; Learning phase; Network traffic; Parameter values; Poor performance; Real time; Solution set; Test case; Traffic monitoring; Training sample; Algorithms; Artificial intelligence; Classification (of information); Equivalence classes; Feature extraction; Manganese compounds; Sampling; Parameter estimation

Authors: Balaji J., Geetha T.V., Parthasarathi R., Karky M.
Title: Anaphora resolution in tamil using universal networking language
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of CSE and IST, College of Engineering, Guindy, Anna University, Chennai-25, India
Authors with affiliations: Balaji, J., Department of CSE and IST, College of Engineering, Guindy, Anna University, Chennai-25, India; Geetha, T.V., Department of CSE and IST, College of Engineering, Guindy, Anna University, Chennai-25, India; Parthasarathi, R., Department of CSE and IST, College of Engineering, Guindy, Anna University, Chennai-25, India; Karky, M., Department of CSE and IST, College of Engineering, Guindy, Anna University, Chennai-25, India
Abstract: Anaphora Resolution is an important task in text processing. Resolving pronouns representing plurals and events is a critical task when compared to person pronouns. The antecedents for representing plurals and event pronouns can be noun phrases, verb phrases and/or segments of sentences. This paper focuses on the use of semantics of words and semantic representation of sentences to resolve pronouns in Tamil. The paper discusses two approaches - In one approach, the incorporation of UNL based semantic constraints and attribute features of words are used for pronoun classification and filtering and anaphora resolution phases of the centering theory for tackling person and place pronouns. The other novel approach of using UNL graph based matching for anaphora resolution attempts to handle complex anaphora of all types of plural pronouns. Moreover, we explore hitherto unexplored territory of event indicating pronouns using semantics. The evaluation shows that the use of sentence based UNL graph for pronoun resolution gives better results.
Author Keywords: Anaphora resolution; Centering theory; Universal networking language (UNL); UNL knowledge base

Authors: Mirkamali S.S., Nagabhushan P.
Title: Depth-wise segmentation of a 3D image using its depth map: An entropy-based approach
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, India
Authors with affiliations: Mirkamali, S.S., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, India; Nagabhushan, P., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, India
Abstract: Image and video segmentation has long been a fundamental problem in computer vision. However, unsupervised segmentation is an inherently ill-posed problem due to the large number of unknown factors and the possible geometric and motion ambiguities in the computation. The present paper is to introduce a new direction in the field of image segmentation called depth-wise segmentation. The method uses depth map to segment a 3D image into multiple layers based on the position of objects with respect to the camera. The proposed algorithm first divides every row of a depth map into line-segments based on their entropy value. Then, line-segments are linked to make a compound object and later an object-layer. The experiment results show that our method gives good performance.

Authors: Grain A.K., Rihani V.
Title: Detection and grading of astrocytoma tumor in MR brain images using neural network
Source title: Proceedings of the 2011 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2011
Affiliations: E and Ec, PEC, University of Technology, Chandigarh, 160012, India
Authors with affiliations: Grain, A.K., E and Ec, PEC, University of Technology, Chandigarh, 160012, India; Rihani, V., E and Ec, PEC, University of Technology, Chandigarh, 160012, India
Abstract: The paper introduces an efficient method for detection and grading of Astrocytoma, a type of brain tumor in MR Brain Images. Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM) is applied to Image to get information like entropy, energy, contrast, correlation and ratio of brain tumor to the MR Image etc. These are used for creation of knowledge base. After training of ANN with input and target matrix, the ANN classifies type of brain tumor. These are classified as Grade I, II, III & IV Astrocytoma brain tumor as per WHO norms.

Authors: Asha V., Bhajantri N.U., Nagabhushan P.
Title: Automatic detection of texture defects using texture-periodicity and chi-square histogram distance
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: New Horizon College of Engineering, Bangalore, Karnataka, India; Govt. College of Engineering, Chamarajanagar, Mysore, Karnataka, India; Mysore University, Mysore, Karnataka, India
Authors with affiliations: Asha, V., New Horizon College of Engineering, Bangalore, Karnataka, India; Bhajantri, N.U., Govt. College of Engineering, Chamarajanagar, Mysore, Karnataka, India; Nagabhushan, P., Mysore University, Mysore, Karnataka, India
Abstract: In this paper, we propose a new machine vision algorithm for automatic defect detection on patterned textures with the help of texture-periodicity and chi-square histogram distance. Input defective image is split into several blocks of size same as the size of the periodic unit of the image and chi-square distances of each periodic block with respect to itself and all other periodic blocks are calculated to get a dissimilarity matrix. This dissimilarity matrix is subjected to Ward's hierarchical clustering to automatically identify defective and defect-free blocks. Results from experiments on real fabric images of 3 major wallpaper groups with defects show that the proposed method is robust in finding fabric defects without human intervention and thus it can contribute to automatic defect detection in fabric industries.

Authors: Asha V., Nagabhushan P., Bhajantri N.U.
Title: Unsupervised detection of texture defects using texture-periodicity and universal quality index
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: New Horizon College of Engineering, Bangalore, Karnataka, India; University of Mysore, Mysore, Karnataka, India; Govt. College of Engineering, Chamarajanagar, Mysore, Karnataka, India
Authors with affiliations: Asha, V., New Horizon College of Engineering, Bangalore, Karnataka, India; Nagabhushan, P., University of Mysore, Mysore, Karnataka, India; Bhajantri, N.U., Govt. College of Engineering, Chamarajanagar, Mysore, Karnataka, India
Abstract: Universal quality index is a measure of loss of correlation, luminance distortion and contrast distortion between any two signals. In this paper, we propose a machine vision algorithm for automatically detecting defects in textures using texture-periodicity and universal quality index. Periodic blocks are extracted from the input defective images and quality indices of a periodic block with respect to itself and all other periodic blocks are calculated to get a similarity matrix containing quality indices. Specific variances of the periodic blocks are derived from the quality index matrix through orthogonal factor model based on eigen decomposition. These variances are subjected to Ward's hierarchical clustering to automatically identify defective and defect-free blocks. Experiments on real fabric images with defects show that the proposed method is robust in finding fabric defects without human intervention.

Title: Clustering of XML documents on the basis of content and structure

Abstract: With the surge of XML documents over the internet as the standard and convenient way to store and transport data, so to efficiently retrieve information clustering these voluminous data is very much needed. The work proposes a clustering technique that uses both the content and the Tags of XML documents for determining similarity among them. Considering that depending on the nature and purpose of the dataset, the structure and content of XML documents have different significance and role. Different similarity measuring techniques are used for content and structure information of the XML documents. The similarity value resulted from the two approaches are then combined to find overall similarity. The overall similarity outperforms the both approaches.

Title: Identification of time-varying effects of sensory perturbations for postural stability analysis
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Signal Analysis Lab., School of Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Indore, 452017 Indore, India; Charles Delaunay Institute, FRE CNRS 2848, University of Technology of Troyes, 10000 Troyes, France
Authors with affiliations: Pachori, R.B., Signal Analysis Lab., School of Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Indore, 452017 Indore, India; Hewson, D., Charles Delaunay Institute, FRE CNRS 2848, University of Technology of Troyes, 10000 Troyes, France
Abstract: Center of pressure (COP) measurements are often used to identify balance problems. One method commonly used to process COP signals is time-frequency analysis, with higher frequencies of postural sway interpreted as tightly controlled posture. However, standard Fourier transform based methods are poorly suited to COP signals due to their inherent non-stationarity. A new method of mean frequency estimation is proposed for COP signals based on the Fourier-Bessel (FB) expansion that is suitable for use in non-stationary signals. In addition, FB expansion provides better frequency resolution and low frequency detectability. Seventeen subjects were tested under eyes open and eyes closed conditions, with different vibration frequencies applied for the eyes closed condition in order to further perturb sensory information. Mean frequency as calculated by FB expansion was able to distinguish between eyes open and eyes closed conditions (p < 0.05), but no effect of vibration could be detected.
Author Keywords: Center of pressure signal; Fourier-Bessel expansion; Non-stationary signals; Postural stability
Index Keywords: Center of pressure; Closed condition; Detectability; Effect of vibration; Fourier; Fourier-Bessel expansion; Frequency resolutions; Higher frequencies; Mean frequency; Non-stationarities; Nonstationary signals; Postural stability; Postural sway; Sensory information; Time frequency analysis; Time-varying effects; Transform-based methods; Vibration frequency; Artificial intelligence

Authors: Sarma D., Sarma K.K.
Title: Real time pre-processing filter design for a speech processing system using TMS320C6713
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Electronics and Communication Technology, Gauhati University, Guwahati-781014, Assam, India
Authors with affiliations: Sarma, D., Department of Electronics and Communication Technology, Gauhati University, Guwahati-781014, Assam, India; Sarma, K.K., Department of Electronics and Communication Technology, Gauhati University, Guwahati-781014, Assam, India
Abstract: Real time applications like speech processing are known to have hardware dependencies. Compared to conventional CPUs, digital signal processor (DSP) architecture like TMS320C6713 provide greater processing speed and throughput. The present description provides a detail account of a work carried out for the design of a few FIR filters using DSP Processors for handling speech inputs sampled at different frequencies. The experimental work shows that DSP processors like TMS320C6713, provide more than 50 % improvement over conventional INTEL Core2Duo processors while carrying out processing of speech samples with lower clock cycle speeds.
Author Keywords: DSP; Filters; FIR; Pre-processing; TMS320C6713

Authors: Konar P., Chattopadhyay P.
Title: Shaft orbit pattern recognition for fault diagnosis of induction motor using neural network
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Electrical Engineering Department, BESU Shibpur, India
Authors with affiliations: Konar, P., Electrical Engineering Department, BESU Shibpur, India; Chattopadhyay, P., Electrical Engineering Department, BESU Shibpur, India
Abstract: The orbits of shaft centerline are pieces of indispensable information for the rotating machinery fault diagnosis. The shape of orbits of shaft centerline reflects the working state of rotating machinery since each shape corresponds to a special fault type. Thus, shaft orbit recognition plays an important role in the fault diagnosis. An automatic orbit pattern recognition method is proposed in this paper. The application of neural network is helpful to identify the orbits of shaft centreline. An effort has been made to study the pattern recognition ability of RBF and ANN for fault detection without employing any pre-processing technique. Random noise has also been mixed to study the robustness of the neural network models. It is found that the neural network model has a strong capability in pattern recognition for fault diagnosis with high precision. This paper presents a comparison between multilayer perceptron neural network (MLP NN) and Radial basis feed-forward neural network (RBF NN) techniques for identifying the shape of orbits of shaft centerline for detection of fault in an induction motor.
Author Keywords: De-noising; MLP; Pattern recognition; RBF; Shaft orbit
Index Keywords: Centerlines; De-noising; Fault types; High precision; MLP; Multilayer perceptron neural networks; Neural network model; Pattern recognition method; Pre-processing; Radial basis; Random noise; RBF; Working state; Induction motors; Neural networks; Orbits; Pattern recognition; Radial basis function networks; Rotating machinery; Fault detection

Authors: Gujarathi A.M., Purohit S., Manchanda R., Ghosh D.
Title: Differential evolution using jumping genes adaptation
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Chemical Engineering Department, Birla Institute of Technology and Science (BITS), Community Welfare and Societal Development Unit, Pilani - 333031, India
Authors with affiliations: Gujarathi, A.M., Chemical Engineering Department, Birla Institute of Technology and Science (BITS), Community Welfare and Societal Development Unit, Pilani - 333031, India; Purohit, S., Chemical Engineering Department, Birla Institute of Technology and Science (BITS), Community Welfare and Societal Development Unit, Pilani - 333031, India; Manchanda, R., Chemical Engineering Department, Birla Institute of Technology and Science (BITS), Community Welfare and Societal Development Unit, Pilani - 333031, India; Ghosh, D., Chemical Engineering Department, Birla Institute of Technology and Science (BITS), Community Welfare and Societal Development Unit, Pilani - 333031, India
Abstract: Jumping gene adaptation of differential evolution algorithm (DE-JGa) is proposed in this study. Detailed working principle of proposed algorithm is given. The performance of the proposed algorithm (DE-JGa) is compared with the performance of existing algorithms (differential evolution (DE) and modified differential evolution (MDE)] by applying these algorithms to some selected benchmark test problems. Thorough algorithm specific study is carried out to check the robustness of individual algorithms with respect to its control parameters, such as crossover constant (CR), number of population points (NP), scaling factor (F) and the number of generations.

Authors: Gopal M., Mahalakshmi G.S., Vani V.
Title: Knowledge modeling from software documentation
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering Guindy, Anna University, Chennai, India; Department of Information Technology, Easwari Engineering College, Chennai, India
Authors with affiliations: Gopal, M., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering Guindy, Anna University, Chennai, India; Mahalakshmi, G.S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering Guindy, Anna University, Chennai, India; Vani, V., Department of Information Technology, Easwari Engineering College, Chennai, India
Abstract: The traditional development, deployment and maintenance of conventional software applications require higher quality with shorter time to market cycles to reap the benefits of customer delight. They follow a conventional, explicit and formal representation of the knowledge base which is shared across the stakeholders. Hence, the associated documentation across various stages of SDLC do not cater to any intelligent extraction and interpretation either for downstream applications or for enhancements. This research framework addresses the nuances of converting the existing documentation to an intelligent knowledge representation which can be extracted for effective and efficient utilisation of the artifacts for further improvisation of the software to deliver enhanced tracea-bility to the changing needs of the future growth.
Index Keywords: Customer delight; Downstream applications; Formal representations; Knowledge base; Knowledge modeling; Software applications; Software documentation; Time to market; Knowledge based systems; Knowledge representation; Artificial intelligence

Authors: Sujatha P., Pradeep Kumar G.N.
Title: Prediction of groundwater levels using different artificial neural network architectures and algorithms
Source title: Proceedings of the 2011 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2011
Affiliations: Civil Engg. Dept. of Mechanical Engg., JNTUH, College of Engg., Jagtyal-505501, Karimnagar district, India; Department of Civil Engg., S.V. University, Tirupati-517 507 Andhra Pradesh, India
Authors with affiliations: Sujatha, P., Civil Engg. Dept. of Mechanical Engg., JNTUH, College of Engg., Jagtyal-505501, Karimnagar district, India; Pradeep Kumar, G.N., Department of Civil Engg., S.V. University, Tirupati-517 507 Andhra Pradesh, India
Abstract: Performance of four types of functionally different artificial neural network (ANN) models, namely Feed forward neural network, Elman type recurrent neural network, Input delay neural network and Radial basis function network and fourteen types of algorithms, namely Batch gradient descent (traingd), Batch gradient descent with momentum (traingdm), Adaptive learning rate (traingda), Adaptive learning rate with momentum (traingdx), Resilient backpropagation (trainrp), Fletcher-Reeves update (traincgf), Polak-Ribiere update (traincgp), Powell-Beale restarts (traincgb), Scaled conjugate gradient (trainscg), BFGS algorithm (trainbfg), One step secant algorithm (trainoss), Levenberg-Marquardt (trainlm), Automated regularization (trainbr) and Random order incremental training (trainr) were examined in order to identify an efficient ANN architecture and algorithm that can simulate the water table fluctuations using a relatively short length of groundwater level records. Tirupati, located in Chittoor district of the drought-prone Rayalaseema region in India, having resident population of over 3.0 lakhs and pilgrims of over 50, 000 per day was chosen as the study area. As its groundwater levels showed a rapid decline in the last decade due to the overexploitation for the domestic, agricultural and industrial needs, accurate prediction is very essential to plan better conservation of groundwater resources. Results showed that Feed forward neural network trained with training algorithm Levenberg-Marquardt is suitable for accurate prediction of groundwater levels.
Author Keywords: Evapotranspiration; Groundwater level forecasting; Neural network

Authors: Jain T., Jain A.
Title: Implementation of artificial neural networks in real time power system: Challenges and issues
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Indian Institute of Technology, Mandi, India; Rustom Ji Institute of Technology, Tekanpur (Gwalior), India
Authors with affiliations: Jain, T., Indian Institute of Technology, Mandi, India; Jain, A., Rustom Ji Institute of Technology, Tekanpur (Gwalior), India
Abstract: The emergence of Artificial Neural Network has motivated many researchers to investigate its application to various power system problems. However, despite numerous research efforts, ANNs could not replace the conventional methods of power system analysis in Energy Management System (EMS) due to its inherent limitations. This paper addresses the various issues and challenges, which inhibits the use of ANN for practical applications in the field of power systems engineering. Apart from this, it also presents an overview on application of ANN to various areas of power system. The main steps in developing the successful model of ANN has been emphasized.

Authors: Karmakar S., Kasturirangan R.
Title: Metaphors and creativity: Constructing meaning in language
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Azim Premji University, Bangalore, India; National Institute of Advanced Studies, Bangalore, India
Authors with affiliations: Karmakar, S., Azim Premji University, Bangalore, India; Kasturirangan, R., National Institute of Advanced Studies, Bangalore, India
Abstract: The paper examines the notion of creativity with a special emphasis on the linguistic metaphor. In doing so, it shows how the notion of creativity differs from the notion of generativity. It argues language as a metaphor is the product of polysemiosis, principles of informative richness and relevance which are lexicon internal phenomenon. As per the proposal outlined in this paper, metaphorical act in language is a complex cognitive phenomenon comprising of semantic and pragmatic components of language. Further, the study reveals that collating of different domains of our cognition is crucial in fixing the context of interpretation with respect to which meaning of a metaphor is realized.

Authors: Saruladha K., Aghila G., Bhuvaneswary A.
Title: Computing information content based semantic similarity for multiple biomedical domain and their application to information retrieval on medline
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Pondicherry Engineering College, Puducherry, India
Authors with affiliations: Saruladha, K., Pondicherry Engineering College, Puducherry, India; Aghila, G., Pondicherry Engineering College, Puducherry, India; Bhuvaneswary, A., Pondicherry Engineering College, Puducherry, India
Abstract: Semantic similarity computation is a common problem in Web mining, natural language related tasks and in domains that need semantic content matching. The traditional information content based approaches are used for computing similarity between concepts by using knowledge available in the domain ontologies (SNOMED) and by using the reliable Mayo clinic corpus These are corpus dependent and the structure of the ontology is alone is taken into consideration. The inherent relationships among the concepts are not taken into consideration. The proposed approach is corpus independent and it also take into consideration the inherent relationships shared by the concepts in the ontology. The proposed four computational approaches for measuring semantic similarity among multiple biomedical ontological concepts outperform the other computational methods as it achieves the highest correlation of 0.920. The proposed approach is information content based and it maps the Tversky feature based similarity model to the information theoretic domain. Moreover the traditional information content based approaches (RESNIK, LIN) used for single ontology have been modified to compute semantic similarity between concepts belonging to multiple ontologies. We also explored the possibility of extending Dice coefficient to measure cross ontological semantic similarity. The extrinsic evaluation of the proposed similarity measure has been done for information retrieval. The proposed semantic similarity measure has been used for conceptual query expansion using SNOMED-CT and MeSH ontologies. The expanded queries were found to increase the retrieval effectiveness when compared to the traditional vector space model.
Author Keywords: Information content; MeSH; Multiple ontologies; Semantic similarity; SNOMED-CT

Authors: Phophalia A., Mitra S.K.
Title: Parameter learning of Spatially Variant Finite Mixture Model using Bayesian Sampling-Resampling for MR images
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology, Gandhinagar, Gujarat-382007, India
Authors with affiliations: Phophalia, A., Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology, Gandhinagar, Gujarat-382007, India; Mitra, S.K., Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology, Gandhinagar, Gujarat-382007, India
Abstract: The Finite Mixture Model (FMM) has so far been used successfully for 3D MRI data. Some variants of FMM have also been tried for same purpose. Among these variants, Spatially Variant Finite Mixture Model (SVFMM) appeared to be effective for analyzing the data. Estimation of parameter of SVFMM has been done so far either by MLE or EM method. In this paper, the parameters of SVFMM are estimated using Bayesian Learning, mostly known as Sampling-Resampling. The result of SVFMM along with proposed parameter estimation technique on 3D MRI image appears to be incrementally better than existing one.

Authors: Guru D.S., Nagasundara K.B., Manjunath S.
Title: Indexing of offline signatures
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, Karnataka, 570006, India
Authors with affiliations: Guru, D.S., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, Karnataka, 570006, India; Nagasundara, K.B., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, Karnataka, 570006, India; Manjunath, S., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, Karnataka, 570006, India
Abstract: In this paper, a model for representation and indexing of offline signatures for person identification is proposed. In any identification mode, the system recognizes an individual by comparing the acquired biometric information against templates corresponding to all the users in the database. In some applications, where the database is supposed to be very large, the identification typically has an unacceptably long response time. A solution to speed up the identification process is to design an indexing model prior to identification which reduces the number of candidate hypotheses to be considered by the identification algorithm. In this paper, we study the suitability of Kd-tree indexing mechanism for person identification based on uni-modal offline signatures. For representation of offline signatures, we extract features from Gabor responses and index by Kd-tree. Experimental results reveal that indexing prior to identification is faster than conventional identification method in terms of time for offline signatures.

Authors: Thiyagu R., Sendhilkumar S.
Title: Ontology based sentiment classification
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Information Science and Technology, College of Engineering, Anna University, Chennai, India
Authors with affiliations: Thiyagu, R., Department of Information Science and Technology, College of Engineering, Anna University, Chennai, India; Sendhilkumar, S., Department of Information Science and Technology, College of Engineering, Anna University, Chennai, India
Abstract: Sentiment classification is the process of classifying the comments/opinions retrieved from blogs as either positive or negative sense. Sentiment classification is useful for customers who want to research the sentiment of product before a purchase or a seller of a product who wants to monitor the public sentiment of their products. This paper proposes a sentiment classification using a semantic approach where book reviews from blogs are retrieved using focused crawler. The book review are preprocessed their using Natural Language Processing. Then the concept based understanding about opinions is captured by domain ontology. Finally Support Vector Machine (SVM) classifier is used to classify sentiments effectively. This paper also provides a comparative analysis of the proposed method with that of existing techniques.

Title: Algorithms for reconstruction of triangular and hexagonal arrays
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, IIITD and M Kancheepuram, Chennai - 600 036, India; Department of Mathematics, St. Joseph's College of Engineering, Chennai - 119, India; Department of Mathematics, Madras Christian College, Chennai - 59, India

Abstract: The concept of a Parikh matrix of words was introduced by Mateescu et al [3]. It was extended to 2D-rectangular arrays and a polynomial time algorithm was given to reconstruct an unknown 2D-array over {0, 1} from its image under the extended Parikh mapping along a single direction, and reconstruction from projections along three or more directions is proved to be NP-hard [2]. We extend the concept of Parikh matrix of words to triangular and hexagonal arrays over {0, 1}.

Authors: Siddiqui F., Afshar Alam M.
Title: Ontology based application model for feature driven development
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Dept. of Computer Science, Jamia Hamdard, New Delhi, India
Authors with affiliations: Siddiqui, F., Dept. of Computer Science, Jamia Hamdard, New Delhi, India; Afshar Alam, M., Dept. of Computer Science, Jamia Hamdard, New Delhi, India
Abstract: The upcoming technology support for semantic web promises fresh directions for Software Engineering community. Also semantic web has its roots in knowledge engineering that provoke software engineers to look for application of ontology applications throughout the Software Engineering lifecycle. The internal components of a semantic web are "light weight", and may be of less quality standards than the externally visible modules. In fact the internal components are generated from external (ontological) component. That's the reason agile development approaches such as Feature Driven Development (FDD) are suitable for application's internal component development. The FDD process is based on its first step of developing the "overall model" which is build using the information in requirement document and later used for deriving the feature list but there is no particular representation for this model that can be used for checking the quality of model. Considering such model as a requirement, we propose ontology based derivation of overall model that can be used for checking the quality of model and later be used for generation of features from it. Advantages of ontology-based feature Driven development are also discussed.
Author Keywords: Agile methodology; Feature Driven Development; Ontology

Authors: Marwaha S., Saha A., Yadav V.K.
Title: Ontology based expert system for varietal selection of maize
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Division of Computer Applications, Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, Pusa, Delhi, India; Directorate of Maize Research, Pusa, Delhi, India
Authors with affiliations: Marwaha, S., Division of Computer Applications, Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, Pusa, Delhi, India; Saha, A., Division of Computer Applications, Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, Pusa, Delhi, India; Yadav, V.K., Directorate of Maize Research, Pusa, Delhi, India
Abstract: Immemorial Indian farmers were growing land races/local cultivars having low productivity which was a matter of concern at national level. To address the issue of low productivity systematic maize research in India was initiated in 1957 with the launch of All India Coordinated Maize Improvement Project (AICMIP). A coordinated emphasis has been laid on various aspects of maize breeding activities throughout the country viz., development of genetically diverse, productive, inbred lines with good per se performance and resistance/tolerance to biotic and abiotic stresses, testing of large number of 2-parent crosses at different locations under multi-location program, easy, economical and efficient commercial seed production technology, and demonstrations especially on farmers' fields. This expert system is designed to help farmers to select variety or varieties for a particular area based on maturity type, grain color and grain type, which is neither feasible nor practical by conventional system of extension. In conventional architecture of expert system, knowledge engineers along with domain experts build the knowledgebase in terms of facts and rules. This knowledgebase resides in the working memory of the inference engine and only accessible to one system. This knowledgebase is not portable and cannot be made accessible to other applications concurrently. Moreover, traditional rule-base systems are not inherently based on Unicode and thus lacks support for internationalization or for regional languages. The presented system has a portable knowledgebase and is based on OWL ontology. The system acts as a tool for transferring the site and crop specific knowledge of various domain experts to the farmers.
Author Keywords: Maize; Ontology; OWL; Protégé; Semantic web; SPARQL; Variety selection

Authors: Chaudhari N.S.
Title: 3-CNF-satisfiability in polynomial time
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Indore, Indore (M.P.), India
Authors with affiliations: Chaudhari, N.S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Indore, Indore (M.P.), India
Abstract: For more than four decades, satisfiability of 2-CNF (2-SAT) is well-known to be solvable in polynomial (in fact linear) time, while satisfiability of 3-CNF formula (3-SAT) is NP-Complete. For last four decades, it was widely believed that 3-SAT does not have polynomial algorithm [6]. We fix this anomaly by first giving two polynomial algorithmic formulations for 2-SAT. Further, we introduce the notion of "context". For a clause of length 3, we generate 3 contexts. Suppose that we have a 3-CNF formula F with k clauses. We represent formula F by generating 3*k contexts, storing all of them, and analyzing them collectively. We construct one 2-SAT problem for analyzing each context. This approach results in the most surprising result that 3-SAT is also solvable in polynomial time. We demonstrate a simple bound of O(k3n3) set operations for our polynomial algorithm for 3-SAT.
Author Keywords: 2-SAT; 3-SAT; NP-complete problems; Polynomial algorithms; Satisfiability

Authors: Shaw S., Orea K., Bhowmik P., Halder A., Chakraborty A., Konar A., Nagar A.K.
Title: Evolvable lip contour model for emotion recognition
Source title: Proceedings of the 2011 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Electronics and Tele-Communication Engineering, Jadavpur University, Kolkata-32, India; Department of Computer Science and Engineering, St. Thomas' College of Engineering and Technology, Kolkata, India; Department, of Computer Science, Liverpool Hope University, Liverpool, United Kingdom

Abstract: This paper proposes an alternative approach to emotion recognition from the outer Up contour of the subjects. Subjects exhibit their emotions through their facial expressions, and the lip region is segmented from their facial images. A lip contour model has been developed, and the parameters of the model are adapted using differential evolution algorithm to match with the actual outer contour of the lip. An SVM classifier is then employed to classify the emotion of the subject from the parameter set of the subjects' lip contour. The experiment was performed on 50 subjects in the age group 20-30 years, and the worst accuracy in emotion classification is found to be 86%.

Authors: Juneja S., Raval M.S., Joshi M.V.
Title: ICA based traitor tracing scheme
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: DAIICT, Gandhinagar, Gujarat, 382-007, India
Authors with affiliations: Juneja, S., DAIICT, Gandhinagar, Gujarat, 382-007, India; Raval, M.S., DAIICT, Gandhinagar, Gujarat, 382-007, India; Joshi, M.V., DAIICT, Gandhinagar, Gujarat, 382-007, India
Abstract: In this paper, we propose a technique that is robust against average collusion attack and has capability to trace colluders. Independent fingerprints are randomly generated using independent and identically distributed (IID) Gaussian source. They were embedded in independent components (ICs) generated by applying independent component analysis (ICA) on cover image. This scheme is based on embedding unique Gaussian fingerprints on different ICs. We used non-blind and correlation based detector for fingerprint detection. The result shows that the scheme is robust against average collusion attack.

Authors: Gogoi P., Sarma K.K.
Title: ANN-assisted booth multiplier for design of convolutional encoder for application in wireless communication
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011

Abstract: Here a method of generating Convolution Encoding is reported. The principal segment of the method is a Booth Multiplier Block implemented using Artificial Neural Network (ANN). The Booth Algorithm follows a fast multiplication process and achieves a significantly less computational complexity over its conventional counterparts. With support from the ANN, the hardware complexity reduces. Moreover, after the ANN is trained properly, it achieves less time to respond compared to conventionally designed Booth Encoder. Simulations carried out show that there is at least 32% improvement in processing time provided by a ANN-assisted Booth Multiplier while implementing a convolutional encoder compared to conventional methods. The convolutional encoder thus designed has been tested in AWGN, Rayleigh and Rician multipath fading channel.

Authors: Bubesh Kumar D.
Title: The design of battle field robot
Source title: Proceedings of the 2011 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2011
Affiliations: Mechanical Engineering Department, Aarupadaiveedu Institute of Technology, Vinayaka Mission University, Kanchipuram, Tamilnadu, India
Authors with affiliations: Bubesh Kumar, D., Mechanical Engineering Department, Aarupadaiveedu Institute of Technology, Vinayaka Mission University, Kanchipuram, Tamilnadu, India
Abstract: The battlefield robot is the robot of the future warfare. The future war will be fought with nuclear, chemical and Biological weapons, where it is difficult for human soldiers to fight the enemies. The battle field robot consists of CCD cameras for eye, servomotors for locomotion, Fuzzy neural network for the brain of the robot. The fuzzy rules are developed and stored in the microprocessor of the robot, and from the microprocessor the fuzzy rules are sent to the neural network. separate servo motors are placed at the locomotion points of the robot to achieve moments similar to the humans. The fuzzy neural network is trained by the three dimensional multilayered fuzzy neural network, the robot gets signal from the main computers which is placed in the military base. The kinematics of essential movements of the robot are derived with the free body diagram. The training of the neural network is also explained in this paper.

Authors: Somasundaram K., Swaminathan H.
Title: Automatic programming through natural language compiler
Source title: Proceedings of the 2011 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of CSE, College of Engineering, Guindy, Anna University, Chennai, India
Authors with affiliations: Somasundaram, K., Department of CSE, College of Engineering, Guindy, Anna University, Chennai, India; Swaminathan, H., Department of CSE, College of Engineering, Guindy, Anna University, Chennai, India
Abstract: The inherent ambiguity involved in understanding the natural language description by a compiler is the greatest bane to the developers of an automated programming tool. Any average programmer would assimilate a very good logic to solve a problem description but would face problems while coding it. And also it is not possible for programmers to remember the syntax of many programming languages. This paper presents a method to develop a tool that takes in natural language instructions as input and converts them to an intermediate representation. This intermediate representation should help the compiler to convert them into target language with minimal effort. Our aim is to reduce the ambiguity involved in parsing through the natural language instructions of a problem statement and output the corresponding object oriented program and also make any application developer concentrate only on the logic to develop a good algorithm.
Author Keywords: Automatic programming through supervised Learning; Language level independence; Natural language compiler; Syntax free programming; Unambiguous description of a problem statement

Authors: Singh P., Sabharwal J., Verma A., Chaudhari N.S.
Title: An efficient method for the Devnagri handwritten vowel recognition
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Institute of Engineering and Technology, Devi Ahilya Vishwavidyalaya, Indore (M.P.) 452017, India; Indian Institute of Technology, Indore (M.P.), India
Authors with affiliations: Singh, P., Institute of Engineering and Technology, Devi Ahilya Vishwavidyalaya, Indore (M.P.) 452017, India; Sabharwal, J., Institute of Engineering and Technology, Devi Ahilya Vishwavidyalaya, Indore (M.P.) 452017, India; Verma, A., Institute of Engineering and Technology, Devi Ahilya Vishwavidyalaya, Indore (M.P.) 452017, India; Chaudhari, N.S., Indian Institute of Technology, Indore (M.P.), India
Abstract: Development of a Character recognition system for Devnagri is difficult because (i) there are basic, modified ("matra") and compound character shapes in the script and (ii) the characters in words are topologically connected. Here focus is on the recognition of offline handwritten Hindi vowels that can be used in common applications like commercial forms, government records, bill processing systems, Signature verification, passport readers. Handwriting has continued to persist as a means of communication and recording information in day-to-day life even with the introduction of new technologies. Challenges in handwritten characters recognition lie in the variation and distortion of offline handwritten characters since different people may use different style of handwriting, and direction to draw the same shape of any Hindi character. This paper describes the nature of handwritten language, how it is translated into electronic data, and the basic concepts behind written language recognition algorithms. Handwritten Hindi character unlike the printed character, are imprecise in nature as their corners are not always sharp, lines are not perfectly straight, and curves are not necessarily smooth. Therefore, a robust offline Hindi handwritten recognition system has to account for all of these factors. In this 14 class classification problem a new feature set made up of horizontal and vertical histogram is introduced. Support Vector Machine is used as classifier for recognition of Handwritten Hindi vowels.
Author Keywords: Devnagri vowel; Feature extraction; Handwriting recognition; Offline recognition; Support Vector Machine

Authors: Chattopadhyay G., Chattopadhyay S.
Title: Multivariate estimation of potential evapotranspiration during summer monsoon using artificial neural network over Gangetic West Bengal
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Institute of Radiophysics and Electronics, University of Calcutta, 92, A. P. C. Road, Kolkata 700 009, India; Department of Computer Application, Pailan College of Management and Technology, Kolkata 700104, India

Abstract: Present paper shows the development of a neurocomputing-based model for estimating the potential evapotranspiration over Gangetic West Bengal, India, during the summer monsoon period consisting of the months of June, July and August. An artificial neural network is implemented in the form of multilayer perceptron to generate the model. Four meteorological variables, namely, maximum surface temperature, minimum surface temperature, vapour pressure and rainfall are used as the independent variables in generating the model. The performance of the model is judged statistically against non-linear regression in the form of asymptotic regression.
