Authors: Pandey R.K., Singh V.K., Singh S.
Title: Computation of fourier bessel transform using hybrid functions
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Indian Institute of Information Technology Design and Manufacturing, Jabalpur, MP, India; Department of Mathematics, BITS, Pilani Goa Campus, Goa, India; Department of Computer Science and Engineering, DIT, Dehradoon, India
Authors with affiliations: Pandey, R.K., Indian Institute of Information Technology Design and Manufacturing, Jabalpur, MP, India; Singh, V.K., Department of Mathematics, BITS, Pilani Goa Campus, Goa, India; Singh, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, DIT, Dehradoon, India
Abstract: A new numerical method based on hybrid of Block-pulse and Rationalized Haar functions for numerical evaluation of integer and fractional order Fourier Bessel (Hankel) transform is proposed in this paper. Hybrid of Block-pulse and Rationalized Haar functions are used as a basis to expand a part of the integrand, rf(r), appearing in the Hankel transform integral. Thus transforming the integral into a Fourier-Bessel series and truncating it, an efficient, stable algorithm is obtained for the numerical evaluations of the Fourier Bessel (FB) transform of order v >-1. The proposed method is quite accurate and stable, as illustrated by given numerical examples with varying degree of random noise terms εθi added to the data function f(r), where θi is a uniform random variable with values in [-1, 1].

Abstract: Social Media set new avenues for and trends of communication among people. These avenues are hubs of sentiments reflecting the general public perception. This paper proposes an approach for classification of sentences based on POS, subjectivity and objectivity and then extraction of sentiments from the stored conversation data in micro-blogs. Classifiers make use of training sets and support vector machines. Sentences are confined to twitter feeds. Experimental results show that the approach works reasonably well only with proposed pre-processing.

District, India; Prasad Babu, M.S., CS and SE Department, Andhra University College of Engineering, Visakhapatnam, India
Abstract: Collaborative filtering (CF) systems have been proven to be very effective for personalized and accurate recommendations. These systems are based on the Recommendations of previous ratings by various users and products. Since the present database is very sparse, the missing values are considered first and based on that, a complete prediction dataset are made. In this paper, some standard computational techniques are applied within the framework of Content-boosted collaborative filtering with imputational rating data to evaluate and produce CF predictions. The Content-boosted collaborative filtering algorithm uses either naive Bayes or means imputation, depending on the sparsity of the original CF rating dataset. Results are presented and shown that this approach performs better than a traditional content-based predictor and collaborative filters.

Authors: Syed Mudhasir Y., Sendhilkumar S.
Title: Near-duplicates detection and filtering in web search using focused crawler
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Anna University, Chennai - 600 025, India
Authors with affiliations: Syed Mudhasir, Y., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Anna University, Chennai - 600 025, India; Sendhilkumar, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Anna University, Chennai - 600 025, India
Abstract: In a web search environment, search engines play an important role to find information on the web. The search engine results at times exasperate users and affect the performance of any web search. This is due to the flooding of numerous copies of web documents in the search results making them a serious problem. This paper proposes a novel approach to identify such near-duplicates based on provenance. In this approach a provenance model has been built using web pages which are results returned by existing search engine. This model uses both content based and trust based factors for classifying the results as original or near-duplicates. A novel web crawler is utilized to obtain such trust based information. Finally a simple ranking is done for ranking the results based on trust.

Authors: Adhikari R., Agrawal R.K.
Title: Effectiveness of PSO based neural network for seasonal time series forecasting
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: School of Computer and Systems Sciences, Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi-110067, India
Authors with affiliations: Adhikari, R., School of Computer and Systems Sciences, Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi-110067, India; Agrawal, R.K., School of Computer and Systems Sciences, Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi-110067, India
Abstract: Recently, the Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) technique has gained much attention in the field of time series forecasting. Although PSO trained Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs) performed reasonably well in stationary time series forecasting, their effectiveness in tracking the structure of non-stationary data (especially those which contain trends or seasonal patterns) is yet to be justified. In this paper, we have trained neural networks with two types of PSO (Trelea1 and Trelea2) for forecasting seasonal time series data. To assess their performances, experiments are conducted on three well-known real world seasonal time series. Obtained forecast errors in terms of three common performance measures, viz. MSE, MAE and MAPE for each dataset are compared with those obtained by the Seasonal ANN (SANN) model, trained with a standard backpropagation algorithm. Comparisons demonstrate that training with PSO-Trelea1 and PSO-Trelea2 produced significantly better results than the standard backpropagation rule.
Author Keywords: ANN; Evolutionary computation; Particle Swarm Optimization; Seasonal ANN; Time series forecasting

Title: Fitness function evaluation of parallel transmitted tomographic image reconstruction using genetic algorithms
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011

Abstract: Over the past few years there have been considerable interest in optimal reconstruction of cross-sectional images from tomographic data using evolutionary algorithms. Reconstruction of image data from projections is a key problem in tomographic image analysis. It is essential to choose some proper objective functions of the problem. We use sum of squared error as objective function to reconstruct the data. This paper work comprises of two parts. Firstly, parallel rays are transmitted from various angle to obtain projection data. Weight matrix is calculated for various angles i.e., -45°, 45°, -63.43° and 63.43° respectively. Secondly, Genetic Algorithm is used to evaluate fitness function. A comparative study between the actual data and reconstructed data is shown at the last part of the work. Result demonstrates good accuracy of the reconstructed data.

Title: ABHIVYAKTI: Hand gesture recognition using Orientation Histogram in different light conditions
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Machine Vision Lab., Digital Systems Group, Central Electronics Engineering Research Institute (CEERI), Pilani, India; Computer Vision Research Group, Dept. of Computer Science, BITS, Pilani, India; Dept. of Electronics Engg., BKBIET, Pilani, India

Abstract: Human machine interaction is the most convenient way for sick, elder and children to control machines when they need to express themselves. Hand gestures provide a natural way to interact with the machine like interacting with the human being. Several efforts have been made to make the gesture recognition system robust, however this field is considered to be very challenging due to the cluttered natural environment. Bad illumination and non uniform backgrounds make it difficult for recognition. In this paper a technique for hand gesture recognition is discussed based on Orientation Histogram, for our ABHIVYAKTI project and it is independent of the illumination. The method and results with PC based vision system have been discussed.

Authors: Jain R., Chaudhari N.S.
Title: Formulation of 3-clustering as a 3-SAT problem
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Indore, M-Block I.E.T D.A.V.V Campus, Khandwa Road, Indore-452011, India
Authors with affiliations: Jain, R., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Indore, M-Block I.E.T D.A.V.V Campus, Khandwa Road, Indore-452011, India; Chaudhari, N.S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Indore, M-Block I.E.T D.A.V.V Campus, Khandwa Road, Indore-452011, India
Abstract: Cluster analysis is a sub-field in artificial intelligence and machine learning that refers to grouping of objects based on some objective metric. Clustering with constraints is an active area of research in artificial intelligence. Adding constraints to clustering improves the performance of a variety of algorithms. Cluster analysis is concerned with the problem of partitioning a given set of entities into homogeneous and well-separated subsets called clusters. Cluster Analysis aims at finding subsets, called clusters, which are homogeneous and/or well separated. Minimum sum of diameters clustering for two Cluster can be solved by reduction constraints into the 2-Conjunctive Normal Form statement. Hansen provided an algorithm that solved minimum sum of diameter problem for two clusters that run with time complexity O (n 3logn). For three or more clusters the problem of determining a minimum diameter partition is NP-complete. However 2-cluster problem is solvable in polynomial time. This paper explains what are the constraints in three cluster analysis and this paper also gives a formulation in-fact a technique to represent the constraints of 3-cluster in 3-Conjunctive Normal Form statement.
Author Keywords: 3-SAT; Agglomerative clustering algorithm; Diameter; Homogeneity; Partitioning; Separation; Split; Three-cluster analysis

Title: Detection of architectural distortions with spiculations in mammograms by analyzing the structure of mammary glands
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: PET Research Centre, Mandya-571401, Karnataka, India; Maharaja Institute of Technology, Mysore-570001, Karnataka, India
Authors with affiliations: Minavathi, PET Research Centre, Mandya-571401, Karnataka, India; Murali, S., Maharaja Institute of Technology, Mysore-570001, Karnataka, India; Dinesh, M.S., PET Research Centre, Mandya-571401, Karnataka, India
Abstract: Architectural distortion (AD) is a very important finding for the early detection of breast cancer. Such distortions can be classified as spiculation, retraction, and distortion. The purpose of this work is to develop an automatic method for detecting areas of architectural distortion with spiculation. We have developed an automated detection algorithm for distorted areas based on the concentration of mammary glands. The direction of a normal mammary gland is toward the nipple, whereas the direction in an abnormal gland or region will be towards distorted area. Gabor filters are used for the detection of line patterns to obtain the orientation field of the given mammogram. Node maps are drawn using phase portraits to analyze the orientation fields and to detect the sites of architectural distortion. To reduce the number of false positives: computerized flow field analysis is done using distance measure (nonlinear least squares) to calculate the degree of distortion at each node point, denseness texture feature is considered at each node point and the structure of left and right breasts are compared using quadrant based comparison. The method was tested with 19 mammograms containing architectural distortion. The result demonstrates that, our preliminary experiment has successfully found the possible candidates of architectural distortion with less number of false positives.
Author Keywords: Architectural distortion; Automated detection; Denseness feature; Gabor filters; Mammogram; Nonlinear least squares
Index Keywords: Architectural distortions; Automated detection; Denseness feature; Mammogram; Non-linear least squares; Artificial intelligence; Gabor filters; X ray screens; Mammography

Authors: Singh P., Gulani S., Verma A., Chaudhari N.S.
Title: An intelligent network for handwritten Devnagri digit recognition using Structural features
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Institute of Engineering and Technology, Devi Ahilya Vishwavidyalaya, Indore (M.P.) 452017, India; Indian Institute of Technology, Indore (M.P.), India
Authors with affiliations: Singh, P., Institute of Engineering and Technology, Devi Ahilya Vishwavidyalaya, Indore (M.P.) 452017, India; Gulani, S., Institute of Engineering and Technology, Devi Ahilya Vishwavidyalaya, Indore (M.P.) 452017, India; Verma, A., Institute of Engineering and Technology, Devi Ahilya Vishwavidyalaya, Indore (M.P.) 452017, India; Chaudhari, N.S., Indian Institute of Technology, Indore (M.P.), India
Abstract: This paper is concerned with recognition of handwritten Devnagri numerals. The basic objective of the present work is to provide an efficient and reliable technique for recognition of handwritten numerals. Automatic Recognition of Handwritten Devnagri Numerals is a difficult task. Handwritten Hindi Digit are imprecise in nature as their corners are not always sharp, lines are not perfectly straight, and curves are not necessarily smooth, unlikely the printed character. Furthermore, Hindi Digit can be drawn in different sizes. Therefore, a robust offline Hindi handwritten recognition system has to account for all of these factors. In the proposed method each character is subjected to thinning followed by size normalization. The structural features viz. loop; end points, cross points, maximum profile distances, and special shapes like U, C and 180 tilted C are used for handwritten numerals recognition. Artificial Neural Network is used as classifier for recognition. It has numerous applications including those in postal sorting, bank cheque processing and form processing. In this work, an efficient method is proposed for recognition of isolated handwritten Devnagri numerals.
Author Keywords: ANN; Features; Neuron; Offline character recognition; Structural feature

Authors: Thomas J., Chaudhari N.S.
Title: Two approaches for hamiltonian circuit problem using satisfiability
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Computer science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, M-Block I.E.T D.A.V.V Campus, Khandwa Road, Indore-452011, India
Authors with affiliations: Thomas, J., Department of Computer science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, M-Block I.E.T D.A.V.V Campus, Khandwa Road, Indore-452011, India; Chaudhari, N.S., Department of Computer science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, M-Block I.E.T D.A.V.V Campus, Khandwa Road, Indore-452011, India
Abstract: A Hamiltonian circuit is a cycle in a graph which visits each vertex exactly once and also returns to the starting vertex. Determining whether such cycles exist in graphs is the Hamiltonian Circuit problem. In this paper, we propose two different approaches to solve the problem. Both our approaches proceed, by reducing a given graph to its equivalent 3-SAT representation. Further, we explore the generated clauses to determine a satisfying truth value assignment. If the values assigned evaluate the clauses to true it indicates the presence of Hamiltonian circuit otherwise not. The two approaches differ in the number of constraints used for reduction. The approach discussed, is better than the already existing backtracking and heuristic based approaches.
Author Keywords: 3SAT; Constraints; Hamiltonian circuit; NP-complete; Satisfiability

Authors: Kumar A., Agrawal R.
Title: A prediction model for Alternaria blight in mustard crop based on artificial neural network
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Division of Forecasting and Econometric Techniques, Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, Library Avenue, New Delhi, India; Division of Forecasting and Econometrics Techniques, Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, Library Avenue, New Delhi, India
Authors with affiliations: Kumar, A., Division of Forecasting and Econometric Techniques, Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, Library Avenue, New Delhi, India; Agrawal, R., Division of Forecasting and Econometrics Techniques, Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, Library Avenue, New Delhi, India
Abstract: There is considerable loss in the yield of the crops as well as quality of produce due to the infestation of various pests and diseases. Such losses can be reduced to a considerable extent if their occurrence is known in advance so that timely remedial measures may be taken. Thus there is a need to develop forewarning systems which can provide advance information for outbreak of pests/diseases attack. Weather plays vital role in development of pests and diseases infestation in crops, therefore, a technique for forewarning pests/diseases may be obtained on the basis of weather variables. Most of the earlier workers have utilised regression models (both linear and non linear) for pests/diseases forewarning. Recently artificial neural network (ANNs) techniques have become the focus of much attention, largely because of their wide range of applicability and the ease with which they can treat complicated problems even if the data are imprecise and noisy. From statistical perspective, neural networks are interesting because of their potential use in prediction. This methodology has been explored for forewarning Alternaria blight in mustard for maximum disease severity, crop age at first appearance of disease and crop age at maximum disease severity as response variables and weather indices as predictors for three locations namely Bharatpur, Dholi and Berhampur. In this study, two types of neural network architectures namely Multilayer perceptron (MLP) and Radial basis function (RBF) were attempted and compared with weather indices based regression model and it has been found that a MLP performs best in terms of mean absolute percentage error (MAPE).
Author Keywords: Alternaria blight; Artificial neural network; Multilayer perceptron; Radial basis function
Index Keywords: Alternaria blight; Disease severity; Mean absolute percentage error; Multi layer perceptron; Prediction model; Radial basis functions; Regression model; Remedial measures; Weather index; Neural networks; Radial basis function networks; Regression analysis; Crops

Authors: Ray S., Alam M., Ray S., Mollah A.F.
Title: Design of a predictor for MD5 based cryptographic systems: A TVAC-PSO based approach
Source title: Proceedings of the 2011 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2011
Affiliations: R and D Division, Cadence Design System, Noida, India; Dept. of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University, Kolkata, India
Authors with affiliations: Ray, S.; Alam, M., R and D Division, Cadence Design System, Noida, India; Ray, S., R and D Division, Cadence Design System, Noida, India; Mollah, A.F., Dept. of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University, Kolkata, India
Abstract: This paper puts forward an efficient and optimized method to determine the probable-colluders in a MD5 based cryptosystem. Along with the conventional MD5 implementing architecture, our scheme employs a predictor control block which takes the message stream from the user, and provides the log-list of the equal length bit-streams that are most likely to produce collisions with the message stream in a real time system. The predictor controller uses Time varying Acceleration Coefficient Particle Swarm optimization (TVAC-PSO) algorithm. Besides proposing the algorithm itself the paper also surveys the performance of the predictor when employed with different hardware platforms.
Author Keywords: Collision; MD-5; TVAC-PSO

Authors: Gupta N., Lal S.
Title: Real time rough set based behavior cluster modeling system
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Computer Engineering, Defence Institute of Advanced Technology (DU), Girinagar, Pune-411025, India
Authors with affiliations: Gupta, N., Department of Computer Engineering, Defence Institute of Advanced Technology (DU), Girinagar, Pune-411025, India; Lal, S., Department of Computer Engineering, Defence Institute of Advanced Technology (DU), Girinagar, Pune-411025, India
Abstract: With the growth of computer network activities, network attacks rate is also growing. Monitoring of such a huge real time data network cannot be done manually anymore. We need efficient and autonomous algorithms which investigate the real time network data. A good mechanism for analyzing this data automatically is Clustering. A variety of cluster analysis techniques exist to group objects having similar characteristics, but some of these algorithms are unable to handle uncertainty in the clustering process while others have stability issues. In this paper we proposes a real time behavior monitoring system implemented in Java programming language and uses JPcap library to capture the real time traffic over network. After capturing the traffic we classify normal network activities and main attack types consisting of Probe and Denial of Service (DoS) and then cluster the behavior of nodes using rough set theory.

Authors: Kumar N., Rai P., Pulla C., Jawahar C.V.
Title: Video scene segmentation with a semantic similarity
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Center for Visual Information Technology, IIIT Hyderabad, Gachibowli, Hyderabad-32, India
Authors with affiliations: Kumar, N., Center for Visual Information Technology, IIIT Hyderabad, Gachibowli, Hyderabad-32, India; Rai, P., Center for Visual Information Technology, IIIT Hyderabad, Gachibowli, Hyderabad-32, India; Pulla, C., Center for Visual Information Technology, IIIT Hyderabad, Gachibowli, Hyderabad-32, India; Jawahar, C.V., Center for Visual Information Technology, IIIT Hyderabad, Gachibowli, Hyderabad-32, India
Abstract: Video Scene Segmentation is an important problem in computer vision as it helps in efficient storage, indexing and retrieval of videos. Significant amount of work has been done in this area in the form of shot segmentation techniques and they often give reasonably good results. However, shots are not of much importance for the semantic analysis of the videos. For semantic and meaningful analysis of the videos (e.g. movies), scene is more important since it captures one complete unit of action. People have tried different approaches in scene segmentation but almost all of them use color, texture etc. to compute scene boundaries. In this paper, we propose a new algorithm based on a Bag of Words(BoW) representation which computes semantic similarity between shots using a Bipartite Graph Model (BGM). Based on semantic similarity, we detect the scene boundaries in the movie. We have tested our algorithm on a multiple Hollywood movies, and the proposed method is found to give good results.
Index Keywords: Bag of words; Bipartite graphs; Indexing and retrieval; Scene segmentation; Semantic analysis; Semantic similarity; Shot segmentation; Video scene segmentation; Algorithms; Artificial intelligence; Computer vision; Graph theory; Semantics; Motion pictures

Authors: Verma H., Agrawal R.K.
Title: Automatic segmentation of MRI brain image using type-3 fuzzy c-means clustering algorithm
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: School of Computer and Systems Sciences, Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi-110067, India
Authors with affiliations: Verma, H., School of Computer and Systems Sciences, Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi-110067, India; Agrawal, R.K., School of Computer and Systems Sciences, Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi-110067, India
Abstract: Fuzzy clustering segmentation methods have been widely used in the brain medical images, because theses methods can preserve more information than the other segmentation methods. However, type-1 fuzzy set used in conventional FCM is unable to handle uncertainty in better way present in the brain image. The research work has shown better segmentation result when type-2 fuzzy set, which is an extension of type-1, is used in conventional FCM. To the best of our knowledge, the higher order fuzzy sets, which can handle uncertainty in better way, is not used with conventional FCM. In this paper, we have proposed clustering method which is based on higher order fuzzy set (type-3) in conjunction with conventional FCM. To evaluate the performance of proposed method, we have used percentage misclassification error and compared its performance with Gustafson-Kessel (GK) algorithm, conventional FCM, type-2 FCM algorithm and type-3 FCM. Experiments are performed on T1-weighted MRI brain images which are publicly available. Experimental results shows that the proposed method gives better performance in comparison to other methods.
Author Keywords: Fuzzy c-means; Gustafson-Kessel algorithm; Magnetic resonance imaging; MRI segmentation; Type-2 fuzzy c-means; Type-3 fuzzy c-means

Authors: Vinay K., Rao A., Hemanthakumar G.
Title: Comparative study on performance of single classifier with ensemble of classifiers in predicting radiological experts ratings on lung nodules
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: DoS in Computer Science, University of Mysore, India; Freelance Academician, 165, 11th main, S. Puram, Mysore, India
Authors with affiliations: Vinay, K., DoS in Computer Science, University of Mysore, India; Rao, A., Freelance Academician, 165, 11th main, S. Puram, Mysore, India; Hemanthakumar, G., DoS in Computer Science, University of Mysore, India
Abstract: In this paper we used a single classifier and an ensemble of classifiers with meta learning strategies to predict radiologists characteristics rating of the lung nodule of the Lung Image Database Consortium. In particular, in this paper we carried out performance analysis experiment of single classifier as against ensemble of classifiers (ensemble of classifiers are considered to be panel of experts in machine learning). We used 54 low level image feature of nodule in four category (shape, texture, size and intensity) and 7 characteristics rating (lobulation, malignancy, sphericity, spiculation, margin, subtlety and texture) from panel of radiologists as a features to create a prediction model. Using our proposed approach, the classification accuracy of ensemble of classifiers is better compared to the accuracy by single classifier which is a generally accepted result. However the correlation of these with that based on Statistics (Kappa Statistics) is very inconsistent. This raises a very important issue of gap between medically significant and statistically significant results. This issue is of serious concern in biomedical field.
Author Keywords: DECORATE; Ensemble classifier; Kappa statistics; LIDC; Machine learning

Authors: Kishor Kumar G., Viswanath P., Ananda Rao A.
Title: Intrusion detection using an ensemble of decision trees
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of IT, Rajeev Gandhi Memorial College of Eng. and Technology, Nandyal-518501, Kurnool, A.P., India; Department of CSE, Rajeev Gandhi Memorial College of Eng. and Technology, Nandyal-518501, Kurnool, A.P., India; Department of CSE, JNTUA College of Engineering, Anantapur, A.P., India
Authors with affiliations: Kishor Kumar, G., Department of IT, Rajeev Gandhi Memorial College of Eng. and Technology, Nandyal-518501, Kurnool, A.P., India; Viswanath, P., Department of CSE, Rajeev Gandhi Memorial College of Eng. and Technology, Nandyal-518501, Kurnool, A.P., India; Ananda Rao, A., Department of CSE, JNTUA College of Engineering, Anantapur, A.P., India
Abstract: In this paper, we present, "an ensemble of decision trees" for intrusion detection, for computer networks. First, the k-prototype method, which is a partition based clustering method, is applied to partition the training instances into k-clusters. Then, a C4.5 decision tree on each cluster is built. For the given network connection, which is a feature vector, decision of each decision tree is obtained. To obtain a final decision for classification, individual decisions of decision trees are combined giving a weight to each decision. Weight to a decision is given based on the query feature vector's distance with each cluster's centroid distance. We report our results of applying this ensemble of decision trees to the extensively gathered network audit data for the 1998 and 1999 MIT DARPA intrusion detection evaluation program.
Author Keywords: Classification; Decision tree; Ensemble techniques; Intrusion detection; K-prototype clustering
Index Keywords: Ensemble techniques; Evaluation program; Feature vectors; Final decision; K-prototype; Network audit; Network connection; Partition-based clustering; Artificial intelligence; Classification (of information); Cluster analysis; Intrusion detection; Decision trees

Authors: Monangi P., Rege P.P.
Title: Historical color document image enhancement using adaptive binarization method
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: College of Engineering, Pune, India
Authors with affiliations: Monangi, P., College of Engineering, Pune, India; Rege, P.P., College of Engineering, Pune, India
Abstract: The first step in document analysis and recognition is usually binarization. Thresholding or binarization is a simple and efficient method for image enhancement and segmentation of document images. This paper presents new binarization algorithm for degraded color document images. The proposed algorithm consists of two steps: a pre-processing stage which consists of low-pass Wiener filter and contrast stretching followed by binarization stage which consists of modified adaptive thresholding for segmentation of text from the background. The technique is tested on a set of historical color document images. The performance of the algorithm is demonstrated on historical color documents distorted with show-through effects, uneven background color and localized spot. The proposed method is effective computationally.

Authors: Mahanand B.S., Aswatha Kumar M.
Title: Brain morphometric analysis on Alzheimer's disease magnetic resonance images
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Information Science and Engineering, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore 570 006, India; Department of Information Science and Engineering, M. S. Ramaiah Institute of Technology, Bangalore 560 054, India
Authors with affiliations: Mahanand, B.S., Department of Information Science and Engineering, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore 570 006, India; Aswatha Kumar, M., Department of Information Science and Engineering, M. S. Ramaiah Institute of Technology, Bangalore 560 054, India
Abstract: Structural magnetic resonance imaging based brain morphometry plays a vital role in identifying tissue volume changes between normal persons and patients of various neurodegenerative diseases. In this paper, tensor-based morphometry and voxel-based morphometry approaches are employed to investigate and analyze the brain tissue volume changes in Alzheimer's disease. In this study, the magnetic resonance images of 30 Alzheimer's disease patients and 30 normal persons from the well-known open access series of imaging studies data set are used. From the study, it is noted that both tensor-based morphometric and voxel-based morphometric analysis detect increased brain tissue volume changes in Alzheimer's disease patients compared to the normal persons. The results obtained from the study shows tissue volume changes predominantly in the temporal lobe of the brain indicating atrophy in the Alzheimer's disease patients.

Authors: Pandya Y., Parey A.
Title: Fault detection of a two-stage gearbox with artificially induced gear crack using vibration monitoring
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: School of Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Indore, Indore-17, India
Authors with affiliations: Pandya, Y., School of Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Indore, Indore-17, India; Parey, A., School of Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Indore, Indore-17, India
Abstract: The fault diagnosis of a gear crack in a two-stage gearbox using the vibration signal processing techniques is the aim of the present work. The online vibration data were recorded for a set of normal gear and cracked gear, at a particular speed and various loading conditions on Drivetrain Diagnostics Simulator. Spectral analysis is carried out for a healthy gear and a cracked gear to demonstrate modulation sidebands from cracked and normal spur gear vibration measurements. The amplitude of sidebands can be used as an input parameter in various artificial intelligence techniques for fault detection. In this paper experimental study has been done to find relation between incipient gear crack at different loading conditions and amplitude of sidebands.

Authors: Abulaish M., Jahiruddin, Dey L.
Title: A statistical approach for automatic keyphrase extraction
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Center of Excellence in Information Assurance, King Saud University, Riyadh, Saudi Arabia; Department of Computer Science, Jamia Millia Islamia, New Delhi, India; Innovation Labs, Tata Consultancy Services, New Delhi, India
Authors with affiliations: Abulaish, M., Center of Excellence in Information Assurance, King Saud University, Riyadh, Saudi Arabia; Jahiruddin, Department of Computer Science, Jamia Millia Islamia, New Delhi, India; Dey, L., Innovation Labs, Tata Consultancy Services, New Delhi, India
Abstract: Due to availability of voluminous textual data either on the World Wide Web or in textual databases automatic keyphrase extraction has gained increasing popularity in recent past to summarize and characterize text documents. Consequently, a number of machine learning techniques, mostly supervised, have been proposed to mine keyphrases in an automatic way. But, the non-availability of annotated corpus for training such systems is the main hinder for their success. In this paper, we propose the design of an automatic keyphrase extraction system which uses NLP and statistical approach to mine keyphrases from unstructured text documents. The efficacy of the proposed system is established over texts crawled from Wikipedia server. On evaluation we found that the proposed method outperforms KEA which uses naïve Bayes classification technique for keyphrase extraction.

Title: Fuzzy automata inspired intelligent assesment of learning achievement
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Sikkim Manipal Institute of Technology, Majitar, Rangpo, Sikkim (E) - 737 136, India; Department of Computer Science and Engineering, National Institute of Technical Teachers' Training and Research (NITTTR), Kolkata, Salt Lake City, Kolkata 700106, India
Authors with affiliations: Chakraborty, U.K., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Sikkim Manipal Institute of Technology, Majitar, Rangpo, Sikkim (E) - 737 136, India; Roy, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, National Institute of Technical Teachers' Training and Research (NITTTR), Kolkata, Salt Lake City, Kolkata 700106, India
Abstract: Advances in Information and Communication Technology (ICT) has contributed in developing free and fair information processing and propagation across frontiers in recent times. However, the applications of ICT in Education have largely been restricted to content delivery types and styles. Existing automated evaluation systems can evaluate MCQ (multiple choice questions) using online responses of learners and matching these with pre-processed information. Such systems lack the humane element essential for testing complete knowledge, wherein the ingenuity of the learner may be evaluated. Another area, where current day automated evaluation systems fall short of achievement is identification and intelligent processing of inadvertent human errors committed by learners. This paper presents an efficient fuzzy automata inspired scheme for intelligent recognition of learners' text-based response. The proposed system is intelligently adaptive to inadvertent mistakes committed by the learner, and imitates a benevolent human evaluator.

Authors: Arun J.P.
Title: Performance evaluation of parallel multi-objective particle swarm optimization
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: IIT Roorkee, India
Authors with affiliations: Arun, J.P., IIT Roorkee, India
Abstract: Most of the real-world optimization problems are NP-hard and compute intensive. To solve such problems, meta-heuristic based approach such as evolutionary algorithms tackle problem of NP-hardness and parallel implementation tackles issue of compute-intensiveness. However, for parallel implementation of algorithms, selecting appropriate platform is necessity as it affects the overall cost. Because of the accuracy and easiness, to solve the optimization problems, Particle swarm optimization (PSO) gained ample attention of researchers over the decade. In this paper, I have focused on the parallel implementation of multi-objective PSO on cluster and GPU. Based on the nature of fitness function and parameters of algorithms, this paper evaluates the performance of MOPSO.

Authors: Darshini I.P., Manjunath Aradhya V.N., Hemantha Kumar G.
Title: A multistage approach for handwritten Kannada numeral recognition
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Dept. of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, India; Dept. of Information Science and Engg., Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering, Bangalore, India
Authors with affiliations: Darshini, I.P., Dept. of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, India; Manjunath Aradhya, V.N., Dept. of Information Science and Engg., Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering, Bangalore, India; Hemantha Kumar, G., Dept. of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, India
Abstract: In this paper, we propose a novel multistage recognition system for unconstrained handwritten numerals for south Indian language of Kannada. The proposed method consists of two stages. In the first stage, wavelets are applied onto input numeral image which intern leads to a decomposition in four components: the approximation and the details in three orientations (horizontal, vertical and diagonal). In order to extract robust feature, well known subspace based feature i.e., Principal Component Analysis (PCA) is used for all the decomposed components. In the second stage of our algorithm, a multistage approach based on probabilistic neural network is used for subsequent classification purpose. The proposed system is tested on large database containing Kannada numerals and the results were found to be better compared to existing methods.

Authors: Hiremath P.S., Tegnoor J.R.
Title: Fuzzy logic based detection of follicles in ultrasound images of ovaries
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Studies and Research in Computer Science, Gulbarga University, Gulbarga, 585106, Karnataka, India
Authors with affiliations: Hiremath, P.S., Department of Studies and Research in Computer Science, Gulbarga University, Gulbarga, 585106, Karnataka, India; Tegnoor, J.R., Department of Studies and Research in Computer Science, Gulbarga University, Gulbarga, 585106, Karnataka, India
Abstract: The ovarian ultrasound imaging is an effective tool in infertility treatment. Monitoring the follicles is especially important in human reproduction. Periodic measurements of the size and shape of follicles over several days are the primary means of evaluation by physicians. Today monitoring the follicles is done by non-automatic means with human interaction. This work can be very demanding and inaccurate and, in most of the cases, means only an additional burden for medical experts. To improve the performance of follicle detection in ultrasound images of ovaries, we develop a new algorithm using fuzzy logic. The proposed method employs contourlet transform for despeckling the ultrasound images of ovaries, active contours without edge method for segmentation and fuzzy logic for classification. The seven geometric features are used as inputs to the fuzzy logic block of the Fuzzy Inference System (FIS). The output of the fuzzy logic block is a follicle class or no follicle class. The fuzzy-knowledge-base consists of a set of physically interpretable if then rules providing physical insight into the process. The experimentation has been done using sample ultrasound images of ovaries and the results are compared with the inferences drawn by 3σ interval based method and also those drawn by the medical expert. The experimental results demonstrate the efficacy of the method.

Authors: Guru D.S., Sharath Kumar Y.H., Manjunath S.
Title: Classification of flowers based on whorl region
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Studies in Computer Science, Manasagangotri, University of Mysore, Mysore-570 006, India
Authors with affiliations: Guru, D.S., Department of Studies in Computer Science, Manasagangotri, University of Mysore, Mysore-570 006, India; Sharath Kumar, Y.H., Department of Studies in Computer Science, Manasagangotri, University of Mysore, Mysore-570 006, India; Manjunath, S., Department of Studies in Computer Science, Manasagangotri, University of Mysore, Mysore-570 006, India
Abstract: In this paper we propose a new method of classifying flowers using their whorl parts. Conventionally all the existing approaches classify flowers based on entire flower region. A flower image is segmented using color information obtained by HYPE's color specifier. The Gabor response of the segmented flower image is extracted and based on the Gabor response the whorl part of the flower is identified. The texture features viz., Leung-Malik filter responses, Schmid filter responses, Maximum responses, Gabor responses are extracted from the identified whorl part and combinations of these four are considered in classification of flowers. In this work we used different classifiers viz., probabilistic neural network, K-nearest neighbor and generalized regression neural network. Further the comparative study made reveal that the model based on probabilistic neural network has better performance. For experimentation we have created our own dataset of 20 classes of flowers each with 20 samples. Experimentation results reveal that classification of flowers based on whorl region is superior than classification of flowers based on entire flower region.

Authors: Jai Hari Raju J., Indhu Reka P., Nandavi K.K., Karky M.
Title: On interestingness modeling and humanness evaluation for generating Tamil summary of a cricket match
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: College of Engineering Guindy, Anna University, Chennai, Tamilnadu, India
Authors with affiliations: Jai Hari Raju, J., College of Engineering Guindy, Anna University, Chennai, Tamilnadu, India; Indhu Reka, P., College of Engineering Guindy, Anna University, Chennai, Tamilnadu, India; Nandavi, K.K., College of Engineering Guindy, Anna University, Chennai, Tamilnadu, India; Karky, M., College of Engineering Guindy, Anna University, Chennai, Tamilnadu, India
Abstract: Cricket is one of the most followed sports in the world. This game has many parameters that influence its outcome. It is the complexity of Cricket that makes it compelling to analyze. AI techniques help us in this analysis. In this paper, we analyze and develop a model to quantify the interestingness of a cricket match. Various parameters contributing to the interestingness are determined, assessed and given due weightage. Interestingness modeling helps to identify the events to be mentioned in a summary, the order in which the events should be listed and the complexity of the sentence used to discuss the event. In this paper we also propose a framework to generate a customizable Tamil summary about the cricket match and define Humanness score, a parameter to assess how coherent and human, the generated summary is.

Authors: Jayaram M.A., Priyadarshini P., Nandeesh, Umesh T.S.
Title: A data driven fuzzy inference system for parametric modeling of water quality
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of Master of Computer Applications, India; Department of Civil Engineering, Siddaganga Institute of Technology, Tumkur, India
Authors with affiliations: Jayaram, M.A., Department of Master of Computer Applications, India; Priyadarshini, P., Department of Master of Computer Applications, India; Nandeesh, Department of Civil Engineering, Siddaganga Institute of Technology, Tumkur, India; Umesh, T.S., Department of Civil Engineering, Siddaganga Institute of Technology, Tumkur, India
Abstract: Water quality management is an important issue in modern times. Determination of status of water quality is highly indeterminate. The purpose of this study is to bring about an association between the parameters in order to assess water quality. The term quality ascribed to water is itself fuzzy as it is only a relative term. However, in a more general characterization, it can be said that increase in total hardness (TH) is due to increase in calcium and magnesium. But, it is impossible to develop a precise mathematical model that can predict crisp numerical values of calcium or magnesium that correspond to crisp values of hardness. Similar argument holds good for total dissolved solids (TDS). TDS consists of inorganic salts such as carbonates, bicarbonates, chlorides, sulphates, phosphates of calcium, magnesium, potassium, iron, etc. and small amount of organic matter and dissolved gases. The determination of water quality due to contamination is highly unpredictable in crisp numerical terms. It may be necessary, with the help of previous experience, to generate additional linguistic expressions for the definition of related water quality parameters. The potential of fuzzy logic in developing qualitative model for characterization by approximate reasoning really lies here. Fuzzy set theory provides a powerful tool for modelling uncertainty associated with vagueness and imprecision. The present study deals with fifteen parametric variables that include Sodium, Potassium, Iron, Calcium, Magnesium, Bicarbonate, Carbonate, Chloride, Fluoride, Nitrates, Sulphates, Total Dissolved Solids, Conductivity, Hardness, pH. The experimental data is modeled in seven distinct steps. In the first five steps, one antecedent and one consequent models are developed. In the last two steps, two antecedents and one consequent models are developed. In total, seven fuzzy inference systems are built. An attempt has also been made to establish sensitivity of parameters. Results indicate that, TDS and total hardness turns to be very significant parameters to determine water quality. It is concluded that, the fuzzy inference system provides a prudent way to capture uncertainty in relationships among parameters that control the water quality.
Author Keywords: Anions; Cations; Linguistic expressions; TDS; TH; WQM

Authors: Subalalitha C.N., Parthasarathi R.
Title: A language independent rhetorical structure framework using Universal Networking Language
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2011
Affiliations: Department of IST, College of Engineering, Guindy, Anna University, Chennai-25, India
Authors with affiliations: Subalalitha, C.N., Department of IST, College of Engineering, Guindy, Anna University, Chennai-25, India; Parthasarathi, R., Department of IST, College of Engineering, Guindy, Anna University, Chennai-25, India
Abstract: We present a language independent approach to find discourse relations using an intermediate semantic document representation language known as Universal Networking Language (UNL). The similarities existing between the UNL features and discourse relations have been explored to identify the discourse relations. Initially a set of rules to map UNL features and discourse relations are framed. Using this initial feature set, new features for each discourse relation are learnt using Yarowsky Bootstrapping approach. The proposed mechanism has been tested with 5000 Tamil language text documents converted to UNL. A F-score of 84.37 % is obtained. To the best of our knowledge, this is the first RST framework developed for Tamil Language text documents.
Author Keywords: Coherence relations; Discourse relations; Rhetorical structure theory; Universal Networking Language

Authors: Shah S., Jayadeva, Kothari R., Chandra S.
Title: M-unit Eigenant: An ant algorithm to find the M best solutions
Source title: Proceedings of the National Conference on Artificial Intelligence
Affiliations: Dept. of Electrical Engg., IIT Delhi, Hauz Khas, New Delhi 110016, India; IBM India Research Lab., 4 Block C, Institutional Area, Vasant Kunj New Delhi - 110070, India; Dept. of Mathematics, IIT Delhi, Hauz Khas, New Delhi 110016, India
Authors with affiliations: Shah, S., Dept. of Electrical Engg., IIT Delhi, Hauz Khas, New Delhi 110016, India; Jayadeva, Dept. of Electrical Engg., IIT Delhi, Hauz Khas, New Delhi 110016, India; Kothari, R., IBM India Research Lab., 4 Block C, Institutional Area, Vasant Kunj New Delhi - 110070, India; Chandra, S., Dept. of Mathematics, IIT Delhi, Hauz Khas, New Delhi 110016, India
Abstract: In this paper, we shed light on how powerful congestion control based on local interactions may be obtained. We show how ants can use repellent pheromones and incorporate the effect of crowding to avoid traffic congestion on the optimal path. Based on these interactions, we propose an ant algorithm, the M-unit EigenAnt algorithm, that leads to the selection of the M shortest paths. The ratio of selection of each of these paths is also optimal and regulated by an optimal amount of pheromone on each of them. To the best of our knowledge, the M-unit EigenAnt algorithm is the first ant algorithm that explicitly ensures the selection of the M shortest paths and regulates the amount of pheromone on them such that it is asymptotically optimal. Intact, it is in contrast with most ant algorithms that aim to discover just a single best path. We provide its convergence analysis and show that the steady state distribution of pheromone aligns with the eigenvectors of the cost matrix, and thus is related to its measure of quality. We also provide analysis to show that this property ensues even when the food is moved or path lengths change during foraging. We show that this behavior is robust in the presence of fluctuations and quickly reflects the change in the M optimal solutions. This makes it suitable for not only distributed applications but also dynamic ones as well. Finally, we provide simulation results for the convergence to the optimal solution under different initial biases, dynamism in lengths of paths, and discovery of new paths. Authors: Kameshwaran S., Mehta S., Pandit V.
Title: Design and analysis of value creation networks
Source title: Proceedings of the National Conference on Artificial Intelligence
Affiliations: IBM Research, India
Authors with affiliations: Kameshwaran, S., IBM Research, India; Mehta, S., IBM Research, India; Pandit, V., IBM Research, India
Abstract: There are many diverse domains like academic collaboration, service industry, and movies, where a group of agents are involved in a set of activities through interactions or collaborations to create value. The end result of the value creation process is two pronged: firstly, there is a cumulative value created due to the interactions and secondly, a network that captures the pattern of historical interactions between the agents. In this paper we summarize our efforts towards design and analysis of value creation networks: 1) network representation of interactions and value creations, 2) identify contribution of a node based on values created from various activities, and 3) ranking nodes based on structural properties of interactions and the resulting values. To highlight the efficacy of our proposed algorithms, we present results on IMDB and services industry data. Copyright © 2011, Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence. Authors: Tyagi V., Ratha N.
Title: Biometric score fusion through discriminative training
Source title: IEEE Computer Society Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition Workshops
Affiliations: IBM Research - India, Plot 4, Block-C, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi, India; IBM T J Watson Research Center, Hawthorne, NY 10532, United States
Authors with affiliations: Tyagi, V., IBM Research - India, Plot 4, Block-C, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi, India; Ratha, N., IBM T J Watson Research Center, Hawthorne, NY 10532, United States
Abstract: In the multibiometric systems, various matcher/modality scores are fused together to provide better performance than the individual matcher scores. In [1] the authors have proposed a likelihood ratio test (LRT) based fusion technique for the biometric verification task that outperformed several other classifiers. They model the genuine and the imposter densities by the finite Gaussian mixture models (GMM, a generative model) whose parameters are estimated using the maximum likelihood (ML) criteria. Lately, the discriminative training methods and models have been shown to provide additional accuracy gains over the generative models, in multiple applications such as the speech recognition, verification and text analytics[5, 7]. These gains are based on the fact that the discriminative models are able to partially compensate for the unavoidable mismatch, which is always present between the specified statistical model (GMM in this case) and the true distribution of the data which is unknown. In this paper, we propose to use a discriminative method to estimate the GMM density parameters using the maximum accept and reject (MARS) criteria[8]. The test results using the proposed method on the NIST-BSSRI multimodal dataset indicate improved verification performance over a very competitive maximum likelihood (ML) trained system proposed in [1]. © 2011 IEEE.

Authors: Kanaujia A., Haering N., Taylor G., Bregler C.
Title: 3D Human pose and shape estimation from multi-view imagery
Source title: IEEE Computer Society Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition Workshops
Affiliations: ObjectVideo, Inc., India; New York University, United States
Authors with affiliations: Kanaujia, A., ObjectVideo, Inc., India; Haering, N., ObjectVideo, Inc., India; Taylor, G., New York University, United States; Bregler, C., New York University, United States
Abstract: In this study we present robust solution for estimating 3D pose and shape of human targets from multiple, synchronized video streams. The objective is to automatically estimate physical attributes of the targets that would allow us to analyze its behavior non-intrusively. Proposed system estimates the anthropometric skeleton, pose and shape of the human target from the 3D visual hull reconstructed from multiple silhouettes of the target. Discriminative (bottom-up) method is used to first initialize 3D pose of the targets using low-level features extracted from the 2D image. The pose is refined using generative (top-down) method that also estimates the optimal skeleton of the target using anthropometric prior models learned from the CAESAR dataset. Statistical shape models are also learned from the CAESAR dataset and are used to model both global and local shape variability of human body parts. We also propose a novel optimization scheme to fit 3D shape by searching in the parametric space of local parts model and constraining the overall shape using a global shape model. The system provides a useful framework for automatically identifying dispropotionate body parts, estimating size of backpacks and inferring attributes like gender, age and ethnicity of the human target. © 2011 IEEE.

Authors: Gupta H., Yu L., Hakeem A., Choe T.E., Haering N., Locasto M.
Title: Multimodal complex event detection framework for wide area surveillance
Source title: IEEE Computer Society Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition Workshops
Affiliations: ObjectVideo Inc., India; Univ. of Calgary, Australia

Abstract: There is an increasing demand for detecting complex events from heterogeneous sensor networks to support the Global War On Terror (GWOT). This paper presents a framework addressing several vital aspects of a multimodal complex event detection system for wide area surveillance. The paper discusses the key modules for an effective system including complex event specification, cross-camera tracking for wide area surveillance, simple and complex event detection from video and network data, and high-level complex event inference from multimodal data using Markov Logic Networks. A novel testing framework is also discussed for data collection, system debugging and performance evaluation. © 2011 IEEE.

Authors: Ladha S., Smith-Miles K., Chandran S.
Title: Projection defocus correction using adaptive kernel sampling and geometric correction in dual-planar environments
Source title: IEEE Computer Society Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition Workshops
Affiliations: IITB, Monash Research Academy, Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay, India; School of Mathematical Sciences, Monash University, Australia; Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay, India
Authors with affiliations: Ladha, S., IITB, Monash Research Academy, Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay, India; Smith-Miles, K., School of Mathematical Sciences, Monash University, Australia; Chandran, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay, India
Abstract: Defocus blur correction for projectors using a camera is useful when the projector is used in ad hoc environments. However, past literature has not explicitly considered the common situation when the projection surface includes a corner made up of two planar surfaces that abut each other, such as the ubiquitous office cubicle. In this paper, we advance the state of the art by demonstrating defocus correction in a non-parametric setting. Our method differs from prior methods in that (a) the luminance and chrominance channels are independently considered, and (b) a sparse sampling of the surface is used to discover the spatially varying defocus kernel. © 2011 IEEE.

Authors: Bharadwaj S., Bhatt H., Vatsa M., Singh R., Noore A.
Title: Quality assessment based denoising to improve face recognition performance
Source title: IEEE Computer Society Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition Workshops
Affiliations: Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology (IIIT), New Delhi, India; West Virginia University, Morgantown, WV, United States
Authors with affiliations: Bharadwaj, S., Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology (IIIT), New Delhi, India; Bhatt, H., Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology (IIIT), New Delhi, India; Vatsa, M., Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology (IIIT), New Delhi, India; Singh, R., Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology (IIIT), New Delhi, India; Noore, A., West Virginia University, Morgantown, WV, United States
Abstract: A probe face image may contain noise due to environmental conditions, incorrect use of sensors or transmission error. The performance of face recognition severely depletes when the probe image is contaminated with noise. Denoising techniques can improve recognition performance, provided the correct parameters are used. In this paper, a parameter selection framework is presented. In the proposed framework, the optimal parameter set is selected for denoising using quality assessment algorithms with low complexity. Quality score based parameter selection is evaluated on the AR face dataset. A correlation study is discussed to ascertain the relationship between the quality scores and recognition rate. The experiments suggest that the proposed framework improves the performance both in terms of accuracy and computation time. © 2011 IEEE.

Authors: Shaji A., Varol A., Fua P., Yashoteja, Jain A., Chandran S.
Title: Resolving occlusion in multiframe reconstruction of deformable surfaces
Source title: IEEE Computer Society Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition Workshops
Affiliations: Computer Vision Laboratory, EPFL, Switzerland; Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay, India
Authors with affiliations: Shaji, A., Computer Vision Laboratory, EPFL, Switzerland; Varol, A., Computer Vision Laboratory, EPFL, Switzerland; Fua, P., Computer Vision Laboratory, EPFL, Switzerland; Yashoteja, Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay, India; Jain, A., Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay, India; Chandran, S., Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay, India
Abstract: Occlusion is troublesome for almost all computer vision algorithms. To a certain extent, the difficulty is alleviated when multiple frames are given. On the other hand, when we consider the recovery of shapes of moving deformable objects, observed using a monocular camera, the problem appears difficult again. In this paper, we show a method that outperforms previous approaches to reconstruction when feature data is unavailable, perhaps due to occlusion. Our key intuition is that portions of the surface that are visible in some frame can be reliably reconstructed in that frame; further, the reliable portions can be stitched together to find even missing portions, much the way a human eye would hallucinate. Our techniques are based on optimization in Riemannian shape spaces, and is demonstrated on isometric surfaces without involving any kind of machine learning methods. © 2011 IEEE.

Authors: Jawanpuria P., Nath J.S., Ramakrishnan G.
Title: Efficient rule ensemble learning using hierarchical kernels
Source title: Proceedings of the 28th International Conference on Machine Learning, ICML 2011
Affiliations: Dept. of CSE, IIT-Bombay, Mumbai, India
Authors with affiliations: Jawanpuria, P., Dept. of CSE, IIT-Bombay, Mumbai, India; Nath, J.S., Dept. of CSE, IIT-Bombay, Mumbai, India; Ramakrishnan, G., Dept. of CSE, IIT-Bombay, Mumbai, India
Abstract: This paper addresses the problem of Rule Ensemble Learning (REL), where the goal is simultaneous discovery of a small set of simple rules and their optimal weights that lead to good generalization. Rules are assumed to be conjunctions of basic propositions concerning the values taken by the input features. From the perspectives of interpretability as well as generalization, it is highly desirable to construct rule ensembles with low training error, having rules that are i) simple, i.e., involve few conjunctions and ii) few in number. We propose to explore the (exponentially) large feature space of all possible conjunctions optimally and efficiently by employing the recently introduced Hierarchical Kernel Learning (HKL) framework. The regularizer employed in the HKL formulation can be interpreted as a potential for discouraging selection of rules involving large number of conjunctions - justifying its suitability for constructing rule ensembles. Simulation results show that, in case of many benchmark datasets, the proposed approach improves over state-of-the-art REL algorithms in terms of generalization and indeed learns simple rules. Unfortunately, HKL selects a conjunction only if all its subsets are selected. We propose a novel convex formulation which alleviates this problem and generalizes the HKL framework. The main technical contribution of this paper is an efficient mirrordescent based active set algorithm for solving the new formulation. Empirical evaluations on REL problems illustrate the utility of generalized HKL. Copyright 2011 by the author(s)/owner(s).
Index Keywords: Active sets; Benchmark datasets; Empirical evaluations; Ensemble learning; Feature space; Input features; Interpretability; Kernel learning; Optimal weight; Regularizer; Simple rules; Technical contribution; Training errors; Learning systems; Algorithms

Authors: Maji S., Vishnoi N.K., Malik J.
Title: Biased normalized cuts
Source title: Proceedings of the IEEE Computer Society Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition
Affiliations: University of California, Berkeley, United States; Microsoft Research India, Bangalore, India
Authors with affiliations: Maji, S., University of California, Berkeley, United States; Vishnoi, N.K., Microsoft Research India, Bangalore, India; Malik, J., University of California, Berkeley, United States
Abstract: We present a modification of "Normalized Cuts" to incorporate priors which can be used for constrained image segmentation. Compared to previous generalizations of "NormalizedCuts" which incorporate constraints, our technique has two advantages. First, we seek solutions which are sufficiently "correlated" with priors which allows us to use noisy top-down information, for example from an object detector. Second, given the spectral solution of the unconstrained problem, the solution of the constrained one can be computed in small additional time, which allows us to run the algorithm in an interactive mode. We compare our algorithm to other graph cut based algorithms and highlight the advantages. © 2011 IEEE.

Authors: Das Gupta M., Xiao J.
Title: Non-negative matrix factorization as a feature selection tool for maximum margin classifiers
Source title: Proceedings of the IEEE Computer Society Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition
Affiliations: GE Global Research, Bangalore, India; Epson Research and Development Inc., San Jose, CA, United States
Authors with affiliations: Das Gupta, M., GE Global Research, Bangalore, India; Xiao, J., Epson Research and Development Inc., San Jose, CA, United States
Abstract: Non-negative matrix factorization (NMF) has previously been shown to be a useful decomposition tool for multivariate data. Non-negative bases allow strictly additive combinations which have been shown to be part-based as well as relatively sparse. We pursue a discriminative decomposition by coupling NMF objective with a maximum margin classifier, specifically a support vector machine (SVM). Conversely, we propose an NMF based regularizer for SVM. We formulate the joint update equations and propose a new method which identifies the decomposition as well as the classification parameters. We present classification results on synthetic as well as real datasets. © 2011 IEEE.

Authors: Edupuganti V.G., Agarwal V.A., Kompalli S.
Title: Registration of camera captured documents under non-rigid deformation
Source title: Proceedings of the IEEE Computer Society Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition
Affiliations: Dept. of Computer Science, New Jersey Inst. of Technology, Newark, NJ, United States; Stanford University, Stanford, CA, United States; Hewlett-Packard Labs, Bangalore, India
Authors with affiliations: Edupuganti, V.G., Dept. of Computer Science, New Jersey Inst. of Technology, Newark, NJ, United States; Agarwal, V.A., Stanford University, Stanford, CA, United States; Kompalli, S., Hewlett-Packard Labs, Bangalore, India
Abstract: Document registration is a problem where the image of a template document whose layout is known is registered with a test document image. Given the registration parameters, layout of the template image is superimposed on the test document. Registration algorithms have been popular in applications, such as forms processing where the superimposed layout is used to extract relevant fields. Prior art has been designed to work with scanned documents under affine transformation. We find that the proliferation of camera captured images makes it necessary to address camera noise such as non-uniform lighting, clutter, and highly variable scale/resolution. The absence of a scan bed also leads to challenging non-rigid deformations being seen in paper images. Prior approaches in point pattern based registration like RANdom SAmple Consensus (RANSAC) [4], and Thin Plate Spline-Robust Point Matching (TPS-RPM) [5, 6] form the basis of our work. We propose enhancements to these methods to enable registration of cell phone and camera captured documents under non-rigid transformations. We embed three novel aspects into the framework: (i) histogram based uniformly transformed correspondence estimation, (ii) clustering of points located near the regions of interest (ROI) to select only close by regions for matching, (iii) validation of the registration in RANSAC and TPS-RPM algorithms for non-rigid registration. We consider Scale Invariant Feature Transform (SIFT) [8] and Speeded-Up Robust Features (SURF) [1] as our features. Results are reported as comparing prior art with our method on a dataset that will be made publicly available. © 2011 IEEE.

Authors: Jain V., Learned-Miller E.
Title: Online domain adaptation of a pre-trained cascade of classifiers
Source title: Proceedings of the IEEE Computer Society Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition
Affiliations: Yahoo Labs Bangalore, India; University of Massachusetts, Amherst, United States
Authors with affiliations: Jain, V., Yahoo Labs Bangalore, India; Learned-Miller, E., University of Massachusetts, Amherst, United States
Abstract: Many classifiers are trained with massive training sets only to be applied at test time on data from a different distribution. How can we rapidly and simply adapt a classifier to a new test distribution, even when we do not have access to the original training data? We present an on-line approach for rapidly adapting a black box classifier to a new test data set without retraining the classifier or examining the original optimization criterion. Assuming the original classifier outputs a continuous number for which a threshold gives the class, we reclassify points near the original boundary using a Gaussian process regression scheme. We show how this general procedure can be used in the context of a classifier cascade, demonstrating performance that far exceeds state-of-the-art results in face detection on a standard data set. We also draw connections to work in semi-supervised learning, domain adaptation, and information regularization. © 2011 IEEE.

Authors: Verma M., Varma V.
Title: Applying key phrase extraction to aid invalidity search
Source title: Proceedings of the International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Law
Affiliations: Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Verma, M., Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India; Varma, V., Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India
Abstract: Invalidity search poses different challenges when compared to conventional Information Retrieval problems. Presently, the success of invalidity search relies on the queries created from a patent application by the patent examiner. Since a lot of time is spent in constructing relevant queries, automatically creating them from a patent would save the examiner a lot of effort. In this paper, we address the problem of automatically creating queries from an input patent. An optimal query can be formed by extracting important keywords or phrases from a patent by using Key Phrase Extraction (KPE) techniques. Several KPE algorithms have been proposed in the literature but their performance on query construction for patents has not yet been explored. We systematically evaluate and analyze the performance of queries created by using state-of-the-art KPE techniques for invalidity search task. Our experiments show that queries formed by KPE approaches perform better than those formed by selecting phrases based on tf or tf-idf scores. © 2011 ACM.

Authors: Eswaran K., Chaitanya C.
Title: Cloud based unsupervised learning architecture based on mirroring neural networks
Source title: Recent Researches in Artificial Intelligence, Knowledge Engineering and Data Bases - 10th WSEAS International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, Knowledge Engineering and Data Bases, AIKED'11

Abstract: In this paper we build upon the Mirroring theorem introduced in [15] as a new method of unsupervised hierarchical pattern classification. The Mirroring theorem affirms that "given a collection of samples with enough information in it such that it can be classified into classes and sub-classes then 1. There exists a mapping which classifies and sub-classifies these samples 2. There exists a hierarchical classifier which can be constructed by using Mirroring Neural Networks (MNNs) in combination with a clustering algorithm that can approximate this mapping." This paper visualizes a cloud based scalable self learning engine, Pioneer, on top of the mirroring neural network architecture. Specifically we discuss about: 1. The modularity and scalability of MNNs to lend themselves to a cloud based architecture. 2. Validation methodology adopted to validate the parallelizing of Mirroring theorem 3. Exposing Pioneer through web service APIs to allow people to build their own unsupervised systems and allow the crowd sourcing of intelligence.

Authors: Jain C., Singh R., Sinha R.
Title: AGRO-SMART: An expert system for selecting agricultural zones for new seed varieties
Source title: Proceedings of the 11th IASTED International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Applications, AIA 2011
Affiliations: Indian Institute of Management Calcutta, Diamond Harbour Road, Joka, Kolkata, West Bengal - 700104, India
Authors with affiliations: Jain, C., Indian Institute of Management Calcutta, Diamond Harbour Road, Joka, Kolkata, West Bengal - 700104, India; Singh, R., Indian Institute of Management Calcutta, Diamond Harbour Road, Joka, Kolkata, West Bengal - 700104, India; Sinha, R., Indian Institute of Management Calcutta, Diamond Harbour Road, Joka, Kolkata, West Bengal - 700104, India
Abstract: We propose the formulation of a rule-based expert system, encompassing a set of diverse parameters that proves essential for estimating the success of a given crop's cultivation in any geographic location under consideration. A geographic region selected on political or biophysical lines is broadly divided into different zones based on variations in a selected set of zonal parameters. These parameters capture the agricultural macro-outlook of all zones. The rules-based expert system will then categorically estimate the probability of successful harvest for any new crop variety being considered for introduction based on its calculation of the crop's survivability or robustness across the parameter set's values. The system thus, suggests the crop variety's viability across different geographical locales. It is capable of recommending suitable combinations of regional geographical zones and crop seasons after learning the crop's ideal climatic and soil requirements.
