Authors: Hiremath P.S., Akkasaligar P.T., Badiger S.
Title: Despeckling medical ultrasound images using the contourlet transform
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Dept. of P.G. Studies and Research in Computer Science, Gulbarga University, Gulbarga-585106, Karnataka, India; Dept of Computer Science and Engineering, B.L.D.E.A's Dr P.G.Halakatti Engineering College, Bijaptir-586103, Karnataka, India; Sri. B.M. Patil Medical College, BLDE University, Bijapur-586103, Karnatak, India
Authors with affiliations: Hiremath, P.S., Dept. of P.G. Studies and Research in Computer Science, Gulbarga University, Gulbarga-585106, Karnataka, India; Akkasaligar, P.T., Dept of Computer Science and Engineering, B.L.D.E.A's Dr P.G.Halakatti Engineering College, Bijaptir-586103, Karnataka, India; Badiger, S., Sri. B.M. Patil Medical College, BLDE University, Bijapur-586103, Karnatak, India
Abstract: The narrowband ultrasound image suffers from a speckle noise. A novel method of medical ultrasound image despeckling using the contourlet transform is presented. The log transformed ultrasound image is contourlet transformed to obtain contourlet coefficients. The number of levels of Laplacian pyramidal decomposition, the number of directional decompositions to perform on each pyramidal level are determined. The transformed image is denoised by applying thresholding technique on individual bandpass subbands using a Bayes' shrinkage rule. The performance is measured in terms of variance, Mean Square Error (MSE), Signal to Noise Ratio (SNR), Peak Signal to Noise Ratio (PSNR) and Correlation Coefficient (CC). Finally, a comparison of performance of wavelet-based despeckling and contourlet based despeckling is provided. It is shown that the contourlet transform method has better performance than wavelet transform method. Despeckling is performed on medical ultrasound images to improve visual quality for better image analysis and diagnosis. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Das N., Basu S., Sarkar R., Kundu M., Nasipuri M.
Title: Handwritten bangla compound character recognition potential challenges and probable solution
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India
Authors with affiliations: Das, N., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India; Basu, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India; Sarkar, R., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India; Kundu, M., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India; Nasipuri, M., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India
Abstract: A novel technique is presented here for recognition of handwritten compound characters of Bangla alphabet. It advocates for incrementally expanding the number of learned character classes from more frequently occurred to less frequently occurred ones. The work is preceded by a survey for finding the frequencies of occurrences of all Bangla characters in the standard literature. One important finding of the survey is that only 4.27 percent of characters in a standard text piece are on average compound characters. Out of the 160 compound character classes, characters of 55 classes constitute 90 percent of the compound characters occurring on average in a standard text piece. For the time being, handwritten characters from these classes are considered here. The average recognition rate, as observed under this work, is 84.67percent after 3 fold cross validation of results. It is more or less comparable with the performance reported in another related work[3J. The work presented here can be considered as an important step for the development of OCR for handwritten Bangla characters, including complex shaped compound characters. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Varma K.I., Sureka A., Akhter A.E., Parthasarathy P.
Title: Table extraction from PDF files using combination of heuristics and machine learning techniques
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Software Engineering and Technology Labs (SET Labs), Infosys Technologies Limited, Bangalore, India
Authors with affiliations: Varma, K.I., Software Engineering and Technology Labs (SET Labs), Infosys Technologies Limited, Bangalore, India; Sureka, A., Software Engineering and Technology Labs (SET Labs), Infosys Technologies Limited, Bangalore, India; Akhter, A.E., Software Engineering and Technology Labs (SET Labs), Infosys Technologies Limited, Bangalore, India; Parthasarathy, P., Software Engineering and Technology Labs (SET Labs), Infosys Technologies Limited, Bangalore, India
Abstract: We present a method for automatically extracting table data from PDF (Portable Document Format ) documents. The proposed method is a two step process. The first step consists of table boundary identification and the second step consists of table decomposition. The basic premise of our approach is to exploit the structural layout properties and information relating to the position of the text within a document for solving the problem of table data extraction. We formulate the problem of table identification as a sequence labelling task and use machine learning technique like Conditional Random Fields (CRFs). We implemented hand-crafted rules and heuristics for the task of Table Decomposition. The approach was applied on synthetic and real-world data. We present experimental results and discuss challenges and limitations of the proposed approach. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.
Index Keywords: Boundary identification; Conditional random fields (CRFs); Data extraction; Handcrafted rules; Machine learning techniques; PDF files; Portable document formats; Real world data; Structural layout; Two-step process; Artificial intelligence; Learning systems

Authors: Joshi M., Bhavsar V., Lingras P.
Title: An algorithm for the estimation of a time period of 2-sequences
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, North Maharashtra University, Jalgaon, India; Faculty of Computer Science, University of New Brunswick, Fredericton, Canada; Department of Math and Computing Science, Saint Mary's University, Halifax, Canada
Authors with affiliations: Joshi, M., Department of Computer Science, North Maharashtra University, Jalgaon, India; Bhavsar, V., Faculty of Computer Science, University of New Brunswick, Fredericton, Canada; Lingras, P., Department of Math and Computing Science, Saint Mary's University, Halifax, Canada
Abstract: Traditional constraint sequential mining discovers sequential patterns containing events which are folded within a pre-specified time window. In contrast, our goal is to estimate a time period between sequential events and generate a list of sensible patterns that eventually results into inter-transaction association rules. We propose a one-pass algorithm that estimates the time period between occurrences of events for a given sequence of length 2 (2-sequence). We introduce the concept of a sensible pattern with the help of the proposed measure, sensible-mm-sup. We discuss the development of the recommender system that is based on our proposed algorithm. The recommender system is tested on the retail consumer data set and we obtained promising results. We present the parallel version of the algorithm and its execution in a distributed computing environment results in appropriate speed up. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors with affiliations: Srivastava, P.R., Computer Science and Information System Group, BITS Pilani, Pilani, 333031, India; Jain, P., Computer Science and Information System Group, BITS Pilani, Pilani, 333031, India; Singh, A.P., Civil Engineering Group, BITS Pilani, Pilani, Rajasthan, 333031, India; Raghurama, G., Electrical Electronics and Instrumentation Group, BITS Pilani, Pilani, Rajasthan, 333031, India
Abstract: An innovative software development for any decision making process is very important and challenging particularly when large software projects are analyzed. It becomes even more sophisticated while dealing with uncertainty and vagueness involved in such development process. The present paper proposes a fuzzy multi-criteria decision-making approach to deal with the uncertainty and vagueness involved due to subjective perception and experience of decision makers involved in the process of software development. As developing high-quality software within the allotted time and budget is a key element for a productive and successful software project, the quality factors are evaluated separately in this study using fuzzy multi-criteria decision approach and the estimates are combined to obtain the preference degree of each software development project giving alternatives to select the most appropriate one. Authors: Jangam A.K., Desai A.R., Rao P.R.
Title: Evaluation of different classifiers: A case s with export quality cashew grades
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: ICAR Research Complex for Goa, Ela, Old Goa, Goa, India; Department of Computer Science and Technology, Goa University, Taligao, Goa, India
Authors with affiliations: Jangam, A.K., ICAR Research Complex for Goa, Ela, Old Goa, Goa, India; Desai, A.R., ICAR Research Complex for Goa, Ela, Old Goa, Goa, India; Rao, P.R., Department of Computer Science and Technology, Goa University, Taligao, Goa, India
Abstract: Evaluation of classification models with different real world problems is an important research area of classification studies. In the present investigation we tried to evaluate different classification models and find the best model suited for cashew kernel aradins Kernel attributes of five different export quality grades were collected and fed as input to different classification models. Even though decision tree models exhibited highest accuracy(98.4%) with all attributes under the study, Artificial Neural Networks (ANN) resulted in highest average classification accuracy (85%) and is found to be best for cashew kernel sradins. ANN's were proved to be best models even with minimum number of input attributes. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Jahirabadkar S., Kulkarni P.
Title: Learning high dimensional distributed data using hierarchical subspace clustering
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Cummins College of Engineering., Pune, India; Capsilon Research Labs, Pune, India
Authors with affiliations: Jahirabadkar, S., Cummins College of Engineering., Pune, India; Kulkarni, P., Capsilon Research Labs, Pune, India
Abstract: Distributed clustering has become extremely important preprocessing task in mining distributed data sources. Many of the real world distributed datasets consists of objects modeled by high dimensional data. In this paper, we propose a distributed approach for clustering very high dimensional data. We propose to apply density based subspace clustering at each local site. A suitable representative for the set of subspaces and corresponding set of dense objects will be sent to global server where the complete clustering on the local representatives will be restored. Clustering at local as well as central server is based on density notion of clustering. Hence it can find clusters of arbitrary shape and size. The subspace clustering is based on ISC - Intelligent Subspace Clustering approach which adaptively finds input parameter e - distance at various levels of dimensionality which gives the ability of incremental learning and dynamic inclusion and exclusions of subspaces which lead to better cluster formation. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.
Author Keywords: Density based clustering; High dimensional data; Subspace clustering

Authors: Kumari S., Patel K.A.
Title: Application of neural networks for steel and composite structures
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: MNIT Jaipur, Rajasthan, India; IIT Delhi, India
Authors with affiliations: Kumari, S., MNIT Jaipur, Rajasthan, India; Patel, K.A., IIT Delhi, India
Abstract: Artificial neural network is a computationally proficient technique and has been applied to solve diverse problems in the field of steel and composite structures. The application of this technique in this field is gaining thrust because it is simple to simulate the actual problem. This paper reviews some of the application of neural networks such as detection of damage, parametric analysis of patch load, modeling, calculation and identification of semi-rigid connections in steel structures, modeling, calculation and identification of semi-rigid connections in steel structures, predict the inelastic moment in the continuous composite beam. These applications show that the neural network modeling provides a much efficient and accurate method as compared to the conventional methods. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Sen N., Shashank, Adhikary A., Basu T.K.
Title: A new feature from modified STFT filter bank for robust text-independent speaker identification
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Signal Processing Research Group, Centre for Educational Teclinology, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India; Cisco Systems India PVT Ltd., Bangalore-560087, India; Electrical Engineering Dept, Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur, India
Authors with affiliations: Sen, N., Signal Processing Research Group, Centre for Educational Teclinology, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India; Shashank, Cisco Systems India PVT Ltd., Bangalore-560087, India; Adhikary, A., Electrical Engineering Dept, Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur, India; Basu, T.K., Signal Processing Research Group, Centre for Educational Teclinology, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India
Abstract: This paper introduces the use of a promismg new method of feature extraction for robust text-independent speaker identification. The focus of this work is on applications winch yield high rates of identification with less computational effort. The impetus for this new feature extraction technique comes from the band pass filtering view of STFT. A complete experimental evaluation was conducted on a database of 61 speakers with Gaussian mixture speaker model. This new feature extraction technique has been compared with mel-frequency cepstral coefficient (MFCC) feature. Evaluation results show, that the new feature provides better identification accuracy than the MFCC feature. Also the computation time required for this new technique is half compared to tune required for MFCC feature. The discrimination capability of the feature sets have been evaluated statistically using F-ratio and J-measure. Experimental results show that the new feature set is much more discriminative than the MFCC feature set. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Shiva Nagendra S.M., Khare M.
Title: Comparative evaluation of gaussian, stochastic and artificial neural network based line source models
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chemiai- 600 036, India; Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, Hauz Klias, New Delhi- 110 016, India

Abstract: This paper presents a comparative evaluation of deterministic, stochastic and artificial neural network (ANN) based line source models in predicting carbon monoxide (CO) concentrations near an urban roadway/intersection. The observed concentration data of CO for the critical winter period (21 st - 31st December. 1999). at two-air quality control regions- a traffic intersection and an arterial road in the Delhi city, have been compared with model predictions. A range of statistical indicators has been used for model performance evaluation. The results show that ANN based line source models are comparatively more accurate in predicting the CO concentration near urban roadway/intersection than the deterministic and univariate statistical models. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Varma V., Pingali P., Shamia N.
Title: Role based personalization in enterprise search
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Search and Information Extraction Lab (SIEL), International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Varma, V., Search and Information Extraction Lab (SIEL), International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India; Pingali, P., Search and Information Extraction Lab (SIEL), International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India; Shamia, N., Search and Information Extraction Lab (SIEL), International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India
Abstract: We present a novel role based approach for personalizing Enterprise Search (ES). In an Enterprise, role describes a set of guidelines pertaining to the work profile; this role implicitly defines the official search needs in the hierarchy. We embed the role based approach into the two basic aspects of information retrieval system the indexing process and the search cycle (query, index search and presentation of results). The user query is expanded using role based thesaurus, obtained from co-occurrence statistics of tagged documents. A naive Bayesian classifier is used to generate role relevant scores for re-ranking of these documents. We validate the performance of our model using modified TREC evaluation framework on HIT intranet dataset. Results show superior performance over classical retrieval systems in termis of relevance. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Prakash H.N., Guru D.S.
Title: Bi-Interval valued symbolic feature vector for off-line signature verification: A fusion based approach
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Manasagangothri, Mysore-570 006, India
Authors with affiliations: Prakash, H.N., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Manasagangothri, Mysore-570 006, India; Guru, D.S., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Manasagangothri, Mysore-570 006, India
Abstract: In this paper, we propose a new approach for off-line signature verification based on feature level fusion of both relative distances between geometric centroids and corresponding relative orientations of geometric centroids. The proposed method employs symbolic representation of off-line signatures using bi-interval valued symbolic feature vector. Distance and orientation features of centroids of off-line signatures are used to form bi-interval valued symbolic feature vector for representing signatures. We investigate the feasibility of the proposed fusion based representation scheme for signature verification on MCYT signature database [1] of 2250 signatures. Unlike other signature verification methods, the proposed method is simple and efficient. Several experiments are conducted to demonstrate the efficacy of using a proposed approach of feature level fusion of distance and orientation features for off-line signature verification. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Konar P., Bandyopadhyay R., Chattopadhyay P.
Title: Bearing fault detection of induction motor using wavelet and neural networks
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009

Abstract: Condition monitoring has become a very important technology in the field of electrical equipment maintenance and has attracted more and more attention worldwide. Keeping this in mind a bearing fault detection scheme of three-phase induction motor has been attempted. In the present study Artificial Neural Network (ANN) is used along with advanced signal processing techniques like continuous wavelet transform (CWT) to analyze the motor frame vibrations during start-up. The paper also focuses oil comparing the results using different mother wavelets. The encouraging results obtained from the analysis, is hoped to set up a base for condition monitoring technique of induction motor which will be simple, fast and overcome the limitations of traditional techniques like FFT. Title: Entropy weighting feature selection for interactive visual clustering
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009

Abstract: VISTA, an interactive visual cluster rendering system, is known to be an effective model, which invites human in to the clustering process. When the dimensionality of the dataset increases, identification of the dominating dimensions for visual tuning and visual distance computation process becomes tedious. One common approach to solve this problem is dimensionality reduction. This paper proposes a novel feature selection method based on wrapper approach for interactive visual clustering which identifies the relevant features using their weight entropies. The experimental results show that, the proposed algorithm works well in identifying the important dimensions and eases the human-computer interaction. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Gupta M., Joshi R.C.
Title: Hiding fuzzy association rules set
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Electronics and Computer Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee, Roorkee, India
Authors with affiliations: Gupta, M., Department of Electronics and Computer Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee, Roorkee, India; Joshi, R.C., Department of Electronics and Computer Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee, Roorkee, India
Abstract: With the advancement in data mining technologies, the protection of confidentiality of sensitive information in databases has become a critical issue to be resolved. Therefore, there is a need to investigate data mining algorithm from a new point of view that is of personal privacy. Most of the conventional data mining algorithms have been developed to work on transactions with binary values. However, transactions with quantitative values are commonly found in real world applications. Therefore, we attempt to propose a method to hide useful fuzzy association rules from quantitative data. The proposed algorithm integrates the fuzzy set concepts and Apriori mining algorithm to find useful fuzzy association rules in quantitative data and then hide them using privacy preserving technique. For hiding purpose, we decrease the confidence of the rule to be hidden by increasing the support value of Left Hand Side (L.H.S.) of the rule only. Experimental results show that the proposed algorithm hides more rules and generates fewer side effects and thus, maintains higher data quality of the released database. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Padma M.C., Vijaya P.A.
Title: Monothetic separation of kannada, hindi and english text lines from a multi-script document
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Dept. of E and C Engg., Malnad College of Engineering, Hassan-573201, Karnataka, India
Authors with affiliations: Padma, M.C., Dept. of E and C Engg., Malnad College of Engineering, Hassan-573201, Karnataka, India; Vijaya, P.A., Dept. of E and C Engg., Malnad College of Engineering, Hassan-573201, Karnataka, India
Abstract: In a multi-script multi-lingual environment, a document may contain text lines in more than one language scripts. For Optical Character Recognition (OCR) of such documents, it is necessary to separate different scripts before employing a particular OCR. In this paper, it is proposed to exploit the concept of monothetic approach to separate Kannada, Hindi and English text lines from a multi script document. The distinct features of the target language are thoroughly studied from the nature of top and bottom profiles of the printed text lines in the three languages - Kannada, Hindi and English. The proposed method uses the dimensionality reduction technique to select the distinct features of the target script and searches for the text lines that possess the anticipated features. Experimentation conducted involved 2000 text lines for learning and 1500 text lines for testing. The performance has turned out to be 99%. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Gangashetty S.V., Sneha M.
Title: Vocal tract system characteristics for studies oil vowels
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Speech and Vision Laboratory, International Institute of Information Technology (HIT), Hyderabad - 500 032, Andhra Pradesh, India
Authors with affiliations: Gangashetty, S.V., Speech and Vision Laboratory, International Institute of Information Technology (HIT), Hyderabad - 500 032, Andhra Pradesh, India; Sneha, M., Speech and Vision Laboratory, International Institute of Information Technology (HIT), Hyderabad - 500 032, Andhra Pradesh, India
Abstract: The shape of the vocal tract system is characterized by a set of formant frequencies which correspond to the resonance frequencies of the vocal tract. Formant frequencies play an important role in the perception of speech by humans. While formant frequencies characterize voiced sounds, the transitions in formant frequencies characterize the consonants preceding and (or) the following vowels. Extraction of formant frequencies is a nontrivial task because it is not possible to directly obtain the resonances of the vocal tract system. This is because, the available speech signal is the convolution of quasi-periodic excitations and time varying vocal tract responses. Therefore, an estimate of the formant frequencies has to be obtained from the speech signal itself. We propose to use the numerator of Group-delay function to accurately extract formant frequencies from short segments of speech signals due to its property of high resolution. These formants play an important role in various speech processing applications. In this work, a detailed analysis of formant frequencies for isolated utterances of various short vowels has been performed. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: George K.V., Khan A., Verma P., Alappat B.J.
Title: A simple rule based fuzzy air pollution index
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: NEERI, Nagppur, India; KDK Engineering College, Nagpur, India; Department of Civil Engineering, IIT Delhi, India
Authors with affiliations: George, K.V., NEERI, Nagppur, India; Khan, A., KDK Engineering College, Nagpur, India; Verma, P., NEERI, Nagppur, India; Alappat, B.J., Department of Civil Engineering, IIT Delhi, India
Abstract: Ambient air quality is described by parameters like particulate matter, visibility and chemical species. For qualitative description of air quality these parameters are transformed into index numbers, by different method which describes the air quality in linguistic forms (classes/set) like clean moderate, poor or harmful. Various researchers have proposed methods for obtaining these indices and are termed as air quality Index. However these indices fail to represent the air quality correctly, when it encounters extreme values in the monitored data as it arithmetically averages them and gives an incorrect estimate of the air quality class. Moreover these indices are too sensitive at the transition boundary (clean to moderate, moderate to poor etc) as a marginal increase in value of the index (one unit) shifts the air quality class from one to another. This is due to the use of crisp set for describing these classes. Both these limitations of the present indices are demonstrated using hypothetical data set. hi order to overcome the limitations of AQI. a new index named Fuzzy Air Pollution Index (FAPI) is proposed for describing the ambient air quality. The new index uses rule based formulation and hence rules out mathematical averaging of extreme values. Since this new methodology is based on fuzzy sets, it is more robust during transition from one class to another. The application of this new methodology is demonstrated through a case study. Data for air quality parameters of Chennai city for four months is used to obtain the air quality index by both the methods and is discussed. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.
Author Keywords: Air quality index; Ambient air quality; Fuzzy air pollution index; Fuzzy numbers; Rule based system

Authors: Premasudha B.G., Adiga S.
Title: An integration of spatial decision support system to blood bank information systems
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Siddaganga Institute of Technology, Dr.MGR University, Tumkur, Karnataka, India; TCS, Bangalore, karnataka, India
Authors with affiliations: Premasudha, B.G., Siddaganga Institute of Technology, Dr.MGR University, Tumkur, Karnataka, India; Adiga, S., TCS, Bangalore, karnataka, India
Abstract: The availability of blood is one of the important requirements in treating medical emergencies; the blood banks do not maintain buffer stocks as required during that time. Thus the buffer stock is obtained from the local donors in the city. In this paper we propose a Geographic Information System (GIS) integrated with blood bank information system to help the blood bank staffs to increase or maintain the buffer stock by studying spatial distribution of donors, classification of donors and defining blood bank service areas. Each one of these issues is covered using several GIS functions including network analysis and overlay analysis, the former is used to produce drive-time to reach blood bank by a required donor and the latter is applied at the selected blood bank to calculate the size of its donors around the city. The created application is regarded as a spatial decision support system for blood bank information system. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Das N., Pramanik S., Basu S., Saha P.K., Sarkar R., Kundu M., Nasipuri M.
Title: Recognition of handwritten Bangla basic characters and digits using convex hull based feature set
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2009, AIPR 2009
Affiliations: Computer Sc. and Engg. Dept., Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India; Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Iowa, Iowa City, IA 52242, United States
Authors with affiliations: Das, N., Computer Sc. and Engg. Dept., Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India; Pramanik, S., Computer Sc. and Engg. Dept., Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India; Basu, S., Computer Sc. and Engg. Dept., Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India; Saha, P.K., Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Iowa, Iowa City, IA 52242, United States; Sarkar, R., Computer Sc. and Engg. Dept., Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India; Kundu, M., Computer Sc. and Engg. Dept., Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India; Nasipuri, M., Computer Sc. and Engg. Dept., Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India
Abstract: In dealing with the problem of recognition of handwritten character patterns of varying shapes and sizes, selection of a proper feature set is important to achieve high recognition performance. The current research aims to evaluate the performance of the convex hull based feature set, i.e. 125 features in all computed over different bays attributes of the convex hull of a pattern, for effective recognition of isolated handwritten Bangla basic characters and digits. On experimentation with a database of 10000 samples, the maximum recognition rate of 76.86% is observed for handwritten Bangla characters. For Bangla numerals the maximum success rate of 99.45%. is achieved on a database of 12000 sample. The current work validates the usefulness of a new kind of feature set for recognition of handwritten Bangla basic characters and numerals.

Authors: Jayanna H.S., Prasanna S.R.M.
Title: Speaker recognition under limited data condition using LVQ and GMM-UBM
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Information Science and Engineering, Siddaganga Institute of Technology, Turnkur-572103, Karnataka, India; Department of Electronics and Communications Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, Guwahati-781039, Assam, India
Authors with affiliations: Jayanna, H.S., Department of Information Science and Engineering, Siddaganga Institute of Technology, Turnkur-572103, Karnataka, India; Prasanna, S.R.M., Department of Electronics and Communications Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, Guwahati-781039, Assam, India
Abstract: In this paper the task of recognizing the speaker with the constraint of limited data using the learning Vector Quantization (LVQ) is demonstrated. The present day speaker recognition systems use the Gaussian-Mixture-Model- Universal-Background-Model (GMM-UBM) as a modelling technique when training data is sparse. Since the performance of the LVQ depends on the tuning of the parameters, we have found that the fine tuned LVQ yields better results than the GMM-UBM. Further, the linearly combined LVQ and GMM-UBM modelling techniques significantly improved the performance over the individual modelling techniques. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.
Author Keywords: GMM-UBM; Limited data; LVQ; Speaker modelling; Speaker recognition

Authors: Ruhil A.P., Raja T.V., Gandh R.S.
Title: Comparative study of connectionist and multiple regression approaches for predicting body weight of attappady black goats
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: National Dairy Research Institute, Computer Centre, Karnal-132 001, India; National Dairy Research Institute, Division of Dairy Cattle Breeding, Karnal- 132 001, India
Authors with affiliations: Ruhil, A.P., National Dairy Research Institute, Computer Centre, Karnal-132 001, India; Raja, T.V., National Dairy Research Institute, Division of Dairy Cattle Breeding, Karnal- 132 001, India; Gandh, R.S., National Dairy Research Institute, Division of Dairy Cattle Breeding, Karnal- 132 001, India
Abstract: The Attappady Black goat is a native goat breed of Kerala in India and is mainly known for its valuable meat and skin, hi this work, a comparative study of connectionist network (also known as artificial neural network (ANN)) and multiple regression is made to predict the body weight from body measurements in Attappady Black goats. A multilayer feed forward network with back propagation of error learning mechanism was used to predict the body weight. Data collected from 824 Attappady Black goats in the age group of 0-12 months consisting of 370 males and 454 females were used for the study. The whole data set was partitioned into two data sets namely training data set comprising of 75 per cent data (277 and 340 records in males and females, respectively) to build the neural network model and test data set comprising of 25 per cent (93 and 114 records in males and females, respectively) to test the model. Three different moiphonietric measurements viz. chest girth, body length and height at withers were used as input variables and body weight was considered as output variable. Multiple Regression Analysis (MRA) was also done using the same training and testing data sets. The prediction efficiency of both models was compared using the R2 value and Root Mean Square error (RMSE). The correlation coefficients between the actual and predicted body weights in case of .ANN were found to be positive and highly significant and ranged from 90.27 to 93.69%. The low value of RMSE and high value of R2 in case of connectionist network (RMSE: Male-1.9005. Female - 1.8434; R2: Male - 87.34, Female - 85.70) in comparison of MRA model (RMSE: Male - 2.0798, Female - 2.0836: R2: Male -84.84. Female - 81.74) shows that connectionist network model is a better tool to predict body weight in goats than MRA. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.
Author Keywords: Artificial neural networks; Attappady black goat; Body measurements; Body weight prediction; Regression models
Index Keywords: Age groups; Attappady black goat; Body weight; Comparative studies; Connectionist networks; Correlation coefficient; Data sets; Input variables; Multi-layer feed forward; Multiple regression analysis; Multiple regression approach; Multiple regressions; Neural network model; Output variables; Regression model; Root mean square errors; Test data; Training and testing; Training data sets; Backpropagation; Forecasting; Mean square error; Neural networks; Regression analysis; Statistical tests; Anthropometry

Authors: Gupta R.A., Kumar R., Surjuse R.S.
Title: An adaptive neuro-fuzzy based stator current MRAS observer for speed sensorless induction motor drives
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, MNIT, Jaipur, 302017, India
Authors with affiliations: Gupta, R.A., Department of Electrical Engineering, MNIT, Jaipur, 302017, India; Kumar, R., Department of Electrical Engineering, MNIT, Jaipur, 302017, India; Surjuse, R.S., Department of Electrical Engineering, MNIT, Jaipur, 302017, India
Abstract: This paper presents a new algorithm for speed observer for high performance induction motor drive. It uses stator current error based MRAS speed observer. The reference model of the stator current error based MRAS is the measured stator current components and the adaptive model is neuro-fuzzy based stator current observer. The adaptive model also needs the use of rotor flux. This rotor flux is estimated by neural network based rotor flux observer. Since both the reference model and the adaptive model are free from the use of pure integrator, there will not be any problem of saturation and cl.c. drift in the observed state variables. Also the neuro-fuzzy based stator current MRAS speed observer is insensitive to parameter variations. The effectiveness of the proposed scheme is tested through simulations. The results shows faster and better response of indirect vector controlled induction motor drive system with neuro-fuzzy based stator current MRAS speed observer. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Pakhira M.K., Das P.
Title: Visual execution of the traveling salesman problem on a generalized stochastic optimizer
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Kalyani Government Engineering College, Kalyani, India; Academy of Technology, Hooghly, India
Authors with affiliations: Pakhira, M.K., Kalyani Government Engineering College, Kalyani, India; Das, P., Academy of Technology, Hooghly, India
Abstract: The Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP) has been used as a benchmark for combinatorial optimization since long. In this paper, we have used a generalized visual optimization platform for solving this problem. Visual optimization is a very interesting topic to the application users for many purposes. It enables the user with an interactive platform where, by varying different parameter settings, one can customize a solution. Also the execution dynamics can be followed in a step-by-step fashion. Use of generalized evolutionary optimizer allows us to solve combinatorial optimization problems using many different algorithms and to compare results visually. Here, we have tried to solve TSP using a generalized visual stochastic optimization algorithm that was initially developed for function optimization problems only. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Title: An expert system for monitoring the health of imaging payload onboard spacecrafts
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Master Control Facility, ISRO, Hassan, Karnataka State, India; Electronics Department, Mangalore University, Mangalore, Karnataka State, India

Abstract: This paper describes the Expert System that was developed at Master Control Facility-Hassan, India, for continuous health monitoring and diagnosing of the imaging payload onboard INSAT spacecrafts. The system has been designed to detect the known and un-known anomalies in the onboard system. Combinations of artificial intelligence reasoning methods are employed to detect the anomalous signatures in the payload parameters. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Adhikari A.
Title: Mining overall association graph using mining driven data structures
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, S P Chowgule College, Margao, Goa - 403 602, India
Authors with affiliations: Adhikari, A., Department of Computer Science, S P Chowgule College, Margao, Goa - 403 602, India
Abstract: Association among items in a database is an important knowledge. Most of the existing metrics have considered only positive association between items. In order to mine structural information about a database, we use overall association between items in a database. In this paper, we introduce the notion of overall association graph in a database. We propose a space efficient data structure, called modified association list, to store overall association graph in a database. We provide algorithms for various operations that can be performed on an association list. We design an algorithm to mine overall association graph in a database. Experimental results are provided on both real and synthetic databases. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Sridhar R., Suganya A., Geetha T.V.
Title: Music information retrieval of tamil film music using melody and similarity measures
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Anna University, Chennai 25, India
Authors with affiliations: Sridhar, R., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Anna University, Chennai 25, India; Suganya, A., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Anna University, Chennai 25, India; Geetha, T.V., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Anna University, Chennai 25, India
Abstract: In tins paper an indexing technique for music information retrieval of Tamil film music has been proposed and implemented. The input polyphonic music signal is separated of voice and non-voice. Then the extracted non-voice signal alone is segmented using Talam based algorithm which is based on Carnatic music. Then the segmented signal is made to run through the existing feature extraction algorithm to extract features pertaining to the signal. After extracting features we propose an indexing technique and using this technique we populate the music database. The proposed indexing technique is based on hash table where we formulated a new method for collision resolution. Using the proposed indexing technique the database is populated and music information retrieval is performed. The proposed indexing technique had a precision of 88% and a recall of 79%. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Anand Kumar S., Ramulu M., Murty D.V.R.
Title: A customized knowledge base system for operation and maintenance of reciprocating pumps
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2009, AIPR 2009
Affiliations: Design and Engg. Division, Indian Institute of Chemical Technology, Hyderabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Anand Kumar, S., Design and Engg. Division, Indian Institute of Chemical Technology, Hyderabad, India; Ramulu, M., Design and Engg. Division, Indian Institute of Chemical Technology, Hyderabad, India; Murty, D.V.R., Design and Engg. Division, Indian Institute of Chemical Technology, Hyderabad, India
Abstract: This article brings a knowledge based system application in the area of operation and maintenance of reciprocating pumps. Operation and maintenance of reciprocating pump machinery are heavily dependent on the use of human expertise for operation, maintenance and repair. In order to develop the expertise, considerable effort is required to train the work force. The proposed system helps in guiding the experienced and non-experienced technicians in operation and troubleshooting stages and in addition, it also serves as a tutor to new technicians. The proposed knowledge based system supports in selecting the best diagnostic method. This study also provides a sound and skillful procedures to overcome the problems encountered in manual procedures adopted in operation and maintenance of reciprocating pumps.

Abstract: The aim of this paper is to find the speech features and then develop a model for speech recognition of the Bodo language. Initially, the six vowels of Bodo language and then fourteen consonants have been considered. The speeches are recorded from both male and female informants (5 informants of each land). In the present study, the LPC(Lmear Predictive Coding) have been used to study the cepstral features of Bodo phonemes. The same data set have also been used to study the mel-cepstral features of the language. Finally, Multi Layer Perception have been used to recognize the Bodo phonemes. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Affiliations: Department of Computer Engineering, National Institute of Technology, Kainataka, Suratlikal, India; Department of Electromcs and Communication Engineering, National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal, India

Abstract: Detecting, segmenting and super resolving of moving object is an important subject in computer visual analysis and surveillance. This paper discusses automatic VOP (Video Object Plane) segmentation and super resolving of VOP. We have proposed a new method for automatic generation of VOP by using block matching and quantization techniques. Edge model based approach is used to generate the HR (High Resolution) image with sharper VOP boundaries. Experimental results show that the proper VOP is segmented and super resolution of VOP yields lesser blurring compared to bicubic, bilinear interpolation schemes. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Title: Image enhancement using wavelet for improving face detection
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009

Authors with affiliations: Devarajan, N., EEE Department, Government College of Technology, Coimbatore-25, India; Anila, S., ECE Department, Sri Ramakrishna Institute of Technology, Coimbatore-10, India
Abstract: This paper proposes an adaptive, data-driven threshold for image denoising via wavelet soft-thresholding to improve performance of face detection. The noisy image is first decomposed into many levels to obtain different frequency bands. Then soft thresholding method is used to remove the noisy coefficients, by fixing the optimum thresholding value by the proposed method. Experimental results on the proposed algorithm show improvement on the performance of the Viola-Jones face detector when compared to other prominent enhancement techniques. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Title: Remote sensing image classification by improved swarm inspired techniques
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2009, AIPR 2009

Authors with affiliations: Bansal, S., Computer Science Department, Delhi College of Engineering, Delhi, India; Gupta, D., Computer Science Department, Delhi College of Engineering, Delhi, India; Panchal, V.K., Defence Terrain Research Lab., Metcalfe House, Delhi, India; Kumar, S., Defence Terrain Research Lab., Metcalfe House, Delhi, India
Abstract: In recent years remote sensing is used for the knowledge elicitation of earth's surface and atmosphere on a very global scale. Land cover mapping is a method for acquiring the geo-spatial information from satellite data. The land cover problem is solved by image classification of the satellite image. This paper focuses on the optimised approach of image classification of satellite multi spectral images. This paper deals with the land cover mapping by using swarm computing techniques. Here we have used the improved Ant Miner algorithm i.e, cAnt Miner and the Hybrid PSO-ACO algorithm for image classification. The motivation of this paper is to explore the improved swarm computing algorithms for the satellite image classification.

Authors: Katiyar G., Awasthy N.
Title: Character recognition and its interpretation using neural network
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2009, AIPR 2009
Affiliations: Electronics and Communication Deptt., Galgotia College of Engg. and Technology, Greater Noida (U.P), Gautam Budh Nagar 201308, India
Authors with affiliations: Katiyar, G., Electronics and Communication Deptt., Galgotia College of Engg. and Technology, Greater Noida (U.P), Gautam Budh Nagar 201308, India; Awasthy, N., Electronics and Communication Deptt., Galgotia College of Engg. and Technology, Greater Noida (U.P), Gautam Budh Nagar 201308, India
Abstract: The aim of this paper is to build a multilayer feed forward network for pattern recognition. The network is trained as a character classifier for 26 uppercase alphabets given as 7×5 black-white pixel maps. The trained network can recognize the patterns on which it is trained. However, noisy patterns were also recognized. In the current study, Multi Layered Perceptron (MLP) network is trained using Adaptive learning gradient descent algorithm and Levenberg-Marquardt algorithm and a comparison is made on the basis of Percentage of Recognition Error and training time. When the network is trained with Adaptive Learning Gradient Descent Algorithm the percentage of recognition error is 7.88% (network trained with noise) and 11.08% (network trained without noise) also the training time required is much less as compared to the network trained with Levenberg-Marquardt Algorithm.

Authors: Swarna L.K., Anu N., Letha J., Muraleedharan Nair M.N.
Title: Heavy metal distribution in akkulam veli lake sediments - A fuzzy approach
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: College of Engineering, Trivandrum, India; Centre for Earth Science Studies, Trivandrum, India
Authors with affiliations: Swarna, L.K., College of Engineering, Trivandrum, India; Anu, N., College of Engineering, Trivandrum, India; Letha, J., College of Engineering, Trivandrum, India; Muraleedharan Nair, M.N., Centre for Earth Science Studies, Trivandrum, India
Abstract: Water bodies receive waste materials through various sources, containing heavy metals in large quantity and accumulate in the sediments. The aim of the study was to assess the distribution of heavy metal contamination in the lake sediments. The results show that Cr, Co, Ni, Cu, and Zn have high positive correlation with clay where as V, Zr and Ba show positive correlation with sand. Distribution of heavy metals in lake were plotted using GIS. A fuzzy aggregation of loadings of heavy metals in the lake was done. Each metal concentration is associated with a fuzzy set "contaminated", defined over the set of four sampling stations. Overall loading indices were calculated using aggregation connectives between fuzzy sets. Concentration of heavy metals Cr, Cu, Zn, and Ni in sediments are found to be exceeding the toxicity level in lake which can adversely affect the aquatic ecosystem. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2009, AIPR 2009

Authors with affiliations: Agrawal, R.K., School of Computer and Systems Sciences, Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi, India; Chaudhary, A., School of Computer and Systems Sciences, Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi, India
Abstract: Linear Discriminant Analysis is a commonly used and valuable approach for feature extraction in face recognition. In this paper, we have proposed and investigated Modified Incremental Linear Discriminant Analysis (MILDA). We have compared the performance of proposed MILDA method against Pang et al. ILDA in terms of classification accuracy, execution time and memory. It is found on the basis of experimental results with different face datasets that the proposed MILDA scheme is computationally efficient in terms of time and memory in comparison to batch method and Pang et al. method. The experimental results also show that the classification accuracy due to MILDA, batch method and Pang et al are in complete agreement with each other.

Title: Approach for mining multiple patterns from clusters
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009

Abstract: Approach for multiple pattern extraction from obtained individual clusters is presented in this paper. Pattern extraction supports the end users in understanding the cluster concept. Pattern discovery approach uses reduct from rough set theory to find out non-significant attributes in pattern formation. These non-significant attributes (reduct) are removed and remaining attributes are ranked for their significance in the cluster. Multiple pattern formulation approach uses ranked attributes and results in generation of meaningful, concise cluster patterns. Applicability of the approach is demonstrated using soybean disease dataset from machine learning repository. Objective of applying proposed approach on soybean disease clusters is to obtain the different disease patterns. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Abstract: In this paper we present a road extraction algorithm from high resolution satellite imagery. In this algorithm, the image is first preprocessed to remove noise using techniques like contrast stretching, Wallis filter etc, then by using morphological reconstruction the road network is extracted. The algorithm is successfully tested on Quickbird and Indian Remote Sensing(IRS) Satellite data.

Authors: Goswami D., Kallimani J.S.
Title: A study on developing and analysis of text to speech (TTS) synthesizer for an indian regional language
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: IBM, Bangalore, India; Department of Computer Science and Engineering, MSRIT, Bangalore, India
Authors with affiliations: Goswami, D., IBM, Bangalore, India; Kallimani, J.S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, MSRIT, Bangalore, India
Abstract: Text-to-speech synthesis is a complex combination of language processing, signal processing and computer science. Ubiquitous computing (ubicomp) is a post-desktop model of human-computer interaction in which information processing has been thoroughly integrated into everyday objects and activities. Speech synthesis is the generation of synthesized speech from text. This paper deals with the development of a Text to Speech (TTS) Synthesis system for an Indian regional language by considering Bengali as the language. This paper highlights various methods which may be used for speech synthesis and also it provides an overview on the problems and difficulties in Bengali text to speech conversion. Variations in the prosody (speech parameters - volume, pitch, intonation, amplitude) yields the emotional aspects (anger, happy, normal), which are applied to our developed TTS system. Authors: Mulay P.
Title: Incremental learning using semi-supervised and incremental clustering
Source title: Proceedings of the 2009 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2009
Affiliations: Bharati Vidyapeeth University, Pune, India
Authors with affiliations: Mulay, P., Bharati Vidyapeeth University, Pune, India
Abstract: In the field of machine learning and special part of artificial intelligence, semi-supervised learning (SSL) occupies the middle ground between supervised learning (in which all training examples are labeled) and unsupervised learning (in which no label data are given). Interest in SSL has increased in recent years, particularly because of application domains such as Software Project Development, in which unlabeled data are plentiful, such as images [UML diagrams], text, and bioinformatics. This first comprehensive overview of SSL presents state-of-the-art algorithms, taxonomy of the field, selected applications, benchmark experiments, and perspectives on ongoing and future research. Semi-Supervised Learning first presents the key assumptions and ideas underlying the field: smoothness, cluster or low-density separation, manifold structure, and transduction. The core of the research is the presentation of SSL methods, organized according to algorithmic strategies and learning/forecasting based on the same. In this research focus is on semi-supervised and incremental clustering. SSL is a special form of classification. Traditional classifiers use only labeled data (feature / label pairs) to train. Labeled instances however are often difficult, expensive, or time consuming to obtain, as they require the efforts of experienced human annotators. Meanwhile unlabeled data may be relatively easy to collect, but there has been few ways to use them. Semi-supervised learning addresses this problem by using large amount of unlabeled data, together with the labeled data, to build better classifiers. Because semi-supervised learning requires less human effort and gives higher accuracy, it is of great interest both in theory and in practice.
Author Keywords: Incremental clustering; Incremental learning; Machine learning; Semi-supervised clustering

Authors: Srilakshmi D., Sujatha P.
Title: Version incompatibility bugs tracking through data mining approach
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, Pondicherry University, Puducheiry, India
Authors with affiliations: Srilakshmi, D., Department of Computer Science, Pondicherry University, Puducheiry, India; Sujatha, P., Department of Computer Science, Pondicherry University, Puducheiry, India
Abstract: Undiscovered errors are the desirable property of software testing so as to make impacts on collective maintenance, reuse. Software testing can also be stated as the process of validating and verifying that a software program-'application product meets the business and technical requirements that guided its design and development. Test techniques are the process of executing a program or application with the intent of finding software bugs. There are many techniques which currently address the bugs in source code without considering the version of the source code. This paper propose the data mining technique metric based partition algorithm for clustering the similar bugs and fixes the bugs in source code by identifying versions of the open source code leads to minimize effort and time. This paper incorporates a new approach for fixing of bugs through clustering techniques such as data mining approach and identifying version of the source code. Clustering technique measures textual coherence in cognitive psychology and computational linguistics. And proves this minimizes effort and time of software tester to fix the bug. Authors: Pujar J.H., Kodad S.F.
Title: Simulation of fuzzy logic based direct torque controlled permanent magnet synchronous motor drive
Source title: Proceedings of the 2009 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of EEE, BVB College of Engineering and Technology, Hubli, India; Department of EEE, Aurora's Engineering College, Hyderabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Pujar, J.H., Department of EEE, BVB College of Engineering and Technology, Hubli, India; Kodad, S.F., Department of EEE, Aurora's Engineering College, Hyderabad, India
Abstract: Fuzzy logic is recently obtaining emphasis in soft computing applications. This paper presents an application of fuzzy logic to control the speed of a permanent magnet synchronous motor. Based on the analysis of the permanent magnet synchronous motor transient response, a fuzzy controller is developed. A high-performance servo motor system modeling and designing simulation scheme of fuzzy logic based direct torque control of a low speed permanent magnet synchronous motor is proposed. The fuzzy logic based direct torque control strategy of a permanent magnet synchronous motor is simulated by using MATLAB simulink. Due to large torque ripples in low speed a permanent magnet synchronous motor, the hysteresis controller in a conventional direct torque control of permanent magnet synchronous motor was replaced by a fuzzy logic controller to minimize the large torque ripples. This scheme integrates the direct torque controller strategy, the time speed measurement algorithm, the fuzzy logic regulating technique and the space vector pulse width modulation principle. The simulation results indicate the fuzzy controller provides satisfactory high dynamic and static performance.

Authors: Pavan Kumar K., Mohan S.
Title: Development and application of multiobjective fuzzy waste load allocation model
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Environmental and Water Resources Engineering Division, IIT Madras, India; National Institute of Technical Teacher Training and Research, Taramani Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India
Authors with affiliations: Pavan Kumar, K., Department of Civil Engineering, Environmental and Water Resources Engineering Division, IIT Madras, India; Mohan, S., National Institute of Technical Teacher Training and Research, Taramani Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India
Abstract: Water quality management though a very important part of overall water resources management programs is also unfortunately given the last priority among all the other objectives like water supply for irrigation, drinking purpose, hydropower. flood mitigation etc. hi the present paper a multiobjective waste load allocation (MOWLA) model has been developed. Though there are many MOWLA models with cost minimization and DO maximization, there are very few models which have adequately addressed the issues of equity in waste load allocation models. The present paper includes equity as one of the objective and shows that by introducing equity in the objective function the solution obtained is more fair when compared to the overall cost minimization solution. However the decision maker has different satisfaction levels to different solutions. To address this uncertainty or ambiguity in a decision maker's (DM) satisfaction level, fuzzy membership functions are introduced for each objective function, thus by introducing fuzziness in the objective functions, a modeler can give a wide range solutions from which the DM can select the most satisfying solution for himself. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Chattopadhyay M., Dan P.K., Das N.
Title: Application of self organizing map in machine-part cell formation
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Computer Application, Pailan College of Management and Technology, Kolkata 700 104, India; Department of Industrial Engineering, School of Engineering and Technology, West Bengal University of Technology, Kolkata 700 064, India; Department of Physics, J.K.College, Purulia, W Bengal, India
Authors with affiliations: Chattopadhyay, M., Department of Computer Application, Pailan College of Management and Technology, Kolkata 700 104, India; Dan, P.K., Department of Industrial Engineering, School of Engineering and Technology, West Bengal University of Technology, Kolkata 700 064, India; Das, N., Department of Physics, J.K.College, Purulia, W Bengal, India
Abstract: Machines in many manufacturing units are often grouped into cells in order to lower work in process levels, reduce set-up and production lead-time while retaining flexibility for new products. Such cells are formed based on the similarities of machines and parts to be processed in them. In this paper the Self Organising Map (SOM) method, a technique in Artificial Neural Network, has been used for cell formation. The purpose of this work is to visualise the clusters data structure by the SOM color-coding and labelling via the SOM map nodes in such a way that the part families are processed in that machine cells. The component plane of SOM is most effective to visualise the machine-part cell formation Four Test problems adopted from the literature and one problem generated randomly are used to evaluate the performance of the proposed SOM algorithm. Two performance measures have been used to find the goodness of the output clusters. Computational experience with the proposed techniques is presented and the results are compared with those reported in the literature and found to be useful to both practitioners and researchers. Authors: Raj G.L., Kaur D.A., Kaur K.
Title: Parametric modeling of learning management system using fuzzy logic and intelligent decision vectors

Abstract: The Academic performance of any institution is governed by various parameters; these parameters can be broadly classified into two categories of inside the class and the ones outside the class. These factors control and administer the academic performance of the institute. In the present work a structured mathematical model is developed for individualistic and interdependent effects of these factors. Two prime functions, each for in-class and out-class activities are formulated then a control function for weaving the parameters within the function is crafted. A regulating function to encompass the dependencies of two prime functions is framed. A decision vector to engross both the prime and control function is originated to suggest the modifications on the present practices for enhancement of academia and overall performance of the institute. © 2009 IEEE.

Authors: Al-Shamri M.Y.H., Bharadwaj K.K.
Title: Collaborative recommender systems under attack: A similarity computation analysis
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Faculty of Engineering and Architecture, Ibb University, Ibb, Yemen; School of Computer and Systems Sciences, Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi 110067, India
Authors with affiliations: Al-Shamri, M.Y.H., Faculty of Engineering and Architecture, Ibb University, Ibb, Yemen; Bharadwaj, K.K., School of Computer and Systems Sciences, Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi 110067, India
Abstract: Pure collaborative recommender system (RS) relies solely on the declared ratings by each user to find the similarity measure between users. However, due to the open nature of RSs, new users can declare their preferences on the available items and therefore benefit from the system. Accordingly, some malicious user can enter biased profiles under fake identity in order to influence the system's behavior and produce some economic advantage for the attacker. These attacks have been termed "shilling" or "profile injection" attacks. The previous studies about attacks focus only on collaborative RSs that use correlation coefficient as a similarity function. However, today many RSs do not relay solely on this similarity measure and therefore it is important to study the effect of similarity computation phase on the various approaches. This paper discusses and analyzes the effect of similarity computation phase on the performance of many collaborative RSs under attacks. The experimental results reveal that the similarity computation phase has an important rule for decreasing to a large extent the effect of the profile injection attacks. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.
Author Keywords: Attack models; Collaborative recommender systems; Similarity computation

Title: Improved genetic programming based multiclass classifier using a new crossover operator

S. Institute of Teclmology and Science, Indore, India; Chaudhari, N.S., School of Computer Engineermg, Nanyang Teclmological University, Singapore
Abstract: The design of classifiers using Genetic Programming (GP) has always been fascinating. But the conventional crossover operation proved to be hurdle in designing the efficient classifiers due to the totally random choice of the crossover points. To deal with this problem this paper introduces an approach with a new crossover operator in GP for multiclass classification. An individual of the population will be represented using multiple trees. The GP is trained with a set of N training samples in steps. A concept of unfitness of a tree is used in order to improve genetic operations. The new crossover operator is similar to Brood Crossover in that multiple children are produced during each crossover event. However, it implicitly discovers the best possible crossover site for a subtree and attains higher fitness values while processing fewer individuals. The modified approach is investigated with various benchmark datasets. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Title: Artificial neural network model for prediction of mid span deflection of two-way RC slabs
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, UEC, Ujjain, MP, India; Department of Civil Engineering- PIT, Udaipur, India

Abstract: Artificial neural network models have been developed to predict mid span deflection in two-way RC slabs from the geometry of the structure and loading on it. The mo|dels developed prove the versatility of the ANN and also facilitate the practicing engineer to work out the deflections in two way RC slabs. The developed models for the deflection of two way slabs are based on the fact that the deflections of slabs depends primarily on the spans, cross sectional properties of the slab, i.e. thickness and loading on the slab. The developed models predicts the deflection to effective depth ratio for slabs for the spans in both directions (x direction and y direction) using three input parameters. The training and testing data for neural networks have been generated using equivalent load method for the determination of mid span deflection in two way RC slabs. The model enables rapid estimation of mid span deflection in two way RC slabs. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Jothiprakash V., Sharma K.
Title: Time series and cause effect neural network models to predict pan evaporation
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Bomaby, Powai, Mumabi-400076, India
Authors with affiliations: Jothiprakash, V., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Bomaby, Powai, Mumabi-400076, India; Sharma, K., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Bomaby, Powai, Mumabi-400076, India
Abstract: Evaporation is a crucial parameter in context of many fields of hydrology and water resources engineering and has a very complex relationship with other meteorological parameters. In the present study, tune-series and cause-effect artificial neural network models were developed to predict the monthly pan evaporation using seven important and commonly measured meteorological parameters, maximum temperature, minimum temperature, relative humidity, sunshine hours, wind speed, and dew point temperature. Recurrent Artificial Neural Network (RANN) models have been developed using ten years monthly data (1993-2002). Two different types of models were developed based on the input data set. in the fust type of model, evaporation for current tune period is predicted using previous time step evaporation (tune-series) and in the second one. the evaporation for current period is predicted by using other meteorological parameters of previous tune period (cause-effect). The determination of the network architecture, activation function, learning rate and length of data set required for the training and testing are carried out by trial and error method to optimize the connection weights and also to get the better network for prediction of evaporation. The results showed that time-series model predicted the evaporation better than cause-effect model. The correlation coefficient during validation is 0.99 for tune-series model and 0.90 for the cause-effect model. Evaporatio[i has a very complex interaction with the other meteorological parameters, which could be the reason for the inferior performance of the cause-effect model. In order to improve the performance of the cause-effect model, a booster factor is applied to the cause-effect model, which has improved the predicting ability of the model particularly the peak values. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

The yield of a crop depends on many factors like salinity level, crop cutting and type of yield. We have studied all these factors and with the help of preexisting experimental data we prepare a mathematical model for predicting the yield of a crop.

Authors: Das C., Maji P.
Title: A new possibilistic biclustering algorithm for microarray gene expression data
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Netaji Subhash Engineering College, Kolkata, 700 152, India; Machine Intelligence Unit, Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata, 700 108, India
Authors with affiliations: Das, C., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Netaji Subhash Engineering College, Kolkata, 700 152, India; Maji, P., Machine Intelligence Unit, Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata, 700 108, India
Abstract: The biclustering method is one of the important tools for analyzing gene expression data. It focuses on finding a subset of genes and a subset of experimental conditions that together exhibit coherent behavior. However, most of the existing biclustering algorithms find exclusive biclusters, which is inappropriate in the context of biology. Since biological processes are not independent of each other, many genes may participate in multiple different processes. Hence, nonexclusive bi-clustering algorithms are required for finding overlapping biclusters. In this paper, a novel possibilistic biclustering algorithm is presented to find highly overlapping biclusters of larger volume with mean squared residue lower than a predefined threshold. It judiciously incorporates the concept of possibilistic clustering algorithm into biclustering framework. The integration enables efficient selection of highly overlapping coherent biclusters with mean squared residue lower than a given threshold. The effectiveness of the algorithm, along with a comparison with other algorithms, is demonstrated on yeast gene expression data sets. In general, the proposed algorithm shows excellent performance at finding patterns in gene expression data. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Title: An optimal neural network model: Categorization of diabetics data
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009

Abstract: Neural network has become a popular tool in the field of medical data mining. However, one of the most difficult tasks in developing an ANN is determining the optimal number of hidden nodes. This paper describes the application of finding optimal architecture for single-layer feedforward neural network model by combining Akaike's information criterion (AIC) and the golden-section optimization technique. The optimal model so developed was used for categorization of diabetics data garnered from Pima Indian diabetic database. A large number of computational experiments have verified that AIC is in close agreement with the network generalization. Topology 4-2-1 emerged to be most prudent and optimal model with the least AIC. Further, the CPU time for the optimal NN architecture is also found to be minimum compared to other experimented topologies. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Nirmala S., Nagabhushan P.
Title: Text extraction in color document images having complex background
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore - 570006, India
Authors with affiliations: Nirmala, S., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore - 570006, India; Nagabhushan, P., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore - 570006, India
Abstract: Analysis of foreground contents is difficult in document images having complex background. For instance line segmentation, optical character recognition of foreground text in documents with multicolored, textured background is complex and crucial. In order to improve the accuracy of the outcome of document analysis tasks it is necessary to isolate the foreground text. In this paper we propose a three stage approach to extract the foreground text printed/handwritten in color document images having complex background. In the first stage the possible text edge pixels in the source document are identified utilizing Canny edge operator. It is also possible that edges of background objects might be identified by the Canny edge operator due to complex background of the input document. In the second stage the resultant image of stage-1 is divided into into overlapping uniform sized blocks. In this stage the blocks that do not contain any edge pixel are dropped and the blocks that contain edges are analyzed as they are candidate text blocks. Based on the texture analysis of the candidate text blocks they are classified as text blocks and false text blocks. In the last stage the foreground text is extracted by performing unsupervised thresholding of the text blocks obtained from the previous stage. The proposed approach can handle document images with varying background of multiple colors and texture; and foreground text in any font and orientation. An optimal size for the blocks is selected by conducting experiments exhaustively. The proposed approach extracts on an average 77.2 % of text in the source document image. The proposed approach is compared with an existing method of foreground separation in color document images. Experimental results show that the proposed method performs better. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.
