Authors: Nagabhushan P., Alaei A.
Title: Unconstrained handwritten text-line segmentation using morphological operation and thinning algorithm
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, 570 006, India
Authors with affiliations: Nagabhushan, P., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, 570 006, India; Alaei, A., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, 570 006, India
Abstract: Text-line segmentation of unconstrained handwritten document is a difficult task because of variation in inter-line distance and base-line skew. Overlapping and touching problems, which frequently happen between two consecutive text-lines in unconstrained handwritten text documents, significantly increase complexities of text-line segmentation. In this paper we propose a novel approach based on painting technique to make foreground and background painted separately. Then the painted image is subjected to smoohing operations. Morphological operation (dilation) is employed on the foreground portion of the smooth image for making it wider and get each line as a single component. Thinning operation on the background portion of the dilated image followed by some trimming operations are performed to get candidate lines. By using the starting and end points information of the candidate lines and employing distance analysis amoung them corresponding lines with minimum distance are connected to gether to obtain segmented text-lines. We tested the proposed scheme on text pages of different scripts such as Persian, English, French, German, Greek, Bangla, Oriya, Kannada and we obtained encouraging results. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.
Author Keywords: Handwritten document; Handwritten line segmentation; Mathematical morphology; Piece-wise painting; Thinning

Authors: Mehta R., Kumar V.
Title: Hybrid subtractive clustering technique for estimation of ground water table
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: National Institute of Hvdrolosv, Roorkee, India; College of Engineering Roorkee, Roorkee, India
Authors with affiliations: Mehta, R., National Institute of Hvdrolosv, Roorkee, India; Kumar, V., College of Engineering Roorkee, Roorkee, India
Abstract: Ground water scarcity and ground water table decline at alarming rate create many problems for managers and planners. This problem will be worsening in future as demand for water would rise tremendously due to steady rise in human population. Optimal-exploitation of groundwater 'in all the areas that are getting fast depleted* is required to estimate the ground water table. Keeping this in view, different models have been developed for an Indian catchment located in North - East resion of India. Ground water studies have not been conducted much by researchers for the problematic area of Budaun district where the water table is continuously declining at a faster rate. The present study is taken up to study the ground water availability in the district. Models have been developed for prediction of water table behavior and a proper ground water recharge plan for the problematic areas can be suggested. Over the last decade, soft computing techniques like Fuzzy logic and Artificial Neural Networks (ANN) are increasingly used in hydrological studies. Furthermore, their computational speed in simulating and forecasting is very welcomed in real time operations. It is robust and flexible in managing real world complex systems involving uncertainty and imprecise data. Fuzzy Logic Controller (FLC) provides a means of converting a linguistic control strategy based on operators' knowledge into an automatic control strategy. An important feature of fuzzy set theory is the symmetry between the objective function and constraints. During tins study, a Neuro-Fuzzy approach such as ANFIS (Adaptive Neuro Fuzzy Inference System)- subtractive cluster method (SCM) and ANN techniques have been used for monsoon (M) and non-monsoon (NM) periods in order to estimate the ground water tables. Input data of the network are composed by past measurements of nearby inflow and rainfall, and the quantity of water which has been pumped out from ground during that specific period. Input data are fuzzified with different degrees of membership. The models are developed and applied for Budaun district in Uttar Pradesh to get the optimum output during monsoon and non-monsoon period. Models developed by SCM technique give better results than ANN technique. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Title: Fuzzy model: Time dependent dispersion in rivers

Abstract: In this paper, two dimensional dispersion equation is considered with time dependent along uniform flow. The solution of time dependent dispersion equation is converted in fuzzy environment. The fuzzy arithmetic used to simulate the fuzzy relation in modeling river water qual-ity. The parameters of two dimensional dispersion equation of water quality model are assumed as trapezoidal fuzzy numbers. From fuzzy model the concentrations can be obtained by corresponding to the specified α-cut technique and arithmetic operations of trapezoidal fuzzy numbers. Solution of Fuzzy model is compared with determinate solution of dispersion equation. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Raghavendra G.S., Prasanna K.N.
Title: Performance description of enhanced ant colony optimization algorithm through principal component analysis
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, BITS, Pilani Goa Campus, Goa, India; Mathematics Department, BITS, Pilani Goa Campus, Goa, India
Authors with affiliations: Raghavendra, G.S., Computer Science Department, BITS, Pilani Goa Campus, Goa, India; Prasanna, K.N., Mathematics Department, BITS, Pilani Goa Campus, Goa, India
Abstract: Ant Colony Optimization (ACO) algorithms belong to class of Meta- heuristic algorithms, where a search is made for optimized solution rather than exact solution, based on the knowledge of the problem domain. ACO algorithms are iterative in nature. As the iteration proceeds solution converges to the optimized solution. In this paper, we examine the pheromone trial, a knowledge repository for ants, which guides the ants in the search process and analyzed the nature of convergence of ACO algorithms using Principal Component Analysis (PCA). Also we have come out with some useful conjectures with proper justification. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Kameswara Rao R., Ravi Kumar G., Tulasi Ram S.S.
Title: Swarm intelligence approach to solution of multi-objective optimal economic dispatch
Source title: Proceedings of the 2009 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2009
Affiliations: Dept. of EEE, JNTU College of Engineering, Kakinada, India; Dept. of EEE, Bapatla Engineering College, Bapatla, India
Authors with affiliations: Kameswara Rao, R., Dept. of EEE, JNTU College of Engineering, Kakinada, India; Ravi Kumar, G., Dept. of EEE, Bapatla Engineering College, Bapatla, India; Tulasi Ram, S.S., Dept. of EEE, JNTU College of Engineering, Kakinada, India
Abstract: An efficient and reliable evolutionary-based meta-heuristic approach, termed as swarm intelligence, is presented for the solution of optimal economic power dispatch. The generation of electricity from the fossil fuel releases several contaminants, such as sulfur oxides, nitrogen oxides and carbon dioxide, into the atmosphere. Genetic algorithmic approach to power system optimization, as reported here for a case of economic power dispatch, consists essentially of minimizing the objective function while gradually satisfying the constraint relations. The advantages of the genetic algorithmic approach in terms of problem reduction, flexibility and solution methodology are also discussed. In the Multiobjective problem formulation, four important non-commensurable objectives in an electrical thermal power system are considered. These are economy and environmental impacts because of NOx, S02, C02 emissions. The feasibility of the proposed method is compared with a simple genetic algorithm is described to multiobjective optimal economic dispatch of electrical power systems.

Authors: Panda M., Patra M.R.
Title: Unsupervised anomaly based network intrusion detection using farthest first and hierarchical conceptual clustering
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of ECE, Gandhi Institute of Engineering and Technolgy, Gunupur, Orissa-765022, India; Department of Computer Science, Berhampur University, Orissa, India
Authors with affiliations: Panda, M., Department of ECE, Gandhi Institute of Engineering and Technolgy, Gunupur, Orissa-765022, India; Patra, M.R., Department of Computer Science, Berhampur University, Orissa, India
Abstract: With the increased usage of computer networks, security becomes a critical issue. Recently, data mining methods have gained lot of attention in addressing network security issues, including intrusion detection. Consequently, unsupervised learning methods have been given much importance for anomaly based network intrusion detection. In this paper, we investigate new clustering algorithms like farthest first and hierarchical conceptual clustering (COBWEB) in building our proposed network intrusion detection model. We evaluated our model using KDDCup'99 intrusion detection benchmark dataset. Our research shows that the proposed clustering methods with five class classifications enable us to build an efficient anomaly based network intrusion detection model with high detection rate and acceptable false positive rate in comparison to other existing methods in detecting rare attacks. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Panda M., Patra M.R.
Title: Unsupervised sequential information bottleneck clustering for building anomaly based network intrusion detection model
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009

Abstract: In this paper we present a novel approach to unsupervised clustering in building an efficient anomaly based network intrusion detection model. The method is based on a recently introduced sequential information bottleneck (sIB) principle. KDDCup 1999 intrusion detection benchmark dataset is used for the experimentation of our proposed technique. The experimental results demonstrate that the proposed technique is more suitable in detecting network intrusions in terms of accuracy compared to other existing clustering algorithms. Title: Improved strategies of multi-objective differential evolution (MODE) for multi-objective optimization

Abstract: Multi-objective optimization using an evolutionary computation technique is used extensively for solving conflicting multi-objective optimization problems. In this work, an improved strategy of multi-objective differential evolution (MODE) where the mutation strategy is changed to a trigonometric mutation approach is proposed. The proposed strategy along with other well known strategies of MODE is used to compare the performance metrics (such as convergence and divergence) with other evolutionary algorithms from the literature. The Pareto optimal solutions are obtained for benchmark test functions and are compared using several strategies of MODE. Improved strategies of MODE show a competitive performance when compared with other evolutionary multi-objective optimization algorithms (EMOAs). Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Anantaram C.
Title: An intelligent framework for surveillance and assessment tasks in military and stock market domains
Source title: Proceedings of the 2009 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2009
Affiliations: Tata Consultancy Services Limited, 249 D and E Udyog Vihar Phase IV, Gurgaon, Haryana 122016, India
Authors with affiliations: Anantaram, C., Tata Consultancy Services Limited, 249 D and E Udyog Vihar Phase IV, Gurgaon, Haryana 122016, India
Abstract: Tasks such as surveillance and assessment are complex, as one has to deal with vast amount of data, incomplete and uncertain data, dynamically changing situations, increasing complexity of systems and increasing volume of complex information. This process requires identifying hidden patterns in data, dealing with rules of operation, and reasoning based on multiple objectives and multiple criteria. We describe a framework for surveillance and assessment tasks that uses the power of multimodal reasoning to help produce efficient solutions. Our framework allows specification of high-level patterns that abstract raw data to useful patterns for further reasoning. Rule-based and case-based reasoning then allows us to construct appropriate solutions to the task at hand. We demonstrate these techniques using an example from stock-market surveillance and describe various possible military applications.

Authors: Sarkar R., Basu S., Das N., Mollah A.F., Kundu M., Nasipuri M.
Title: Line extraction from unconstraint handwritten document pages using piece-wise water-flow technique
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University, Kolkata, India; School of Mobile Computing and Communication, Jadavpur University, Kolkata, India
Authors with affiliations: Sarkar, R., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University, Kolkata, India; Basu, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University, Kolkata, India; Das, N., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University, Kolkata, India; Mollah, A.F., School of Mobile Computing and Communication, Jadavpur University, Kolkata, India; Kundu, M., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University, Kolkata, India; Nasipuri, M., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University, Kolkata, India
Abstract: To extract the lines from multi-skewed document images of handwritten Bangla or Roman text, a novel technique is described here. In this paper, at first, the document image is partitioned into number of vertical fragments. Then a hypothetical water-flow technique is applied separately in each vertically fragmented portion of the document images, from both left and right sides of the said partition. After identifying the touching segments-separation of the same is done and finally the water-flow technique is applied on the overall document image. The stripes of areas left unwetted on the image frame are finally labelled for extraction of text lines. To test the developed technique, Bangla and Roman scripts are used and the performance of the technique, as observed experimentally, is 95.54% for the document images of the said scripts. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Mukherjee A., Garain U.
Title: Understanding of natural language text for diagram drawing
Source title: Proceedings of the IASTED International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Soft Computing, ASC 2009
Affiliations: RCC Institute of Information Technology, Kolkata - 15, India; Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata - 108, India
Authors with affiliations: Mukherjee, A., RCC Institute of Information Technology, Kolkata - 15, India; Garain, U., Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata - 108, India
Abstract: There are many scientific and engineering software tools available that aids in drawing complex diagrams (in computer) comprising basic geometric entities. These tools can be used to create geometric figures following step-by-step commands given by the user. However, such tools are not intelligent enough to read and understand textual description of a diagram and directly generate it in the computer. The software application reported in this paper attempts to simulate human approach for drawing a geometric figure implied by a school-level geometric problem stated in natural language English. This involves machine understanding of the problem-text and then automatically creating the graphic representation by triggering relevant computer graphics functions. The system uses a language comprehension module for syntactic, semantic and logical analysis of a problem-text and also a custom knowledge base GeometryNet [1], comprising classified knowledge about objects and concepts related to school-level geometry, for geometric interpretation of the problem. Finally, the aim of this paper is to indicate an implementable framework for automatic text to diagram conversion using ideas from several fields like artificial intelligence, knowledge representation, natural language processing, automated reasoning etc.

Title: Modeling and analysis of a helicopter transportation facility using artificial neural networks
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009

Abstract: A helicopter transport facility is modeled and analyzed using artificial neural networks. Historical data pertaining to failures, repairs and maintenance was collected from the logbooks. Eight input parameters of interest were developed for quantifying the repairable system. A single composite measure of system reliability, maintainability and availability was developed as an output parameter. A neural network was trained, validated and simulated to quantify and analyze system behavior in different situations. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Title: Multi agent based call admission control for managing multi class traffic in cellular networks
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Vivekanand Education Society's Instiuite of Technology, Chembur, Mumbai, India; Electronics and Telecommunication Department, Bharti Vidyapeeth College of Engineering, Pune, India
Authors with affiliations: Giri, N., Computer Engineering Department, Vivekanand Education Society's Instiuite of Technology, Chembur, Mumbai, India; Dhami, K., Computer Engineering Department, Vivekanand Education Society's Instiuite of Technology, Chembur, Mumbai, India; Swarnakar, S., Computer Engineering Department, Vivekanand Education Society's Instiuite of Technology, Chembur, Mumbai, India; Bodhe, S., Electronics and Telecommunication Department, Bharti Vidyapeeth College of Engineering, Pune, India
Abstract: In wireless cellular networks, collaboration, coordination and negotiation amongst cells help in performing channel allocation and call admission in fan. efficient and distributed manner. Thus help in increasing utility function of the system as a whole and providing Quality of Service guarantee as specified in Service Level Agreement. Multi Agent System (MAS) extends intelligent agent paradigm to improve upon the conceptual model of designing problems through agent interaction. Our paper models (priority non-priority) call admission control for multi class traffic in cellular networks as multi agent resource provisioning problem, where agents interact with each other to find the optimal call admission thresholds. The MAS is modeled using open source Java Agent Development framework (JADE). The paper presents the design of Network Provider Cell Agents (NPCA). their interaction models and performatives. The performance evaluation of connection level parameters for multi agent Static and Dynamic call admission control strategies is also presented. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Lai S., Kulkarni P., Singh A.
Title: Classification based on parametric partitioning of solution space
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Defence Institute of Advanced Technology, Deemed University, Girinagar, Sinhgad Road, Pune- 411025, Maharashtra, India; Capsilon India, 6th Floor Marisoft 1, Marigold Premises, Kalvani Nagar, Pune - 411014, Maharashtra, India
Authors with affiliations: Lai, S., Defence Institute of Advanced Technology, Deemed University, Girinagar, Sinhgad Road, Pune- 411025, Maharashtra, India; Kulkarni, P., Capsilon India, 6th Floor Marisoft 1, Marigold Premises, Kalvani Nagar, Pune - 411014, Maharashtra, India; Singh, A., Defence Institute of Advanced Technology, Deemed University, Girinagar, Sinhgad Road, Pune- 411025, Maharashtra, India
Abstract: In classification task training sample size and high feature dimensionality enhances computational complexity of algorithms. Therefore, many algorithms tend to work with reduced feature set and hence ignore contribution of all relevant parameters. This paper presents Simple Efficient and Accurate (SEA) algorithm to consider contribution of all available relevant parameters while keeping the computational complexity and accuracy within acceptable limits. SEA partitions the training sample space during the preprocessing stage as part of learning. Partitioning is done based on parameter values, taking one at a time, resulting into equivalent classes respective to the parameter. During classification these sets are selected based on parameter values of the test case and result is collated. Average case complexity of classification is O(m (log2 n)2). Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Jayaram M.A., Nataraja M.C., Ravikumar C.N.
Title: Particle swarm optimization: Design of high performance concrete mixes
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Master of Computer Applications, Siddaganga Institute of Technology, Tumkur, India; Department of Civil Engineering, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore, India; Department of Computer Science and Engg., Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore, India
Authors with affiliations: Jayaram, M.A., Department of Master of Computer Applications, Siddaganga Institute of Technology, Tumkur, India; Nataraja, M.C., Department of Civil Engineering, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore, India; Ravikumar, C.N., Department of Computer Science and Engg., Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore, India
Abstract: Tins paper elaborates the application of particle swarm optimization (PSO) for a design problem. The case in point is the optimization of high volume fly ash concrete (HVFAC) mix design. The model presented here consists of two stages. In the first stage, a huge database of 450 mix designs garnered through standard research publications were statistically analyzed to elicit upper and lower bounds of certain range constraints and rational ratio constraints of functional parameters. In the second stage, PSO is applied to find the quantities of cement, fly ash, and water for maximized strength of the mix. Optimal mix proportions of these important ingredients are computed corresponding to five ranges of 28 days strength by augmenting the algorithm with appropriate constraint ranges obtained in the first stage. The optimized proportions of ingredients in all the five cases are encouraging and corroborate very well with the experimental results. The outcome of this work is useful in reducing the number of trial mixtures with desired properties in the field tests. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Title: A graph clustering approach to product attribute extraction
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Search and Information Extraction Lab, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Raju, S., Search and Information Extraction Lab, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India; Shishtla, P., Search and Information Extraction Lab, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India; Varma, V., Search and Information Extraction Lab, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India
Abstract: This work focuses on attribute extraction from product descriptions. We propose a novel solution to extract attributes of a product from a set of text documents. A graph is constructed from the text using word co-occurrence statistics. We compute word clusters and extract attributes from these clusters using graph based methods. Our solution is able to achieve nearly 80% precision and 45% recall. Experiments show-that the methods employed are effective in identifying attributes for different dataset sizes. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Chouksey P., Thakur R.S., Jain R.C.
Title: Exploring interesting multi-level patterns using graph based approach
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of MCA, TIT, Bhopal (M.P.), India; Department of Computer Applications, NIT, Trichy, India; Department of Computer Applications, SATI, Vidisha (M.P.), India
Authors with affiliations: Chouksey, P., Department of MCA, TIT, Bhopal (M.P.), India; Thakur, R.S., Department of Computer Applications, NIT, Trichy, India; Jain, R.C., Department of Computer Applications, SATI, Vidisha (M.P.), India
Abstract: Most of the previous studies on mining multi-level interesting patterns based on an Apriori approach required more number of databases scans and operations for counting pattern supports in the database. In this paper, we have focused on reducing database scans and avoiding candidate generation for extracting multilevel patterns. To achieve this objective a single level graph based approach has been used with a top-down progressive deepening method. At each concept level the whole database is compressed by converting into a directed graph which is stored in the form of an Adjacency Matrix. Further frequent pattern mining is done by performing operation on Adjacency Matrix of directed graph. The advantage of this method is that it requires only single scan of the database at each concept level for mining interesting patterns. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Kandali A.B., Routray A., Basu T.K.
Title: Cross-cultural vocal emotion recognition in five native languages of Assam
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Teclmology, PIN Code-721302, Kharagpur, West Bengal, India; Centre for Educational Teclmology, Indian Institute of Teclmology, PIN Code-721302, Kharagpur, West Bengal, India
Authors with affiliations: Kandali, A.B., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Teclmology, PIN Code-721302, Kharagpur, West Bengal, India; Routray, A., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Teclmology, PIN Code-721302, Kharagpur, West Bengal, India; Basu, T.K., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Teclmology, PIN Code-721302, Kharagpur, West Bengal, India, Centre for Educational Teclmology, Indian Institute of Teclmology, PIN Code-721302, Kharagpur, West Bengal, India
Abstract: This work investigates the specific research question concerning voice emotion recognition, whether vocal emotion expressions of discrete emotions can be recognized cross-culturally. This study will enable us to get more information regardmg nature and function of emotion. Furthermore, this study will help in developing a generalized voice emotion recognition system, which will increase the efficiency of human-machine interaction systems. In this work, an emotional speech database was created with 140 acted speeches per speaker, consisting of short sentences of six full-blowi basic emotions and neutral, of five native languages of Assam. Eight feature sets are extracted based on normal and Teager-energy-operated Wavelet-Packet-Cepstral- Coefficients (WPCC and a modified version of it, WPCC2), Mel-Frequency- Cepstral-Coefficients (MFCC) and Log-Frequency-Power-Coefficients (LFPC). The WPCC2 and Teager-energy-operated WPCC2 and LFPC (tfWPCC2 and tfLFPC) features are proposed by the authors. The Gaussian Mixture Model (GMM) is used as the classifier employing Leave-One-Out (LOO) cross- validation method. The performances of all these feature sets are compared in respect of accuracy of classification and computational time. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.
Author Keywords: Cross-culture emotion recognition; Full-blown basic emotion; GMM classifier; LFPC; MFCC; Teager energy operator; WPCC

Authors: Kalra V., Jain R.
Title: A comparative study of rough set based decision tree and variable precision rough set based decision tree: Noisv data sets
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Sri Guru Govind Singh College of Commerce, Pitampura (Near T.V. Tower), Delhi-110 088, India; National Centre for Agricultural Economics and Policy Research, Library Avenue, Pusa, New Delhi-110 012, India
Authors with affiliations: Kalra, V., Sri Guru Govind Singh College of Commerce, Pitampura (Near T.V. Tower), Delhi-110 088, India; Jain, R., National Centre for Agricultural Economics and Policy Research, Library Avenue, Pusa, New Delhi-110 012, India
Abstract: Classification is a data mining technique used to predict group membership for data instances. Out of many Classification tools, the Rough set approach (RS) is the basic classification tool which is further generalized to Variable Precision Rough set approach (VPRS) for handling uncertain information. Decision tree (DT) is a common classification model to build decision model recursively. All these approaches have their own advantages and limitations. Rough Set based Decision tree (RDT) and Variable Precision Rough Set based Decision Tree (VPRDT) were applied on the dominant attributes of noisy dataset. Comparative evaluation of the two approaches was made to understand their merits and demerits in terms of accuracy and simplicity. It was observed that VPRDT handles uncertainity in the dataset better than RDT. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Shekar B.H., Thippeswamy G., Shivakumara P.
Title: Discriminative scale invariant feature transform (SIFT FLD) model for efficient representation and accurate recognition of faces
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, Mangalore University, Karnataka, India; Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Sir M Visvesvasvaraya Institute of Technology, Hunasamaranahalli, Bangalore, India; School of Computing, National University of Singapore, Singapore
Authors with affiliations: Shekar, B.H., Department of Computer Science, Mangalore University, Karnataka, India; Thippeswamy, G., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Sir M Visvesvasvaraya Institute of Technology, Hunasamaranahalli, Bangalore, India; Shivakumara, P., School of Computing, National University of Singapore, Singapore
Abstract: In this paper, we propose a new discriminative scale invariant feature transform (SIFTFLD) model for efficient representation and accurate recognition of faces. Discriminative SIFT descriptors are extracted for compact representation of faces. Unlike PCA-SIFT that employs PCA on normalized gradient patch; we employ FLD on smoothed weighted histograms. The proposed model has better recognition performance in an unstructured environment and invariant to in-plane rotations. To establish the superiority of the proposed model, we have experimentally compared the performance of our new algorithm with recently proposed (2D)2-FLD on the benchmark databases: AT&T and CALTECH face datasets. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Jain R., Ahuja U.
Title: Developing decision tree for characterizing ICT empowered women farmers in india
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: National Centre for Agricultural Economics and Policy Research, Library Avenue, 11305, New Delhi-110 012, India
Authors with affiliations: Jain, R., National Centre for Agricultural Economics and Policy Research, Library Avenue, 11305, New Delhi-110 012, India; Ahuja, U., National Centre for Agricultural Economics and Policy Research, Library Avenue, 11305, New Delhi-110 012, India
Abstract: Knowledge and information are the key drivers of growth. ICTs have the potential for promoting equitable and sustainable growth and development. There is a need to capitalize on the promise of ICTs and ensure that the opportunities to gain are spread throughout the society including rural poor women. Convergence of information and communication technologies can revolutionize access to information in Indian scenario where women are responsible for 70 per cent of the actual farm work and constitute up to 60 per cent of fanning population. To harness the potential of ICT for women farmers, it is essential to understand the constraints and factors which determine the access and use of ICT by rural women. This paper attempts to characterise the farm women who are empowered to use ICT by employing data mining algorithms for extracting pattern from real agricultural data. Primary survey data from 3 selected villages of Sonepat district of Haryana was used. It was observed that decision tree obtained using C4.5 algorithm was simple to understand and also provided maximum accuracy. On the basis of validation and discussion of the induced rules with the domain expert, it is recommended that status of education should be improved in the villages, more income opportunities should be provided to farm women and also appropriate technologies should be developed for providing ICT empowerment to farm women. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Title: Challenges in personalization for general information search
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Anna University, Chennai, - 600 025, India
Authors with affiliations: Sendhilkumar, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Anna University, Chennai, - 600 025, India; Geetha, T.V., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Anna University, Chennai, - 600 025, India
Abstract: Searching through the World Wide Web is an important online activity. For search to be effective, personalization has become a very popular remedy. Personalization of general search has rooted deep in the arena of information retrieval. In the history of information retrieval there exists a variety of techniques for achieving personalization. This paper provides an effective classification of systems that are used for searching information through the Web. After a through study of the various personalized search systems this paper highlights the challenges and issues that makes personalized web search an important area of research. This paper also suggests an integrated approach for achieving effective personalized web search. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Guru D.S., Manjunath S., Punitha P.
Title: Topological triangular spatial relations
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: University of Mysore, Mysore, India; University of Glasgow, Glasgow, United Kingdom
Authors with affiliations: Guru, D.S., University of Mysore, Mysore, India; Manjunath, S., University of Mysore, Mysore, India; Punitha, P., University of Glasgow, Glasgow, United Kingdom
Abstract: In this paper, we present a novel scheme for archival and retrieval of symbolic images from a symbolic image database based on Triangular Spatial Relationship [1]. Conventionally, Triangular Spatial Relationship was designed to preserve only spatial relationship among the components in a symbolic image neglecting the topological relationship existing between them, where topological relationship plays a major role in preserving the structure of the symbolic image. Hence in this paper we extend the concept of Triangular Spatial Relationship to Topological Triangular Spatial Relationship. The proposed can handle both spatial as well as topological relationships existing among the components present in the image which is suitable for high level image archival and retrieval. Also, we propose a new similarity measure which takes care of both spatial as well as topological relation for similarity match retrieval and is invariant to image transformations. To study the efficacy of the proposed method we have conducted experimentation on video frames of cartoon film and on a set of personal photographs taken during outings. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Abstract: An efficient face recognition algorithm, robust against illumination variations has been developed based on support vector machines using two complementary features - The Local Binary Pattern (LBP) Histogram for texture and Projected Principal Edge Distribution (PPED) Feature Vector. The results of the experiments performed on the YALE Extended-B Database shows the robustness of these two features under varied illumination conditions.

Authors: Das A.K., Sil J.
Title: An efficient classifier design integrating rough set and graph theory based decision forest
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Bengal Engineering and Science University, Shibpur, Howrah - 711103, W.B., India
Authors with affiliations: Das, A.K., Bengal Engineering and Science University, Shibpur, Howrah - 711103, W.B., India; Sil, J., Bengal Engineering and Science University, Shibpur, Howrah - 711103, W.B., India
Abstract: Feature subset selection and dimensionality reduction of data is a fundamental and most explored area of research in machine learning and data mining domains. Rough set theory (RST) is purely based on mathematical concept, used to determine a subset of attributes called reduct which can fully characterize the knowledge of the datasets and thereby reduces dimensionality of the information system. In the paper, rule set of an information system is generated for each reduct by applying decision tree algorithm. As a next step the rule sets representing initial classifiers are pruned by removing the extraneous components resulting enhancement of accuracy in the information system. The concept of graph theory is invoked to construct the final classifier, by removing redundancy and inconsistency in the rule sets of initial classifiers. A complete and minimal set of rules is thus obtained by reducing dimensionality of the information system. The proposed method is compared with the support vector machine based classification technique to measure its efficiency. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Raheja J.L., Shyam R., Kumar U.
Title: Hand gesture capture and recognition technique for real-time video stream
Source title: Proceedings of the IASTED International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Soft Computing, ASC 2009
Affiliations: Digital Systems Group, Central Electronics Engineering Research Institute (CEERI), Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), Pilani - 333031, Rajasthan, India
Authors with affiliations: Raheja, J.L., Digital Systems Group, Central Electronics Engineering Research Institute (CEERI), Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), Pilani - 333031, Rajasthan, India; Shyam, R., Digital Systems Group, Central Electronics Engineering Research Institute (CEERI), Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), Pilani - 333031, Rajasthan, India; Kumar, U., Digital Systems Group, Central Electronics Engineering Research Institute (CEERI), Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), Pilani - 333031, Rajasthan, India
Abstract: This paper presents a fast and efficient technique for recognition of continuous hand gestures with a stationary background from video stream. The system consists of four modules. A real time hand tracking and extraction, feature extraction, Principle component analysis (PCA) algorithm training, and gesture recognition. First of all, real-time hand tracking and extraction algorithm is applied to trace the moving hand and to extract the hand region, and then motion analysis is performed to characterize the temporal features. Instead of capturing each frame and tracking hand movement for gesture recognition, it captures only that frame for analysis which shows least motion of the hand. That is, the frame is captured where hand stops moving for a few moments of time. This instance of the frame is where the gesture of the hand is complete. In this way the proposed technique becomes fast and memory efficient. In this proposed technique we capture 5 frames per second from video stream. After that we compare 3 continuous frames to know the frame, containing static posture shown by hand. This static posture is recognized as a hand gesture. Now it is matched with stored gesture database to know its meaning. Before matching gesture, preprocessing is performed to remove other part of human body and to select only part of hand showing some useful gesture.
Author Keywords: Hand gesture; Human-machine interaction; Image matching; Motion detection; Object recognition and image segmentation

Abstract: In this research, we are conferring the need and methodology for decision making in the treatment of broken tooth. A decision-making system based on fuzzy inference mechanism is presented. The aim of this research is to help the dentists to determine the required treatment for the effected tooth based on the values of various associated sign-symptoms.

Authors: Jangain A.K., Ramachandrarao P.
Title: Random number approach for addressing issues of classification problems
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: ICAR Research Complex for Goa, Ela. Old Goa, Goa, India; Department of Computer Science and Technology, Goa University, Taligao, Goa, India
Authors with affiliations: Jangain, A.K., ICAR Research Complex for Goa, Ela. Old Goa, Goa, India; Ramachandrarao, P., Department of Computer Science and Technology, Goa University, Taligao, Goa, India
Abstract: Data mining tools are data intensive techniques and training of models with small sized data sets obviously result poor performance. Improving the performance of models even when the input data size is small has got significance in dealing with classification problems. An experiment was conducted to address the issues of classification problems like size of the input instances and accuracies. Iris data with three species (Setosa, versicolor and Virginica) was used for the study. Random numbers were generated for each of four attributes (Sepal length. Sepal width, Petal length and Petal width) of the Iris species using uniform and Gaussian distributions. Input data sets of different sizes with a combination of original Iris data and random numbers for each attribute were prepared to train the decision trees and multilayer percepti on models. We observed considerable improvement in the accuracies of the decision tree models with new data sets containing random numbers than the original Iris data. Artificial neural network models, even though produced better algorithms in some cases, were proved to be inconsistent in performance with increase in the size of input instances using random numbers of either uniform or Gaussian distributions. With regard to decision tree models the proposed method provides higher average classification accuracies and a way to find better algorithms for classifying the data. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Title: A self-organizing network based method for text classification using MST of data points for grouping
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009

Abstract: A text classification method using Kohonen's Self Organizing Network is presented here. The proposed method can classify a set of text documents into a number of classes depending on then contents where the number of such classes is not known a priori. Necessary morphological analysis to extract the root words from the given set of texts is earned out to form the pattern vector for classification. Text documents from various faculties of games are considered for experimentation. The method is found to provide satisfactory results for large size of data. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Title: Innovative handwritten text segmentation method using ANN for recognition of assamese scripts
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Electronics and Communication Technology, Gauhati University, Guwahati-781014, Assam, India
Authors with affiliations: Bhattacharyya, K., Department of Electronics and Communication Technology, Gauhati University, Guwahati-781014, Assam, India; Sarma, K.K., Department of Electronics and Communication Technology, Gauhati University, Guwahati-781014, Assam, India
Abstract: Segmentation of words into individual letters has been one of the major problems in handwriting recognition. The work explores the performance difference obtained by using an ANN-based dynamic method compared to projection- based static segmentation applied to handwritten Assamese scripts. Individual characters from the input text are over-segmented and fed as units or combination of units to a handwritten character- trained ANN. The point at which the ANN recognizes a segment or a combination of several segments to be similar to a handwritten character, a segmentation boundary for the character is assumed to exist. The results thus obtained j improves the recognition rate of the system. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Kaur H., Jain D.
Title: Employing experience for updating trust in trust based recommender systems
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, Hans Raj College, University of Delhi, Delhi - 110007, India
Authors with affiliations: Kaur, H., Department of Computer Science, Hans Raj College, University of Delhi, Delhi - 110007, India; Jain, D., Department of Computer Science, Hans Raj College, University of Delhi, Delhi - 110007, India
Abstract: While traveling on a today's wide information highway, to reach our destination in a faster and smarter way, we need a well guided route map which may be in the form of recommender systems. This paper proposes a trust based recommender system where opinions are taken from trust worthy acquaintances to get personalized responses. In this recommender system there exist a web of trust, which is formed on the basis of trust among agents in application domain. The personalized recommendations lists for the user agent are generated by the recommender agents that consist of Intuitionistic fuzzy sets which are computed on the basis of the extent to which the products match the profile of the user. Once the user sets the aggregated list of recommendations, user associated with that agent selects an item from the list and uses that item. On the basis of his experience with that item, he then updates his trust on his recommenders. In this way, the recommenders who provide recommendations according to the taste of user become trust worthier and vice-versa. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Venkatarama H.S., Sekaran K.C.
Title: Simulation environment for maximizing profits in an autonomic computing system using fuzzy control
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Computer Science and Engg. Dept., Manipal Institute of Technology, Manipal, India; Dept. of Computer Engg., National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Srinivasnagar - Surathkal, India
Authors with affiliations: Venkatarama, H.S., Computer Science and Engg. Dept., Manipal Institute of Technology, Manipal, India; Sekaran, K.C., Dept. of Computer Engg., National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Srinivasnagar - Surathkal, India
Abstract: eCommerce is an area where an Autonomic Computing system could be very effectively deployed. The growth of eCommerce has created demand for services with financial incentives for service providers. Revenues accrue if the admitted requests are processed within the specified deadline and costs are incurred if the admitted requests are not processed within the deadline. The number of requests to be admitted depends oil system capacity and workload. This paper describes a simulation environment to implement an approach to automate the admission control decisions in an Apache web server for maximizing profits. A fuzzy controller that implements hill climbing logic is used. This is an illustration of the self-optimizing characteristic of an autonomic computing system. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Dinesh R., Harish B.S., Guru D.S., Manjunath S.
Title: Concept of status matrix in classification of text documents
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Honeywell Technology Solutions Lab Pvt. Ltd., Bangalore 560 076, Kamataka, India; Department of SUidies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore 570 006, Kamataka, India
Authors with affiliations: Dinesh, R., Honeywell Technology Solutions Lab Pvt. Ltd., Bangalore 560 076, Kamataka, India; Harish, B.S., Department of SUidies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore 570 006, Kamataka, India; Guru, D.S., Department of SUidies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore 570 006, Kamataka, India; Manjunath, S., Department of SUidies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore 570 006, Kamataka, India
Abstract: In tins paper we propose a new method of classifying text documents. Unlike conventional vector space models, the proposed method preserves the sequence of term occurrence in a document. The term sequence is effectively preserved with the help of a novel datastructure called Status Matrix. Further the corresponding classification technique has been proposed for efficient classification of text documents. To corroborate the efficacy of the proposed representation and classification methods, we have conducted extensive experiments on very large datasets including few benchmark datasets. Also the superiority of the proposed method has been established by comparing the results of the proposed method with that of very well accepted contemporary methods. The experimental results reveal that the proposed method outperforms the existing methods both in terms of representation as well as classification accuracy. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Gaona M.Á.R., Gelbukh A., Bandyopadhyay S.
Title: Web-based Variant of the Lesk Approach to Word Sense Disambiguation
Source title: 8th Mexican International Conference on Artificial Intelligence - Proceedings of the Special Session, MICAI 2009
Affiliations: Center for Computing Research, National Polytechnic Institute, Mexico City, Mexico; Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, Kolkata 700 032, India
Authors with affiliations: Gaona, M.Á.R., Center for Computing Research, National Polytechnic Institute, Mexico City, Mexico; Gelbukh, A., Center for Computing Research, National Polytechnic Institute, Mexico City, Mexico; Bandyopadhyay, S., Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, Kolkata 700 032, India
Abstract: Word Sense Disambiguation (WSD) is the task of selecting the meaning of a word based on the context in which the word occurs. The principal statistical WSD approaches are supervised and unsupervised learning. The Lesk method is an example of unsupervised disambiguation. We present a measure for sense assignment useful for the simple Lesk algorithm. We use word co-occurrences of the gloss and the context, which is statistical information retrieved from the Web. In the SemCor data our method always gives an answer. On the Senseval 2 data, our variant of the Lesk method outperformed some other Leskbased methods. © 2009 IEEE.

Authors: Gosain A.K., Patil N.S., Sahu C., Thakur D.C.
Title: Geospatial web portal for hydrological information
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, New Delhi- 110016, India
Authors with affiliations: Gosain, A.K., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, New Delhi- 110016, India; Patil, N.S., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, New Delhi- 110016, India; Sahu, C., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, New Delhi- 110016, India; Thakur, D.C., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, New Delhi- 110016, India
Abstract: Water resources projects are being tackled by various line departments at the state level and various jtninistries at the central level, and at times there is a large overlap of objectives. Although they act upon the common water resources but very seldom there is proper coordination which is very essential for ensuring collective sustainability of such acts and interventions. Thus a hydrological framework that can keep track of the inter connection of the watersheds is essential. The present paper discusses the implementation of Web-based GIS (ArcGIS Server) to cope with all the above concerns. The integration of information is done by placing a database server and by adapting the ArcGIS Hydro data model (Arc Hydro). The data model is further enhanced to capture additional relevant information related to Soil, Landuse. Administrative area and some feature class of Hydrography data set. which are not part of Arc Hydro model. Implementation has been designed to ensure that internal GIS capabilities are shared with users in the line departments, while a Web-based platform is maintained for dissemination to external users. The data model also has a model base attached for indirect assessment of various components of water balance, water quality, flow etc. This Geospatial portal provides the gate way for dissemination of Hydrological Information for the planning, execution and monitoring of status of water resources. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Rajashekararadhya S.V., Vanaja Ranjan P.
Title: Efficient zone-based hybrid feature extraction algorithm for handwritten numeral recognition of kannada script
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, College of Engineering, Anna University, Chennai-600 025, India
Authors with affiliations: Rajashekararadhya, S.V., Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, College of Engineering, Anna University, Chennai-600 025, India; Vanaja Ranjan, P., Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, College of Engineering, Anna University, Chennai-600 025, India
Abstract: Handwritten character recognition has received extensive attention in academic and production fields. The recognition system can be either on-line or off-line. There is a large demand for handwritten character recognition and hand written documents. India is a multi-lingual and multi script country, where eighteen official scripts are accepted and there are over hundred regional languages, hi this paper we propose a zone-based feature extraction algorithm. The numeral/character image is divided into n equal zones. Average distance from the character centroid to the pixels present in the zone, is computed (one feature).The zone centroid is computed (two features). The average distance from the zone centroid to the pixels present in the zone is computed (one feature). This procedure is repeated sequentially for all zones present in the numeral image. There could be some zone having empty foreground pixels: then, the value of that particular zone in the feature vector is zero. Finally, 4*n such features are extracted. We achieved 98.05 % of recognition accuracy using the support vector machine classifier for Kannada numerals. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.
Author Keywords: Feature extraction algorithm; Feed forward back propagation neural network; Handwritten character recognition; Indian scripts; Nearest neighbor classifier; Support vector machine

Authors: Girisha R., Murali S.
Title: Segmentation of motion objects from four successive video frames simultaneously by temporal differencing combined with multivariate statistics
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: P.E.T. Research Centre, P.E.S.C.E., Mandya, Karnataka, India
Authors with affiliations: Girisha, R., P.E.T. Research Centre, P.E.S.C.E., Mandya, Karnataka, India; Murali, S., P.E.T. Research Centre, P.E.S.C.E., Mandya, Karnataka, India
Abstract: Identifying moving objects from a video sequence is a fundamental and critical task in many computer vision applications. We develop an efficient adaptive segmentation algorithm for color video surveillance sequence in real time, which uses four frames simultaneously and works for non-stationary background in indoor environment. At runtime, segmentation is performed by checking color intensity values at corresponding pixels P(x,y) from four frames using temporal differencing. Background is modeled with multivariate statistical partial correlation coefficient using pixel-level based approach. The segmentation starts from a seed in the form of 3×3 image blocks to avoid the noise. Usually, temporal differencing generates holes in motion objects. After subtraction, holes are filled using image fusion, which uses spatial clustering as criteria to link motion objects. The emphasis of this approach is on the robust detection of moving objects even under noise or environmental changes (indoor). Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Mohan S., Murali S.
Title: Interactive 3D walkthrough from sampled video frames - An approach based on perspective correction using symmetric objects
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Dept of IT, Kamnya University, Coimbatore, Tamilnadu, India; Dept of ISE, PES College of Engg, Mandya, Karnataka, India
Authors with affiliations: Mohan, S., Dept of IT, Kamnya University, Coimbatore, Tamilnadu, India; Murali, S., Dept of ISE, PES College of Engg, Mandya, Karnataka, India
Abstract: For rich user interaction in the 3D virtual environment, photo realistic models have to be constructed. The photo realism can be brought to the 3d model by using the image based modeling methods. The image based methods impose certain assumptions on the system to reconstruct the 3D models. Video based systems on the other hand can be a very useful system for creating 3D models. It becomes more complex when perspective distortion is introduced. The challenge involved here is selecting the frames where the object of interest is present. The proposed method addresses the sampling of frames from a perspective video sequence for 3D modeling. The sampled frames are then corrected for perspective rectification. With the presence of symmetric patterns in the scene, it is possible to reconstruct the scene with photorealism. As the method doesn't impose any camera parameters and site information, 3d model of the scene can be constructed easily. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Sarmah K., Sarma K.K.
Title: Parameter prediction and optimization of loop antenna design using ANN
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Electronics and Communication Technology, Gauhati University, Guwahati-781014, India
Authors with affiliations: Sarmah, K., Department of Electronics and Communication Technology, Gauhati University, Guwahati-781014, India; Sarma, K.K., Department of Electronics and Communication Technology, Gauhati University, Guwahati-781014, India
Abstract: The two most common approaches to antenna design are tedious theoretical calculations and use of software. The ready made solutions made available by software for ascertaining the design requirements of an antenna suffers from several limitations.The most noticeable is the inability of these tools to control precision and provide prediction. Moreover the custom made softwares provide 110 facility to obtain design optimization of the antenna parameters and physical layout. Also, such software solutions cannot be modified to suit extensive transmit-receive conditions observed in applications. An Artificial Neural Network (ANN) offers a solution for such situations. The ANN can be trained to provide the best and worst case precisions of antenna design problems and can be configured so as to generate an optimization of the design. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Dasgupta T., Basu A., Bhowmick P., Mitra P.
Title: English to indian sign language machine translation: A structure transfer framework
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Society for Natural Language Technology Research, Kolkata, India; Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India
Authors with affiliations: Dasgupta, T., Society for Natural Language Technology Research, Kolkata, India; Basu, A., Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India; Bhowmick, P., Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India; Mitra, P., Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India
Abstract: Machine translation from one natural language to another is a widely accepted challenging problem. This becomes even more challenging when the source and the target language differ in terms of both structure as well as modality, as in the case of spoken languages like, English and sign languages like. Indian Sign Language. A large number of issues are to be addressed while translating between such a language pair. This paper presents a framework for the English- To-Indian Sign Language machine translation system. The system can be used to disseminate information to the deaf people in India. The present system takes English sentence as input, performs syntactic analysis, and represents the source language into an intermediate case frame representation. Finally, transfer grammar rules are used to generate the corresponding ISL sentence structure. As ISL does not have any written form, the final sentence is synthesized in terms of pre-recorded video streams. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Gupta B., Kaur H., Bedi P.
Title: Trust based personalized ecommerce for farmers
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, University of Delhi, Delhi -110007, India; Department of Conputer Science, Hans Raj College, University of Delhi, Delhi -110007, India
Authors with affiliations: Gupta, B., Department of Computer Science, University of Delhi, Delhi -110007, India; Kaur, H., Department of Conputer Science, Hans Raj College, University of Delhi, Delhi -110007, India; Bedi, P., Department of Computer Science, University of Delhi, Delhi -110007, India
Abstract: Amid the diversity and change, patterns of e-commerce practices in agricultures are emerging It has been found that farmers are switching to e-transactions. especially with regard to purchasing seeds, crop chemicals and machinery. A large and seemingly swelling number of agribusiness firms offer their sendees online, which makes it difficult for fanners to decide an appropriate vendor for delegation of task. To focus on this difficulty, the notion of "trust" needs to be addressed so that trustworthiness makes such decisions profitable and reliable. In this paper, a model of reputation for use by the fanners is proposed using which they can compute the reputation of service providers. The fanner computes the reputation based on its own experience as well as experience the peers have with the service providers. For every transaction, rank among various service providers are compared and based on that delegation of the job is done by fanners. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Surendiran B., Vadivel A.
Title: An automated classification of mammogram masses using statistical measures
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Computer Applications, National Institute of Technology, Tiruchirappalli, India
Authors with affiliations: Surendiran, B., Department of Computer Applications, National Institute of Technology, Tiruchirappalli, India; Vadivel, A., Department of Computer Applications, National Institute of Technology, Tiruchirappalli, India
Abstract: Breast cancer is the primary and most common disease found in women which causes second lushest rate of death after lung cancer. The digital mammogram is the X-ray of breast captured for the analysis, interpretation and diagnosis. In this paper, we classify the malignant and benign masses present in mammogram using weight function and various statistical measures. The range of the calculated statistical values aligns together based on the category of mass. The mammograms for The Digital Database for Screening Mammography (DDSM) have been used. The experimental results are found to be encouraging. Also, the results will agree to the standard specified by the American College of Radiology-Breast Imaging and Reporting Data Systems (ACR-BIRADS). Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Kaur D.A., Kaur K.
Title: Fuzzy expert systems based on membership functions and fuzzy rules
Source title: 2009 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Computational Intelligence, AICI 2009
Affiliations: Lovely Professional University, Phagwara, Punjab, India
Authors with affiliations: Kaur, D.A., Lovely Professional University, Phagwara, Punjab, India; Kaur, K., Lovely Professional University, Phagwara, Punjab, India
Abstract: The prime focus in artificial intelligence is on creating machines that can exhibit some form of intelligence. Accurate mathematical models neither always exist nor can they be derived for all complex environments because the domain may not be thoroughly understood. The solution consists of constructing rules that apply when input values lie within certain designer-defined categories. The major disadvantage of existing approach lies in defining the categories, called membership functions, for each input parameter - i.e. use of this method requires some form of expert knowledge in order to define these membership functions. The efficiency or accuracy of the fuzzy system is then proportional to the designer's expertise in the application area. The knowledge base in an expert system can grow incrementally and can be updated dynamically; so that the performance of an expert system can be enhanced. In this paper, a general learning method is proposed as a framework for automatically deriving membership functions and fuzzy if then rules from a setoff given training examples to rapidly build a prototype fuzzy expert system. Based on the membership functions and the fuzzy rules derived, corresponding fuzzy inference procedure to process inputs is also developed. © 2009 IEEE.

Authors: Satyanarayana P., Srinivas V.V.
Title: Regional frequency analysis of rainfall using climate information and fuzzy cluster analysis
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, - 560 012, India
Authors with affiliations: Satyanarayana, P., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, - 560 012, India; Srinivas, V.V., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, - 560 012, India
Abstract: Regional frequency analysis (RFA) of rainfall is potential alternative to at-site frequency analysis when data at target site are inadequate or unavailable to calibrate parameters of frequency distribution. In conventional RFA, a group of sites (having rainfall characteristics similar to those of target site) are identified to pool information for estimation of the parameters. For this purpose, conventional methods use statistics of observed rainfall as attributes. Therefore they are ineffective in areas where data are sparse or unavailable. To address this issue, an approach is described in this paper. Large scale atmospheric variables affecting hydro-meteorology and location parameters of sites in the study area are suggested as attributes to form regions using fuzzy cluster analysis. This allows formation of effective groups of sites that can be validated for homogeneity using statistics computed from the observed rainfall. Effectiveness of the proposed approach is illustrated through application to India. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Title: A novel symmetric key and non-deterministic encryption algorithm for information security
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Computer Applications, National Institute of Technology, Tiruchirappalli, India
Authors with affiliations: Vijay, K.A.S., Department of Computer Applications, National Institute of Technology, Tiruchirappalli, India; Vadivel, A., Department of Computer Applications, National Institute of Technology, Tiruchirappalli, India; Gopalan, N.P., Department of Computer Applications, National Institute of Technology, Tiruchirappalli, India
Abstract: We propose a symmetric key and non-deterministic encryption algorithm for information security. The algorithm uses 256 bit key to Encrypt and Decrypt the data. The key is generated randomly and every time the encrypted value differs. The proposed encryption algorithm introduces randomness by varying the starting index of the key pattern, which gives a total combination of 84C 32 * 29. We have used the proposed algorithm in the area of steganography to hide the encrypted text with the image pixels without any notable distortion to the original image. The performance of the algorithm is found to be encouraging. While trying to crack the key by brute force method, it requires a total of 84C32 * 29 combinations of the. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Talreja J., Sood M., Kaur H., Bedi P., Gupta B.
Title: Using web mining to generate recommendations: A website recommender
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, University of Delhi, Delhi -110007, India; Department of Computer Science, Hans Raj College, University of Delhi, Delhi 110007, India
Authors with affiliations: Talreja, J., Department of Computer Science, University of Delhi, Delhi -110007, India; Sood, M., Department of Computer Science, University of Delhi, Delhi -110007, India; Kaur, H., Department of Computer Science, Hans Raj College, University of Delhi, Delhi 110007, India; Bedi, P., Department of Computer Science, University of Delhi, Delhi -110007, India; Gupta, B., Department of Computer Science, University of Delhi, Delhi -110007, India
Abstract: Recommender Systems assist users in decision-making process when potentially overwhelming set of choices of products or services are available. Website recommender system proposes use of web mining techniques to recommend a personalized set of websites that might be of interest to a user. This approach exploits the user access patterns as registered by the proxy web server to underpin relation between users and websites. These patterns are determined by clustering websites on the basis of preferences given to them by different users. Hence, the websites rated similarly (visited) by different users and those visited by active user, forms the basis for website recommender system to generate recommendations for the active user. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Mishra K.K., Singh K., Verma M.
Title: A novel algorithm for finding non-dominated set in multi objective optimization
Source title: Proceedings of the 2009 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2009
Affiliations: Computer Science and Engg., MNNIT, Allahabad, Uttar Pradesh, India; Computer Science and Engg., U.P. Technical University, Lucknow, India
Authors with affiliations: Mishra, K.K., Computer Science and Engg., MNNIT, Allahabad, Uttar Pradesh, India; Singh, K., Computer Science and Engg., U.P. Technical University, Lucknow, India; Verma, M., Computer Science and Engg., U.P. Technical University, Lucknow, India
Abstract: Non dominated sorting is an essential part of multi objective optimization problems so efficient algorithms for finding non dominated set are always in demand. In this paper we will present a novel algorithm based on the sorting and deleting steps and analysis of our algorithm with the various algorithms available.

Authors: Roselin R., Thangavel K.
Title: Classification of mammograms: A data mining approach
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, Sri Sarada College for Women, Salem-16, Tamil Nadu, India; Department of Computer Science, Periyar University, Salem - 636 011, Tamil Nadu, India
Authors with affiliations: Roselin, R., Department of Computer Science, Sri Sarada College for Women, Salem-16, Tamil Nadu, India; Thangavel, K., Department of Computer Science, Periyar University, Salem - 636 011, Tamil Nadu, India
Abstract: Classification is a form of data analysis and it is a process of extracting model to describe data classes. The extracted model is used to predict the class of unseen data. This paper proposes Ant-Miner algorithm for classifying mammograms. A comparative analysis is performed to achieve the efficiency of the proposed method. The classification accuracy reaches 99%. The cases which are classified by the default classes are less and it generates less number of rules too. It is observed from the results that the role of default class in the classifications reduces the accuracy. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.

Authors: Mangesh D., Raghunath H.
Title: Improving speaker identification in noisy environment
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Instrumentation Engineering, SGGS Institute of Engineering and Technology, Nanded, Maharashtra, India
Authors with affiliations: Mangesh, D., Department of Instrumentation Engineering, SGGS Institute of Engineering and Technology, Nanded, Maharashtra, India; Raghunath, H., Department of Instrumentation Engineering, SGGS Institute of Engineering and Technology, Nanded, Maharashtra, India
Abstract: In tins paper, an investigation is done on the importance of different frequency bands for identifying speakers. It is found that the speaker specific information is encoded non-uniformly in different frequency bands and particularly, higher frequency bands also carry more speaker specific information Based on this information, we have proposed a novel feature set which emphasizes individual information for speaker identification using admissible wavelet packet transform. To evaluate the robustness of the proposed features for speaker identification, clean speech corpus from TIMET database has been used and combined the speech signal with ear noise from the NOISEX-92 database. The proposed feature set provides significant improvements in the identification accuracy over the conventional method like MFCC under mismatched training and testing environments. The results show that better speaker identification rates are attainable under mismatched conditions especially at low signal-to-noise ratio (SNR). Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.
Author Keywords: GMM; MFCC; Speaker identification; Wavelet transform

Title: A hybrid APSO-aided learnable bayesian classifier
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2009
Affiliations: Department of Information and Communication Technology, Fakir Mohan University, Vyasa Vihar, Balasore-756019, Orissa, India; Department of Computer Science, Soft Computing Laboratory, Yonsei University, 232 Seongsanno, Seodaemun-gu, Seoul 120-749, South Korea

Abstract: In this paper a hybrid adaptive particle swarm optimization aided learnable Bayesian classifier is proposed. The objective of the classifier is to solve some of the fundamental problems associated with the pure naive Bayesian classifier and its variants with a larger view towards maximization of the classifier accuracy. Further, the proposed algorithm can exhibits an improved capability to eliminate spurious features from large datasets aiding researchers in identifying those features that are solely responsible for achieving higher classification accuracy. The effectiveness of the proposed algorithm is demonstrated on several benchmark datasets. Copyright © 2009 by IICAI.
