Title: Transformation invariant robust shape analysis
Source title: Proceedings of the 2007 International Conference on Image Processing, Computer Vision, and Pattern Recognition, IPCV 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Engineering, Malaviya National Institute of Technology, Jaipur-302017, India
Authors with affiliations: Nain, N., Department of Computer Engineering, Malaviya National Institute of Technology, Jaipur-302017, India; Laxmi, V., Department of Computer Engineering, Malaviya National Institute of Technology, Jaipur-302017, India; Khandelwal, M., Department of Computer Engineering, Malaviya National Institute of Technology, Jaipur-302017, India; Agarwal, D., Department of Computer Engineering, Malaviya National Institute of Technology, Jaipur-302017, India; Rao, D., Department of Computer Engineering, Malaviya National Institute of Technology, Jaipur-302017, India; Verma, P., Department of Computer Engineering, Malaviya National Institute of Technology, Jaipur-302017, India
Abstract: Shape is one of the most important low level image features, which remains intact even after the introduction of sampling noise, quantization noise and applications of geometric tran-formations. Thus shape is a very important feature to human perception. This paper describes transformation invariant simple scalar descriptors and moment descriptors. A new shape descriptor is described using chain-encoding methods, where a shape boundary is represented as a list of vectors of line segments. This is a very compact and efficient method of shape representation which could be exploited for shape compression, classification, segmentation and shape matching techniques. Common issues and techniques for shape representation and normalization are also analyzed in the paper. Data is given to compare the various techniques.

Abstract: This paper presents a method for generating fractal pattern images from different sample images and then hiding it into different data images. These data images are gray scale images This paper uses the idea given by Zhicheng Ni, Eric Sung and Yun Q. Shi in their paper "Enhancing Robustness of Digital Watermarking against Geometric Attack Based on Fractal Transform" [7]. This paper exploits the various well known fractal patterns as a watermark logo for the above scheme and then analyzes the performance of fractal logos against JPEG compression and geometric attacks like crop, zoom, spatial and color flip.

Authors: Kar B., Katiyar D., Dutta P.K.
Title: Digital watermarking of biometric signatures
Source title: Proceedings of the 2007 International Conference on Image Processing, Computer Vision, and Pattern Recognition, IPCV 2007
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India
Authors with affiliations: Kar, B., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India; Katiyar, D., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India; Dutta, P.K., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India
Abstract: Because of increase in biometric authentication, it is important to maintain the security of the biometrie samples. It is here where watermarking comes in play, empowering the biometrie authentication system and securing biometrie data stored in the databases. In this paper, an application of watermarking is presented i.e. to secure electronic biometrie signatures using digital watermarking techniques. The performance of the schemes is compared in terms of bit embedding capacity and detector's performance. The first two schemes are a based on least significant bit plane watermarking. The third watermarking scheme is the based on the Fourier descriptor watermarking technique (FDWM). Here, we also propose and analyze a generic biometrie authentication system using watermarking security. In our work we found that the receiver operating characteristic (ROC) of the verification algorithm is very slightly or not perturbed due to watermarking of input and the template signatures stored in the database.

Authors: Ray T., Dutta P.K.
Title: Comparative study of Gabor, Circular Gabor and DCT based method with contextual information for unsupervised texture segmentation
Source title: Proceedings of the 2007 International Conference on Image Processing, Computer Vision, and Pattern Recognition, IPCV 2007

Abstract: In this paper the concept of pixel wise feature extraction for texture segmentation has been extended to block wise feature extraction with the addition of contextual information. A comparative study has been made among different texture feature extraction techniques with this concept. Computational burden is small due to processing in non overlapping blocks. It has been observed that Circular Gabor filter followed by DCT gives the best performance. The results have been validated in presence of noise.

Authors: Misra S., Chakrabarti A.
Title: An efficient approach to estimate velocity fields using optical flow and wavelet transform
Source title: Proceedings of the 2007 International Conference on Image Processing, Computer Vision, and Pattern Recognition, IPCV 2007
Affiliations: School of Information Technology, West Bengal University of Technology, Kolkata, West Bengal, India; A.K. Choudhury School of Information Technology, University of Calcutta, Kolkata, West Bengal, India

Abstract: The computation of optical flow plays a key role in computer vision techniques related to robot vision, moving object detection and velocity estimation. The generation of motion vectors is a crucial issue for moving object detection and tracking using image sensors. In this paper we offer a technique for computing the velocity of moving objects in a real time video sequence by applying optical flow and discrete wavelet transform. The purpose is to extract the moving objects and then use the proposed technique to compute the moving object velocities. The proposed technique can be used to develop an intrusion detection system, which can be used in detecting, classifying, tracking objects in a real time video sequence. The results of the proposed technique have been found to be satisfactory.

Authors: Pati U.C., Dutta P.K., Barua A.
Title: Multimodal image fusion of a real world object
Source title: Proceedings of the 2007 International Conference on Image Processing, Computer Vision, and Pattern Recognition, IPCV 2007
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, West Bengal, India
Authors with affiliations: Pati, U.C., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, West Bengal, India; Dutta, P.K., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, West Bengal, India; Barua, A., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, West Bengal, India
Abstract: Image fusion is the process whereby images or some of their features from various modalities are merged to provide a more complete picture of a scene or object under identification. Fusion of images obtained from two different modalities of a real world object has been reported in this paper. In the first case, the images are taken while the object is subjected to scanning by a laser beam. In the second case, the image is taken while the object is under ambient illumination. Edge maps are extracted in both the cases by appropriate techniques. Fusion of both the edge maps is achieved with the help of affine transformation. Combined visualization has the potential to provide more information than the individual data sets as it takes the advantage of individual strength of each mode.

Authors: Banerjee S.
Title: Boosting inductive transfer for text classification using Wikipedia
Source title: Proceedings - 6th International Conference on Machine Learning and Applications, ICMLA 2007
Affiliations: Hwlett-Packard Labs, Bangalore, India
Authors with affiliations: Banerjee, S., Hwlett-Packard Labs, Bangalore, India
Abstract: Inductive transfer is applying knowledge learned on one set of tasks to improve the performance of learning a new task. Inductive transfer is being applied in improving the generalization performance on a classification task using the models learned on some related tasks. In this paper, we show a method of making inductive transfer for text classification more effective using Wikipedia. We map the text documents of the different tasks to a feature space created using Wikipedia, thereby providing some background knowledge of the contents of the documents. It has been observed here that when the classifiers are built using the features generated from Wikipedia they become more effective in transferring knowledge. An evaluation on the daily classification task on the Reuters RCV1 corpus shows that our method can significantly improve the performance of inductive transfer. Our method was also able to successfully overcome a major obstacle observed in a recent work on a similar setting. © 2007 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Classification (of information); Education; Learning systems; Robot learning; Background knowledge (BK); Feature spaces; Generalization performance; International conferences; Machine-learning; Reuters (CO); Text classification (TC); Text documents; Wikipedia; Text processing

Authors: Thilagam P.S., Ananthanarayana V.S.
Title: Semantic partition based association rule mining across multiple databases using abstraction
Source title: Proceedings - 6th International Conference on Machine Learning and Applications, ICMLA 2007
Affiliations: Dept. of Computer Engineering, NITK, Surathkal 575025, India; Dept. of Information Technology, NITK, Surathkal 575025, India
Authors with affiliations: Thilagam, P.S., Dept. of Computer Engineering, NITK, Surathkal 575025, India; Ananthanarayana, V.S., Dept. of Information Technology, NITK, Surathkal 575025, India
Abstract: Association rule mining activity is both computationally and I/O intensive. A majority of ARM algorithms reported in the literature is efficient in handling high dimensional data but is single database based. Many enterprises maintain several databases independently to serve different purposes. There could be an implicit association among various parts of such data. In this paper, we investigate a mechanism to generate Association Rules (ARs) between the sets of values which are subsets of domains of attributes occurring in relations present in different databases. In our approach, the relevant databases, relations and attributes are identified using knowledge, multiple navigation paths are generated using data dictionary, a structure is constructed which semantically partitions the resultant relation using this navigation paths. We propose an efficient algorithm which uses this structure to generate ARs. © 2007 IEEE.

Authors: Sebastian N., Krithivasan K.
Title: Learning algorithms for grammars of variable arity trees
Source title: Proceedings - 6th International Conference on Machine Learning and Applications, ICMLA 2007

Authors with affiliations: Sebastian, N., Dept. of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai 600036, India; Krithivasan, K., Dept. of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai 600036, India
Abstract: Grammatical Inference is the technique by which a grammar that best describes a given set of input samples is inferred. This paper considers the inference of tree grammars from a set of sample input trees. Inference of grammars for fixed arity trees is well studied, in this paper we extend the method to give algorithms for inference of grammars for variable arity trees. We give algorithms for inference of local, single type and regular grammar and also consider the use of negative samples. The variable arity trees we consider can be used for representation of XML documents and the algorithms we have given can be used for validation as well as for schema inference. © 2007 IEEE.

Authors: Mukherjee A., Choudhury M., Basu A., Ganguly N.
Title: Redundancy ratio: An invariant property of the consonant inventories of the world's languages
Source title: ACL 2007 - Proceedings of the 45th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India
Authors with affiliations: Mukherjee, A., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India; Choudhury, M., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India; Basu, A., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India; Ganguly, N., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India
Abstract: In this paper, we put forward an information theoretic definition of the redundancy that is observed across the sound inventories of the world's languages. Through rigorous statistical analysis, we find that this redundancy is an invariant property of the consonant inventories. The statistical analysis further unfolds that the vowel inventories do not exhibit any such property, which in turn points to the fact that the organizing principles of the vowel and the consonant inventories are quite different in nature. © 2007 Association for Computational Linguistics.
Index Keywords: Invariant properties; Vowel inventory; Computational linguistics; Information theory; Statistical methods; Redundancy

Authors: Jing H., Kambhatla N., Roukos S.
Title: Extracting social networks and biographical facts from conversational speech transcripts
Source title: ACL 2007 - Proceedings of the 45th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics
Affiliations: IBM T.J. Watson Research Center, 1101 Kitchawan Road, Yorktown Heights, NY 10598, United States; IBM India Research Lab., EGL, Domlur Ring Road, Bangalore - 560071, India
Authors with affiliations: Jing, H., IBM T.J. Watson Research Center, 1101 Kitchawan Road, Yorktown Heights, NY 10598, United States; Kambhatla, N., IBM India Research Lab., EGL, Domlur Ring Road, Bangalore - 560071, India; Roukos, S., IBM T.J. Watson Research Center, 1101 Kitchawan Road, Yorktown Heights, NY 10598, United States
Abstract: We present a general framework for automatically extracting social networks and biographical facts from conversational speech. Our approach relies on fusing the output produced by multiple information extraction modules, including entity recognition and detection, relation detection, and event detection modules. We describe the specific features and algorithmic refinements effective for conversational speech. These cumulatively increase the performance of social network extraction from 0.06 to 0.30 for the development set, and from 0.06 to 0.28 for the test set, as measured by f-measure on the ties within a network. The same framework can be applied to other genres of text - we have built an automatic biography generation system for general domain text using the same approach. © 2007 Association for Computational Linguistics.

Authors: Padma M.C., Vijaya P.A.
Title: Visual Feature Extraction Method for Identification of south Indian languages
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Dept of Computer Science and Engg., PES College of Engineering, Mandya Karnataka State, India; Dept. of Electronics and Communication Engg., Malnad College of Engineering, Haasan Karnataka State, India
Authors with affiliations: Padma, M.C., Dept of Computer Science and Engg., PES College of Engineering, Mandya Karnataka State, India; Vijaya, P.A., Dept. of Electronics and Communication Engg., Malnad College of Engineering, Haasan Karnataka State, India
Abstract: In a multi-script, multi-lingual country like India, a document may contain text lines in more than one language. According to the three language formula [1], a document produced in south Indian states such as Karnataka, Andhrapradesh, Kerala and Tamilnadu, may be printed in their official regional language viz., Telugu, Kannada, Malayalam and Tamil respectively, national language Hindi and also in English. For such a scenario, it is necessary to identify the language of the multilingual document, before feeding the document to the OCRs of individual language. The objective of this paper is to develop a system that should identify the six different language portions of the multilingual document using visual features. The proposed method recognizes the type of the language using the spatial occurrence and the frequency of the four visual discriminating features such as horizontal lines, vertical lines, variable sized blocks and blocks with more than one component. Authors: Rihani V., Bansal R.
Title: Hand gesture recognition based on orientation histograms and cognitron network
Source title: Proceedings of the 2007 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2007

Authors with affiliations: Rihani, V., E and Ec. Deptt., PEC, Chandigarh, India; Bansal, R., E and Ec. Deptt., PEC, Chandigarh, India
Abstract: This paper proposes a Static Hand Gesture Recognition technique based upon Local Orientation Histogram technique and Cognitron Neural Network. The Local Orientation Histogram technique consists in calculating gradients in a picture and then constructs histograms of gradients orientation. The orientation histogram is then used as a feature vector for gesture classification. The Cognitron network developed by Fukushima is used for gesture recognition.

Authors: Nath J.D., Mitra P., Ganguly N.
Title: Scalable evolutionary design of CA pattern classifier
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007

Authors with affiliations: Nath, J.D., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India; Mitra, P., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India; Ganguly, N., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India
Abstract: The paper reports a scalable evolutionary design for pattern recognition using Multiple Attractor Cellular Automata (MACA). MACA helps to impart non-linearity in the classifier using Hamming distance based attractors. Isomorphism in MACA was exploited to make the method scalable to large classification problems involving non-linear boundaries. Extensive experimentation was performed on datasets with different topologies to establish the efficacy of the proposed method Abstract: compared to existing popular approaches like support vector machines. The classifier was applied to satellite image analysis problem. Experiments on different types of data sets were performed to discover the classifier's feature selection capabilities. Authors: Goyal P., Goyal N., Khandelwal A., Babu S.R.
Title: Online hotlink assignment algorithm for adaptive websites
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani, 333031, India
Authors with affiliations: Goyal, P., Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani, 333031, India; Goyal, N., Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani, 333031, India; Khandelwal, A., Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani, 333031, India; Babu, S.R., Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani, 333031, India
Abstract: A competitive online hotlink assignment algorithm is proposed to reach a desired page on a website in minimum number of clicks, thereby reducing the load on the web server. As a consequence, the network traffic is also reduced. The hotlinks are assigned based on the frequency of access of pages. We model the website as a rooted directed tree T=(V,E), where V is a collection of web pages connected by set of E links, all reachable from a source home page, represented by the root of T. The proposed online algorithm is capable of obtaining considerable savings on the access costs of websites. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Lakshmi K., Mukherjee S.
Title: Category based feature weighting for automatic text categorization
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering-Guindy, Chennai, TamilNadu, India
Authors with affiliations: Lakshmi, K., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering-Guindy, Chennai, TamilNadu, India; Mukherjee, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering-Guindy, Chennai, TamilNadu, India
Abstract: Vector space model representation of documents is an important aspect in text classification. Feature selection methods in turn use these representations to select important features for a category. Although many feature weighting schemes are available, none truly exploited the category-related information to capture the importance of the term with respect to its presence or absence in the category level rather than only in the document level. In this paper, we propose two new methods of capturing category-related information, which were combined with four feature weighting methods to produce enhanced performance. The effectiveness of these enhancements is demonstrated by using these schemes to calculate the term weight of the documents. We have compared their performances with their original versions when applied in text classification. Encouraged by these results, we introduce a new feature weighting scheme, which takes care of the category-related information and performs impressively in text classification. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Author Keywords: Document categorization; Feature selection; Machine learning; Natural language processing; Text mining
Index Keywords: Automatic text categorization; Document categorization; Feature selection methods; Feature weighting; NAtural language processing; Term weight; Text classification; Text mining; Vector space models; Artificial intelligence; Classification (of information); Data mining; Feature extraction; Learning algorithms; Learning systems; Text processing; Natural language processing systems

Authors: Guru D.S., Suraj M.G.
Title: Fusion of PCA and FLD at feature extraction level for fingerspelling recognition
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, India
Authors with affiliations: Guru, D.S., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, India; Suraj, M.G., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, India
Abstract: In this paper, we propose a novel approach to fuse two classifiers, specifically Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and Fisher Linear Discriminant (FLD), during feature extraction. Methods of integrating the covariance matrices of PCA and FLD are presented. Unlike other existing fusion techniques, our work combines PCA and FLD during feature extraction itself. The covariance matrices of PCA and FLD methods are combined with the expectation that the nature of both covariance matrices are preserved which leading to increased performance of the model. The model has been tested on a large dataset of fingerspelling sign images. The proposed method is further tested on ORL, Yale and Caltech face databases to demonstrate its efficacy. The proposed fusing approach has an improved performance over individual classifier. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Jain R.
Title: Approximate core based RDT model for classifying technology savvy farmers
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: National Centre for Agricultural Economics and Policy Research, Library Avenue, Pusa, New Delhi, India
Authors with affiliations: Jain, R., National Centre for Agricultural Economics and Policy Research, Library Avenue, Pusa, New Delhi, India
Abstract: Rough set based Decision Tree (RDT) model is a hybrid of rough set methodology with decision tree induction under the umbrella of data mining applications. RDT model uses a rough set tool called reduct to produce decision trees. A variant of RDT model that emerges while using other rough set tools like core or approximate core instead of reduct is referred as approximate core based RDT model. A case study involving identification of farmers adopting pesticides, insecticides or fungicides in their fields for crop protection is presented in this paper. Results of the experiments using the standard conventional techniques are compared with the hybridized rough set based decision tree approaches. Evaluation parameters accuracy, complexity, number of rules and number of attributes in the classifier were used for comparison. Approximate core based hybridized RDT model is simple and shows accuracy better than or comparable to other classification methods. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Author Keywords: Approximate core; Classification; Data mining; Hybrid; RDT model; Reduct; Soft computing
Index Keywords: Approximate core; Classification methods; Conventional techniques; Crop protection; Data mining applications; Decision tree induction; Evaluation parameters; Hybrid; Reduct; Rough set; Rough-set based; Agriculture; Artificial intelligence; Classification (of information); Data mining; Decision trees; Soft computing; Rough set theory

Authors: Ghosh S., Fatima S.S.
Title: A web based English to Bengali text converter
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Dept. of CSE, G. Narayanmma Institute of Technology and Science for Women, Hyderabad, AP, India; BITS, Pilani - Dubai Campus, UAE, Osmania Universty, Hyderabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Ghosh, S., Dept. of CSE, G. Narayanmma Institute of Technology and Science for Women, Hyderabad, AP, India; Fatima, S.S., BITS, Pilani - Dubai Campus, UAE, Osmania Universty, Hyderabad, India
Abstract: Machine Translation (MT) is an important technology to overcome the barrier of communication, information gathering and is particularly appropriate in a linguistically assorted country like India. In this direction, our paper focuses on the development of an 'English to Bengali' web based text conversion system. As a result people who do not know English well can understand or read the English text along with the translated output. We have followed a five-step-approach for better results and efficiency. The POS tagging and parsing is done using statistical methods, as it is one of the modern and successful methods among all. The conversion of an English parse tree to a Bengali parse tree is done using a normalization technique. The Bengali sentence is finally generated applying a proper context disambiguation check. We also claim[sm1] that the proposed MT system can be considered as one of the fastest, modern and low cost web based MT system. The implementation is done using HTML, JavaScript and Java. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Niranjan S.K., Vijay Kumar V., Hemantha Kumar G.
Title: Unconstrained handwritten Kannada numeral recognition: An approach based on thinning and distance measure
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Dept of Computer Science and Engineering, Bahubali College of Engineering, Shravanabelgola, Hassan, Karnataka, India; MGNIRSA, Gagan Mahal Road, Domalguda, Hyderabad, India; Dept of Computer Science and Engineering, Godhavari Institute of Engg and Technology, Rajamundri, Andhra Pradesh, India; Dept of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, India

Abstract: Character Recognition lies at the core of the discipline of pattern recognition where the objective is to interpret a sequence of characters taken from an alphabet [16]. Though many kinds of features have been developed and their test performances on standard database have been reported, there is still room to improve the recognition rate by developing improved features. In this paper, we present a recognition scheme for handwritten Kannada numeral. The proposed approach is based on thinning, distance measure and Generalized Regression Neural Network (GRNN). The proposed system is tested on various individual writers and achieved the overall accuracy of 96.5%. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Index Keywords: Distance measure; Generalized regression neural networks; Numeral recognition; Recognition rates; Test performance; Neural networks; Character recognition

Authors: Sardana H.K., Bhargaw H.N., Sachdeva S., Varshney D.
Title: Automatic rice classification under uniform specification using flat-bed scanner and image processing
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Central Scientific Instruments Organisation, Chandigarh-160030, India
Authors with affiliations: Sardana, H.K., Central Scientific Instruments Organisation, Chandigarh-160030, India; Bhargaw, H.N., Central Scientific Instruments Organisation, Chandigarh-160030, India; Sachdeva, S., Central Scientific Instruments Organisation, Chandigarh-160030, India; Varshney, D., Central Scientific Instruments Organisation, Chandigarh-160030, India
Abstract: An automatic rice grain classification system for assessing refractions and grades as per an Indian Standard is developed. The standard offers uniform specification for marketing of grains all over the country. A flat-bed scanner is used for imaging the samples so as to allow remote operation. The system initially trained for raw rice uses both colour and geometrical attributes of each grain. A rule-based classifier distinguishes grains into ten refractions with small number of inputs. An exhaustive-input artificial neural network (ANN) classifier provides results in a better way. Initial results show the advantages and performance of both the approaches with high degree of classification accuracy for common refractions and grades. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Bhattacharyya R., Bhattacharyya B.
Title: Cohesive geneset discovery in microarray data
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Dept of Computer Science and Engg, Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India; Department of Computer and System Sciences, Visva-Bharati Universty, Santiniketan - 731235, India
Authors with affiliations: Bhattacharyya, R., Dept of Computer Science and Engg, Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India; Bhattacharyya, B., Department of Computer and System Sciences, Visva-Bharati Universty, Santiniketan - 731235, India
Abstract: Application of classical Association Rule Discovery (ARD) techniques on gene expression data makes an attempt to uncover cellular biological phenomena occurring at gene level. However, due to support-dependency of ARD techniques, numerous low support but extremely important genetic relationships get overlooked. Lowering of threshold support generates large number of patterns and rules that create difficulty in detecting the right set of rules appropriate for biological interpretation. The present work introduces a new methodology for mining significant causal genetic relationships using a different metric called cohesion. Some techniques have also been suggested to reduce count of rules by focusing at the more informative ones while discarding others. Experiments with several gene expression datasets reveal that cohesion-based mining is much more effective as well as pragmatic than its support-based counterpart in mining high-confidence and significant genetic associations. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Author Keywords: Cohesion; Geneset mining; High-confidence association; Low support

Authors: Devraj, Jain R.
Title: Development of a knowledge acquisition system for pulse crop diseases
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Computer Application in Agri., Indian Institute of Pulses Research, Kanpur (U.P.), India; Department of Computer Science and Engg., UIET, CSJM University, Kanpur (U.P.), India
Authors with affiliations: Devraj, Computer Application in Agri., Indian Institute of Pulses Research, Kanpur (U.P.), India; Jain, R., Department of Computer Science and Engg., UIET, CSJM University, Kanpur (U.P.), India
Abstract: Knowledge acquisition is one of the most difficult and error-prone task that a knowledge engineer does while building a knowledge-based system. The cost and performance of the application depends directly on the quality of the knowledge acquired. The objective of the proposed system is to overcome the problem of knowledge acquisition for pulse disease diagnostic domain by developing an acquisition tool which can be customized for all types of pulse crops grown in India. Here, we present design and development of an user-friendly interactive knowledge acquisition system having the facilities of adding, viewing, modifying and deleting both types of knowledge (i.e. textual and pictorial) for identification and control of pulse crop diseases. The system assists domain experts and knowledge engineers to feed knowledge in the knowledge base in a structured form and in maintaining consistency of the encoded knowledge. The basic structure of the knowledge base is designed by the knowledge engineer on the basis of different types of knowledge needed for the identification and control of diseases in pulse crops. However, this structure can be used for other crops also. This knowledge acquisition system is one of the module of an expert system being developed for the diagnosis and control of diseases in pulse crops. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Yadav D., Sharma A.K., Gupta J.P.
Title: Optical character recognition for printed hindi text in devnagari using soft-computing technique
Source title: Proceedings of the IASTED International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Applications, AIA 2007
Affiliations: JIIT (Deemed Univ.), Noida, India; YMCA, Faridabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Yadav, D., JIIT (Deemed Univ.), Noida, India; Sharma, A.K., YMCA, Faridabad, India; Gupta, J.P., JIIT (Deemed Univ.), Noida, India
Abstract: In this paper, we present an OCR for printed Hindi text in devnagari script. Text written in Devnagari script, there is no separation between the characters. Hindi is one of the most spoken language in India. About 300 million people speak Hindi in India. One of the important reasons for poor recognition rate in optical character recognition (OCR) system is the error in character segmentation. Preprocessing task considered in this paper is conversion of gray scale images to binary images, image rectification, and segmentation of text into lines, words and basic symbols. Basic symbols are identified as the fundamental unit of segmentation in this paper which are recognized by neural classifier. We have used three feature extraction techniques namely, histogram of projection based on mean distance, histogram of projection based on pixel value and Vertical Zero crossing . These feature extraction techniques are very much powerful to extract feature of even distorted characters. A back-propagation neural network with two hidden layer is used to create a character recognition system. The system is trained and evaluated with printed text. A performance of approximately 90% correct recognition is achieved.
Author Keywords: Artificial Neural Network (ANN); Classification; Feature vector; OCR; Pre-processing; Segmentation

Authors: Jeyasingh V.K.R., Christobel Manonmani B.E.
Title: An innovative method for pattern recognition and feature extraction using optimal rotational transformation technique
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2007, AIPR 2007
Affiliations: Misrimal Navajee Munoth Jain Engineering College, Jyothi Nagar, Thoraipakkam, Chennai-600 096, Tamilnadu, India; Plot No:4 /7, 3rd street, Venkateshwara Nagar, Adyar, Chennai-600 020, Tamilnadu, India
Authors with affiliations: Jeyasingh, V.K.R., Misrimal Navajee Munoth Jain Engineering College, Jyothi Nagar, Thoraipakkam, Chennai-600 096, Tamilnadu, India; Christobel Manonmani, B.E., Plot No:4 /7, 3rd street, Venkateshwara Nagar, Adyar, Chennai-600 020, Tamilnadu, India
Abstract: Global modeling, using Optimal Rotational Transformation(ORT) technique is used for pattern recognition and feature extraction with simultaneous data compression. Extraction of certain features normally not possible with conventional methods is possible using the Optimal Modeling Technique. Reflectance observations on different types of soil in the laboratory were used to construct prediction models for extracting the grain size characteristics of the soils.. The prediction models so obtained were found to be highly reliable and statistically validated. A comparative study was made between the models developed herein with the model developed by Environmental Research Institute, Michigan. The model developed here was found to be superior. The technique shown will be useful for the feature extraction when the resolution of the data acquisition system is low.

Authors: Munshi S., Maiti N.S., Ray D., Chowdhury D.R., Pal Chaudhuri P.
Title: An analytical framework for characterizing restricted two dimensional Cellular Automata evolution
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Cellular Automata Research Lab (CARL), TICT, Rajarhat, Kolkata, West Bengal 700156, India
Authors with affiliations: Munshi, S., Cellular Automata Research Lab (CARL), TICT, Rajarhat, Kolkata, West Bengal 700156, India; Maiti, N.S., Cellular Automata Research Lab (CARL), TICT, Rajarhat, Kolkata, West Bengal 700156, India; Ray, D., Cellular Automata Research Lab (CARL), TICT, Rajarhat, Kolkata, West Bengal 700156, India; Chowdhury, D.R., Cellular Automata Research Lab (CARL), TICT, Rajarhat, Kolkata, West Bengal 700156, India; Pal Chaudhuri, P., Cellular Automata Research Lab (CARL), TICT, Rajarhat, Kolkata, West Bengal 700156, India
Abstract: This paper reports an analytical framework to study a restricted class of Two Dimensional CA. The imposed restriction enables characterization of 2DCA evolution. The concept of Rule Vector Graph (RVG) introduced in [6,7] for characterizing one dimensional CA has been extended in this paper for 2DCA. Design of Rule Vector Graph (RVG) for restricted class of 2DCA is reported. Analysis of RVG enables identification of necessary and sufficient conditions for a 2DCA to be invertible. Further, traversal of the RVG enables checking of reversibility and also identification of all Non-Reachable States (NRSs) and Self Loop States (SLSs) of a (m* n) 2DCA in O(n:2m) time complexity. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Ojha A.C., Pradhan S.K., Patra M.R.
Title: Extending Contract Net protocol for arguing agents
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: School of Information Technology, Icfai University, Hyderabad, India; Department of Computer Science, Utkal University, Bhubaneswar, India; Department of Computer Science, Berhampur University, Berhampur, India

Abstract: Negotiation is a technique through which two agents having conflicting interests reach an agreement that is beneficial for both of them. Argumentation-based negotiation is a better form of negotiation where one negotiating agent argues with another to justify its position and influences the other agent to follow it. This increases the likelihood and quality of agreement in a negotiation process. In this paper, we present an interaction protocol to support argumentation-based negotiation in agent-based e-commerce. We extend the widely used Contract Net protocol for the purpose with a set of performatives essential for argumentation scenario. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Adhikari A., Rao P.R.
Title: Synthesizing global exceptional patterns in multiple databases
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, S P Chowgule College, Margao, Goa - 403 602, India; Department of Computer Science and Technology, Goa University, Taleigao Plateau, Goa - 403 206, India
Authors with affiliations: Adhikari, A., Department of Computer Science, S P Chowgule College, Margao, Goa - 403 602, India; Rao, P.R., Department of Computer Science and Technology, Goa University, Taleigao Plateau, Goa - 403 206, India
Abstract: Many large organizations transact from multiple branches. Many of them possess multiple databases. The number of multi-branch companies as well as the number of branches of a multi-branch company is increasing over time. Thus, it is important to study data mining on multiple databases. A global exceptional pattern describes interesting individuality of few branches. Therefore, it is interesting to identify such patterns. In this paper, the following contributions are made: Firstly, we propose a definition of global exceptional frequent itemset in multiple databases. Secondly, we introduce the notion of exceptional sources for a global exceptional frequent itemset. Thirdly, we propose an algorithm for synthesizing global exceptional frequent itemsets. Experimental results are presented on both artificial and real datasets. We compare the proposed algorithm with the existing algorithm theoretically and experimentally. The experimental results show that the proposed algorithm is effective and promising than the existing algorithm. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Kolhe S., Kamal R., Saini H.S., Gupta G.K.
Title: Prototype intelligent information system for disease diagnosis in crops
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: National Research Centre for Soybean, Khandwa Road, Indore-452017, Madhya Pradesh, India; School of Computer Sciences and Electronics, Devi Ahilya University, Khandwa Road, Indore-452017, Madhya Pradesh, India; Guru Nanak Engineering College, Ibrahimpatnam, R.R. Dist-501506., Andhra Pradesh, India
Authors with affiliations: Kolhe, S., National Research Centre for Soybean, Khandwa Road, Indore-452017, Madhya Pradesh, India; Kamal, R., School of Computer Sciences and Electronics, Devi Ahilya University, Khandwa Road, Indore-452017, Madhya Pradesh, India; Saini, H.S., Guru Nanak Engineering College, Ibrahimpatnam, R.R. Dist-501506., Andhra Pradesh, India; Gupta, G.K., National Research Centre for Soybean, Khandwa Road, Indore-452017, Madhya Pradesh, India
Abstract: Expert systems and information systems have successfully been used in disease diagnosis in crops. Intelligent Information Systems (IIS) provide a broader scope for implementation of diagnostic expert systems in terms of technologies and procedures. Real time and real world information collection, knowledge representation and its application have been a challenge in disease diagnosis of crops as knowledge involved is of dynamic nature. The development of Web based intelligent systems has great potential for providing timely and appropriate diagnostic advice based on real-time processing of disease and expert systems. Present paper gives new design for web-based diagnostic intelligent information system (IIS) incorporating information, knowledge (rules) and databases under collaborative inference mechanism involving inference engine and database queries. The functionality of preliminary prototype of the system currently under development has been explained using soybean crop. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors with affiliations: Tudu, B., Jadavpur University, Department of Instrumentation and Electronics Engineering, Salt Lake Campus, Kolkata-700 098, India; Bhattacharyya, N., Centre for Development of Advanced Computing(C-DAC), E-2/1, Kolkata-700 091, West Bengal, India; Jana, A., Centre for Development of Advanced Computing(C-DAC), E-2/1, Kolkata-700 091, West Bengal, India; Ghosh, D., Centre for Development of Advanced Computing(C-DAC), E-2/1, Kolkata-700 091, West Bengal, India; Bandyopadhyay, R., Jadavpur University, Department of Instrumentation and Electronics Engineering, Salt Lake Campus, Kolkata-700 098, India
Abstract: Fermentation process in black tea manufacturing plays the key role in determining the quality of finished tea. During this process, a complex chain of biochemical changes occur in the tea leaves and the leaves change colour from green to coppery brown and the grassy smell gets transformed to floral smell. Digital camera based image capture and processing establishes that the transformation of colour of the leaves from green to coppery brown passes through defined stages measurable by defined changes in the values of Hue, Saturation and Intensity (H, S, I). Since transformation of colour is accompanied by transformation in smell; the present study investigates possibility of existence of any such defined smell stages during the fermentation runs of Black Tea processing. Electronic Nose has been used for online monitoring of smell for teas in fermentation. Self Organized Map (SOM) based analysis of Electronic Nose data demonstrates well-defined partitions and clusters, which clearly establishes existence of such smell stages. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Author Keywords: Black tea; Electronic nose; Fermentation; Self Organizing Map (SOM); Sensors

Authors: Dey L., Abulaish M., Jahiruddin
Title: Relation extraction from texts for efficient access to information - Application to bio-medical text processing

Abstract: In this paper, we present a text-mining based approach to extract biological relations among ontology concepts from a text corpus and use them for indexing the corpus. The proposed method uses Natural Language Processing techniques to locate inter-concept relations within biological abstracts and then subjects the extracted relations to feasibility analysis. The feasible biological relations are represented as fuzzy relations, where the fuzzy membership values indicate the possibility of finding information within a corpus about two biological entities interacting in a specific manner. The system also performs biological ontology enhancement with appropriate generic characterization of relations. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Das A.K., Sil J., Mondal M.
Title: A probabilistic approach on association rule-based text classifier system
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Bengal Engineering and Science University, Shibpur, Howrah-711103,W.B., India
Authors with affiliations: Das, A.K., Bengal Engineering and Science University, Shibpur, Howrah-711103,W.B., India; Sil, J., Bengal Engineering and Science University, Shibpur, Howrah-711103,W.B., India; Mondal, M.
Abstract: Recently, there is an explosive growth of data generated from various projects and business houses. Analysis of such data is utmost important but development of new mechanisms to handling the data lag behind with this massive growth, resulting a tremendous volume of data retained without being studied. Text classification is therefore, needed to analyzing the huge text data. In the paper a novel text classifier is proposed based on the probability of each item that describes various classes. The text classifier generates the classification rules based on the assignment theory of linear programming problem. Time complexity of the proposed classifier has been improved, compare to the Apriori-based classification, due to the consideration of relational approach instead of hierarchical or network approach. The experimental results are illustrated in the paper. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Singh K.
Title: Suitability of farm machinery using vague selection knowledge
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Computer Applications, Central Institute of Agricultural Engineering, Nabi Bagh, Berasia Road, Bhopal - 462 038 (M.P.), India
Authors with affiliations: Singh, K., Computer Applications, Central Institute of Agricultural Engineering, Nabi Bagh, Berasia Road, Bhopal - 462 038 (M.P.), India
Abstract: Selection of suitable farm machinery is the important task for optimum utilization of the power sources and timely operations, which becomes even more difficult in the absence of an expert. A new method for selection of suitable machinery using vague set theory, based on expert knowledge, is demonstrated. The selection of suitable farm machinery is represented by vague sets defined in the universe of discourse [0,1] for membership and non-membership values. Through the use of proposed method, selection of farm machinery can be made in flexible and more intelligent manner. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Singh A.K., Husain S.
Title: Exploring translation similarities for building a better sentence aligner
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Singh, A.K., Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India; Husain, S., Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India
Abstract: The approaches previously used for sentence alignment (sentence length, word correspondence and cognate matching) take into account different aspects of similarity between the source and the target language sentences. In this paper we discuss various aspects of similarity in translated texts that can be used for sentence alignment. We then describe a customizable method for combining several approaches that can exploit these aspects of similarity. This method also includes a novel way of using sentence length for alignment. Finally, the results of evaluation for this composite method (overall and at various stages) are presented. These results are compared with those for some previous approaches. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Maji P., Pal Chaudhuri P.
Title: Design of response-pattern classifier for fault diagnosis of electronic circuits
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Machine Intelligence Unit, Indian Statistical Institute, India; Cellular Automata Research Laboratory, Rajarhat Megacity, Kolkata, India
Authors with affiliations: Maji, P., Machine Intelligence Unit, Indian Statistical Institute, India; Pal Chaudhuri, P., Cellular Automata Research Laboratory, Rajarhat Megacity, Kolkata, India
Abstract: This paper reports the design of a response-pattern classifier for diagnosis of faults in electronic circuits. The design is based on the computing model of a special class of sparse network referred to as cellular automata (CA). The CA based classifier is employed to diagnose the faulty module of a circuit under test (CUT). It performs faster diagnosis with one to two order of magnitude reduction of memory overhead over that required for conventional fault dictionary based diagnosis scheme. The desired classifier for a CUT is evolved through efficient evolution of genetic algorithm (GA). The hardwired version of the fault diagnosis machine (FDM) has been designed with simple, regular, modular, and cascadable structure of CA that suits ideally for VLSI implementation. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Author Keywords: Cellular automata; Fault diagnosis; Genetic algorithm; Pattern classifier

Authors: Murthy G.R., Prasad B.
Title: Linear filter model of synapse operating on noisy inputs: Associated neural networks
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2007, AIPR 2007
Affiliations: IIIT-Hyderabad, Gachibowli, Hyderabad-500032, AP, India; Department of Computer and Information Sciences, Florida A and M University, Tallahassee, FL 32307, United States

Abstract: In this research paper, based on biological motivation, synapses are modeled as frequency selective filters. These filters remove undesired noise signals. Also, a synapse is modeled as a matched filter which maximizes the signal-to-noise ratio at the neuron activation level. Utilizing the results in optimal linear filtering, the synapses are modeled as Minimum Mean Square Error (MMSE) Linear Filters. It is hoped that these models provide robust neuronal information processing in the presence of noise signals.

Authors: Rajamani L.
Title: A neural network approach to fault diagnosis of pumps
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2007, AIPR 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Osmania University, Hyderabad-500007, India
Authors with affiliations: Rajamani, L., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Osmania University, Hyderabad-500007, India
Abstract: This paper presents a neural network model for fault diagnosis of pumps. The symptoms and causes correlation is used as input to the network model. The causes are classified into hydraulic and mechanical. A back propagation algorithm is used with creation of data module, simulator module, graphical module etc. Variation of error tolerance with learning rate and momentum factor is studied. The network is observed to predict results with 92 per cent for test patterns.

Authors: Natarajan S., Srikanta Murthy K.
Title: Image sharpening using triple energy wells
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2007, AIPR 2007
Affiliations: Dept of Information Science and Engineeirng, PES Institute of Technology, Bangalore-560085, India
Authors with affiliations: Natarajan, S., Dept of Information Science and Engineeirng, PES Institute of Technology, Bangalore-560085, India; Srikanta Murthy, K., Dept of Information Science and Engineeirng, PES Institute of Technology, Bangalore-560085, India
Abstract: Image sharpness deals with the edges of images, where the image content changes rapidly from one color or one tone to another. In sharp images, these transitions occur rapidly, over a small area. In soft images, the transitions occur slowly, spread over a large area. Thus, sharpening routines and programs work towards detecting the regions where a transition occurs and makes this transition more rapid. In this paper, we propose a simple method to sharpen the image. The proposed approach consider the noise and edges as separate entities. It is observed that the gradient plots for noise appear much lower in energy, when compared to the gradient plots for edges. Using this concept, we use a triple energy well, whose plot appears as three U's joined together. Applying this plot in the form of a filter to the image will sharpen it and, at the same time, diminish the noise content.
Author Keywords: Gaussian; Image filtering; Image sharpening; Lapalcian; Triple Energy Well
Index Keywords: Energy wells; Gaussians; Image filtering; Image sharpening; Lapalcian; Artificial intelligence; Pattern recognition

Authors: Bind J.L.
Title: Approach to judge the experience of domain expert with uncertainty using rough set theory for soil mapping
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2007, AIPR 2007
Affiliations: Scientist Defence Terrain Research Laboratory Metcalfe House, Delhi-110085, India
Authors with affiliations: Bind, J.L., Scientist Defence Terrain Research Laboratory Metcalfe House, Delhi-110085, India
Abstract: In this paper we propose an evolutionary problem solving paradigm to deal with uncertainty of domain expert's experience. Experience of a domain expert can be exploited using Case Based Reasoning (CBR) approach which is stored in the form of Cases in the Case Base. Rough Set Theory is used to deals with uncertainty involve in the experience of domain expert. The main goal of Rough Set Theory is to synthesize approximation of concepts from acquired knowledge which model informative region in the feature space. Hence, hybridization of CBR and Rough Set Theory is efficient technique to obtain the adequate accuracy for soil mapping. The novelty of the proposed work lies in developing of methodology in algorithmic way for knowledge approximation from case base to generate the soil map. The Cases are prepared on the basis of real data collected from different terrain i.e., plain, desert, marshy, costal and deltaic regions. The result is compared with Ground Truth in the field.
Index Keywords: Case base; Case-based reasoning approaches; Different terrains; Domain experts; Feature space; Ground truth; Soil mapping; Soil maps; Approximation algorithms; Artificial intelligence; Case based reasoning; Pattern recognition; Soils; Rough set theory

Authors: Pakhira M.K.
Title: Parallel κ-means algorithm on a cyclic network
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Kalyani Government Engineering College, Kalyani, West Bengal, India
Authors with affiliations: Pakhira, M.K., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Kalyani Government Engineering College, Kalyani, West Bengal, India
Abstract: Clustering algorithms are heavily used in many areas of scientific research and applications. The κ-means algorithm is one of the most popular and the most widely used clustering algorithm. For large input size, the running time complexity of this algorithm is very high and is measured as O (TKN) where N is the number of input patterns, K is the number of clusters and T is the number of iterations. This high complexity limits its applicability for data mining problems that deals with very large databases. In this paper, we present a parallel κ-means algorithm for execution on a cyclic network of processors. Results of experiments show that this parallel approach can provide significant speedup than many other algorithms. Instead of a common master-slave network, we used a cyclic network for efficient resource usage. In our implementation, each of the processors deals with a single cluster only. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Singh A., Baghel A.S.
Title: A hybrid evolutionary approach to the quadratic knapsack problem
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer and Information Sciences, University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad - 500046, Andhra Pradesh, India; Department of Electronics and Communication, Banasthali Vidyapith Jaipur Campus, Sarojini Marg, Jaipur - 302001, Rajasthan, India
Authors with affiliations: Singh, A., Department of Computer and Information Sciences, University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad - 500046, Andhra Pradesh, India; Baghel, A.S., Department of Electronics and Communication, Banasthali Vidyapith Jaipur Campus, Sarojini Marg, Jaipur - 302001, Rajasthan, India
Abstract: The quadratic knapsack problem is an extension of the well known 0-1 knapsack problem. In the quadratic knapsack problem profit values are associated not only with individual objects as in the 0-1 knapsack problem, but also with pairs of objects. The profit value associated with a pair of objects is added to the overall profit if both objects of the pair belong to the knapsack. Being an extension of the 0-1 knapsack problem, this problem is also NP-Hard. In this paper we have proposed a hybrid evolutionary approach to the problem, combining a steady-state genetic algorithm with a greedy heuristic. We have compared our approach with two previously proposed generational genetic algorithms. On the problem instances considered, our hybrid approach obtained better quality solutions in shorter time. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Babu B.V., Gujarathi A.M.
Title: Elitist-multi-objective differential evolution (E-MODE) algorithm for multi-objective optimization
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Chemical Engineering, Birla Institute of Technology and Science (BITS), Pilani -333 031, Rajasthan, India
Authors with affiliations: Babu, B.V., Department of Chemical Engineering, Birla Institute of Technology and Science (BITS), Pilani -333 031, Rajasthan, India; Gujarathi, A.M., Department of Chemical Engineering, Birla Institute of Technology and Science (BITS), Pilani -333 031, Rajasthan, India
Abstract: Several problems in the engineering domain are multi-objective in nature. The solution to multi-objective optimization is a set of solutions rather than a single point solution. Such a set of non-dominated solutions are called Pareto optimal solutions or non-inferior solutions. In this paper, a new algorithm, Elitist-Multi-objective Differential Evolution (E-MODE) is proposed. The proposed algorithm is applied successfully on several test functions, and the results are discussed extensively. Results obtained from the proposed algorithm are compared with those obtained using Multi-objective Differential Evolution (MODE) algorithm. E-MODE is found to give better solutions in terms of wide range of solutions, spread, and diversity of Pareto front than those obtained using MODE. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Prasad S., Singh Y.P.
Title: Intelligent hybrid multipath routing in Mobile Ad Hoc Networks
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Centre for Development of Advanced Computing, Sector-62, Noida, India
Authors with affiliations: Prasad, S., Centre for Development of Advanced Computing, Sector-62, Noida, India; Singh, Y.P., Centre for Development of Advanced Computing, Sector-62, Noida, India
Abstract: Mobile Ad Hoc Networks (MANETs) are characterized by dynamic topology and limited resources. The routes in MANET are short-lived due to frequent link breakages. The paper presents an intelligent hybrid multipath routing for mobile ad hoc networks inspired by Ant Colony Optimization (ACO) framework. Multipath routing sets up multiple routes between the source and the destination node. It provides load balancing and increases the reliability of data transmission. In ACO, optimal values of the parameters are critical to balance intensification and diversification. The proposed hybrid multipath algorithm (ACO-H) uses Genetic Algorithm (GA) to optimize the ACO parameters for enhancing the exploration of the search space. The paper compares ACO-H with ACO-F (ACO with fixed parameters) and the standard routing protocol, AODV. The simulation results demonstrate the superiority of ACO-H in terms of better solution quality. The results also indicate that ACO-H is more scalable than AODV. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Bhaskar T., Sundararajan R., Krishnan P.G.
Title: A fuzzy mathematical programming approach for cross-sell optimization in retail banking
Source title: Proceedings of the IASTED International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Applications, AIA 2007
Affiliations: Computing and Decision Sciences, GE Global Research, Bangalore, India
Authors with affiliations: Bhaskar, T., Computing and Decision Sciences, GE Global Research, Bangalore, India; Sundararajan, R., Computing and Decision Sciences, GE Global Research, Bangalore, India; Krishnan, P.G., Computing and Decision Sciences, GE Global Research, Bangalore, India
Abstract: In this paper we discuss the mailer selection problem in retail banking. Mailer selection takes estimates of several parameters (like response probability of a customer, expected volume, expected profit from a customer etc.) and decides on the list of customers to whom the offer should be sent such that a certain set of business objectives are met/optimized. We discuss some of the issues (unreliable estimates and computational complexity) related to the mailer selection process and propose solution to the problems. We propose a fuzzy mathematical programming technique to take care of the imprecise estimates of the parameters. The imprecise parameters and constraints are represented as triangular fuzzy numbers. We use a simple example to demonstrate the method.

Authors: Hemanth K., Rao N., Krishna K.M., Subhash S.
Title: Global localization of robots by occupancy fields
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: IIIT Robotics Research Centre, IIIT Hyderabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Hemanth, K., IIIT Robotics Research Centre, IIIT Hyderabad, India; Rao, N., IIIT Robotics Research Centre, IIIT Hyderabad, India; Krishna, K.M., IIIT Robotics Research Centre, IIIT Hyderabad, India; Subhash, S., IIIT Robotics Research Centre, IIIT Hyderabad, India
Abstract: We present a methodology for global localization of mobile robots based on occupancy fields. The fields are modeled as an intensity function. The intensity function peaks at locations from obstacles that are at the obtained sensor distance after incorporating visibility constraints. Intensity functions corresponding to various sensor readings are superposed and the areas with highest intensity are the best location/pose estimates of the robot. The proposed method can be viewed in two ways. Firstly, it is perceived as a faster alternative to traditional global localization methods based on Markov and particle filters approaches. Secondly it can be viewed as an aid to quick Markov or particle filter localization. Markov localization involves belief computation of robots position at all cells in a discretized representation of the map of the environment. Particle filters or Monte Carlo methods initialize particles across the whole map. This method can quickly say those cells in the map where belief computations need to be done or those places where particles need to be initialized instead of doing it across the entire terrain. Simulation results portary the efficacy of the current method and comparative advantages over other methods tabulated. Real-time runs on a SICK laser obtaining sensor scans of the environment are also illustrated. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Narappanawar N.L., Rao B.M., Srikanth T.
Title: A vector approach to boundary traversing
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: International Institute of Information Technology, P-14 Rajiv Gandhi Infotech Park, Hinjewadi, Pune-411057, India
Authors with affiliations: Narappanawar, N.L., International Institute of Information Technology, P-14 Rajiv Gandhi Infotech Park, Hinjewadi, Pune-411057, India; Rao, B.M., International Institute of Information Technology, P-14 Rajiv Gandhi Infotech Park, Hinjewadi, Pune-411057, India; Srikanth, T., International Institute of Information Technology, P-14 Rajiv Gandhi Infotech Park, Hinjewadi, Pune-411057, India
Abstract: Boundary traversing is one of the first steps in boundary based feature extraction of an image/ vision based algorithm. This paper presents a new algorithm for traversing a boundary using the concept of the vector product. Present algorithm provides mathematical basis for boundary traversing. It consists of two distinct phases: scanning of the image to identify boundary pixels and border following. Vector cross product is used for the identification of the next boundary pixel while traversing the boundary. This algorithm also has an ability to peel off, one by one, layers of a binary region till it exhausts. Generalized nature of the solution is verified by choosing test objects that belong to both regular shapes and more natural shapes. Experimental results of boundary tracing and peeling are provided. The obtained results indicate a very high accuracy for the test images. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Abstract: In this paper we describe a fast approach for image contrast enhancement, based on localized contrast manipulation. Our approach is not only fast and easy to implement, but also has several other promising properties (Adaptive, Multiscale, weighted localization, etc). We will discuss in this paper an anisotropic version of our approach. Several examples of medical images, including brain MR images, chest CT images and mammography images, will be provided to demonstrate the performance of our approach. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Mohan M., Krishna K.M., Srikanth M.B., Mathias P.C.
Title: Increasing coverage and preserving covertness for UAV moving in undulated terrains
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: IIIT Robotics Research Centre, IIIT Hyderabad, India; Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, India
Authors with affiliations: Mohan, M., IIIT Robotics Research Centre, IIIT Hyderabad, India; Krishna, K.M., IIIT Robotics Research Centre, IIIT Hyderabad, India; Srikanth, M.B., Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, India; Mathias, P.C., Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, India
Abstract: This paper deals with the problem of path planning through a 3D terrain in the presence of hostile observation posts with a view to maximizing the surveillance in the wake of rich terrain information, for a single UAV. We use a divide and conquer strategy to find a good that locally optimizes coverage in the given environment under the given constraints. We do this by finding points of locally maximum coverage and then forming a graph of such points. This graph can then be used to find an approximation to the optimum path. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Subramanian K.G., Roslin Sagaya Mary A., Chandra P.H.
Title: On the inference of linear single tree grammars from positive structural information
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: School of Mathematical Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, 11800 Penang, Malaysia; Research Group on Mathematical Linguistics, Rovira i Virgili University, Pl. Imperial Tarraco 1, 43005 Tarragona, Spain; Jayaraj Annapackiam College for Women, Periyakulam, Theni, India

Imperial Tarraco 1, 43005 Tarragona, Spain; Chandra, P.H., Jayaraj Annapackiam College for Women, Periyakulam, Theni, India
Abstract: Machine learning of grammars is known to have a variety of applications. Grammatical Inference is the process of learning of grammars and languages from data. Greibach et al (1992) introduced a subclass of context-free grammars called single tree grammars with applications in logic data base theory. An inference algorithm has been proposed by Mäkinen (2000) for inferring a restricted class of linear single tree languages generated by linear single tree grammars. Here based on the technique of Sempere and Nagaraja (1998) we give an algorithm to learn linear single tree languages with positive structural information as input to the algorithm. The advantage is that the language class includes the class inferred by the Mäkinen's algorithm. We extend single tree notion to linear simple matrix languages (Ibarra 1970) and point out the applicability of our algorithm to learn these languages. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Abirami S., Manjula D.
Title: Classification of language and styles from printed bilingual document images
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2007, AIPR 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Anna University, Chennai, India
Authors with affiliations: Abirami, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Anna University, Chennai, India; Manjula, D., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Anna University, Chennai, India
Abstract: Identification of the script of the text in multi-script documents is one of the important steps in the analysis and recognition of document images. Much work has already been reported in this area relating to Roman, Arabic, Chinese, Korean and Japanese scripts. In the Indian context, though some results have been reported, the task is still at its infancy. In the work presented in this paper, an attempt has been made to identify the script, and to classify its font style (Bold, Italic, Normal) at the word level, in a bilingual document containing English and Tamil scripts. Gabor filters with directional features are used to identify the script in document images. Based on the spatial spread features of word images, a Classifier is used to classify the font style of the words having a training set of samples for each class.

Authors: Sailesh Babu G.S., Bhagwan Das D., Patvardhan C.
Title: Hybrid Stochastic Search approach for solution of Unit Commitment Problem
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Dayalbagh Educational Institute, Dayalbagh, Agra, India
Authors with affiliations: Sailesh Babu, G.S., Department of Electrical Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Dayalbagh Educational Institute, Dayalbagh, Agra, India; Bhagwan Das, D., Department of Electrical Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Dayalbagh Educational Institute, Dayalbagh, Agra, India; Patvardhan, C., Department of Electrical Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Dayalbagh Educational Institute, Dayalbagh, Agra, India
Abstract: Unit Commitment Problem (UCP) is of importance in optimal operation of power systems. Complexity involved in UCP is high because of the non-linear constraints involved and the complexity further increases when ramp rates are considered. Further, in Unit Commitment, reliability considerations are reflected in the form of hourly Spinning Reserve (SR) Capacity. Spinning reserve, more often than not, is treated as a soft constraint by using penalty methods which don't guarantee a strict compliance of the minimum hourly reserve constraint throughout the schedule period. This paper presents Hybrid Stochastic Search (HSS) approaches, HSS Unit Commitment (HSSUC) and HSSUC with Ramp rates (HSSUCR) for solving Unit Commitment with hard reserve constraints. The proposed algorithms have been tested on standard test systems. These algorithms provide low-cost solutions with less computational effort, even while ensuring strict compliance of constraints. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Author Keywords: Hard reserve constraint; Ramp rate limits; Unit commitment

Authors: Lakshmi K., Sakthi Kala S., Mukherjee S.
Title: Improving link detection system using SVM with context-graph
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Guindy, Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India
Authors with affiliations: Lakshmi, K., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Guindy, Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India; Sakthi Kala, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Guindy, Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India; Mukherjee, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Guindy, Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India
Abstract: Story link detection is considered to be a key component of Topic Detection and Tracking. Task is to find whether the given two documents discuss the same event. In the current proposal we have applied SVM in combination with Context-Graph for Story Link Detection System. SVM has been successfully used for many machine learning applications like text categorization, email filtering etc. This drives us to use it for link detection system. While SVM captures the necessary unigram-related information without any regard to word dependency, term dependency needs to be captured. We have proposed a technique of creating a Context-Graph that performs this function successfully. One of the documents given for link detection is used for training the SVM and the other document is used for testing the closeness. The output of the SVM is combined with the similarity measure of the contextgraph to produce the final measure. Our experimental results show that the combined effects of SVM and context-graph exhibit an improved performance. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Ghosh S., Laskar N., Mahapatra S., Pal Chaudhury P.
Title: Probabilistic cellular automata model for identification of CpG island in DNA string
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007

Abstract: A probabilistic CA model for analysis of DNA sequence is reported. Identification of CpG islands in a DNA string is the target application addressed in this paper. The proposed model displays improvement over the popular HMM used to solve this problem. The cases of false positive instances usually encountered by the HMM have been analyzed. Based on this analysis, a filter has been proposed for the model to detect such false positive cases. Experimental results confirm the viability of the proposed filter to enhance prediction quality for identifying CpG islands in a DNA string. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Teja A., Krishna K.M.
Title: Multi robotic navigation with coverage and communication constraints
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: IIIT Robotics Research Centre, IIIT Hyderabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Teja, A., IIIT Robotics Research Centre, IIIT Hyderabad, India; Krishna, K.M., IIIT Robotics Research Centre, IIIT Hyderabad, India
Abstract: We introduce a new algorithm for multi robotic sensor network navigation which maximizes coverage, using communication constraints. Our approach is based on behavior based algorithms for robots. Our main behaviors are navigation to a specified target point, obstacle avoidance, maximizing coverage satisfying the communication constraint. The multi robotic coverage uses the potential field method of defining potential field zones in the map. Target position is the least potential point. The obstacles have higher potential. By the laws of physics any body tries to go from a high potential zone to a lower potential zone. We try to capture this idea and implement it on the robot. The advantage of this method is that it treats each robot as an independent entity obeying the three behaviors. This reduces the multi robotic navigation algorithm to a single robotic navigation problem satisfying the constraints. We present experimental runs with a group of amigobots which are equipped with sonar sensors. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
