Authors: Mundankar K.Y., Sawant S.D., Sawant I.S., Sharma J., Adsule P.G.
Title: Knowledge based decision support system for management of powdery mildew disease in grapes
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: National Research Centre for Grapes, Manjri Farm Post, Manjri, Pune - 412 307, Maharashtra, India
Authors with affiliations: Mundankar, K.Y., National Research Centre for Grapes, Manjri Farm Post, Manjri, Pune - 412 307, Maharashtra, India; Sawant, S.D., National Research Centre for Grapes, Manjri Farm Post, Manjri, Pune - 412 307, Maharashtra, India; Sawant, I.S., National Research Centre for Grapes, Manjri Farm Post, Manjri, Pune - 412 307, Maharashtra, India; Sharma, J., National Research Centre for Grapes, Manjri Farm Post, Manjri, Pune - 412 307, Maharashtra, India; Adsule, P.G.
Abstract: Management of powdery mildew is a difficult task. A knowledge based decision support system that assists grape growers in management of powdery mildew disease in vineyard has been developed. The system estimates disease risk based on plant growth stage in the plot and weather conditions and determines the requirement for spray. The program generates a) diagnosis based on weather risk, growth stage risk, nutrient deficiencies affecting powdery mildew and previous fungicide applications, b) recommendations on the choice of fungicides and their doses for control of disease. The hierarchical classification and expert knowledge used by the system for management of disease is represented in the form of if-then rules and is supported through a database which also contains domain knowledge. The design and performance of a hierarchical decision making system that aids in management of powdery mildew disease has been discussed in this paper. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Jayaram M.A., Nataraja M.C., Ravikumar C.N.
Title: Soft computing in concrete technology: A pragmatic appraisal
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Master of Computer Applications, Siddaganga Institute of Technology, Tumkur-572103, India; Department of Civil Engineering, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore-570006, India; Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Sri Jayachamarajendra Coolege of Engineering, Mysore-570006, India
Authors with affiliations: Jayaram, M.A., Department of Master of Computer Applications, Siddaganga Institute of Technology, Tumkur-572103, India; Nataraja, M.C., Department of Civil Engineering, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore-570006, India; Ravikumar, C.N., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Sri Jayachamarajendra Coolege of Engineering, Mysore-570006, India
Abstract: There has been a growing interest among the researchers in the area of soft computing assisted material modeling in general and modeling of concrete in particular. Their results look very promising. Concrete is a heterogeneous material with complex behavior and is not amenable for crisp mathematical predications. Most of the inferences regarding the material behavior are formulized after going through experimental results that consists of equipment imprecision, tolerances and human factor. The analytical modeling of concrete using traditional methods is arduous and not robust. Further, the mathematical models developed using traditional statistical methods are generally based on assumed relationships and do not have the true predicting capability outside the experimental domain used for their development. Unlike traditional parametric methods, the soft computing methods do not assume a relationship between various parameters and concrete performance. The relationship is rather generated from the experimental data provided to build and train the model. This paper makes a modest attempt to present an elaborative discussion on the applications of soft computing techniques in concrete technology and their advantages. The published research work pertaining to applications of constituents of soft computing in general and hybrid systems in particular are discussed. The paper concludes with a briefing on the contribution of authors in this area. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Abhang R.Y.
Title: A study of the dynamics of an artificial neural network as a point attractor for cloud classes from microwave satellite images and construction of cloud Maps
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2007, AIPR 2007
Affiliations: Abasaheb Garware College, Karve Road, Pune 411004, Maharashtra, India
Authors with affiliations: Abhang, R.Y., Abasaheb Garware College, Karve Road, Pune 411004, Maharashtra, India
Abstract: The dynamics of Hopfield Neural Network (HNN) as a point attractor for the cloud classes has been presented. Raw binary data collected over the Indian region from the five microwave channels of the NOAA-15, 16, 17 satellites is converted to Brightness Temperature (Tb) images. Total records of 5-element Tb vectors are classified into five cloud classes. Prototype patterns for the cloud classes are stored during the storage phase of the HNN. The ability of HNN to retrieve the stored patterns on the presentation of unknown records is tested during the recall phase. HNN works as an Associative Memory for the classification of clouds. The study showed that the accuracy of HNN in cloud classification is greater than the conventional methods. An early version of the cloud atlas consisting of cloud maps showing the occurrence of various classes of clouds over the Indian region during the different months and seasons of the year is being prepared. It will be made available to the potential users in different fields.
Index Keywords: Associative memory; Brightness temperatures; Cloud classification; Conventional methods; Hopfield neural networks (HNN); Potential users; Prototype patterns; Satellite images; Associative processing; Hopfield neural networks; Neural networks; Pattern recognition; Digital storage

Authors: Saradhi V.V., Karnick H.
Title: Error estimation for kernel matrix learning through leave-one-out-kernel bootstrap
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, Kanpur, 208 016, India
Authors with affiliations: Saradhi, V.V., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, Kanpur, 208 016, India; Karnick, H., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, Kanpur, 208 016, India
Abstract: This paper focuses on obtaining better error estimates for learning the kernel matrix (LKM) algorithm proposed by Lanckriet et al. We consider three different error estimates viz., (1) Lanckriet's bound (2) span of support vectors based bound (which estimates the leaveone- out (LOO) error for SVMs) and (3) bootstrap technique. For small data sets, we show through experiments that (a) Lanckriet's bound is loose and (b) estimated errors using bootstrap and LOO technique are not reliable as LKMs are unstable algorithms (large variation in errors under small perturbation of learning data set). To obtain good error estimate for the generalization error, we present a bootstrap technique that combines the proposed leave-one-out-kernel (LOOK) algorithm for estimating the generalization error for the optimal kernel matrix learning problem. Experiments on both artificial and real world data sets suggest that estimated error obtained through the proposed LOOK bootstrap yields good estimates for the generalization error. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Title: Incomplete beta function based multi level crossing approach for signal sampling
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Dept of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, 570006, India
Authors with affiliations: Nagesha, Dept of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, 570006, India; Hemantha Kumar, G., Dept of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, 570006, India; Manjunath Aradhya, V.N., Dept of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, 570006, India; Noushath, S., Dept of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, 570006, India
Abstract: This paper presents a new threshold level allocation scheme for multilevel crossing based non uniform sampling. Intuitively, it is more reasonable if the information rich regions of the signal are sampled finer and those with sparse information are sampled coarser. To achieve this objective, we proposed a non-linear quantization function which dynamically assigns the number of quantization levels depending on the importance of the given amplitude range. The parameters, to calculate the importance of given amplitude segment approximately, are estimated by incomplete beta function and probability of occurrence of the amplitude segment. Various aspects of proposed techniques are discussed and experimentally validated. Its efficacy is investigated by comparison with Nyquist based sampling. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Aher Y.D., Garg P.
Title: QSAR modeling of CCR5 receptor antagonists using artificial neural network
Source title: Proceedings of the IASTED International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Applications, AIA 2007
Affiliations: Centre of Pharmacoinformatics, National Institute of Pharmaceutical Education and Research, S.A.S. Nagar, Punjab, India
Authors with affiliations: Aher, Y.D., Centre of Pharmacoinformatics, National Institute of Pharmaceutical Education and Research, S.A.S. Nagar, Punjab, India; Garg, P., Centre of Pharmacoinformatics, National Institute of Pharmaceutical Education and Research, S.A.S. Nagar, Punjab, India
Abstract: In-silico prediction methods are gaining the popularity in drug discovery processes as they are relatively inexpensive and less time consuming. In this study, Artificial Neural Network (ANN) based on back propagation algorithm (BP algorithm) has been applied to develop a Quantitative structure-activity relationship (QSAR) model for predicting pIC50 values of a series of structurally diverse CCR5 receptor antagonists. Model was trained with a data set of 426 chemical compounds and tested with independent data set of 423 compounds. A good correlation between training data set (R2= 0.847) and total data set of 849 chemical compounds (R2=0.765) is observed. The results are further validated by performing external validation using validation set (R2=0.692) and leave 20% out cross validation which show that such an approach is suitable for establishing a predictive model to determine pIC50 values.

Abstract: In this paper, we propose a method for sports videos genre classification using edge-based feature, namely edge direction histogram and edge intensity histogram. We demonstrate that these features provide discriminative information useful for sports video classification. We use hidden Markov models (HMMs) to model the sports video categories. Evidence from the two edge based features are combined using a linear weighting rule. We also show that combining evidence from complementary edge features results in improved classification performance. We demonstrate the application of this framework to five sport genre types, namely, cricket, football, tennis, basketball and volleyball. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Abstract: Frequent itemsets determine major characteristics of a transactional database. Thus, it is important to mine arbitrary Boolean expressions induced by frequent itemsets. In this paper, we propose a simple and elegant framework for synthesizing arbitrary Boolean expressions using conditional patterns in a database. Experimental results are provided on both real and synthetic databases. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Lele A., Desai V.R.
Title: Flood forecasting using ARMA and artificial neural networks
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, 721302, India
Authors with affiliations: Lele, A., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, 721302, India; Desai, V.R., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, 721302, India
Abstract: Floods are without doubt the most devastating natural disasters. Therefore it is essential to minimize the damage due to floods by reliable flood forecasting followed by effective flood warning. This paper aims at reliably predicting the occurrence of flood events, using neural networks and auto-regressive moving average (ARMA) type statistical models to arrive at a reliable, accurate prediction model. The use of statistical models in forecasting has a long history and a lot of work has been done so far. Neural networks promise capability to model non-linear, complex phenomena. The river discharge and stage data for three stations namely, Polavaram, Pathegudem and Perur in the lower Godavari basin are used in this study. The data was procured from the Central Water Commission, Ministry of Water Resources, Government of India. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Author Keywords: ARMA; Artificial neural networks; Flood
Index Keywords: Accurate prediction; ARMA; Autoregressive moving average; Flood event; Flood forecasting; Flood warning; Government of India; Natural disasters; River discharge; Statistical models; Flood control; Neural networks; Water resources; Floods

Authors: Bedi P., Gaur V.
Title: Optimal partner selection model for cooperation
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, Adjoining Arts Faculty Building, University of Delhi, Delhi-110007, India
Authors with affiliations: Bedi, P., Department of Computer Science, Adjoining Arts Faculty Building, University of Delhi, Delhi-110007, India; Gaur, V., Department of Computer Science, Adjoining Arts Faculty Building, University of Delhi, Delhi-110007, India
Abstract: Advances in networking technology have revitalized agent technology for engineering complex distributed software systems. However, the success of agent-based system is subject to the adoption of effective agents' cooperation that would be needed to share expertise for achieving goals of Multi-agent systems. To effectively handle cooperation among agents, a modeling tool is required that an agent could use as a decisive support for partner selection in order to collaborate or delegate a task. This paper presents an application of Fuzzy Cognitive Maps (FCMs), which are useful tool for simulating and analyzing dynamic systems, to recognize a suitable partner from its agent base and to prevent possible failures of others. The evaluation for partner choice is based on the two important features of agents namely service quality and its computation state. Service quality of a service provider agent could be evaluated by characteristics namely accuracy, relaibility, and availability while computational state is an indicator of its stress in terms of tasks at hand and its capability to process those tasks. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Rihani V., Sit K.
Title: Recognition of bangla characters using artificial neural networks
Source title: Proceedings of the 2007 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2007
Affiliations: Dept. of Electronics and Electrical Communication, Punjab Engineering College, Deemed University, Chandigarh 160012, India; Communication Service Provider, Infosys Technology Ltd., Chandigarh, India
Authors with affiliations: Rihani, V., Dept. of Electronics and Electrical Communication, Punjab Engineering College, Deemed University, Chandigarh 160012, India; Sit, K., Communication Service Provider, Infosys Technology Ltd., Chandigarh, India
Abstract: While recognizing Bangla characters, the character matrix is subjected to feature extraction process. These features are fed to artificial neural networks. The network architecture is developed using multi-layer perceptron (MLP) and back-propagation (BP) algorithm. Total of 893 training patterns (i.e. features of 893 noisy character patterns) are used to train the network while another 43] patterns are used for testing of network performance. Different networks have been developed and tested by varying parameters like learning rate, momentum and number of hidden nodes. In the present scheme, recognition accuracy of 98.37% has been achieved.

Authors: Islam S.N., Chaturvedi K.K., Agarwal H.O., Farooqi M.S., Sharma K., Sharma A.K., Singh R., Sharma R.K., Sikarwar H.S.
Title: Knowledge engineering for an Expert System on Wheat Crop Management
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, New Delhi 110012, India; Indian Agricultural Research Institute, New Delhi 110012, India; Directorate of Wheat Research, Agarsen Marg, Karnal 132001, India

Abstract: An expert system is computer software that solves real-world problems using human knowledge and reasoning skills. Knowledge base is the heart and mind of such systems where knowledge is stored in the form of rules, databases, heuristics, and facts. The key conceptual challenge in these approaches is the exploitation of domain knowledge that is vast and mainly in the minds of the experts and is a major bottleneck in development. The field of knowledge engineering addresses these challenges by applying AI principles to add new knowledge in the system through a powerful mechanism. "Expert System on Wheat Crop Management" developed at IASRI is an example of such system that allows a user to add diagnostic rules and provides a platform to add new facts, heuristics and methods associated with it. The system applies AI principles to identify a disease, to add new rules and makes a mechanized system for the growth of its knowledge base. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Title: On construction of Multi-class Binary Neural Networks

Abstract: Use of positive successive product (PSP [1]) for construction of Binary Neural Networks (BNNs) has been demonstrated by Kim and Park [2]. We adapt the concept of PSP for the construction of multi-class Binary Neural Networks (MBNNs) in this paper. An analytical formulation has been developed for constructing the network. Our approach results in the construction of a three-layered MBNN. The proposed method has been tested on Iris data set and Zoo data set. The number of hidden neurons needed and the resulting classification accuracies are given for these datasets. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Abstract: The paper discusses the importance of symbolic feature extraction in recognition and classification of numerals. A new symbolic feature extraction and representation scheme is proposed in this paper. Further classification of the numerals is done by the use of the symbolic similarity measure proposed in [4]. Authors: Halder A., Ghosh S., Sinha M.
Title: Fuzzy quadtree based path planner and trajectory smoother for a low cost Unmanned Aerial Vehicle
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Intelligent Systems Lab., Department of Aerospace Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, West Bengal, 721302, India
Authors with affiliations: Halder, A., Intelligent Systems Lab., Department of Aerospace Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, West Bengal, 721302, India; Ghosh, S., Intelligent Systems Lab., Department of Aerospace Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, West Bengal, 721302, India; Sinha, M., Intelligent Systems Lab., Department of Aerospace Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, West Bengal, 721302, India
Abstract: This paper presents an effective path planning algorithm for presents an effective path planning algorithm for Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) navigation based on fuzzy quadtrees. This formulation allows the user to specify the desired level of details in the planner depending on the mission complexity. A comparative study is done to investigate the advantage of the proposed fuzzy quadtree path planner over conventional quadtree path planner. It has been shown that fuzzy quadtree path planner offers a significant reduction in storage space and computation time, which are critical for low cost UAV applications. In addition to that, the optimal path predicted by the fuzzy quadtree planner was smoothened by a proposed trajectory smoother, taking vehicle's kinematic constraint into account. The user inputs the two dimensional map of obstacles to get an optimal path predicted by the fuzzy planner and then a feasible trajectory is obtained, taking UAV turn rate kinematics in consideration. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Abstract: Story is a Natural Language description of objects (agents), their attributes, relationships, beliefs, behaviors, motivations and interactions. Most of the story generation models have concentrated on syntactic level rather than semantics. The semantics of the generated story is responsible for the interestingness. The use of ontology in each phase of story generation can help to incorporate semantics into the generated story. Ontology is the formal explicit specification of shared conceptualization. The domain ontology can be used to check the semantics of the generated story. This paper implements a method in generating story automatically using Ontology as the knowledge base, which provides semantics.

Authors: Don S., Revathy K.
Title: Classifying remotely sensed data using fractal features
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2007, AIPR 2007
Affiliations: School of Computer Science and Information Technology, Chinmaya Institute of Technology, Kanuur, 670 007, India; Department of Computer Science, University of Kerala, Kariavattom, Trivandrum 695 581, India
Authors with affiliations: Don, S., School of Computer Science and Information Technology, Chinmaya Institute of Technology, Kanuur, 670 007, India; Revathy, K., Department of Computer Science, University of Kerala, Kariavattom, Trivandrum 695 581, India
Abstract: Fractal geometry is becoming increasingly important in the study of image characteristics. For recognition of regions and objects in natural scenes, there is always a need for features, which are invariant and they provide a good set of descriptive values for the region. There are numerous methods available to estimate parameters from the image of the fractal surface. In this paper, fractal features of remotely sensed data is studied with aim of classifying them. Fractal dimensions(FD) and fractal signature(FS) are considered as different features to characterize the degree of self-similarity among the points in the clusters. The K-Means and Fuzzy C-Means algorithms are used for classification of images. In both the methods it has been found that 98% classification rate could be achieved.

Authors: Sendhilkumar S., Geetha T.V.
Title: An evaluation of personalized web search for an individual user
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2007, AIPR 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Anna University, Chennai-600 025, India
Authors with affiliations: Sendhilkumar, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Anna University, Chennai-600 025, India; Geetha, T.V., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Anna University, Chennai-600 025, India
Abstract: Searching for information need through the World Wide Web results in a large list of search results that contain only a handful of useful pages. In such a dynamic environment it is difficult to capture the user preferences and interests without interfering with the normal activity of the user. Also finding pages on the Web that are similar to a query is an important component of modern search engines. This insight has led to the utilization of personalization and as a result a personalized environment for the user to search for their information need has been developed. To improve user searching in the World Wide Web, a system that supports user searches by learning about user preferences and by observing responses to prior search experiences aided by a new index called the User Conceptual Index (UCI) has been proposed. This paper is directly focused on the evaluation of the results of individual user's UCI based search and introduces three measures for this purpose. The UCI based search for individual user shows significant improvement in the search results, which is confirmed by traditional IR evaluation measures.
Author Keywords: Personalization; Search Engine; User Conceptual Index; User Profile; Web Search

Authors: Santra A.K., Nasira G.M.
Title: Application of neural networks to a constrained multifacility location problem
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2007, AIPR 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Applications, Bannari Amman Institute of Technology, Sathyamangalam-638401, Erode Dist, Tamilnadu, India; Research Scholar, Mother Teresa Women's University, Kodaikanal, Madurai Dist, Tamilnadu, India
Authors with affiliations: Santra, A.K., Department of Computer Applications, Bannari Amman Institute of Technology, Sathyamangalam-638401, Erode Dist, Tamilnadu, India; Nasira, G.M., Research Scholar, Mother Teresa Women's University, Kodaikanal, Madurai Dist, Tamilnadu, India
Abstract: The Multifacility Location problem is an extension of the single facility location problem. In the case of multifacility location problem we shall be interested in finding the locations of multiple new facilities with respect to multiple existing facilities in a given environment. A detailed literature survey reveals that a little attention has been paid to problem involving area constraints even though; perhaps every location problem is inherently bound by area constraint of some sort or the other. This has motivated us to take care of the area constraint aspect of multifacility location problems. The scope of our present work is to consider multifacility location problem having interactions between sources and destinations with circular area constraint. Mathematical formulation and the analytical solution have been obtained by using Kuhn-Tucker theory. An attempt has also been made to get the solution of the problem using Artificial Neural Networks (ANN).

Authors: Sendhilkumar S., Geetha T.V.
Title: Personalized web search using a modified User Conceptual Index based on a Search Flow Graph
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Anna University, Chennai - 600 025, India
Authors with affiliations: Sendhilkumar, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Anna University, Chennai - 600 025, India; Geetha, T.V., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Anna University, Chennai - 600 025, India
Abstract: Effective usage of World Wide Web is an important challenge due to the vast amount of data available in it. Searching for information need through this web-based information results in a large list of search results that contain only a handful of useful pages. The www is a dynamic environment and it is difficult to capture the user preferences and interests without interfering with the normal activity of the user. Hence to improve user searching in the World Wide Web, we have proposed a personalized search system that supports user searches by learning about user preferences and by observing responses to prior search experiences aided by a new index called the User Conceptual Index (UCI). This paper models every user search behavior as a Search Flow Graph (SFG). The main focus of this paper is the analysis of the SFG and the redesign of the UCI using the results arrived from the analysis. The modified User Conceptual Index takes into account about the user's interested transaction and sessions that contain relevant pages, which match their information need. This UCI will help to develop an effective personalized profile of a user's search goals in order to aid future search. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Upadhyaya S., Setiya R.
Title: Optimization of antnet routing through agent based intelligence
Source title: Proceedings of the 2007 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2007
Affiliations: Deptt. of Computer Sc and Applications, Kurukshetra University, Kuruksetra, India; Deptt. of Computer Sc Engg., N.C. College of Engineering, Israna, Panipat, India
Authors with affiliations: Upadhyaya, S., Deptt. of Computer Sc and Applications, Kurukshetra University, Kuruksetra, India; Setiya, R., Deptt. of Computer Sc Engg., N.C. College of Engineering, Israna, Panipat, India
Abstract: Antnet routing's foundational concept is the ability to sense, interpret and optimize an entire network of nodes in a network, as opposed to optimizing only point-to-point node interactions which is the case with many prevailing routing algorithms in use today. For antnet routing to be optimized it must have mapped ontological relationships of nodes through taxonomy, and from that foundation, the selective use of constraint-based logic to define the highest levels of performance possible can be found. Future applications of antnet routing to business process management and composite application development are possible when constraint-based logic and state engines are provided in each antnet agent.

Authors: Vibha L., Harshavardhan G.M., Pranaw K., Shenoy P.D., Venugopal K.R., Patnaik L.M.
Title: Lesion detection using segmentation and classification of mammograms
Source title: Proceedings of the IASTED International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Applications, AIA 2007
Affiliations: Dept. of CSE, University Visvesvaraya College of Engineering, Bangalore University, Bangalore, 560001, India; Microprocessor Applications Laboratory, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, 560012, India
Authors with affiliations: Vibha, L., Dept. of CSE, University Visvesvaraya College of Engineering, Bangalore University, Bangalore, 560001, India; Harshavardhan, G.M., Dept. of CSE, University Visvesvaraya College of Engineering, Bangalore University, Bangalore, 560001, India; Pranaw, K., Dept. of CSE, University Visvesvaraya College of Engineering, Bangalore University, Bangalore, 560001, India; Shenoy, P.D., Dept. of CSE, University Visvesvaraya College of Engineering, Bangalore University, Bangalore, 560001, India; Venugopal, K.R., Dept. of CSE, University Visvesvaraya College of Engineering, Bangalore University, Bangalore, 560001, India; Patnaik, L.M., Microprocessor Applications Laboratory, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, 560012, India
Abstract: The national cancer institute (NCI) estimates that 1 in 8 women in USA (12.6%) develop breast cancer, during their life time. Mammography is a medical imaging technique that combines, low-dose radiation and high-contrast, high-resolution film for examination of the breast and screening for breast cancer. The aim of a screening mammogram is to detect a tumor that cannot be physically detected. This paper proposes a method for detection of tumor using Watershed Algorithm, and further classifies it as benign or malignant using Watershed Decision Classifier (WDC). The technique consists of four phases namely, the pre-processing of image, detecting the presence of tumor, creation of the data base and finally classifying and categorizing them into two groups such as Cancerous or Benign. Experimental results show that this method performs well with the classification accuracy reaching nearly 88.38%.

Authors: Sundararajan R., Pal A.K.
Title: Rejection schemes for graded multiclass problems
Source title: Proceedings of the IASTED International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Applications, AIA 2007
Affiliations: Computing and Decision Sciences Lab., GE Global Research, 122 EPIP, Whitefield Road, Bangalore 560066, India; Department of Information Systems and Computer Science, Indian Institute of Management Calcutta, D. H. Road, Joka, Kolkata 700104, India
Authors with affiliations: Sundararajan, R., Computing and Decision Sciences Lab., GE Global Research, 122 EPIP, Whitefield Road, Bangalore 560066, India; Pal, A.K., Department of Information Systems and Computer Science, Indian Institute of Management Calcutta, D. H. Road, Joka, Kolkata 700104, India
Abstract: We consider the problem of learning with the option to reject in graded multiclass problems (GMP), i.e., problems where there exists a gradation among the class labels. We examine two aspects that distinguish GMP from standard multiclass problems: a) the performance metric of interest in GMP may not be strict accuracy; accuracy within a bandwidth of the desired class may be permissible in some situations, and b) the ambiguity expressed by the classifier may simply reflect the underlying ambiguity in the class labeling itself. To deal with these issues, we extend the existing rejection schemes for multiclass problems to cover the GMP case. Firstly, we take the existing rejection schemes and calibrate them to optimize measures other than strict accuracy. Secondly, we present an extension to the wellknown dual threshold scheme to deal with GMP. We illustrate these ideas using a credit rating prediction problem.
Author Keywords: Graded multiclass problems; Pattern recognition; Reject option

Authors: Sivakumar S., Mohan S.
Title: Development of water resources management policies for multi-reservoir systems using simulation-based soft computing models approach
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, IIT Madras, Chennai, India
Authors with affiliations: Sivakumar, S., Department of Civil Engineering, IIT Madras, Chennai, India; Mohan, S., Department of Civil Engineering, IIT Madras, Chennai, India
Abstract: A heuristic simulation based optimization model has been developed to optimize the operation of a multiple reservoir using dynamic programming and soft computing techniques. Soft computing based tools including Adaptive Neuro Fuzzy Inference systems (ANFIS) and Genetic Algorithms (GA) are used here to tackle the complexity of deriving the operational policies. This heuristic approach involves three stages in the model development. In the first stage GA is used to develop initial trajectories for DP model and then DP model results are used to adopt training data set for ANFIS model. Finally, a general operating policy is developed for multi-reservoir system operations. The demonstration is carried out through application of Parambikulam Aliyar Project systems in India. The performance of the proposed GA-DP-ANFIS is compared with simulation based multi regression model. Rule curves are developed for different scenarios like current operating policy, rezoning pattern, improved irrigation management and increase of available water potentials. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Title: Fuzzy medical diagnostic decision support with semiautomatic knowledge acquisition: A case study in infectious diseases
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Interdisciplinary School of Scientific Computing (ISSC), University of Pune, Pune 411007, India; Berkeley Initiative in Soft Computing (BISC), Special Interest Group (SIG), Environment Management Systems (EMS), United States; University of California, Berkeley CA, United States; Department of Bioinformatics, University of Pune, India; National Environmental Engineering Research Institute, India
Authors with affiliations: Wagholikar, K., Interdisciplinary School of Scientific Computing (ISSC), University of Pune, Pune 411007, India; Deshpande, A., Berkeley Initiative in Soft Computing (BISC), Special Interest Group (SIG), Environment Management Systems (EMS), United States, University of California, Berkeley CA, United States, Department of Bioinformatics, University of Pune, India, National Environmental Engineering Research Institute, India
Abstract: Research in the modeling of uncertainties using soft computing techniques, has an important role in the development of computational systems to aid medical decision-making. The present work revisits the fuzzy relations based approach for medical diagnosis, described by Wagholikar, Sutar and Deshpande [1], and investigates the use of semi-automatic method to implement the algorithm. In the case study, a medical diagnostic decision support (MDDS) system is developed with the semiautomatic method, and evaluated on a database of 57 patients diagnosed with infectious diseases. Jackknifing gives an accuracy of 94 percent, for the outcome of presence of correct diagnosis (as made by the physician) within the first two diagnoses suggested by the system. The study demonstrates the utility of the semi-automatic method and fuzzy relations based approach, and the need for further research. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Author Keywords: Decision-support; Diagnosis; Fuzzy; Relations; Semi-automatic

Authors: Lal S.B., Ramasubramanian V., Agrawal R., Raza S.M., Jha G.K.
Title: A software for imputing missing values using neural networks
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, Pusa, New Delhi, India; GGS Indraprastha University, New Delhi, India; Indian Agricultural Research Institute, Pusa, New Delhi, India
Authors with affiliations: Lal, S.B., Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, Pusa, New Delhi, India; Ramasubramanian, V., Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, Pusa, New Delhi, India; Agrawal, R., Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, Pusa, New Delhi, India; Raza, S.M., GGS Indraprastha University, New Delhi, India; Jha, G.K., Indian Agricultural Research Institute, Pusa, New Delhi, India
Abstract: Various approaches exist for imputation of item non-response such as mean, random, regression, hotdeck etc. A possible and perhaps better alternative method of imputing item non-response is to use Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs). In ANNs, input and output values of complete records are used to train a model to respond similar to the behavior revealed in the data. A software has been developed incorporating ANN-based as well as other methods for imputation of missing values. The type of ANN method used in the software is a backpropagation network with multilayer perceptron architecture. The system is developed in Java open source platform independent language. The parameters of the training algorithm such as number of epochs, momentum, learning rate and error tolerance can be customized by the user before and during training. The software has been designed to handle categorical data as well. Performance of the algorithm used in the software has been evaluated using agricultural datasets. The results obtained compared well with those obtained from STATISTICA - Neural Networks package using evaluation measures viz. Mean Absolute Percent Error (MAPE) and Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE). Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Author Keywords: Backpropagation; Imputation; Multilayer perceptron; Neural network

Authors: Krishnanand K.N., Ghose D.
Title: Chasing multiple mobile signal sources: A glowworm swarm optimization approach
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Mobile Robotics Laboratory, Department of Aerospace Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, India
Authors with affiliations: Krishnanand, K.N., Mobile Robotics Laboratory, Department of Aerospace Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, India; Ghose, D., Mobile Robotics Laboratory, Department of Aerospace Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, India
Abstract: We address the problem of developing individual agent rules that enable a swarm of mobile pursuers, with hard-limited sensing ranges, to split into subgroups, exhibit simultaneous taxis towards, and eventually chase a group of mobile signal sources. Examples of such sources include hostile mobile targets in a battlefield and moving fire-fronts that are created in forest fires. The coordination scheme used by the pursuers is based on an algorithm called the glowworm optimization algorithm (GSO) that finds multiple optima of multimodal objective functions. We briefly describe the various phases of the GSO algorithm and the modifications that are required to implement the algorithm in a set of physical robots. For the case where the positions of the pursuers and the moving source are collinear, we present a theoretical result that provides anupper bound on the relative speed of the mobile source below which the pursuers succeed in chasing the source. We use simulations to demonstrate the efficacy of the algorithm in chasing mobile signal sources. In particular, we present simulation results for single and two source cases, respectively, where each source moves in a circular trajectory and at constant angular speed. In the case where the positions of the pursuers and the moving source are non-collinear, we use numerical experiments to determine an upper bound on the relative speed of the mobile source below which the pursuers succeed in chasing the source. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Author Keywords: Cooperative hunting; Glowworm swarm optimization; Multiple mobile signal sources
Index Keywords: Angular speed; Circular trajectory; Cooperative hunting; Coordination scheme; Forest fires; Individual agent; Mobile signals; Mobile sources; Mobile targets; Moving source; Multi-modal; Numerical experiments; Objective functions; Optimization algorithms; Physical robots; Sensing ranges; Swarm optimization; Theoretical result; Two sources; Upper Bound; Artificial intelligence; Deforestation; Mobile power plants; Algorithms

Authors: Arora A., Jain R., Upadhyaya S.
Title: Rough set based feature selection for clustering
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, New Delhi, India; National Center for Agricultural Economics and Policy Research, New Delhi, India; Department of Computer Science and Application, Kurukshetra University, Kurukshetra, India
Authors with affiliations: Arora, A., Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, New Delhi, India; Jain, R., National Center for Agricultural Economics and Policy Research, New Delhi, India; Upadhyaya, S., Department of Computer Science and Application, Kurukshetra University, Kurukshetra, India
Abstract: In this paper, we describe a preliminary study into the use of rough set based feature selection for clustering. Initial experiments reveal that rough set theory facilitated in feature selection, without decreasing the quality of obtained clusters. Cluster quality is judged on two validity indices of Root Mean Square Standard Deviation and Dunn's Index. These validity indices are computed for datasets with full features and rough set based selected subset of features. Further graph is plotted on these validity indices with number of clusters, to find the partitioning that best fits the underlying data. Optimum number of clusters obtained with full features and selected subset is compared with the number of classes already present in the dataset to confirm that this process resulted in obtaining the same number of clusters. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Nagabhushan T.N., Padma S.K.
Title: Training Resource Allocating Network using medoids and significant patterns
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Information Science and Engineering, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore 570 006, India
Authors with affiliations: Nagabhushan, T.N., Department of Information Science and Engineering, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore 570 006, India; Padma, S.K., Department of Information Science and Engineering, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore 570 006, India
Abstract: Among the several variants of constructive learning networks, Piatt's Resource Allocating Network (RAN) is still one of the popular incremental learning networks that has been tried on several problem types. In this paper, we propose two new ideas to improve the performance of RAN. In the first instance, we calculate the medoids from samples in respective pattern classes. Secondly we pick a small percentage of significant patterns based on the farthest neighbor concept. The medoids and the significant patterns are collectively used to train the RAN. The entire samples in the input space are used to test the generalization performance of the network. Two benchmark datasets, Iris and Wine are used to experiment the proposed techniques. Results reveal significant enhancement in the performance of the RAN compared to traditional RAN. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Author Keywords: Incremental learning; Medoids; Neural networks; Resource allocating network; Significant patterns
Index Keywords: Benchmark datasets; Constructive learning; Generalization performance; Incremental learning; Input space; Medoids; Pattern class; Resource allocating networks; Significant patterns; Artificial intelligence; Neural networks; Learning systems

Authors: Barai S.V., Dikshit A.K., Sharma S.
Title: Self-Organizing Feature map Model for air quality prediction
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur 721 30, India; Center for Environmental Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay, 400 076, India; Tata Consulting Engineers Ltd., Mumbai 400 009, India

Abstract: The present paper aims to find neural network based air quality predictors, which can work with limited number of data sets and are robust enough to handle data with noise and errors. Self Organizing Feature Model (SOFM) model is implemented for predicting air quality. Developed model was run to simulate and forecast based on the long-term (annual) and short-term (daily) data. The models, in general, could predict air quality patterns with modest accuracy for long-term (annual) data as well as short-term (daily) data. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Mahalakshmi G.S., Geetha T.V.
Title: I-KARe - A rational approach to knowledge acquisition and reasoning using Indian logic based knowledge models
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Anna University, Chennai, 600 025, India
Authors with affiliations: Mahalakshmi, G.S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Anna University, Chennai, 600 025, India; Geetha, T.V., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Anna University, Chennai, 600 025, India
Abstract: This paper discusses the knowledge acquisition and reasoning system from procedural arguments between the members of virtual knowledge community. The knowledge sharing protocol determines the inclusion and exclusion of knowledge volunteers and regulates the discussion within the community. By rationally exchanging questions and answers in a debate fashion, knowledge is explored across knowledge volunteers until a definite conclusion is reached. The initial predicates of world knowledge are represented as a thoroughly classified ontology based on the knowledge models of Nyaya Sastra. Besides classification, the knowledge volunteers are grouped according to a degree of trust, using which the other volunteers accept or reject the knowledge proposed by any proponent. During discussion, the proponent refers to a special relation, invariable concomitance, between the concepts to explain the inference to other opponents. The opponent analyses the presence of the above relation in its very own knowledge base and the relevant defects obtained are rewarded to the proponent. In this fashion, autonomous knowledge volunteers gain new and valid knowledge, using which they arrive at new conclusions in the future. The system acquires facts, descriptions, and arguments by allowing participants to construct and fill in natural language templates. It employs methods of clarifying entered knowledge and allows participants to validate knowledge and in turn each other. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Author Keywords: Indian philosophy; Knowledge-sharing and Argument; Logic; Procedural argumentation

Authors: Bhattacharya M., Das A.
Title: Discrimination for malignant and Benign masses in breast using mammogram: A study on adaptive neuro-fuzzy approaches
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Indian Institute of Information Technology and Management, Gwalior, Morena Link Road, Gwalior-474003, India; Institute of Radio Physics and Electronics, University of Calcutta, 92, A.P.C. Road, Kolkata-700009, India
Authors with affiliations: Bhattacharya, M., Indian Institute of Information Technology and Management, Gwalior, Morena Link Road, Gwalior-474003, India; Das, A., Institute of Radio Physics and Electronics, University of Calcutta, 92, A.P.C. Road, Kolkata-700009, India
Abstract: An intelligent computer assisted diagnostic procedure is very much helpful for radiologists to detect breast cancer faster than typical screening program. In present study we have attempted to distinguish malignant masses from benign one using digital mammograms. The suspicious regions in breast tissue as suggested by the radiologists have been segmented using fuzzy c-means clustering technique. Fourier descriptors are utilized for the extraction of shape features of the region of interest. These shape features as well as texture features are fed to the input of the adaptive neuro fuzzy based classifier for determination of the tumor masses as benign, lobular or malignant. The classification system utilizes Euclidian distance function to determine the degree of malignancy. The study involves 200 digitized mammograms from MIAS and other databases and has shown 84% correct classification rate. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Title: Perturbation based local search for the degree-constrained minimum spanning-tree problem
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007

Abstract: Given a connected, weighted, and undirected graph, the degreeconstrained minimum spanning-tree problem seeks on this graph a spanningtree of minimum weight subject to a limit on the number of edges that can be incident to each node. In this paper we have proposed a perturbation based local search for this problem. Tests on standard benchmark instances for the problem demonstrate the effectiveness of our approach. Authors: Ramasubramanian V., Agrawal R., Lal S.B., Rai A., Kumar A., Raza S.M., Jha G.K.
Title: Evaluation of neural network applications for data editing
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, New Delhi, India; GGSIP University, New Delhi, India; Indian Agricultural Research Institute, New Delhi, India
Authors with affiliations: Ramasubramanian, V., Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, New Delhi, India; Agrawal, R., Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, New Delhi, India; Lal, S.B., Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, New Delhi, India; Rai, A., Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, New Delhi, India; Kumar, A., Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute, New Delhi, India; Raza, S.M., GGSIP University, New Delhi, India; Jha, G.K., Indian Agricultural Research Institute, New Delhi, India
Abstract: Editing is a procedure for detecting and adjusting individual errors in data records resulting from data collection and capture wherein incorrect or missing values identified will either be corrected or imputed. While several methods of data editing procedures exist, in recent times, the use of Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs) for editing purposes has been increasingly recognized. Non-response and interchange errors as well as their joint effects are frequently occurring editing situations. In this study, out of these three situations, editing under non-response errors has been considered. Evaluation of applications of ANN for data editing has been done by considering agricultural census data of Maharashtra state, India. The results revealed that ANNs do provide a viable alternative method for editing purposes. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Title: A constructive heuristic for no-wait flowshop scheduling
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007

Abstract: In this paper, we present a heuristic for minimizing makespan in no-wait flowshop scheduling problem. The heuristic uses the principle of insertion technique, already present in the NEH heuristic (Omega 11 (1983) 91) for permutation flowshop problem. The exhaustive computational experiment shows the exceptionally superiority of the proposed heuristic over the currently best constructive ones by Rajendran (J. Oper. Res. Soc. 45(1994) 472) and Gangadharan and Rajendran (Int. J. Prod. Econom. 32 (1993) 285). Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Balakrishnan M., Ravisankar N., Meena K., Elanchezhian R., Zamir Ahmed S.K.
Title: Yield prediction through feed forward neural network approach for direct seeded rice (Oryza sativa) in bay islands
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Central Agricultural Research Institute, PB 181, Port Blair -744 101, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, India
Authors with affiliations: Balakrishnan, M., Central Agricultural Research Institute, PB 181, Port Blair -744 101, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, India; Ravisankar, N., Central Agricultural Research Institute, PB 181, Port Blair -744 101, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, India; Meena, K., Central Agricultural Research Institute, PB 181, Port Blair -744 101, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, India; Elanchezhian, R., Central Agricultural Research Institute, PB 181, Port Blair -744 101, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, India; Zamir Ahmed, S.K., Central Agricultural Research Institute, PB 181, Port Blair -744 101, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, India
Abstract: Field experiment was conducted at the Bloomsdale farm of Central Agricultural Research Institute (CARI), Port Blair during 2002 to 2006 and data collected was subjected to Artificial Neural Networks (ANN) approach for developing a meaningful yield prediction for direct seeded rice under island conditions with the objective to estimate the crop production a few days or months before harvesting of crop. The observations of all experiments viz., plant height, number of tillers, panicles/m2, filled grains/panicle, grain yield weight, harvest index, cost of cultivation, gross returns, net returns, BC ratio, labour involved, energy input, specific energy, energy output for the period of four years from 2002 were collected from the basic records of experimental field. All the data were used for training data set. The results showed that the ANN had potential and ability to forecast rice yield accurately despite small set of data available. Prediction of crop yield, mainly strategic plant of rice has been an interesting research area to agronomists since long for its importance in national and international economic programming. Application of ANN was found to be significant tool for prediction of yield in direct seeded rice. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Title: Analysis of VQ based fractal image coding using Genetic algorithm
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Electronics and Communication Engineering, Sri Venkatewara College of Engineering, Sriperumbudur, Tamil Nadu, India
Authors with affiliations: Santhosh Kumar, S., Electronics and Communication Engineering, Sri Venkatewara College of Engineering, Sriperumbudur, Tamil Nadu, India; Shankar Narayanan, V., Electronics and Communication Engineering, Sri Venkatewara College of Engineering, Sriperumbudur, Tamil Nadu, India; Rangarajan, K.M., Electronics and Communication Engineering, Sri Venkatewara College of Engineering, Sriperumbudur, Tamil Nadu, India; Venkata Krishna, A.L., Electronics and Communication Engineering, Sri Venkatewara College of Engineering, Sriperumbudur, Tamil Nadu, India; Vignesh, J., Electronics and Communication Engineering, Sri Venkatewara College of Engineering, Sriperumbudur, Tamil Nadu, India; Rangarajan, L.R., Electronics and Communication Engineering, Sri Venkatewara College of Engineering, Sriperumbudur, Tamil Nadu, India
Abstract: This paper presents an analysis of the usage of clustering algorithms in fractal coding using Genetic algorithm (GA). The self-transformability property of images is assumed and exploited in the fractal image compression technique. The technique described here utilizes the GA, which greatly decreases the search space for finding the self-similarities in the given image. The use of vector quantization (VQ) in image coding has been in vogue for quite some time. The usage of clustering algorithms in VQ is widespread, but choosing from a wide variety of available clustering algorithms is a tough proposition. Analysis is performed on the 2-D Eucledian space and the results of the simulations performed are presented. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Patil H.A., Basu T.K.
Title: Advances in speaker recognition: A feature based approach
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2007, AIPR 2007
Affiliations: Dhirubahi Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology (DA-IICT), Gandhinagar, Gujarat, India; Department of Electrical Engineering, IIT Kharagpur, W. Bengal, India
Authors with affiliations: Patil, H.A., Dhirubahi Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology (DA-IICT), Gandhinagar, Gujarat, India; Basu, T.K., Department of Electrical Engineering, IIT Kharagpur, W. Bengal, India
Abstract: Automatic Speaker Recognition (ASR) deals with the identification or verification of a person's identity from his or her voice with the help of machines. A typical ASR system consists of two major blocks, viz., feature extractor and pattern classifier. The feature extractor does the job of mapping speech signals into speaker-specific features whereas pattern classifier builds up speaker-specific models from the features. An ASR system will be efficient if the proper speaker-specific features are extracted. Most of the state-of-the-art ASR systems use the same features which have been used in speech recognition research. In this paper, an attempt is made to survey and discuss different sources (Glottal flow derivative, LP residual, its phase, or its wavelet domain representation), system (LPC, PLP, LPCC, WLPCC, MFCC, T-MFCC, modified group delay functionbased, SBCC, WPCC, etc.) and suprasegmental features (duration, pitch, idiolect, speaking style, speaking rate, etc.) features used in ASR systems. The paper concludes with a short discussion for current status and future research directions to move towards designing most efficient and robust ASR system. Index Terms-Automatic Speaker Recognition, feature extraction, feature selection, LP residual phase (LPRP), Mel cepstrum, wavelet domain cepstrum and LPR, pitch contour, modified group delay function.
Index Keywords: Automatic speaker recognition; Feature based approaches; Future research directions; Modified group delay; Pattern classifier; Speaker recognition; Speaker-specific features; Suprasegmental features; Artificial intelligence; Feature extraction; Group delay; Speech recognition
Correspondence Address: Patil, H.A.; Dhirubahi Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology (DA-IICT), Gandhinagar, Gujarat, India
Abbreviated Source Title: Int. Conf. Artif. Intell. Pattern Recogn., AIPR

Authors: Abhang R.Y.
Title: A study of the nonlinear dynamics of an artificial neural network model storing patterns in limit cycle attractors
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2007, AIPR 2007
Affiliations: Abasaheb Garware College, KarveRoad, Pune 411004, Maharashtra, India
Authors with affiliations: Abhang, R.Y., Abasaheb Garware College, KarveRoad, Pune 411004, Maharashtra, India
Abstract: Willshaw type Artificial Neural Network Model (ANN) uses limit-cycle attractors to store and associatively recall individual patterns, by introducing time-delay mechanisms. The methods of equilibrium statistical mechanics cannot be used in the study of models with timedelayed interactions and asymmetric connections. Numerical simulation is the alternative method available in these cases. Hence, the Willshaw-type ANN model for storing patterns in limit-cycles is simulated on the computer and its dynamics is studied by varying the model parameters. This study of the nonlinear dynamics of ANN has important application to investigate various complex phenomena involving limit cycles in Physics, Chemistry, Biology etc.
Index Keywords: Alternative methods; Artificial neural network models; Equilibrium statistical mechanics; Limit cycle; Limit cycle attractors; Model parameters; Time-delay mechanisms; Time-delayed interactions; Artificial intelligence; Delta sigma modulation; Dynamical systems; Dynamics; Pattern recognition; Statistical mechanics; Computer simulation

Authors: Kumar V., Mittal A.P., Singh R.
Title: Comparative study of real time performance of Fuzzy PI/PID controllers in cascade control loop
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Division of Instrumentation and Control Engineering, Netaji Subhas Institute of Technology, Dwarka, New Delhi - 110075, India
Authors with affiliations: Kumar, V., Division of Instrumentation and Control Engineering, Netaji Subhas Institute of Technology, Dwarka, New Delhi - 110075, India; Mittal, A.P., Division of Instrumentation and Control Engineering, Netaji Subhas Institute of Technology, Dwarka, New Delhi - 110075, India; Singh, R., Division of Instrumentation and Control Engineering, Netaji Subhas Institute of Technology, Dwarka, New Delhi - 110075, India
Abstract: Cascade control is the most popular control configuration in the chemical and process industry. It is the most popular architecture for improving disturbance rejection. It performance is far superior to simple feedback controllers for disturbance rejection. The performance of cascade control loop can further improve by using the Intelligent Control Techniques like Fuzzy Logic Controller. Fuzzy logic control deals with reasoning algorithms used to emulate human thinking and decision making in machines. In present research work, Fuzzy PI, Fuzzy P + Fuzzy I and Fuzzy P + Fuzzy I + Fuzzy D controllers have been implemented in a level control system in real time. NATIONAL INSTRUMENTS™ (USA) based hardware and software tools (LabVIEW™) were used for precise and accurate acquisition, measurement and control. The real time implementation of the Fuzzy PI controller has been carried out in two configurations: simple feedback and cascade control configuration. In cascade control configuration Fuzzy PI has been implemented only in the primary loop. The secondary loop has been tuned using the conventional PI controller. It was observed that Fuzzy controller perform better in comparison with conventional controller in both the simple feedback and cascade control configurations in level control system in real time. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Author Keywords: Cascade control; Fuzzy P + Fuzzy I; Fuzzy P + Fuzzy I + Fuzzy D; Fuzzy PI; PID; Process control

Authors: Srinivasa K.G., Dhar S., Venugopal K.R., Patnaik L.M.
Title: Statistical analysis and compression of DNA using weighted probability approach and modified run-length encoding
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Data Mining Laboratory, M S Ramaiah Institute of Technology, India; Department of Computer Science, University Visvesvaraya, College of Engineering, India; Microprocessor Application Laboratory, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, India
Authors with affiliations: Srinivasa, K.G., Data Mining Laboratory, M S Ramaiah Institute of Technology, India; Dhar, S., Data Mining Laboratory, M S Ramaiah Institute of Technology, India; Venugopal, K.R., Department of Computer Science, University Visvesvaraya, College of Engineering, India; Patnaik, L.M., Microprocessor Application Laboratory, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, India
Abstract: Rapid advancements in research in the field of DNA sequence discovery has led to a vast range of compression algorithms. The number of bits required for storing four bases of any DNA sequence is two, but efficient algorithms have pushed this limit lower. With the constant decrease in prices of memory and communication channel bandwidth, one often doubts the need of such compression algorithms. The algorithm discussed in this paper hence not only compresses the DNA sequence, but also allows one to generate finite length sequences, which can be used to find approximate pattern matches. DNA sequences are mainly of two types, Repetitive and Non-Repetitive. The compression technique used is meant for the non-repetitive parts of the sequence, where we make use of the fact that a DNA sequence consists of only 4 characters. The algorithm achieves bit/base ratio of 1.3 - 1.4(dependant on the database), but more importantly one of the stages of the algorithm can be used for efficient discovery of approximate patterns. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Abstract: Language Identification (LID) refers to the task of identifying an unknown language from the test utterances. In this paper, a new method of feature extraction, viz., Teager Energy Based Mel Frequency Cepstral Coefficients (T-MFCC) is developed for identification of phonetically similar languages. Finally, an LID system is presented for Hindi and Urdu (phonetically similar Indian languages) to demonstrate effectiveness of newly proposed feature set with short discussion on experimental results.

Authors: Ramani R.G., Subramanian R., SivaSathya S., Viswanath P.
Title: A new tree generation algorithm for Genetic Programming
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Dept. of CSE and IT, Pondicherry Engineering College, Pondicherry, India; Department of Computer Science, Pondicherry University, Pondicherry, India

Abstract: In this paper we present a new methodology for tree generation in Genetic Programming (GP). The proposed algorithm (TreeComDepth) is capable of generating trees with user specified expected depth. This algorithm comes with eight variations that are used for generating the trees of required parameter values (size/depth/terminals). The algorithms are found to produce more structural varieties and unique trees when compared to other standard tree generation algorithms. The user can have control over the tree structures. The new algorithm and its variants can be used for the evolutionary design problems of Type III involving both variable structure and variable parameters. For those problems importance has been given to maintain diversity in the structures and parameters. The proposed algorithm and its variants are capable of generating initial population trees with varieties of structures. The proposed tree creation method can also be used to produce the required tree structures for the mutation process. Through structure fitness sharing the diversity of the structures can be maintained. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Singh A.K.
Title: Extraction and translation of multi-word number expressions
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Singh, A.K., Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India
Abstract: This paper describes a tool for extracting multi-word number expressions, calculating their numerical values, and then generating them into another language, thus translating the expressions in that language. It is based on the fact that such expressions in many languages follow a simple recursive pattern. By changing the language configuration files of our tool, extraction and translation can be done for all the languages which use this pattern. We present the results of testing this tool on seven languages and twenty four language pairs. During testing, the analysis part (finding the numerical value) worked correctly for all the languages for which testing was done. Generation worked correctly for five languages but requires some modification for two languages due to the fact that word forms in languages like Telugu depend on the context. We also discuss some issues which remain and suggest solutions for some of these issues. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Abstract: Application of Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs) for rice yield forecasting using Multi-Layer Perceptron (MLP) architecture has been done. For development of neural network based forecast models, yield of rice crop at district level (Uttar Pradesh state, India) was considered as output variable and weather variables viz. maximum and minimum temperatures, rainfall and morning relative humidity were considered as input variables. Forecasts based on MLP architecture of neural networks have been found to be close to the observed ones in most of the cases. The findings of the study substantiates that neural networks possess potential for prediction purposes. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Abstract: A continuous segmentation approach is used to get the isolated letters or pseudo character from the handwritten word for feature extraction. The preprocessing is done using Morphological operation to remove noise, compress and provide smoother way for Feature extraction. To get better results we have used Invariant moments (IM) for feature extraction once preprocessing and segmentation is over because invariant moments are insensitive to translation, scale change, mirroring, and rotation. After segmentation it is often necessary to evaluate the quality of the image for that we have used objective quality measure like mean and standard deviation. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Title: Rough sets based hybrid c-means algorithm
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Center for Soft Computing Research, Indian Statistical Institute, India
Authors with affiliations: Maji, P., Center for Soft Computing Research, Indian Statistical Institute, India; Pal, S.K., Center for Soft Computing Research, Indian Statistical Institute, India
Abstract: This paper describes a hybrid clustering algorithm, termed as rough-fuzzy-possibilistic c-means. While the concept of lower and upper approximations of rough sets deals with vagueness and incompleteness in class definition, the membership function of fuzzy sets enables efficient handling of overlapping partitions. Both the problems of noise sensitivity of fuzzy c-means and the coincident clusters of possibilistic cmeans can be avoided by the proposed algorithm as it incorporates both probabilistic and possibilistic memberships simultaneously. The effectiveness of the algorithm, along with a comparison with other algorithms, has been demonstrated on a set of benchmark data sets. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Abstract: Sentiment analysis of plain text data available from user product reviews or blog comments is gaining more and more importance especially for customer feedback concerns. In this paper we propose a simple and intuitive Sentiment analysis approach on such data by using a weighted polarity approach for word level and phrase level sentiment which both amount to giving the sentence's sentiment. The results shown in the paper prove the performance and the efficiency of the proposed approach. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007

Authors with affiliations: Sarma, K.K., Department of Electronics Science, Gauhati University, Guwahati-781014, India
Abstract: Neural number recognition as an extension of an Optical Character Recognition (OCR) system requires a unique feature set capturing relevant details of the input profiles. The performance of such a recognition system depends on the feature set. The work deals with the design of a combined character and numeral recognition system using a hybrid feature set applied earlier to the recognition of Assamese characters. The work also describes the use of a modified hybrid feature set derived for handwritten numeral detection using a neural network. The set aims to maximize recognition performance, improve robustness and invariance to shape and size in presence of noise. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Abstract: In this paper, we present a new algorithm for mining multilevel association rules which searches for interesting relationship among items in a given data set at multiple levels in an effective way. This algorithm group the items at data warehousing level for each branch of the decision tree and find the association between them which is effective on a large set of data items. It generates a smaller set of rules, with higher quality and lower redundancy in comparison with general approach of multilevel association rules.

Title: A multi layer perceptron (MLP) based on back propagation technique for flank wear analysis of single point cutting tool inserts
Source title: Proceedings of the 2007 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department Mechanical Engineering, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore, Karnataka, India; Department of Electrical and Electronics Engg., Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore, Karnataka, India; Department of Instrumentation Technology, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore, Karnataka, India; Department of Mechanical Engineering, University B.D.T. College of Engineering, Davangere, Karnataka, India
Authors with affiliations: Srinidhi, R., Department Mechanical Engineering, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore, Karnataka, India; Veeramanju, K.T., Department of Electrical and Electronics Engg., Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore, Karnataka, India; Sukumar, M., Department of Instrumentation Technology, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore, Karnataka, India; Venkatesha, C.S., Department of Mechanical Engineering, University B.D.T. College of Engineering, Davangere, Karnataka, India
Abstract: Wear of cutting tools is very important in manufacturing industry. Study and analysis of each tool is extremely useful in the tool condition monitoring process. Determination of optimal cutting conditions and prediction of expected tool life is gaining momentum. Various measurable parameters and their correlative results are essential in taking steps to make the tool health monitoring process on-line and minimize downtime in productive environments. Condition monitoring of the cutting tools is very important as the process capability and process parameters may be evaluated based on the condition of the tool. Wear of the tool tip generates poor surface finish and an unexpected tool failure may damage the tool, work piece and the machine tool. Advanced manufacturing demands an optimal machining process with proper control of machining parameters. Efforts are on to make control of most of the machining parameters on-line. Many problems that affect optimization are related to the diminished machine performance caused by worn out tools. One of the most promising tool condition monitoring technique is based on the analysis of acoustic emission (AE) signals. Generation of the AE signals in the cutting zone makes them sensitive to changes in the cutting process. Experiments were conducted on select specimens of steel using select varieties of cutting tools inserts on a high speed lathe for some specific cutting conditions. The AE signal analysis is carried out using, ring down count (RDC), rise time (RTT), event duration (EDT), energy (ENT) and peak amplitude (PA).
Author Keywords: AE; EDT; ENT; PA; RCT; RTT
Index Keywords: AE; EDT; ENT; RCT; RTT; Artificial intelligence; Condition monitoring; Machining centers; Optimization; Polyamides; Cutting tools

Authors: Srivastava N., Saxena A., Prithiani R.K.
Title: Predicting more accurate structure of Human Oxidoreductase protein family using neural network technique
Source title: Proceedings of the 2007 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2007
Affiliations: Dept. of Computer Science, A.P.S. University, Rewa, MP, India; Dept. of Zoology, Govt. Science College, Rewa, MP, India
Authors with affiliations: Srivastava, N., Dept. of Computer Science, A.P.S. University, Rewa, MP, India; Saxena, A., Dept. of Zoology, Govt. Science College, Rewa, MP, India; Prithiani, R.K., Dept. of Computer Science, A.P.S. University, Rewa, MP, India
Abstract: In this paper, an attempt has been made to develop a neural network-based method for predicting the secondary structure of protein (Human Oxidoreductase family). The neural network has been trained using Bayesian Regularization Feed-forward Backpropagation Neural Network Technique to predict the a-helix, P-sheet and coil regions of this protein family. Feed-forward neural network have been trained by analyzing windows of 25 parameters for predicting the central residue of protein sequence. P SI-BLAST has been used for multiple-sequence alignment. SCOP and PDB database has been used for searching the primary and secondary structure of proteins and for training the data set. The method correctly identifies the secondary structure of Human Oxidoreductase family with more than 79% accuracy, which is well above any previously reported method.
