Abstract: In the present day existing routing algorithms are single criteria routing algorithm these type of routing algorithms mainly concentrate on unique metric of the network because to avoid computation in routing being single criteria qualitative routing [8] is not achieved in ad-hoc networks. In this paper we proposed two changes to existing routing algorithms to achieve qualitative routing in ad-hoc networks by adapting multi criteria (i.e. considering more than one characteristic of network) and mobile agent concept to evaluate multi criteria in to an equivalent single criteria normalized cost metric. Title: Named entity recognition in Tamil using context-cues and the E-M algorithm

Abstract: The aim of this paper is to present the use of the Expectation-Maximisation (E-M) algorithm considering context-based evidence for the problem of named-entity recognition in Tamil. Using contextual cues, bootstrapping probabilities are defined for each word in a word sequence and smoothened using the E-M algorithm and a probability model from a training corpus. The resultant probabilities are examined and help identify named entities from a document. This hybrid method gives an F-measure of 93.15, an improvement of 26.22 over the results derived when random initial probabilities are assigned. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Chandra B., Paul Varghese P., Saxena P.K., Kant S.
Title: Neural networks for identification of crypto systems
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Mathematics, Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi, 110016, India; DRDO, Metcalfe House, New Delhi, India
Authors with affiliations: Chandra, B., Department of Mathematics, Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi, 110016, India; Paul Varghese, P., Department of Mathematics, Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi, 110016, India; Saxena, P.K., DRDO, Metcalfe House, New Delhi, India; Kant, S., DRDO, Metcalfe House, New Delhi, India
Abstract: Cryptography is important in the field of information security. Cryptography, the science of code making and code breaking, keeps the defense, business and financial transactions, safe from unwanted elements and terrorists. Covert communications are kept secure by using a secret code to encrypt sensitive information. In the new digital age, secrecy is paramount. Cryptosystem Identification is one of the challenging tasks in Crypt analysis. Statistical techniques have been widely used by researchers for cryptanalysis; however significant results have not been achieved so far. This work demonstrates how Artificial Neural Networks can be effectively used for Cryptosystem Identification by performing efficient transformations on the encrypted text. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Adhikari A., Rao P.R.
Title: Study of select items in multiple databases by grouping
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, S P Chowgule College, Margao, Goa - 403 602, India; Department of Computer Science and Technology, Goa University, Taleigao Plateau, Goa - 403 206, India
Authors with affiliations: Adhikari, A., Department of Computer Science, S P Chowgule College, Margao, Goa - 403 602, India; Rao, P.R., Department of Computer Science and Technology, Goa University, Taleigao Plateau, Goa - 403 206, India
Abstract: Many large organizations have multiple large databases as they transact from multiple branches. Many important decisions are based on a set of specific items called the select items. Thus, the analysis of select items in multiple databases is an important issue. We make the following contributions in this paper: Firstly, a model of mining global patterns of select items from multiple databases is proposed. Secondly, a measure of overall association between two items in a database is proposed. Thirdly, an algorithm is designed based on the proposed overall association between two items in a database for the purpose of grouping the frequent items in multiple databases. Each group contains a select item called the nucleus item and the group grows centring round the nucleus item. Experimental results are presented on real, synthetic and artificial databases. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Raghuveer K., Murthy K.N.
Title: Text categorization in Indian languages using machine learning approaches
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer and Information Sciences, University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad, 500 046, India
Authors with affiliations: Raghuveer, K., Department of Computer and Information Sciences, University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad, 500 046, India; Murthy, K.N., Department of Computer and Information Sciences, University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad, 500 046, India
Abstract: In this paper we present our work on automatic text categorization in Indian languages. Here we use purely corpus based machine learning techniques. The methods we present are completely language independent - no language specific knowledge is used. We describe our experiments on ten of the major Indian languages including Assamese, Bengali (Bangla), Gujarati, Hindi, Kannada, Malayalam, Oriya, Punjabi, Tamil and Telugu. We have conducted our experiments on the DoE-CIIL corpora. We have also worked on the newspaper corpus forming part of the LERC-UoH Telugu corpus developed by us. We have used several machine learning techniques including naive Bayes classifier, k-Nearest-Neighbor classifier and SVMs. We have used one-vs.-all SVMs for multi-classification with 3-fold Cross Validation in all cases. We see that SVMs out-perform other classifiers. We describe our experiments with soft-margin linear SVMs as well as kernel based SVMs using polynomial and Radial Basis Function kernels. Kernel based SVMs have not performed significantly better than linear SVMs. There is not much work done in text categorization in Indian languages. Text categorization in Indian languages is challenging as Indian languages are very rich in morphology, giving rise to a very large number of word forms and hence very large feature spaces. We show how Mutual Information between features and categories can be used to achieve substantial reduction in the dimensionality of the feature space without reducing the performance. In fact many terms actually act as noise and we show that pruning such terms from the feature space actually enhances the performance. The paper is written in tutorial style and adequate background material is included on text categorization as also on the machine learning techniques used, for the benefit of readers who may not be familiar with these. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Saroj, Bharadwaj K.K.
Title: A parallel genetic algorithm approach for automated discovery of censored production rules
Source title: Proceedings of the IASTED International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Applications, AIA 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Guru Jambheshwar University of Science and Technology, Hisar - 125001, Haryana, India; School of Computer and Systems Sciences, Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi-110067, India
Authors with affiliations: Saroj, Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Guru Jambheshwar University of Science and Technology, Hisar - 125001, Haryana, India; Bharadwaj, K.K., School of Computer and Systems Sciences, Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi-110067, India
Abstract: Exceptions, which focus on a very small portion of dataset, have been discarded as noise in machine learning. It is interesting to discover exceptions, as they challenge the existing knowledge and often lead to the growth of knowledge in new directions. Discovering exceptions from voluminous data sets still remains a great challenge. In Knowledge Discovery in Databases (KDD), it is also significant to extract the knowledge in a form that is flexible and efficient enough for approximate reasoning. A Censored Production Rule (CPR) is a special kind of knowledge structure that is represented as an augmented production rule of the form: If P Then D Unless C, where C (Censor) is an exception to rule. If P Then D part of CPR holds frequently while Unless C part holds rarely. Discovery of CPRs not only provides a computational mechanism to exhibit variable precision logic but also results in the discovery of a set of rules of considerably reduced size. In this paper, a Parallel Genetic Algorithm approach is suggested for automated discovery of Censored Production Rules. The parallel Genetic Algorithm involves both data and control parallelism. A fitness function that incorporates the constraints of CPRs, is proposed. The experimental results establish the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm.
Author Keywords: Censored production rules; Data mining; Parallel genetic algorithm; Variable precision logic
Index Keywords: Constraint theory; Genetic algorithms; Logic programming; Parallel algorithms; Precision engineering; Censored production rules; Parallel genetic algorithms; Variable precision logic; Data mining

Authors: Raj V.J., Chellam G.H.
Title: Orthonormal implementation on neural network - A new approach
Source title: Proceedings of the 2007 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Engineering, European University of Lefke, TRNC, Turkey; Department of Computer Applications, Sarah Tucker College, M.S.University, Tirunelveli, Tamil Nadu, India
Authors with affiliations: Raj, V.J., Department of Computer Engineering, European University of Lefke, TRNC, Turkey; Chellam, G.H., Department of Computer Applications, Sarah Tucker College, M.S.University, Tirunelveli, Tamil Nadu, India
Abstract: The "anytime, anywhere access" view of computing is evolving towards "all the time, everywhere access "view of pervasive computing. The "all the time access" requires mobile devices to be always connected, even if connectivity may be compressed due to Access point overload and transient signal degradations. The everywhere access requires mobile devices to use heterogeneous Access Points such as ranging from Bluetooth and 802.11 to 2.5 G and 3 G, leading to high variability of connection status. A wireless management solution that leverages connection availability, while enabling applications such as internet access to be aware of the connection status is thus needed. This paper proposes the efficiency of orthonormal implementation on neural network by comparing, the performance of 3 G wireless Network Architecture, in electronic neural network approach, which provides connection awareness.

Authors: Ruhil A.P., Singh R.R.B., Jain D.K., Patel A.A., Patil G.R.
Title: Development of an artificial neural network based model for shelf-life prediction of Basundi mix -an Indian dairy product
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Computer Centre, National Dairy Research Institute, Karnal-132 001, India; Division of Dairy Technology, National Dairy Research Institute, Karnal-132 001, India
Authors with affiliations: Ruhil, A.P., Computer Centre, National Dairy Research Institute, Karnal-132 001, India; Singh, R.R.B., Division of Dairy Technology, National Dairy Research Institute, Karnal-132 001, India; Jain, D.K., Computer Centre, National Dairy Research Institute, Karnal-132 001, India; Patel, A.A., Division of Dairy Technology, National Dairy Research Institute, Karnal-132 001, India; Patil, G.R., Division of Dairy Technology, National Dairy Research Institute, Karnal-132 001, India
Abstract: Basundi is a popular Indian dairy dessert. A ready-to-reconstitute formulation of this product was developed to overcome the problem of limited shelf life. As the new product was intended for room temperature storage it was expected that during storage and marketing, the product might undergo variable temperature exposure making prediction of shelf life a difficult task. It was therefore envisaged to monitor deteriorative changes in Basundi mix stored at various temperatures (10, 25 and 40°C) using quality indices like pH, hydroxymethylfurfural (HMF), bulk density (BD) and insolubility index (II) which served as the input parameters for model building. The output parameters were sensorily evaluated flavour and total sensory score, which could be related to storage life of the product. A multilayer feed forward neural network model with back propagation algorithm was used for predicting shelf life of Basundi mix employing ANN tool box of MATLAB software. A number of ANN approaches were used to train the network out of which Bayesian regularization algorithm provided stable and consistent results for the given dataset. A total of 140 observations were used and the prediction performance was judged on the basis of percent root mean square error. Relatively lower magnitude of percent root mean square error (%RMS 3.72 for flavour and 1.85 for total sensory score) indicated an excellent fit. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Ghongade R., Ghatol A.
Title: Electrocardiogram pattern classification: An approach employing DCT and artificial neural networks
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Vishwakarma Institute of Information Technology, Pune, India; Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Technological University, Lonere, India
Authors with affiliations: Ghongade, R., Vishwakarma Institute of Information Technology, Pune, India; Ghatol, A., Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Technological University, Lonere, India
Abstract: Most of the deaths in developed and developing countries are attributed to cardiac diseases. Many of the cardiac problems are visible as distortions in the electrocardiogram (ECG).In this paper the authors have attempted to automate this process of cardiac disease diagnosis making use of artificial neural networks. Arrhythmia is the specific cardiac disease dealt with in this paper. The three classes of ECG signals are Normal, Fusion and Premature Ventricular Contraction (PVC). Authors propose to use DCT (discrete cosine transform) as a novel approach for feature extraction. The most important DCT coefficients, about thirty, are identified and used to train an artificial neural network. Various network topologies like MLP, RBF and SOFM are also evaluated. The MLP with one hidden layers with 15 neurons for hidden was found to give best results. The system showed accuracy of more than 98.5% and was tested for various noise level conditions. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Ghosh K., Pal S.K.
Title: Figure-ground segregation: Cues from early vision
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Center for Soft Computing Research, Indian Statistical Institute, 203 B. T. Road, Kolkata-700108, India
Authors with affiliations: Ghosh, K., Center for Soft Computing Research, Indian Statistical Institute, 203 B. T. Road, Kolkata-700108, India; Pal, S.K., Center for Soft Computing Research, Indian Statistical Institute, 203 B. T. Road, Kolkata-700108, India
Abstract: The present work attempts to investigate how cues may be provided from low-level vision that may serve to perform meaningful figure-ground segregation at high level. The model is an eigenfunction-based generalization of the Gaussian Derivative approach to receptive field structure modeling that mimics the extra-classical receptive field of retinal Ganglion cells and those of lateral geniculate nucleus (LGN). The grouping and segmentation performed by this model has been compared with binary images formed after gray level thresholding with the widely referred clustering-based Otsu algorithm. The experiments performed on both benchmark images as well as some synthetic images, mostly brightness perception based illusions, show more meaningful segmentation being performed by the proposed model compared to the gray level thresholding approach. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Dutta L., Gangashetty S.V.
Title: Application of euclidean distance in optimal coupling used in Text to Speech synthesis
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: NITTTR, Kolkata, India; International Institute of Information and Technology, Hyderabad -500 032, India
Authors with affiliations: Dutta, L., NITTTR, Kolkata, India; Gangashetty, S.V., International Institute of Information and Technology, Hyderabad -500 032, India
Abstract: This paper illustrates in brief about the on-going research work in the field of Text to Speech System (TTS) synthesis, specifically on optimal coupling, used to achieve naturalness in concatenative techniques for Indian languages. Our goal is to develop a TTS system that could be trained for any voice in a fully automatic way. That is we would like to develop a customized TTS synthesizer for any voice, reading a predetermined Indian text instead of text in the form of diphones. Our first step in this direction is to generate a natural phoneme synthesizer instead of diphone synthesizer. The constraints in our research paper are limited database and Euclidian distance is used to extract the good spectral feature. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Ekbal A., Naskar S.K., Bandyopadhyay S.
Title: Language independent Named entity transliteration
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engg., Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India
Authors with affiliations: Ekbal, A., Department of Computer Science and Engg., Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India; Naskar, S.K., Department of Computer Science and Engg., Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India; Bandyopadhyay, S., Department of Computer Science and Engg., Jadavpur University, Kolkata-700032, India
Abstract: This paper reports about a modified joint source -channel model that has been used along with a number of alternatives to generate English transliterations of the Bengali, Hindi and Telugu Named entities (NE). The Bengali, Hindi and Telugu NEs are divided into Transliteration Units (TUs) that have the pattern C+M, where C represents a vowel or a consonant or conjunct and M represents the vowel modifier or matra. An English word is divided into TUs that have the pattern Cz.ast;Vz.ast;, where C represents a consonant and V represents a vowel. The system learns mappings automatically from the bilingual training sets of NEs, particularly person and location names. The output of this mapping process is a decision-list classifier with collocated TUs in the source language and their equivalent TUs in collocation in the target language along with the probability of each decision obtained from the training set. Evaluation of the proposed models in terms of Word Agreement Ratio (WAR) and Transliteration Unit Agreement Ratio (TUAR) demonstrated that the modified joint source-channel model performs best for Bengali, Hindi and Telugu to English transliterations. All the transliteration models have been tested for English to Bengali transliteration and it has been observed that the modified joint source-channel performs best in terms of evaluation parameters, WAR and TUAR. The Bengali to English (B2E) and English to Bengali (E2B) transliteration systems have also been tested with the help of linguistic knowledge in the form of conjuncts and diphthongs in Bengali and their corresponding representations in English. It has been observed that with the inclusion of linguistic knowledge the modified joint source-channel model performs best. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Title: On construction of a geometrynet
Source title: Proceedings of the IASTED International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Applications, AIA 2007

Abstract: GeometryNet can be considered as a lexical database for geometric entities and concepts. The idea is borrowed from WordNet, a popular knowledge repository often used for natural language processing tasks in AI applications. The basic objective behind the construction of a GeometryNet is to analyze and understand the geometric problems and draw relevant geometric figures automatically. Initial emphasis is put on machine understanding of problem statements that involve geometric constructions. School level geometry problems practiced by students of age group 13-16 are targeted. This paper explains different aspects of a GeometryNet, issues behind its construction, and its possible use for machine understanding of geometric problem statements.

Authors: Sarkar S., Ghosh K., Bhaumik K.
Title: Stochastic resonance in the perceptual interpretation of zero crossing maps: A low level center surround model of vision
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Microelectronics Division, Saha Institute of Nuclear Physics, 1/AF Bidhannagar, Kol-64, India; Center for Soft Computing Research, Indian Statistical Institute, 203 B. T. Road, Kol-108, India; West Bengal University of Technology, BF 142 Bidhannagar, Kol-64, India
Authors with affiliations: Sarkar, S., Microelectronics Division, Saha Institute of Nuclear Physics, 1/AF Bidhannagar, Kol-64, India; Ghosh, K., Center for Soft Computing Research, Indian Statistical Institute, 203 B. T. Road, Kol-108, India; Bhaumik, K., West Bengal University of Technology, BF 142 Bidhannagar, Kol-64, India
Abstract: Traditionally the intensity discontinuities in a monochrome image are detected as zero crossings of the second derivative with the help of a Laplacian of Gaussian (LOG) operator that models the receptive field of retinal Ganglion cells. Such zero-crossings supposedly form a raw primal sketch edge map of the external world in the primary visual cortex of the brain. On the basis of the recent physiological evidences, we have modified the existing center-surround model of the receptive field of the Ganglion cells. and consequently observed the importance of the higher derivatives in zero crossing detection particularly in the presence of noise. Zero crossing points, thus generated, produce a better primal sketch in the form of a halftone image. Apart from the edge information these sketches also retain shading information of the original image in the form of zero-crossing density variation. We have also observed that an optimal amount of noise contamination produces better representation of the original image. We show that this phenomenon is similar in nature to that of SR phenomenon observed in psychophysical experiments. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Veeramanju K.T., Srinidhi R., Sukumar M., Venkatesha C.S.
Title: ANN based tool condition monitoring and prediction of tool status
Source title: Proceedings of the 2007 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2007
Affiliations: Dept. of Electrical and Electronics, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore-570006, Karnataka, India; Dept. of Mechanical Engineering, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore-570006, Karnataka, India; Dept. of Instrumentation Technology, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore-570006, Karnataka, India; Dept. of Mechanical Engineering, University B.D.T. College of Engineering, Davanagere-577404, Karnataka, India
Authors with affiliations: Veeramanju, K.T., Dept. of Electrical and Electronics, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore-570006, Karnataka, India; Srinidhi, R., Dept. of Mechanical Engineering, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore-570006, Karnataka, India; Sukumar, M., Dept. of Instrumentation Technology, Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore-570006, Karnataka, India; Venkatesha, C.S., Dept. of Mechanical Engineering, University B.D.T. College of Engineering, Davanagere-577404, Karnataka, India
Abstract: Industry demands optimal performance from the machineries. The performance of manually operated and human monitored systems are mainly dependent on the operating personnel. Production process and optimal performance of automated process can further be improved if human intelligence and observations can be inbuilt into a machine system. In automated machine tools, condition monitoring of cutting tools is very important to determine the expected tool life. Tool monitoring is becoming important as most of the times reduced performance is attributed to worn out tools. Acoustic Emission (AE) signal analysis has emerged as a promising tool condition monitoring technique. AE Signal parameters such as Ring Down Count (RDC), Rise Time (RTT), Event Duration (EDT), Energy (ENT) and Peak Amplitude (PA) have been widely used by various researchers in tool status monitoring. Artificial Neural Networks (ANN) have emerged as powerful pattern classifiers because of their better generalization and fault tolerance. Artificial Neural Networks(ANN) have high discriminatory power to handle variations in the input features. In this research work, we have implemented a incremental learning Radial Basis Function (RBF) called Resource Allocating Network (RAN) neural network trained using the Acoustic Emission Parameters as input features. The trained neurnl network is capable of handling input features with noise and predict the condition of tool.

Authors: Nouh Y., Nagarajan V., Nadarajan R.
Title: BiTutor - Decision making and tutoring strategy in Bayesian intelligent system
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007

Authors with affiliations: Nouh, Y., Department of Mathematics and Computer Applications, PSG College of Technology, Coimbatore 641004, Tamil Nadu, India; Nagarajan, V., Department of Mathematics and Computer Applications, PSG College of Technology, Coimbatore 641004, Tamil Nadu, India; Nadarajan, R., Department of Mathematics and Computer Applications, PSG College of Technology, Coimbatore 641004, Tamil Nadu, India
Abstract: This paper proposes a decision model for BiTutor using Decision Bayesian Networks. The BiTutor is a Bayesian Intelligent Tutoring System whose architecture is composed of intelligent modules like student model, knowledge domain and the adaptation module. Bayesian Networks are used to assess users' state of knowledge and preferences, in order to suggest pedagogical options and recommend future steps in the tutor. A fully developed BiTutor will provide an interactively-rich learning environment for students that will result in increased achievement. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Rajesh K., Kartik P., Prasanna S.R.M., Sahambi J.S.
Title: Significance of multimodal biometric systems
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Electronics and Communications Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, Guwahati-781039, Assam, India
Authors with affiliations: Rajesh, K., Department of Electronics and Communications Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, Guwahati-781039, Assam, India; Kartik, P., Department of Electronics and Communications Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, Guwahati-781039, Assam, India; Prasanna, S.R.M., Department of Electronics and Communications Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, Guwahati-781039, Assam, India; Sahambi, J.S., Department of Electronics and Communications Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, Guwahati-781039, Assam, India
Abstract: Establishing identity is becoming critical in our vastly inter- connected society. Questions such as "Is she really who she claims to be?," "Is this person authorized to use this facility?" are routinely being posed in a variety of scenarios ranging from issuing a driver's licence to gaining entry into a country. Biometric recognition refers to an automatic recognition of individuals based on a feature vector(s) derived from their physiological and/or behavioral characteristic. Biometric recognition systems should provide a reliable personal recognition schemes to either confirm or determine the identity of an individual. Applications of such a system include computer systems security, secure electronic banking, mobile phones, credit cards, secure access to buildings, health and social services. By using biometrics a person could be identified based on "who she/he is" rather than "what she/he has" (card, token, key) or "what she/he knows" (password, PIN). In this paper, a brief overview of biometric systems, both unimodal and multimodal, and their advantages and disadvantages, will be presented. In addition to that, implementation of multimodal biometric system using speech and signature features is introduced. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Sudha S., Beula Sahaya Hepziba J.
Title: Hybrid Particle Swarm Optimization for Rectilinear Steiner Arborescence problem
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Thiagarajar College of Engineering, Madurai, Tamil Nadu, India
Authors with affiliations: Sudha, S., Thiagarajar College of Engineering, Madurai, Tamil Nadu, India; Beula Sahaya Hepziba, J., Thiagarajar College of Engineering, Madurai, Tamil Nadu, India
Abstract: This paper presents finding minimal Rectilinear Steiner Arborescence using Hybrid PSO. Given a set of points in the first quadrant, a Rectilinear Steiner Arborescence (RSA) is a Steiner tree rooted at the origin, containing all points, and composed solely of horizontal and vertical edges oriented from left to right, or from bottom to top. The minimum rectilinear Steiner Arborescence problem seeks a tree of minimum total length. This is an NP-Complete problem. The complexity of finding MRSA for set of points in the plane is difficult and it is an open problem. HPSO is PSO with breeding strategies have the potential to achieve faster convergence and to find a better solution. We have used HPSO to find the optimal solution and tested with the bench mark data provided in Beasley's OR-Library [1]. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Author Keywords: Hybrid PSO; Rectilinear Steiner Arborescence; Steiner tree

Authors: Noushath S., Rao A., Hemantha Kumar G.
Title: Performance evaluation of subspace methods and a study of their robust behavior
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Dept of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore - 570 006, India; Dept of Electronics and Communication, Shri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore, India
Authors with affiliations: Noushath, S., Dept of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore - 570 006, India; Rao, A., Dept of Electronics and Communication, Shri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore, India; Hemantha Kumar, G., Dept of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore - 570 006, India
Abstract: Methods based on explicit facial features and metrics for comparison, an intuitive and popular kind of approaches during the early days of face recognition research, are being sparingly used now due to its sensitiveness to noise. In this paper, comprehensive performance evaluation of twenty different alternate methods known as subspace methods are carried out under several important real time test conditions. A mathematical model as a preprocessing step is also suggested for existing FLD based methods to improve the classification performance. We have also carried out experiments to study the robust behavior of these algorithms under several noise conditions modeled by continuous distributions and used in their discretized version. We observed the performances of these algorithms on data taken from three standard databases namely ORL, FERET and the Yale. Some theoretical aspects of the algorithm and the analysis of the simulations are also presented. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Sharma A.
Title: Step integration based fusion algorithm for multimodal biometrics
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2007, AIPR 2007
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee-247667, India
Authors with affiliations: Sharma, A., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee-247667, India
Abstract: The present day needs of the society for an efficient and more reliable identification system has given birth to the biometric matcher technology. Over the years, efforts have been made to improve the detection and recognition performance of the biometric systems, and at the same time reduce the processing time of the systems for a faster identification. One of the approaches for performance optimization is to fuse two or more biometric matcher technologies to add on to the performance of the individual systems. In the present paper, we propose a new step integration based fusion method for multimodal biometric technologies, based upon eliminative machine learning. The individual matcher systems are integrated in steps eliminating unwanted user classes at each matcher step. The method achieves high accuracies and recognition rates, achieving low processing times at the same time. We compare our approach with simple sum fusion technique because of the simplicity and high accuracy rates associated with the simple sum method.

Abstract: The sampling problem for a shift-invariant space in L2(Rn) arising out of certain subclass of Schwarz class of rapidly decreasing functions is discussed. This is proved to be useful in reconstructing an image from its nonuniform sample values. An algorithm is provided along with illustrations using MatLab.

Authors: Hanmandlu M., Vineel D., Singh G.
Title: Computer aided fuzzy based technique for detection of suspicious masses and microcalcifications from mammographic images
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Electrical Engineering Dept., IIT Delhi, Hauz Khas, New Delhi-110016, India; Medical Physics Unit, IRCH, AIIMS, New Delhi-110029, India
Authors with affiliations: Hanmandlu, M., Electrical Engineering Dept., IIT Delhi, Hauz Khas, New Delhi-110016, India; Vineel, D., Electrical Engineering Dept., IIT Delhi, Hauz Khas, New Delhi-110016, India; Singh, G., Medical Physics Unit, IRCH, AIIMS, New Delhi-110029, India
Abstract: Mammograms are best suited to breast cancer detection. Many computer aided techniques are available to assist the radiologist in taking crucial decisions. A method of microcalcification detection from digitized mammograms is presented. This method uses the LoG (Laplacian-of-a-Gaussian) filter; it is not significantly sensitive to noise. Before the application of LoG filter, the image is subjected to background subtraction which equalizes the background to some extent. LoG filter is applied with a specific standard deviation. The response of LoG filter is considered and pixel level contrast measure is used to discriminate between microcalcification and normal tissue. A description, an implementation of the proposed method is presented. This article also describes a segmentation technique that uses the fuzzy texture segmentation to provide mass detection in digitized breast images. The technique consists of two steps: first step using fuzzification with sigmoidal membership function and defuzzification and second step consists of entropic thresholding to get the segmented image. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Author Keywords: Breast cancer; Entropic thresholding; Entropy; Fuzzy segmentation; Fuzzy texture; Laplacian of Gaussian filter; Microcalcification

Authors: Rama Mohan Reddy G., Kalyanaraman V.
Title: Online incremental machine learning in design
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2007, AIPR 2007
Affiliations: Structural Engineering Laboratory, Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai-600036, India
Authors with affiliations: Rama Mohan Reddy, G., Structural Engineering Laboratory, Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai-600036, India; Kalyanaraman, V., Structural Engineering Laboratory, Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai-600036, India
Abstract: Current software technologies enable modeling of the open ended nature of the design process in a modular and efficient manner using object oriented and other such methods. Various AI techniques have enabled representation of knowledge in visible and easily up gradable fashion for use in such design software. All these technologies have rendered design software more flexible and user friendly for solving the open ended design problem emulating usual design practice. However, a designer learns from his earlier design experiences and thus improves his design capability and design output with time. Although machine learning technologies have made great strides in the past decade, demonstration of the ability to capture the design knowledge in real time, assimilating it and using it subsequent designs has been very limited. In this paper the Locally Weighted Projection Regression method is briefly explained and its application to online incremental learning of structural engineering design is demonstrated.

Authors: Shekar B.H., Thippeswamy G., Nagabhushan P., Guru D.S.
Title: Polar-eigenspace: A linear transformation invariant model for appearance based object / face recognition
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, Mangalore University, Mangalagangotri, Mangalore, Karnataka, India; Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Sir M Vishweswaraiah Institute of Technology, Yalahanka, Bangalore, Karnataka, India; Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Manasagangotri, Mysore, Karnataka, India
Authors with affiliations: Shekar, B.H., Department of Computer Science, Mangalore University, Mangalagangotri, Mangalore, Karnataka, India; Thippeswamy, G., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Sir M Vishweswaraiah Institute of Technology, Yalahanka, Bangalore, Karnataka, India; Nagabhushan, P., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Manasagangotri, Mysore, Karnataka, India; Guru, D.S., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Manasagangotri, Mysore, Karnataka, India
Abstract: In this work, we present a polar-eigenspace representation scheme for appearance based object recognition. Given an object or a face image, we first transform to its polar coordinate (r, θ) representation called polar image using the center of mass of the image as the origin. Fourier spectrum of a polar image is obtained for achieving invariance to linear transformations (in-plane rotation and scale) and then subjected to the standard principal component analysis (PCA) to construct polar-eigenspace. Experiments conducted on COIL-20 dataset and AT&T face dataset show that the proposed polareigenspace representation is invariant to linear transformations and hence is suitable for real time practical recognition applications. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Nandedkar A.V., Biswas P.K.
Title: Learning from missing data: A Reflex Fuzzy Min-Max Neural Network approach
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, Kharagpur, India
Authors with affiliations: Nandedkar, A.V., Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, Kharagpur, India; Biswas, P.K., Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, Kharagpur, India
Abstract: A Reflex Fuzzy Min-Max Neural Network (RFMN) capable of learning from missing data is presented. Many real world problems involve machine leaning with missing values or attributes. Thus, learning with missing or incomplete data is an important issue for the practical implementation of pattern recognition systems. The conventional approach to this problem is to impute missing values by substituting their estimates. The proposed RFMN uses an evidence based learning approach. It extracts the underlying structure in the missing data from the available features or attributes only. The learned classes are represented by an aggregation of hyperbox fuzzy sets. A novel concept of reflex mechanism, inspired from human brain is used to handle class overlaps. The main advantage of RFMN is that it learns the data on-line and in a single pass though. Experimental results on real datasets show a better performance of RFMN. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Krishna S., Kaushik S.
Title: Automatic conversion of HTML pages to semantic web pages
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi, India
Authors with affiliations: Krishna, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi, India; Kaushik, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi, India
Abstract: The simplicity and proliferation of World Wide Web (WWW) has taken the availability of information to an unprecedented level. Moreover, this entire available information is in unstructured textual format that results search process inefficient. Simultaneously, development of web technology led to the new concept of semantic web [1], which is an extension of current web and seeks to make information understandable by machines. This creation of semantic web content involves semantic annotation of the web pages, extraction of essential data from the annotated web page and finally generation of semantic web page through processes that require high degree of engineering skill. We have developed integrated tool that helps in creation of semantic web page based on ontology [4] from HTML web page, thus enabling computers and people to work in cooperation in a better way. Semantic web page will help to process user's query in meaningful way. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Thammi Reddy K., Shashi M., Pratap Reddy L.
Title: Rough set based document ranking system
Source title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition 2007, AIPR 2007
Affiliations: Dept of Computer Science and Engineering, GITAM, Visakhapatnam, India; Dept. of Computer Science and Systems Engineering, Andhra University, Visakhapatnam, India; Dept. of Electronics and Communications Engineering, JNTU, Hyderabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Thammi Reddy, K., Dept of Computer Science and Engineering, GITAM, Visakhapatnam, India; Shashi, M., Dept. of Computer Science and Systems Engineering, Andhra University, Visakhapatnam, India; Pratap Reddy, L., Dept. of Electronics and Communications Engineering, JNTU, Hyderabad, India
Abstract: Information Retrieval systems used in digital libraries need to find the extent of similarity between a pair of text documents for providing access to topically relevant documents on one hand and for identifying document replication on the other hand. In this paper the details of a Rough Set based Document Ranking system (RSDRS) developed by the authors are presented. The terms associated with related concepts are grouped together to form equivalence classes by clustering the terms of the vocabulary. The query passage and the documents are represented as rough sets using these equivalence classes of terms and further partitioned into families of rough sets in higher level approximation spaces which impose partial ordering on the families of documents with reference to the query passage. Documents falling in the same family are ordered in accordance with their similarity to the query to form the relevance ranking of the documents. The performance of the RSDRS is analyzed using Average Precision metric by computing the precision at different positions in the ranking list.

Authors: Moitra D., Dhar S., Mallick J.M., Sikdar B.K.
Title: Cellular automata model for cost optimal design of steel building frames
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Bengal Engineering and Science University, Shibpur, Howrah, 711103, India; Department of Computer Science and Technology, Bengal Engineering and Science University, Shibpur, Howrah, 711103, India
Authors with affiliations: Moitra, D., Department of Civil Engineering, Bengal Engineering and Science University, Shibpur, Howrah, 711103, India; Dhar, S., Department of Civil Engineering, Bengal Engineering and Science University, Shibpur, Howrah, 711103, India; Mallick, J.M., Department of Civil Engineering, Bengal Engineering and Science University, Shibpur, Howrah, 711103, India; Sikdar, B.K., Department of Computer Science and Technology, Bengal Engineering and Science University, Shibpur, Howrah, 711103, India
Abstract: Provision of a well-designed bracing system leads to an economical design of tall steel building frames. A large number of design alternatives exist regarding the choice of bracing pattern and the placing of braces. In the conventional design procedure based on the principles of structural engineering, it is nearly impossible to arrive at an appropriate design of the bracing system that may lead to optimum design of the entire structure. This work proposes a novel approach in designing the steel building frames. The target is to find a cost optimal steel structure through proper placing of bracings. The proposed design scheme is developed around the modeling tool of cellular automata (CA). It offers better alternatives and an easier way to arrive at a near-optimum solution in zero time. The exhaustive experimental results point to the fact that the proposed CA based approach is most effective, while considering the design of tall building frames, and can reuse a design for scalability. Authors: Ghosh S., Mujumdar P.P.
Title: Modeling GCM and scenario uncertainty: An imprecise probability approach
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore - 560 012, India
Authors with affiliations: Ghosh, S., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore - 560 012, India; Mujumdar, P.P., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore - 560 012, India
Abstract: Hydrologic implications of global climate change are usually assessed by downscaling appropriate predictors simulated by General Circulation Models (GCMs). Results from GCM simulations are subjected to a number of uncertainties due to incomplete knowledge about the underlying geophysical processes of global change (GCM uncertainties) and due to uncertain future scenarios (scenario uncertainties). With a relatively small number of GCMs available and a finite number of scenarios simulated by them, uncertainties in the hydrologic impacts at a smaller spatial scale become particularly pronounced due to incomplete knowledge or information. In this study, incorporation of incomplete knowledge or partial ignorance in assessment of drought, based on GCM projections, is performed with imprecise probability, which can be defined as a probability with upper and lower bounds. Statistical downscaling based on fuzzy clustering is used to model precipitation from GCM output of Mean Sea Level Pressure (MSLP). Precipitation is then converted to a suitable drought index for assessing the severity. Probability density function (pdf) of the drought indicator, which is a random variable at each time step, is determined by fitting a normal distribution with interval regression, resulting in imprecise normal distribution to model the partial ignorance about future scenario and uncertainty associated with the assumption of normal distribution. Using the imprecise pdf, the imprecise probability of different categories of drought, viz., extreme, severe or mild drought is determined. The methodology is demonstrated with a case study of droughtprone Orissa meteorological subdivision, India. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Author Keywords: Climate Change; Imprecise Probability; Statistical Downscaling; Uncertainty Modeling

Authors: Janga Reddy M., Nagesh Kumar D.
Title: Multi-objective differential evolution approach for optimal control of water resource systems
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Bombay, Mumbai - 400 076, India; Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore - 560 012, India
Authors with affiliations: Janga Reddy, M., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Bombay, Mumbai - 400 076, India; Nagesh Kumar, D., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore - 560 012, India
Abstract: Optimal control of water resource systems plays an important role in sustainable development of a nation. In general, most of the water management problems are multi-objective in nature and often involve different types of complexities in their model formulation. Obtaining optimal solutions to such problems is always a challenging task. In multi-objective environment, in order to perceive the effect of a particular decision on the performance of individual goals, various alternatives need to be generated. For multi-objective optimization, classical methods of optimization often face difficulties in generating a sufficiently wide spread of true Pareto optimal solutions. Also it requires a large number of simulation runs to arrive at good Pareto optimal front. Recently multi-objective optimization algorithms based on evolutionary algorithms yielding attractive features to overcome those problems. In this study, an efficient multi-objective evolutionary technique namely multiobjective differential evolution algorithm (MODE) is presented for optimal control of water resource systems, with an application to a case study of reservoir operation. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Mahendra K.R., Das L.B.
Title: Change detection of satellite images for disaster assessments using image registration
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Departmetn of Electronics and Communication Engineering, National Institute of Technology, Calicut, India
Authors with affiliations: Mahendra, K.R., Departmetn of Electronics and Communication Engineering, National Institute of Technology, Calicut, India; Das, L.B., Departmetn of Electronics and Communication Engineering, National Institute of Technology, Calicut, India
Abstract: Change detection is the process of identifying differences in the state of object sand/or phenomena under consideration by observing them at different times. Disaster assessments can be monitored using change detection and recent advances in satellite imagery, in terms of improved spatial and temporal resolutions, allow for reliable identification and prediction of change patterns. The quality of the image registration process of the involved imagery is the key factor that dictates the validity and the reliability of the change detection outcome. The fact that change detection analysis might involve multispectral, multi-source, and/or multi-resolution imagery captured at different times, calls for the development of a robust registration procedure that can handle these types of imageries. Here we use two different image registration techniques for the same set of images, which independently aid the change detection. The comparison of these two helps in verifying the detected changes. A well defined methodology is used for detecting the changes of two images once these images are properly registered and this methodology is capable of eradicating small registration errors and errors due to the radiometric differences. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Ghosh S., Fatima S.S.
Title: Retrieval of XML data: To support NLP applications
Source title: Proceedings of the 2007 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, G. Narayanamma Institute of Technology and Sc., Hyderabad - 500008, Andhra Pradesh, India; BITS, Pilani, Dubai Campus, United Arab Emirates; Dept. of CSE, Osmania Universty, Hyderabad, Andhra Pradesh, India
Authors with affiliations: Ghosh, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, G. Narayanamma Institute of Technology and Sc., Hyderabad - 500008, Andhra Pradesh, India; Fatima, S.S., BITS, Pilani, Dubai Campus, United Arab Emirates, Dept. of CSE, Osmania Universty, Hyderabad, Andhra Pradesh, India
Abstract: Information retrieval (IR) deals with the organization, storage, representation and access to information. An XML document is a database only in the strictest sense of the term. That it is a collection of data. As a database XML has some advantages like it is self-describing, portable & it can describe data in tree or graph structures. At the same time it is considered that XML is verbose and access to data is slow due to parsing & text conversion. Even though it is tough to provide efficient storage, indexes, security, transactions & data integrity, multi-user access, triggers, queries across multiple documents etc. with XML data repository, the application of XML in present & next generation applications and the huge amount of XML data available round the world can not be ignored. So retrieving XML data efficiently - is always a challenge. Hybrid Data Servers, SQL, XPath and WQuery have opened a new era to handle both relational and XML data. XML, has also become the standard framework for publishing on the net, as well as the standard e-commerce language to build B2B and B2C Web services. A major concern for this scenario is the "point of creation" bottleneck, at which creating useful, well-structured XML data can consume unduly amount of time and effort., XML helps the NLP researches, especially the ones with annotated corpus based approaches, by providing them with the knowledge representation frameworks for morphological, syntactic, semantics and/or pragmatics information structure of NL resources. In many cases, XML is able to provide NLP with deeper semantic structure clues and thus realize much more robust, higher precision NLP applications. This paper focuses on the retrieval techniques of XML databases for present and next generation NLP applications.
Author Keywords: Hybrid Data Servers; NLP; XML; XPath; XQuery

Authors: Ali R., Sufyan Beg M.M.
Title: Rough set based Rank Aggregation for the web
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer Engineering, A.M. U., Aligarh-202002, India; Department of Computer Engineering, J.M.I., New Delhi-25, India
Authors with affiliations: Ali, R., Department of Computer Engineering, A.M. U., Aligarh-202002, India; Sufyan Beg, M.M., Department of Computer Engineering, J.M.I., New Delhi-25, India
Abstract: Rank Aggregation is the problem of getting a single consensus ranking for a given set of rankings. In this paper, we present a user feedback based learning algorithm for rank aggregation, which learns ranking rules using rough set theory. We present results of implementation of our algorithm to the problem of meta-searching. In training data set, we use implicit user feedback to the results of seven popular search engines for fifteen queries. We mine the ranking rules using rough set theory. We perform cross-validation test to select the best rules set. We apply the selected rules for aggregating partial lists obtained from the seven search engines in response to another set of thirty seven queries. We also discuss some metrics for rank aggregation. We compare our method with three other rank aggregation methods by using these metrics. We emphasize that main essence of our method is in modeling user's preference. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Author Keywords: Learning algorithm; Rank aggregation; Rough set; User feedback
Index Keywords: Consensus ranking; Cross-validation tests; Meta-searching; Rank aggregation; Ranking rules; Rough set; Rough-set based; Training data sets; User feedback; Artificial intelligence; Learning algorithms; Search engines; Rough set theory

Authors: Majumdar A., Ray S., Bhattacharya A.
Title: Face recognition by multiresolution Contourlet Transform on bit quantized facial images
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: PricewaterhouseCoopers India Pvt. Ltd., India
Authors with affiliations: Majumdar, A., PricewaterhouseCoopers India Pvt. Ltd., India; Ray, S., PricewaterhouseCoopers India Pvt. Ltd., India; Bhattacharya, A., PricewaterhouseCoopers India Pvt. Ltd., India
Abstract: Multiresolution ideas notably the wavelet transform have been profusely employed for addressing problems in face recognition and other problems in computer vision. However, theoretical studies indicate that wavelets are not the ideal image descriptors; they have very crude directional representations and are not anisotropic. A recent development called the Contourlet Transform tries to overcome these shortcomings of wavelets. In this paper, we propose a multiresolution contourlet based method for face recognition. Recognition will be done in three steps. In the first step the original 8 bit image is quantized to 4 bit and 2 bit representations. In the second step, each of the 3 different resolved versions of the image are subjected to contourlet transform at five different resolutions. The approximate contourlet coefficients at each resolution represent a different feature set. In the last step these fifteen (three bit resolved version x five resolutions) sets of coefficients are then used to train separate Support Vector Machines. During testing, the results of the fifteen SVMs are fused to determine the final result. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.
Author Keywords: Contourlet Transform; Face recognition; Support vector machine
Index Keywords: Bit image; Contourlet coefficients; Contourlet transform; Contourlets; Facial images; Feature sets; Ideal images; Multi-resolutions; Theoretical study; Artificial intelligence; Computer vision; Face recognition; Support vector machines

Authors: Ali Sk.F., Samui P.
Title: Confinement efficiency of R C columns with rectangular ties: A SVM approach
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560 012, India
Authors with affiliations: Ali, Sk.F., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560 012, India; Samui, P., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560 012, India
Abstract: Present paper explores the use of support vector machine in modeling and predicting the confinement efficiency of concentrically loaded reinforced concrete columns with rectangular transverse steel. Fifty-five experimental test results have been collected from the literature. A support vector machine (SVM) model with three different kernel functions, namely, radial basis function; polynomial function; and spline has been used for training and testing of the experimental data. A comparative study between the SVM model, neural network model and four parametric models (taken from the literature) has also been carried out. It has been demonstrated that the SVM models can predict well the nonlinear input-output relation in predicting the compressive strength of RC columns with complex input-output relation. Given the six input parameters, selected based on previous studies, SVM models outperform other existing and familiar analytical models as well as neural network predictive model. The close correlation between experimental and calculated values shows that the SVM based modeling is a practical method for predicting the confinement efficiency of RC columns with transverse steel. It can be used as a quick reference when predicting the confinement strength of RC columns by the practicing engineers because it provided instantaneous result once it is properly trained and tested. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Pradeep Varma D., Rakesh M., Sanyal R.
Title: HMM-based language-independent POS tagger
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Pradeep Varma, D., Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad, India; Rakesh, M., Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad, India; Sanyal, R., Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad, India
Abstract: We have developed a Parts-of-Speech tagger using Hidden Markov Models. Both bigram and trigram HMM are implemented and their results are compared. These taggers are tested on English and Indian languages such as Hindi and Urdu to analyze the differences. Proper care is taken regarding issues like smoothing, handling of unknown words and handling cardinal strings. A detailed analysis of the effect of Corpus size on accuracy is done for English, Hindi and Urdu. The analysis shows that the accuracy increases with the size of the corpus and appears to approach an asymptotic limit. This analysis allows us to predict the corpus size required to attain a desired accuracy. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Basu S., Basu S.
Title: Hybrid fuzzy one dimensional cellular automaton with external input
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007

Authors with affiliations: Basu, S., Universitat Rovira i Virgili, Placa Imperial Tarraco 1, 43005, Tarragona, Spain; Basu, S., Lady Brabourne College, P1/2 Suhrawardy Avenue, Kolkata-700014, India
Abstract: In this paper a special type of cellular automaton (CA) model is investigated. This CA model computes effect due to interaction of neighboring cells and effect due to external disturbance on the cells simultaneously. The transition due to both the effects may be represented by a function which is the composition of two functions. Further it is shown that the class of language accepted by hybrid one dimensional fuzzy cellular automaton is included in the class of language accepted by hybrid one dimensional fuzzy cellular automaton with external input (HFCAI). HFCAI is useful for computing growth in evolutionary systems which are also affected by external cause. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Samui P., Das S.
Title: Relevance Vector Machine classifier analysis of slope
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore - 560012, India; Department of Civil Engineering, College of Engg. and Tech, Techno Campus, Ghatikia, Bhubaneswar- 751 003, India
Authors with affiliations: Samui, P., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore - 560012, India; Das, S., Department of Civil Engineering, College of Engg. and Tech, Techno Campus, Ghatikia, Bhubaneswar- 751 003, India
Abstract: The determination of stability of slope is an imperative task in geotechnical engineering. The current research aims at proposing Relevance Vector Machine (RVM) as a novel classification technique for the determination of stability of slope. RVM is based on a Bayesian formulation of a linear model with an appropriate prior that results in a sparse representation. As a consequence, it can generalize well and provide inferences at low computational cost. It also gives probabilistic output through Bayesian inference. In this study, the input data for slope stability determination consist of values of geotechnical and geometrical input parameters. As an output, RVM predicts stability status(s). The results show that RVM approach has the potential to be a practical tool for determination of stability of slope. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Prajapati G.L., Chaudhari N.S., Chandwani M.
Title: An effective model for context-free grammar inference
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Institute of Engineering and Technology, Department of Computer Engineering, Devi Ahilya University, Khandwa Road, Indore, 452017, M.P., India; School of Computer Engineering, Nanyang Technological University, 50, Nanyang Avenue, Singapore, 639798, Singapore
Authors with affiliations: Prajapati, G.L., Institute of Engineering and Technology, Department of Computer Engineering, Devi Ahilya University, Khandwa Road, Indore, 452017, M.P., India; Chaudhari, N.S., School of Computer Engineering, Nanyang Technological University, 50, Nanyang Avenue, Singapore, 639798, Singapore; Chandwani, M., Institute of Engineering and Technology, Department of Computer Engineering, Devi Ahilya University, Khandwa Road, Indore, 452017, M.P., India
Abstract: We study the problem of inferring context-free languages from finite positive samples of structural descriptions based on tree automata model early proposed by Sakakibara [24], where a structural description of a context-free grammar for the target language is an unlabelled derivation tree of the grammar, the shape of parse tree. An inference model is presented for inferring contextfree grammars from positive only examples, and it is shown that it leads to be significantly better than the learning model presented by Sakakibara in this framework. Our model has several desirable features that the output grammar is consistent with the given examples, makes the task of bottom-up parsing easy, runs in O(n3) time in the sum of the sizes of the examples, achieves O(n2) storage space saving and infers a grammar from positive only examples efficiently. Numerous examples are discussed to illustrate the model and its effective execution. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Chinnappa G., Singh A.K.
Title: A java implementation of an extended word alignment algorithm based on the IBM models
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Chinnappa, G., Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India; Singh, A.K., Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India
Abstract: In recent years statistical word alignment models have been widely used for various Natural Language Processing (NLP) problems. In this paper we describe a platform independent and object oriented implementation (in Java) of a word alignment algorithm. This algorithm is based on the first three IBM models. This is an ongoing work in which we are trying to explore the possible enhancements to the IBM models, especially for related languages like the Indian languages. We have been able to improve the performance by introducing a similarity measure (Dice coefficient), using a list of cognates and morph analyzer. Use of information about cognates is especially relevant for Indian languages because these languages have a lot of borrowed and inherited words which are common to more than one language. For our experiments on English-Hindi word alignment, we also tried to use a bilingual dictionary to bootstrap the Expectation Maximization (EM) algorithm. After training on 7399 sentence aligned sentences, we compared the results with GIZA++, an existing word alignment tool. The results indicate that though the performance of our word aligner is lower than that of GIZA++, it can be improved by adding some techniques like smoothing to take care of the data sparsity problem. We are also working on further improvements using morphological information and a better similarity measure etc. This word alignment tool is in the form of an API and is being developed as part of Sanchay, (a collection of tools and APIs for NLP with focus on Indian languages). Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Jayanna H.S., Prasanna S.R.M.
Title: Speaker recognition in limited data conditions using Self-Organizing Map
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Electronics and Communications Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, Guwahati-781039, Assam, India
Authors with affiliations: Jayanna, H.S., Department of Electronics and Communications Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, Guwahati-781039, Assam, India; Prasanna, S.R.M., Department of Electronics and Communications Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, Guwahati-781039, Assam, India
Abstract: In this paper, an evaluation of unsupervised Kohonen Self-Organizing Maps (SOM) and Crisp Vector Quantization (CVQ) classifiers for speaker recognition in limited data condition is presented. We demonstrate through experimental studies that fine tuned SOM yields better recognition performance over CVQ especially in limited data conditions. We already have proposed Variable Frame Rate and Size (VFRS) analysis of speech improves the recognition performance compared to Single Frame Size (SFS) analysis in limited data conditions using CVQ. VFRS technique extracts the features using multi-resolution and multi-shifting concepts. Alternatively, in case of SFS technique the features are extracted with single frame size and rate. To show an alternative model still improves the recognition performance in limited data conditions, we conducted this experiment using SOM. Experimental results show that SOM models are better in limited data conditions. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Dani A.R., Pujari A.K., Gulati V.P.
Title: Strategy proof electronic markets
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Computer and Information Sciences, Institute for Development and Research in Banking Technology, University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Dani, A.R., Department of Computer and Information Sciences, Institute for Development and Research in Banking Technology, University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad, India; Pujari, A.K., Department of Computer and Information Sciences, Institute for Development and Research in Banking Technology, University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad, India; Gulati, V.P., Department of Computer and Information Sciences, Institute for Development and Research in Banking Technology, University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad, India
Abstract: In electronic double auctions, property of incentive compatibility is very important. Incentive compatibility ensures that truthful bidding is the dominant strategy. Other important properties in electronic auctions are budget balance (BB) and individual rationality (IR). The former ensures that the auction does not run in loss whereas the latter ensures voluntary participation. However these can be achieved only after sacrificing efficiency. In this paper we generalize two price single unit double auction mechanism for multiple units. It is shown that our mechanism is efficient and incentive compatible. It is also shown that the mechanism is individual rational. Then we establish the conditions for the existence of desirable mechanism in case of multi unit double auctions. An approach achieving budget balance is also proposed. It is also shown that in our mechanism there is no incentive for demand reduction. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Sheel S., Varshney T.
Title: Identification of nonlinear plant using neural network
Source title: Proceedings of the 2007 International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, ICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology, Allahabad, Uttar Pradesh, India; MIT, Moradabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Sheel, S., Department of Electrical Engineering, Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology, Allahabad, Uttar Pradesh, India; Varshney, T., Department of Electrical Engineering, Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology, Allahabad, Uttar Pradesh, India, MIT, Moradabad, India
Abstract: The ability of a neural network to realize some complex nonlinear function makes them attractive for system identification. In the recent past, neural networks trained with back-propagation learning algorithm have gained attention for the identification of nonlinear dynamic systems. Slower convergence and longer training times are the disadvantages often mentioned when the conventional back-propagation (BP) algorithm are compared with other competing techniques. In addition, in the conventional BP algorithm, the learning rate is fixed and that it is uniform for all weights in a layer. In this paper, we present an improvement to the back-propagation algorithm based on the use of an adaptive learning rate, where the learning rate is adjusted at each iteration to reduce the training time. Simulation results indicate a faster convergence speed and better error minimization as compared to other competing methods.

Authors: Deisy C., Subbulakshmi B., Baskar S., Ramaraj N.
Title: A novel multi thread based feature selection for dimensionality reduction
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Department of ComputerScience and Engineering, Thiagarajar College of Engineering, Madurai, Tamilnadu, India; Department of Electical and Electronics, Thiagarajar College of Engineering, Madurai, Tamilnadu, India; GKM College of Engineering, Chennai, India
Authors with affiliations: Deisy, C., Department of ComputerScience and Engineering, Thiagarajar College of Engineering, Madurai, Tamilnadu, India; Subbulakshmi, B., Department of ComputerScience and Engineering, Thiagarajar College of Engineering, Madurai, Tamilnadu, India; Baskar, S., Department of Electical and Electronics, Thiagarajar College of Engineering, Madurai, Tamilnadu, India; Ramaraj, N., GKM College of Engineering, Chennai, India
Abstract: Feature selection is used to reduce the number of features in many applications where data has hundreds or thousands of features. The quality of the data being analyzed is a critical factor that affects the accuracy of data mining algorithms. There are two important aspects of the data quality, one is relevance and the other is data redundancy. The inclusion of irrelevant and redundant features in the data-mining model results in poor predictions and high computational overhead. This paper focuses on a method that identifies relevant and irredundant features through correlation-based measures using novel multi thread concept which reduces the computation time for feature selection and improve the accuracy .The learning time for the feature selection algorithm in classification approach is based on the dimensionality of the data domain. Normally the learning time is very high when the data is having an increased number of attributes and instances. The multithreaded concept is used for data preprocessing and later, the data is converted into a two dimensional array of primitive types, for faster manipulation. Then the correlation measures of attributes are calculated. The proposed approach is compared with FCBF (Fast Correlation Based Feature Selection) algorithm which is implemented without using thread, and also with the built in Relief Feature selection algorithms available in Weka data mining tool. The proposed algorithm provides better accuracy and reduced time complexity for lung cancer and breast cancer data sets. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Seshikanth Varma C.M.B., Asharaf S., Narasimha Murty M.
Title: Core vector clustering
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
Affiliations: Computer Science and Automation, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560012, India
Authors with affiliations: Seshikanth Varma, C.M.B., Computer Science and Automation, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560012, India; Asharaf, S., Computer Science and Automation, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560012, India; Narasimha Murty, M., Computer Science and Automation, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560012, India
Abstract: Support Vector Machines (SVMs) are emerging as one of the hottest and fruitful learning methodology in Artificial Intelligence. However, despite the prominent properties of SVM, they are not as favored for large-scale data mining as for pattern recognition or machine learning because the training complexity of SVM is highly dependent on the size of a data set. Many real-world data mining applications involve millions or billions of data records and hence, support vector machines may not be applied in real world data-mining scenarios. In this paper, we propose a novel kernel method for data clustering called Core Vector Clustering which is a computationally efficient realization of Support Vector Clustering. Here Support Vector Clustering problem is formulated using an approximate Minimum Enclosing Ball problem and is solved using an approximate Minimum Enclosing Ball finding algorithm. Experiments done with several Large Multi-class datasets such as Forest cover type, and other Multi-class datasets taken from LIBSVM page shows that the proposed strategy is very much efficient in training and finds meaningful hard cluster abstractions which provide a comparable generalization performance when compared to SVM. Copyright © 2007 IICAI.

Authors: Pant M., Radha T., Singh V.P.
Title: Particle Swarm Optimization: Experimenting the distributions of Random Numbers
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2007
