Authors: Gupta S., Mathew T.V.
Title: Micro-simulation of heterogeneous single lane traffic in VISSIM for computing link travel time
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Bombay, Powai Mumbai (Bombay) - 400 076, India
Authors with affiliations: Gupta, S., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Bombay, Powai Mumbai (Bombay) - 400 076, India; Mathew, T.V., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Bombay, Powai Mumbai (Bombay) - 400 076, India
Abstract: Traffic congestion is the most visible manifestation of the failures in urban transportation planning. The concepts of intelligent traffic management system have not been successfully adopted in India. A considerable amount of traffic congestion is caused due to poor information of when and where congestion is occurring and hence the inability to avoild it. Variable message signs (VMS) is one such system, which respond dynamically to traffic congestion and can give information to commuters based on the sensor data. The core of this is the prediction of the link travel time. Coifman [1] proposed a travel time prediction algorithm for the homogeneous traffic considering the spot speed detected from the upstream of a link. In this study, heterogeneous single lane traffic apt for Indian scenario is reproduced in a traffic simulator (VISSIM) and the data generated is used to investigate the behavior of this algorithm. The algorithm is then modified to suit heterogeneous traffic WW w conditions. It was observed that although the estimates are not perfect, it is sufficient for all practical problems. Finally, the study shows how natural computing can be the solution to many traffic problems. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Jain A., Jha S.K., Misra S.
Title: Estimation of concrete slump based on mix constituents using artificial neural networks
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, Kanpur, India
Authors with affiliations: Jain, A., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, Kanpur, India; Jha, S.K., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, Kanpur, India; Misra, S., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, Kanpur, India
Abstract: Artificial neural networks (ANNs) have been employed by various researchers for variety of purposes e.g. modeling, forecasting, classification, and control of complex engineering systems. In this study, ANNs are employed for the estimation of concrete slump using concrete mix proportions. Linear and multiple regression models are also developed for comparison purposes. Many multi-layer feed-forward ANN architectures with back-propagation training algorithm were used for developing ANN models. A wide variety of error statistics was used to determine the best ANN model. The concrete mix constituent and slump data obtained from IIT Kanpur laboratory were employed for model development. The results obtained show that the ANN models consistently outperformed both linear and non-linear regression models in terms of the standard statistical measures during both training and testing data sets. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Kumar A.
Title: Computational model of the hippocampus for encoding and retrieval of events

Authors with affiliations: Kumar, A., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, Kanpur, India
Abstract: There has been considerable research in understanding the functional anatomy of the hippocampus and the role it plays in human memory. Models are being developed by researchers which explain some data and also predict results in novel situations. Following the same pattern of research a number of computational models of hippocampus have been developed. Each model fo-cuses on one particular aspect of memory like recognition memory or episodic memory, hi this work we have implemented a computational model of the hip pocampus winch can perform the task of memorization of events and can re spond to queries related to the memorized events. The implemented model can memorize isolated events as well as sequence of events and can respond to the queries related to them. This work primarily uses the computational model of the hippocampus described in the previous work [5]. The original model is re-implemented with slight changes being made to the original model in order to be used as an episodic memory system. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Basu S., Das N., Sarkar R., Kundu M., Nasipuri M., Basu D.K.
Title: An MLP based approach for recognition of handwritten 'Bangla' numerals
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Computer Science and Engineering Department, MCKV Institute of Engineering, Liluah, Howrah - 711204, India; Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, Kolkata - 700032, India
Authors with affiliations: Basu, S., Computer Science and Engineering Department, MCKV Institute of Engineering, Liluah, Howrah - 711204, India; Das, N., Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, Kolkata - 700032, India; Sarkar, R., Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, Kolkata - 700032, India; Kundu, M., Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, Kolkata - 700032, India; Nasipuri, M., Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, Kolkata - 700032, India; Basu, D.K., Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, Kolkata - 700032, India
Abstract: The work presented here involves the design of a Multi Layer Perceptron (MLP) based pattern classifier for recognition of handwritten Bangla numerals using a 76 element feature set. Bangla is the second most popular script and language in the Indian subcontinent and the fifth most popular language in the world. The feature set developed for representing handwritten Bangla numerals here includes 24 shadow features, 16 centroid features, and 36 longest-run features. The technique is tested with a database of 6000 samples, which is divided in a ratio of 2:1 to form a training set and a test set respectively. After three-fold cross validation of results, the technique yields an average recognition rate of 96.72% on test samples. It is useful for applications related to OCR of handwritten Bangla digits and can also be extended to include OCR of handwritten characters of Bangla alphabet. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Bangla digit; Bangla numeral; Cross validation; Feature sets; Hand-written characters; Multi layer perceptron; Pattern classifier; Recognition rates; Test samples; Test sets; Training sets; Artificial intelligence; Character recognition

Authors: Srivastava A.K., Nema A.K.
Title: Comparison of artificial neural network and ARIMA models for forecasting solid waste quantities
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, New Delhi, India
Authors with affiliations: Srivastava, A.K., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, New Delhi, India; Nema, A.K., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, New Delhi, India
Abstract: Effective operation of solid waste management system is a challenging task. In the last two decades, considerable research effort has been made towards the development of models for selection of waste management facilities, waste allocation and vehicle routing. However, successful planning for a solid waste management system depends critically on the accurate prediction of the quantities of solid waste generated. A number of researchers have forecasted it using ARIMA model, which was initially presented by Box -Jenkins. Recently Artificial Neural Network (ANN) has received promising performance in the area of Control and Pattern Recognition. This paper compares forecasted solid waste generation pattern by Back Propagation Neural Network (BPNN) and Neural Network Regression (NNR) models of ANN with ARIMA model. A case of Municipal Solid Waste (MSW) of Delhi is considered for the study. The performances of the models are judged by comparing the mean absolute percentage error (MAPE) with same of Box - Jenkins Model. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Accurate prediction; ARIMA models; Back-propagation neural networks; Mean absolute percentage error; Research efforts; Solid waste generation; Solid waste management systems; Waste management facility; Municipal solid waste; Pattern recognition; Waste management; Neural networks

Authors: Wagholikar K., Sutar S., Deshpande A.
Title: Fuzzy modeling in medical diagnosis: A case studv for cardiovascular diseases
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Bioinformatics Center, University of Pune, Pune - 411007, India; Special Interest Group (SIG), Berkeley Initiative in Soft Computing (BlSC), Environment Management Systems (EMS), United States; University of California, Berkeley CA, United States; Department of Bioinformatics, University of Pune, India
Authors with affiliations: Wagholikar, K., Bioinformatics Center, University of Pune, Pune - 411007, India; Sutar, S., Bioinformatics Center, University of Pune, Pune - 411007, India; Deshpande, A., Special Interest Group (SIG), Berkeley Initiative in Soft Computing (BlSC), Environment Management Systems (EMS), United States, University of California, Berkeley CA, United States, Department of Bioinformatics, University of Pune, India
Abstract: Medicine is one field in which efforts were initiated in mid- 70' s on modeling of uncertainties using soft computing techniques. The descriptions of disease entities often use linguistic terms that are inherently vague. The uncertainty found in the process of diagnosis prompted the use of fuzzy set theory. We have revisited max- min fuzzy operations used in medical diagnosis with a case study of cardiovascular diseases identified by a team of experts (cardiologists) and compared the accuracy of the algorithm for 42 diagnostic records. Vagueness in the perception of the experts in describing the symptoms in linguistic terms for the diseases has been the primary focus of the analysis. The study demonstrates the utility of fuzzy modeling and need for further research. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Cardio-vascular disease; Fuzzy modeling; Fuzzy operation; Linguistic terms; Softcomputing techniques; Artificial intelligence; Diseases; Fuzzy set theory; Linguistics; Soft computing; Uncertainty analysis; Diagnosis

Authors: Pingali P., Jagadeesh J., Varma V., Indurkhya B.
Title: Exploring creative concepts in the nearest neighborhood using lexical ontologies
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Pingali, P., Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India; Jagadeesh, J., Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India; Varma, V., Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India; Indurkhya, B., Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India
Abstract: Conceptual blending is an important area of research for creativity modeling. In this paper we present a creativity model that takes an existing blend and generates new blends using the nearest neighborhood replacements from a lexical ontology. For example "Artificial Intelligence" is a compounded concept comprising of "Artificiality" and "Intelligence" as two sub-concepts. After concept generation, the system comes up with "Artificial Creativity" as one of the generated concepts. This project is part of a larger ongoing project called CAPRICON whose goal is to provide with stimuli for new futuristic concepts. This tool is a creativity enhancement tool that helps users enhance their creative thinking by providing stimuli for new concepts. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Concept generation; Creative thinking; Creativity models; Lexical ontology; Nearest neighborhood; Blending; Artificial intelligence

Authors: Manoria M., Sinhal A., Maheshwarr M.
Title: Writer identification using texture analysis
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Samrat Ashok Technological Institute, Vidisha, M.P., India; Department of Computer Science and Engineering, University Institute of Technology, Barkatullah University, Bhopal, M.P., India; Department of Computer Science, Makhanlal Chaturvedi Rashtriya Patrakarita Vishwa Vidyalaya (MCRPW), Bhopal, M.P., India
Authors with affiliations: Manoria, M., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Samrat Ashok Technological Institute, Vidisha, M.P., India; Sinhal, A., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, University Institute of Technology, Barkatullah University, Bhopal, M.P., India; Maheshwarr, M., Department of Computer Science, Makhanlal Chaturvedi Rashtriya Patrakarita Vishwa Vidyalaya (MCRPW), Bhopal, M.P., India
Abstract: In this paper, we describe a new method to identify the writer of handwritten documents. There are many methods for signature verification or writer identification, but most of them require segmentation or connected component analysis. They are the kinds of content dependent identification methods as signature verification requires the writer to write the same text (e.g. his name). In our new method, we take the handwriting as an image containing some special texture, and writer identification is regarded as texture identification. This is a content independent for a particular script. We apply the well-established 2-D Gabor filtering technique and grey scale co-occurrence matrices to extract features of such textures and a weighted Euclidean distance classifier and K-nearest neighbor classifier to fulfill the identification task. Experiments are made using handwritings from different people in different languages and very promising results were achieved. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Co-occurrence-matrix; Connected component analysis; Content dependent; Gabor filtering; Grey scale; Handwritten document; Identification method; K-nearest neighbor classifier; Signature verification; Texture analysis; Weighted euclidean distance; Writer identification; Artificial intelligence; Textures

Abstract: A model of the mammalian retinal ganglion cells, to be implemented neuromorphically, has been presented. The model incorporates contributions not only from the outer, but also from the inner plexiform layer of the retina. It has been shown that such a system is capable of yielding better filters for detecting edges compared to the silicon retina models reported in literature. The results have been explained in terms of the power spectra for the corresponding two operators. The same model can also be applied in carrying out enhancement of images. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Abstract: We describe the system Euclid for automatically finding various ge-ometrical properties of a triangle starting from a set of relations and operators defined over categories like scalars, points, lines (or line-segments), angles and triangles. Euclid is comprised of a knowledge base consisting of the definitions of categories, relations and operators, a search algorithm and a set of constraints and pruning strategies to guide the search. We describe each component and also the theoretical properties of the search algorithm. Euclid's efficacy is demonstrated by the interesting potential theorems it is able to discover about triangles. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Abstract: The paper presents the stabilization of multimachine power system using genetic algorithm based fuzzy logic power system stabilizer. A two area, four-generator power system is used to demonstrate the effectiveness of genetic based fuzzy logic power system stabilizer (GFLPSS). The Integral of squared time squared error (ISTSE) technique is used for the simultaneous tuning of parameters of fuzzy logic power system stabilizer (FLPSS). The effectiveness of the GFLPSS in damping local and interarea modes of oscillations in multimachine power system over a wide range of loading conditions have been verified through performance analysis. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Jagadeesh J., Varma V.
Title: Single document summarization using natural language processing
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Jagadeesh, J., Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India; Varma, V., Language Technologies Research Centre, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India
Abstract: The need for text summarization is crucial as we enter the era of information overload. However, the current implementations are specific to a domain or a genre of the source document. In this paper, we discuss an algorithm for text summarization which is independent of domain and document source. This algorithm creates text summaries by analyzing the logical struc-ture of the sentences. Sentences are parsed and important relationships are identified, stored in the form of a graph, thus graph corresponding to each sentence in the document is generated and merged to form graph of the document, now this graph is clustered into sub-graphs which represent the different topics in the document. Then a graph scoring algorithm scores the graph, and helps in extracting the important sentences towards summary. To increase the coherence of the summary, the pool of extracted sentences undergoes some transformation in a specified order, resulting in final sentences that form the summary of the document. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Information overloads; NAtural language processing; Scoring algorithms; Single document summarization; Subgraphs; Text summarization; Algorithms; Artificial intelligence; Natural language processing systems; Text processing

Abstract: Approximating a fuzzy set under the given knowledge is necessary in several decision-making problems. This paper deals with approximating a fuzzy set by using fuzzy partition. Here, some types of bags are introduced and the theory of fuzzy rough bags is developed, by using the algebra spanned by the fuzzy partition. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Title: Optimal train rescheduling for single track railway line
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005

Authors with affiliations: Kyavars, S., Engineering Research Center, Tata Motors, Pimpri, India; Potluri, R., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur, 208016, India
Abstract: Train traffic rescheduling is a problem of current active research. A search on the World Wide Web shows that in many countries, dispatchers use paper and pencil techniques to reschedule trains. At the time of writing this paper, very few countries in the world had announced development of software for rescheduling. In the present work two solutions are presented for the problem of train traffic rescheduling on a single-track railway. The first solution uses 0 - 1 Integer Programming and is an adaptation of a solution existing in the literature for the problem of Air Traffic Control. This solution takes a long time to run. So, a sub-optimal solution has been developed that uses fuzzy logic and that has a shorter running time. The parameters of the fuzzy logic controller are tuned offline so that the fuzzy logic solution is close to the 0-1 integer programming solution. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Sarma K.K., Bora P.K., Mahanta C.
Title: Innovative feature set for multi layered perceptron(MLP) based assamese character recognition
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, Guwahati-781039 Assam, India
Authors with affiliations: Sarma, K.K., Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, Guwahati-781039 Assam, India; Bora, P.K., Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, Guwahati-781039 Assam, India; Mahanta, C., Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, Guwahati-781039 Assam, India
Abstract: Classification and recognition performance of a neural network based Optical Character Recognition (OCR) system, to a large extent, depends upon the feature set used to train the neural network. The feature vector represents a unique set of data providing relevant information regarding shape, size, morphology etc. of characters. The feature set, therefore, must have lower correlatedness between the training samples for providing better classification and recognition results. Our proposed feature set is a hybrid one formed by selective mixture of geometrical, statistical, morphological and tomographic features. The aim is to minimize redundancy among training samples and components of the feature vector, but at the same time improve their robustness and invariance to shape and size. The proposed feature vector is used for character recognition of Assamese language which is an important language spoken in the North Eastern part of India. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Classification and recognition; Feature sets; Feature vectors; Multi-layered; Perceptron; Shape and size; Tomographic; Training sample; Optical character recognition; Sampling; Artificial intelligence

Authors: Khan N.S.
Title: Analysis and removal of artifacts in 3-D LADAR data
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Rishiraj Institute of Technology, Sanwer Road, Revati, Indore (M.P.) - 452001, India
Authors with affiliations: Khan, N.S., Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Rishiraj Institute of Technology, Sanwer Road, Revati, Indore (M.P.) - 452001, India
Abstract: This paper presents a survey of mixed pixel phenomena and a method of removing mixed pixels from scenes stored as 3-D points. The paper further reveals that mixed pixels are points in LADAR data which occur when the measurement beam intersects two objects at within a certain range of distances apart. The resulting return signal represents data from both objects; the laser electronics read this as a single point, but not at the real location of either object. As such, mixed pixels present an obstacle to accurate analysis of a scene. It also highlights that method does not depend on the sensor used to originally collect the data, and is efficient and effective. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: 3-D LADAR; Accurate analysis; Mixed pixel; Return signals; Single point; Artificial intelligence; Pixels; Optical radar

Authors: Bijral A.S., Palshikar G.K.
Title: Milling interesting temporal patterns: An information theoretic approach
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, University of Colorado, Boulder 80309, United States; Tata Research Development and Design Centre, 54 B Hadapsar Industrial Estate, Pune 411 013, India
Authors with affiliations: Bijral, A.S., Department of Computer Science, University of Colorado, Boulder 80309, United States; Palshikar, G.K., Tata Research Development and Design Centre, 54 B Hadapsar Industrial Estate, Pune 411 013, India
Abstract: Interesting patterns in temporal databases have equivalently been treated in literature as novelties or surprises. In this paper we propose a Information Theoretic framework for detecting interestingness that can handle most subjective notions of what might be interesting in temporal data . Based on this framework, a mutual information measure is derived using kernel based nonparametric probability density estimation techniques to assess interestingness of a temporal sub-sequence given another. This measure is then utilized in a sliding windows algorithm to detect all possible interesting sub-sequences with respect to a reference sequence. The algorithm's effectiveness is shown to be independent of the parameter choice for the density estimates and its advantages over other prominent techniques are discussed. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Hareesha K.S., Gangashetty S.V., Ramaswamy V.
Title: Support vector machines for face recognition
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Image Processing Laboratory, Bapuji Institute of Engineering and Technology, Davangere - 577 004, Karnataka, India
Authors with affiliations: Hareesha, K.S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Image Processing Laboratory, Bapuji Institute of Engineering and Technology, Davangere - 577 004, Karnataka, India; Gangashetty, S.V., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Image Processing Laboratory, Bapuji Institute of Engineering and Technology, Davangere - 577 004, Karnataka, India; Ramaswamy, V., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Image Processing Laboratory, Bapuji Institute of Engineering and Technology, Davangere - 577 004, Karnataka, India
Abstract: Face recognition is one of the challenging problems in human-computer interaction. An automated face recognition system requires an efficient method for detection of face region in the image sequence, extraction of facial features, and construction of a recognition model. In recent years, support vector machines (SVMs) have demonstrated excellent performance in a variety of pattern recognition problems. In this paper, we apply SVMs for face recognition (recognition model). Multi-class recognition system using SVMs are built using onc-against-the-rest approach. In this approach, one SVM model is built for each persons face (class). For each SVM model an optimal hyperplane is constructed in the kernel feature space to separate the examples of a class from the examples of all the other classes. SVMs learn the boundary regions between patterns of two classes by mapping the patterns into a higher dimensional space, and seeking a separating hyperplane, so as to maximize its distance from the closest training examples. SVM based approach for face recognition has been demonstrated for partial CMU face data base. The face recognition system is evaluated on faces of 10 different persons. For each person there arc 75 faces. The results of our studies show that, the system gives about 100% detection rate. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Automated face recognition; Boundary regions; Detection rates; Face data; Face recognition systems; Face regions; Facial feature; Feature space; Higher-dimensional; Image sequence; Multi-class; Pattern recognition problems; Recognition models; Recognition systems; Separating hyperplane; SVM model; Training example; Artificial intelligence; Geometry; Support vector machines; Face recognition

Title: Circular languages and learning algorithms

Abstract: DNA molecules are known to occur not only as linear strings but also as circular strings. While investigating the recombinant be haviour of DNA molecules in a pioneering work. Tom Head introduced the notion of regularity of circular languages, that are languages of cir cular strings. Pixton has made an interesting study of circular strings accepted by finite automata. Recently. Fruend et al.. Kari et al.. and Yokomori et al., and Paola Bonizzoni et al.. have investigated circular strings in the context of DNA computing, In this paper an algebraic characterization of the class of circular languages accepted by finite au tomata and learning algorithms for subclasses of circular languages are provided. The relationship between the learn able circular languages and circular (Paun) splicing languages is shown. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Title: An improved version of 2-steps method for accurate thinning for binary document images

Affiliations: Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Manasagangotri, Mysore, India; Department of Computer Science and Engineering, APS College of Engineering, Kanakapura Road, Somanahalli, Bangalore-82, India
Authors with affiliations: Manjunath, A.V.N., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Manasagangotri, Mysore, India; Hemantha, K.G., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Manasagangotri, Mysore, India; Shivakumara, P., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, APS College of Engineering, Kanakapura Road, Somanahalli, Bangalore-82, India
Abstract: Thinning is the process of reducing thickness of each line of pattern to just a single pixel. Thinning is usually used as the first step in applications such as optical character recognition to improve the recognition rate. In this paper, we present an improved version of 2-steps method for accurate thinning for binary document images. The proposed algorithm preserves topology of the characters. It means that the algorithm is rotation invariant. The algorithm is improved version of 2-steps method [19]. This is a generalized algorithm can be used to thin symbols, digits, characters, letters, irrespective of the script they are written. The results show that the system is very efficient in preserving the topology of symbols and letters written in any language. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Shahina A.
Title: Self-organizing map for estimation of close-speaking microphone speech from throat microphone speech
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Speech and Vision Laboratory, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai - 600 036, India
Authors with affiliations: Shahina, A., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Speech and Vision Laboratory, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai - 600 036, India
Abstract: The message content in a throat microphone speech is intelligible, but the speech is perceptually different from the close-speaking microphone speech. The perceptual difference between the two speech signals depend on their acoustic characteristics. The throat microphone speech could be enhanced to make it perceptually similar to the close-speaking microphone speech. This paper utilizes a Self-organizing map (SOM) for deriving the features of the close-speaking microphone speech from those of the throat microphone speech. Self-organizing maps create an ordered mapping of the input signals (as in the brain) into a layer of independent, interconnected units. The feature vectors of the throat microphone are clustered using the SOM algorithm. The response of the SOM to the test input pattern (derived from the throat microphone speech) is used to derive the nearest linear prediction coefficients of the close-speaking microphone speech. These estimated spectral features are used to reconstruct the enhanced speech. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Agarwal S., Agarwal P.
Title: A pragmatic solution to an indian accented english speech synthesizer using residual excited linear predictive coded voice
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Indian Institute of Information Teclmology, Jhalwa, Allahabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Agarwal, S., Indian Institute of Information Teclmology, Jhalwa, Allahabad, India; Agarwal, P., Indian Institute of Information Teclmology, Jhalwa, Allahabad, India
Abstract: This paper elucidates a practical solution to an Indian accented English text to speech synthesizing system. The paper covers the complete procedure to generate the speech signal of the text, in Indian accented voice. The technique described considers the various prosodic features that need to be incorporated into the synthesized speech to make it appear natural and in the way an Indian speaks. The paper describes the complete method for synthesizing the speech including the pre-processing of the text and prosody analysis in the Indian style of speaking. The diphones extracted from an Indian's voice are coded using Residual Excited Linear Predictive (RELP) coding technique and the resulting formants and residual values of the diphones are used to resynthesize the final output speech for the text to be synthesized. 'PALSA' - an Indian accented English speech synthesizer has been successfully implemented using the mentioned technique to produce the Indian accented speech and is described in this paper. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Accented speech; Coding techniques; Diphones; Practical solutions; Pre-processing; Prosodic features; Residual value; Speech signals; Speech synthesizer; Synthesized speech; Text to speech; Artificial intelligence; Speech

Authors: Aine S., Kumar R., Chakrabarti P.P.
Title: Adaptive control of anytime algorithm parameters
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, Kharagpur WB 721302, India; Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur UP 208 016, India
Authors with affiliations: Aine, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, Kharagpur WB 721302, India; Kumar, R., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur UP 208 016, India; Chakrabarti, P.P., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, Kharagpur WB 721302, India
Abstract: Monitoring based techniques have been used for anytime algorithms solving time critical problems. The quality-time trade-off for optimization algorithms can be controlled using two techniques, time deliberation and parameter adaptation. The existing meta-level control methodologies try to address these problems independently. In this paper, we present a meta-level framework capable of taking a combined decision on time allocation and parameter variation of an anytime optimization algorithm to maximize its utility in terms of solution quality and the time allocated. We use the proposed strategy to get an adaptive cooling schedule for an anytime simulated annealing algorithm (ASA). Results on the travelling salesman problem (TSP) show that a combined dynamic control for cooling schedule and time allocation performs better than the fixed/dynamic strategies for time deliberation or parameter adjustment if done independently. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Ghosh K., Sarkar S., Bhaumik K.
Title: A new mechanism of "fuzzy" edge detection by multi scale gaussian filters in the light of human visual system
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Microelectronics Division, Saha Institute of Nuclear Physics, 1/AF, Bidhannagar, Kolkata-700064, India
Authors with affiliations: Ghosh, K., Microelectronics Division, Saha Institute of Nuclear Physics, 1/AF, Bidhannagar, Kolkata-700064, India; Sarkar, S., Microelectronics Division, Saha Institute of Nuclear Physics, 1/AF, Bidhannagar, Kolkata-700064, India; Bhaumik, K., Microelectronics Division, Saha Institute of Nuclear Physics, 1/AF, Bidhannagar, Kolkata-700064, India
Abstract: In this paper a new multi-scale Gaussian derivative filter is proposed, where the higher order derivatives are expressed as a linear combination of the Gaussian function at various scales, one of which has been approximated to a Dirac-delta function to yield a filter which is in agreement with a very old psychophysical model of vision. This modification also finds support from neurophysiology of retina. The proposed filter can be optimized at any order of derivative in terms of the scale-ratios of the Gaussians. Such optimization yields further support to the approximation mentioned above. It has been shown that the proposed filter is very effective in extracting features from a noisy image in the form of a "fuzzy" derivative computation. Zero-crossing maps of any image filtered with the proposed model gives a half-toning effect to the retrieved image. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Dirac-delta; Extracting features; Gaussian derivative filter; Gaussian filters; Gaussian functions; Gaussians; Halftoning; Higher order derivatives; Human Visual System; Linear combinations; Multiscales; New mechanisms; Noisy image; Psychophysical; Retrieved images; Zero-crossings; Artificial intelligence; Delta functions; Edge detection; Image processing; Optimization; Fuzzy filters

Authors: Nagesh Kumar D., Janga Reddy M., Maity R.
Title: Regional rainfall forecasting using large scale climate teleconnections and evolutionary algorithms
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560 012, India
Authors with affiliations: Nagesh Kumar, D., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560 012, India; Janga Reddy, M., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560 012, India; Maity, R., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560 012, India
Abstract: The continuous occurrence of changes in the global climate causes significant variability in the seasonal and intra-seasonal rainfall pattern, which often leads to frequent floods and droughts in India. To reduce the magnitude of effect of such natural calamities and for better management of water resources, it is essential to predict the rainfall, well in advance. In this study the possible relationship between the large scale climate indices like. El-Nino Southern Oscillation (ENSO). EQUitorial INdian Ocean Oscillation (EQUINOO) and a local climate index of Ocean-Land Temperature Contrast (OLTC) are studied and used to forecast regional monsoon rainfall of Orissa state in Lidia. To handle the highly non-linear and complex behavior of the climatic variables in forecasting the rainfall, this study employs Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs) methodology. In this study, to optimize the ANN architecture. Genetic Optimizer is used. After identifying the lagged relationship between climate indices and monthly rainfall, the rainfall values are forecasted for summer monsoon months of June. July, August and September (JJAS) individually as well as total monsoon rainfall. The models are trained individually for monthly and for seasonal rainfall forecasting. Then the trained models are tested to evaluate the performance of the model. The results show reasonably good accuracy for monthly and seasonal rainfall forecasting. The study demonstrates the possible teleconnection between large scale climate indices and regional rainfall over Orissa and also shows the usefulness of ANNs in rainfall forecasting. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Climate index; Climatic variables; Complex behavior; EQUINOO; Global climates; Indian ocean; Local climate; Monsoon rainfall; Optimizers; Rainfall forecasting; Rainfall patterns; Seasonal rainfall; Southern oscillation; Summer monsoon; Teleconnections; Temperature contrast; Atmospheric pressure; Atmospheric thermodynamics; Forecasting; Neural networks; Water management; Rain

Authors: Bhaumik H., Chowdhury N.
Title: A neural network based method for text classification using root words to form pattern vectors
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Regional Computer Centre, Institute of Information Technology, Beliaghata, Kolkata - 700015, India; Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University, Kolkata - 700032, India
Authors with affiliations: Bhaumik, H., Regional Computer Centre, Institute of Information Technology, Beliaghata, Kolkata - 700015, India; Chowdhury, N., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University, Kolkata - 700032, India
Abstract: A text classification method using an artificial neural network is presented here. The proposed method can classify a set of English text documents into a number of given classes depending on their contents where the number of such classes is not known a priori. All the surface words of a given set of text documents are converted into their corresponding root words by performing necessary morphological analysis in order to form the pattern vector for text classification. A suitable "elimination factor' is used to reduce the dimensionality of the feature space. Text documents from various faculties of games and sports are considered for experimentation. The method is found to provide satisfactory results for three sets of data considered for experimentation. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Rene E.R., Chidambaram M., Swaminathan T.
Title: Predictive modeling of biofilters treating benzene vapours using artificial neural networks
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Chemical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai (Madras) - 600 036, India
Authors with affiliations: Rene, E.R., Department of Chemical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai (Madras) - 600 036, India; Chidambaram, M., Department of Chemical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai (Madras) - 600 036, India; Swaminathan, T., Department of Chemical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai (Madras) - 600 036, India
Abstract: Biofiltration is a simple, reliable and cost effective treatment process for the removal of hazardous volatile air contaminants. The variability of feed conditions and performance of biofilters make the application of mathematical models very useful. The lack of information on the micro kinetic and metabolic mechanisms has restricted the use of process based models. Data driven models such as Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs) can predict the performance of biofilters by their ability to map the input-output relationships. This study predicts the performance of a compost based biofilter. operated continuously for 155 days with varying loading rates of benzene vapours in terms of the elimination capacity (EC) and removal efficiency (RE). Two ANN models having three layers were trained using the back propagation algorithm and by changing the network parameters. The best network architecture was selected based on low root mean square value (RMS) in the test data. The two models fitted the data well with RMS values of 0.0845 and 0.0765 for EC and 0.1183 and 0.0874 for RE respectively. The results suggest that ANNs can be a useful predictive tool for modeling biofilters. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Sukavanam N., Panwar V.
Title: Neural network based optimal position/force control for constrained robot manipulators
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Mathematics, Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee 247667, India
Authors with affiliations: Sukavanam, N., Department of Mathematics, Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee 247667, India; Panwar, V., Department of Mathematics, Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee 247667, India
Abstract: In this paper the application of quadratic optimization and sliding mode approach is considered for hybrid position and force control of a robot manipulator. The dynamic model of the manipulator is transformed to a state-space model to contain two sets of state variables, where one describes the constrained motion and the other describes the unconstrained motion. The optimal feedback control law is derived solving matrix differential Riccati equation, which is obtained using Hamilton Jacobi Bellman optimization. The dynamic model uncertainties are compensated with a feedforward neural network. The FFNN requires no preliminary off-line training and is trained with on-line weight tuning algorithms that guarantee small errors and bounded control signals. The application of the derived control law is demonstrated through simulation with a two-arm robot manipulator to track a circular constrained surface while applying the desired force on the surface. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Ghosh S., Suresh H.R., Mujumdar R.P.
Title: Fuzzy water quality management model application to a case study
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Inidian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560012, India
Authors with affiliations: Ghosh, S., Department of Civil Engineering, Inidian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560012, India; Suresh, H.R., Department of Civil Engineering, Inidian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560012, India; Mujumdar, R.P., Department of Civil Engineering, Inidian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560012, India
Abstract: A fuzzy optimization model developed earlier to address uncertainty due to imprecision in management goals in river water quality management problems is applied to a case study in this paper by also addressing uncertainty due to randomness implicitly through Monte Carlo simulations. Municipal and industrial effluents, characterized by their Biochemical Oxygen Demand (BOD) loads are considered as point sources of pollution and the Dissolved Oxygen (DO) level at specified checkpoints in the river stretch is taken as the single water quality indicator. Conflicting goals related to water quality and fraction removal levels are expressed as fuzzy sets with appropriate membership functions in the model. The fuzzy optimization model is solved for a number of simulated sets of inputs to obtain optimal solutions, thus generating a large set of optimal objective function values and associated decisions. This information is used to obtain waste load allocation decisions for a specified level of reliability. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Sathyavathy P., Sneha C., Uma B., Swamynathan S., Geetlia T.V.
Title: Semantic and QoS based web service selection using a multi agent system
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Guindy, Anna University, Chennai - 600025, India
Authors with affiliations: Sathyavathy, P., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Guindy, Anna University, Chennai - 600025, India; Sneha, C., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Guindy, Anna University, Chennai - 600025, India; Uma, B., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Guindy, Anna University, Chennai - 600025, India; Swamynathan, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Guindy, Anna University, Chennai - 600025, India; Geetlia, T.V., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, Guindy, Anna University, Chennai - 600025, India
Abstract: Currently all web services are published and found by making use of the WSDL and UDDI techniques. This forces the consumers to find and bind services at design time since WSDL relies on static descriptions. Also the current techniques don't address runtime service selection based on a dynamic assessment of QoS attributes. Hence in this paper, a Semantic QoS Web Services Agent Framework (SQoSWSAF) architecture has been proposed and implemented that can dynamically select a web service based on user's requirements, QoS constraints and preferences. This requires developing service and QoS ontologies and adding semantic descriptions to web services using these ontologies, which enables the automation of web services discovery, selection and composition. Dynamic service selection based on user constraints requires an agent-based system. Thus a multi-agent framework, which involves an agent querying the web service registry for the set of advertised service and selecting the best service, is implemented in the SQoSWSAF system. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Title: Process monitoring and fault detection using curvilinear component analysis
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Chemical Engineering and Process Development Division, National Chemical Laboratory, Dr. Homi Bhabha Road, Pune - 411 008, India
Authors with affiliations: Phulwale, U.S., Chemical Engineering and Process Development Division, National Chemical Laboratory, Dr. Homi Bhabha Road, Pune - 411 008, India; Jeevankumar, B., Chemical Engineering and Process Development Division, National Chemical Laboratory, Dr. Homi Bhabha Road, Pune - 411 008, India; Patel, S.U., Chemical Engineering and Process Development Division, National Chemical Laboratory, Dr. Homi Bhabha Road, Pune - 411 008, India; Badhe, Y.P., Chemical Engineering and Process Development Division, National Chemical Laboratory, Dr. Homi Bhabha Road, Pune - 411 008, India; Tambe, S.S., Chemical Engineering and Process Development Division, National Chemical Laboratory, Dr. Homi Bhabha Road, Pune - 411 008, India; Kulkarni, B.D., Chemical Engineering and Process Development Division, National Chemical Laboratory, Dr. Homi Bhabha Road, Pune - 411 008, India
Abstract: This paper demonstrates an application of a new nonlinear dimensionality reduction method, namely curvilinear component analysis (CCA) for the classification of chemical and biochemical process data. The CCA projects high dimensional data into a low dimensional space by maintaining the dis-tances between the original input data patterns. It performs vector quantization (VQ) followed by the nonlinear mapping of the quantized vectors. The aim of the present study is to demonstrate how the CCA can be effectively used for the classification applications that involve nonlinear projection of a high dimensional input space into a low. i.e. two dimensional projected space. The paper reports two case studies comprising a continuous stirred tank reactor (CSTR) and a batch biochemical (invertase) process to illustrate the efficacy of the CCA for the process monitoring and fault detection and diagnosis applications. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Mani A., Desai V.R.
Title: Artificial neural networks - A state-of-the-art computing technique in stage discharge relationship
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, Kharagpur - 721302, India
Authors with affiliations: Mani, A., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, Kharagpur - 721302, India; Desai, V.R., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, Kharagpur - 721302, India
Abstract: Streamflow forecasting by using rating curve technique lias been challenging subject in hydrology due to the continuous change in river-bed channel morphology. The main objective of this paper is to determine the effect of temporal information in short-term flood predictions at Pathegudem and Polavaram gauging stations, which are located in lower reaches of the Godavari river in Andra Pradesh state, India. Based on the availability of past daily discharge cum stage data during the period from June to Oct. over the period 8 years from 1993 to 2000. the whole data set was divided into two parts, (i.e. 75% of the data used for model training calibration and rest of the 25% data used for model testing validation). Performance of the ANN simulated results are compared in terms of correlation coefficient (R). coefficient of efficiency, normalised root-mean-square-error (NRMSE). average absolute relative error (AARE) for back-propagation algorithm (BP) based artificial neural networks model. It was found that the artificial neural networks provided the accurate flow predictions when an optimum number of temporal inputs were included into the network. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Title: An extrinsic method for the synthesis of analog functions using non-linear current-mode circuits
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005

Abstract: A methodology is presented for synthesis of current-mode analog cir cuits using piecewise linear (PWL) approximations. The function to be synthe sized is divided in to PWL segments such that in each segment the output of the function has a constant slope. Each of these PUT. segments with any arbitrary slope can be realized using elementary MOS current-mode circuits. When such current-mode circuits connected in parallel, it is possible to realize piecewise linear approximation of the desired analog function within the allowed approxi mation error bounds. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Bhat M.S., Rekha S., Jamadagni H.S.
Title: An Extrinsic method of evolutionary synthesis of multiple-valued arithmetic functions using genetic algorithms
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Centre for Electronics Design and Technology, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore - 560012, India
Authors with affiliations: Bhat, M.S., Centre for Electronics Design and Technology, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore - 560012, India; Rekha, S., Centre for Electronics Design and Technology, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore - 560012, India; Jamadagni, H.S., Centre for Electronics Design and Technology, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore - 560012, India
Abstract: In this paper, we propose an evolutionary method of synthesizing multiple-Valued (MV) arithmetic functions using Genetic Algorithms (GAs). The synthesis procedure is aimed at multi-level realization of the circuits subjected to the constraint set - 1) 100% functional completeness 2) minimum transistor count and 3) minimum number of levels in multi-level synthesis process. We en-code the circuit using a chromosome with each chromosome represented in terms of a set of primary inputs and a set of gates from a pre-defined library. To arrive at a given circuit functionality, the length of the chromosome is increased if lower logic depths do not give 100% circuit functionality. Examples of evolved 4-valued half-adder, half-subtracter. 1-digit full adder and multiplier circuits are examined. The technique used in this paper gives novel as well as optimal synthesis solutions for MV logic circuits. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Agrawal M., Sarma V.V.S.
Title: Query expansion by flexible relevance feedback for searching on the web
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Computer Science and Automation, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, India
Authors with affiliations: Agrawal, M., Computer Science and Automation, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, India; Sarma, V.V.S., Computer Science and Automation, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, India
Abstract: This paper presents our work towards improving precision of web search results by adding more words to the user's query, called key word-spices. We propose machine learning techniques to get these keyword spices. The training sample can be achieved from initial search results, classified by the user according to his interest. Since we cannot expect the user to classify each document, we propose clustering of doc uments, such that documents of the same cluster are semantically better correlated than documents in different clusters. We propose a relevance feedback scheme which gives flexible support to the user to specify his relevance by making set operations on the clusters. Experimental results show that the proposed scheme gives higher precision than other popular web search agents and the fully automatic query expansion technique. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Sreekumar M., Nagarajan T., Singaperumal M.
Title: Design of supervisory adaptive fuzzy controllers for intelligent robotic vehicles
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Mechanical Engineering, Precision Engineering and Instrumentation Laboratory, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai-600 036, India
Authors with affiliations: Sreekumar, M., Department of Mechanical Engineering, Precision Engineering and Instrumentation Laboratory, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai-600 036, India; Nagarajan, T., Department of Mechanical Engineering, Precision Engineering and Instrumentation Laboratory, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai-600 036, India; Singaperumal, M., Department of Mechanical Engineering, Precision Engineering and Instrumentation Laboratory, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai-600 036, India
Abstract: Supervisory fuzzy control is a type of adaptive fuzzy control as it seeks to observe the current behavior of the control system and modify the controller behavior for better performance. It adaptively integrates the whole variety of information received from the sensory feedback systems and selects the optimal control action. This paper describes design, modeling and implementation of a new type of supervisory adaptive fuzzy controller, designed for intelligent robotic vehicles which could be interfaced with a microcontroller and an ultrasonic sensor. Distance between the obstacle and sensor and its time rate are considered as inputs and how the robotic vehicle has to take diversion is treated as output. The obstacles are identified as stationary or moving objects and accordingly adaptive self tuning with supervisory control is accomplished, based on various linguistic rules. The performance of the controller is evaluated by generating fuzzy control and contour surfaces. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Bhaumik H., Chowdhuiy N.
Title: A minimal spanning tree based method for text document classification
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Regional Computer Centre, Institute of Information Technology, Behaghata, Kolkata - 700015, India; Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University, Kolkata - 700032, India

Abstract: A text classification method using minimal spanning tree (MST) of data points is presented in this paper, where each data point corresponds to a text in a given set of text documents. The proposed method can classify a given set of text documents into a number of classes depending on their contents where the number of such classes is not known a priori. Three sets of text documents from various faculties of games are considered for experimentation. The method is found to provide satisfactory results for large size of data. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Dutta S., Hazarika S.M.
Title: Qualitative approach to synthesis of planar grasp
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Information Technology, Tezpur University, Tezpur, India
Authors with affiliations: Dutta, S., Department of Computer Science and Information Technology, Tezpur University, Tezpur, India; Hazarika, S.M., Department of Computer Science and Information Technology, Tezpur University, Tezpur, India
Abstract: In this paper we propose a qualitative approach to grasp synthesis. We have considered the grasping criteria in terms of form closure property. We have used results from qualitative kinematics [11] to analyze a 2-D grasping problem and develop a qualitative grasping procedure. The analysis is based on intuitive description of the resulting spatial motion of an object because of application of multiple constraints through point contacts. Grasps obtained satisfies the efficiency criteria of closure grasps as specified by the quantitative Steinitz's theorem [10]. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Efficiency criteria; Form closure; Grasp synthesis; Multiple constraint; Planar grasp; Qualitative approach; Spatial motions; Artificial intelligence

Authors: Roy D., Sarkar S., Ghose S.
Title: Automatic annotation of documents with metadata for use with tutoring system
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Computer Science and Engineering Department, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur Kharagpur - 721302, India
Authors with affiliations: Roy, D., Computer Science and Engineering Department, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur Kharagpur - 721302, India; Sarkar, S., Computer Science and Engineering Department, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur Kharagpur - 721302, India; Ghose, S., Computer Science and Engineering Department, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur Kharagpur - 721302, India
Abstract: Adaptive web based education is a popular source of learning environment. One problem with the existing systems is that a great deal of effort is required by the author for their development. But the course structure for any curriculum often changes. The author has to put in more effort to update the course to the new structure. To overcome the problem of rebuilding of courses again and again, we separate the content from course structure. We present a metadata based open repository of a tutoring system, which integrates learning objects from different sources. To reuse these modules for course organization, each learning object is annotated with a set of metadata that describe the educational and pedagogic characteristics of the learning object that are needed for the tutoring process. To reduce the overhead of content developer we have implemented a tool for automatic annotation, which extracts metadata automatically from documents. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Adaptive web; Automatic annotation; Content developer; Course organization; Course structure; Existing systems; Learning environments; Learning objects; Tutoring system; Artificial intelligence; Computer aided instruction; Curricula; Teaching; Metadata

Authors: Chaurasia N., Agrawal A.
Title: Estimation of terrain height map from a single satellite imagery using shape from shading techniques
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Indian Institute of Information Technology, Deoghat, Jhalwa, Allahabad - 211011, India
Authors with affiliations: Chaurasia, N., Indian Institute of Information Technology, Deoghat, Jhalwa, Allahabad - 211011, India; Agrawal, A., Indian Institute of Information Technology, Deoghat, Jhalwa, Allahabad - 211011, India
Abstract: Relative or absolute terrain elevation extraction from satellite image has been an active research topic for many years. In this paper, few well-known shapes from shading (SFS) techniques are implemented to extract height information from single Satellite Imagery. A comparative study about the performance of these algorithms for deriving depth information and terrain parameters has also been done. A minimization algorithm is implemented with integrability constraint, Linear Pentland algorithm with fast Fourier transform and also Tsai-Shah linear algorithm with smoothness constraint has been implemented; and these algorithms are applied to Dehradun IRS-1C panchromatic image. The results are evaluated using a reference DEM of the same area. Tsai-Shah algorithm is found to be giving good result in maximum cases. A new modified Tsai-Shah algorithm is proposed in this paper for remote sensing images, which adds smoothness constraint to remove spikes. The relative height measurements with the shape from shading techniques are calibrated into an absolute elevation model using a parametric least-squares adjustment procedure based oil a number of ground control points. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Title: An efficient clustering scheme using support vector methods

Abstract: Support vector clustering involves three steps - solving an optimization problem, identification of clusters and tuning of hyper- parameters. In this paper, we introduce a pre-processing step that eliminates data points from the training data that are not crucial for clustering. Pre-processing is efficiently implemented using the R*-tree data structure. Experiments on real-world and synthetic datasets, show that pre-processing drastically decreases the run-time of the clustering algorithm. Also, in many cases reduction in the number of support vectors is achieved. Further, we suggest an improvement for the step of identification of clusters. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Title: Design and implementation of fuzzy control for inverted pendulum

Abstract: Inverted Pendulum is used as a test bed for control theory. Tins paper deals with design and implementation of fuzzy controller for disuirbance rejection and tracking in inverted pendulum. Instead of designing a single fuzzy controller to control the angle of vertical rod and position of sliding rod, two fuzzy controllers are designed to control them individually, winch reduces the complexity of rule base. The performance of the fuzzy controller designed is compared with that of state feedback controller. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Thukaram D., Khincha H.P., Ravikumar B.
Title: Support vector machine approach for fault monitoring and identification in power transmission systems
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560012, India
Authors with affiliations: Thukaram, D., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560012, India; Khincha, H.P., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560012, India; Ravikumar, B., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore-560012, India
Abstract: Generally Extra High Voltage (EHV) transmission substations in power systems are connected with multiple transmission lines to neighboring substations. The transmission lines are exposed to faults, which are equipped with protective devices such as relays and circuit breakers. Power system disturbance are often caused by a faults on transmission lines. When a fault occurs on one of the transmission lines, the protective relays expected to detect the fault and give trip signal to circuit breaker to clear the fault. In these cases over tripping of relays can happen because of inappropriate coordination of relay settings. Due to this condition the power system margins for contingencies are decreasing. With this situation, power system protective relaying reliability be-comes increasingly important. In this paper an approach is presented using Support Vector Machine (SVM) as an artificial intelligent tool for identifying the faulted feeder that is emanating from a substation and finding the distance from the substation. Support vector Machines have well-established advantages over other methods. This approach is particularly important to avoid mal- operation of relays following a disturbance in the neighboring feeder connected to the same substation and assuring secure operation of the power systems. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligent tools; Extra high voltage; Fault monitoring; Multiple transmission; Over tripping; Power system disturbances; Power system margin; Power transmission systems; Protective devices; Protective relaying; Relay settings; Trip signals; Artificial intelligence; Electric circuit breakers; Electric lines; Electric power transmission; Relay protection; Transmission line theory; Support vector machines

Authors: Manvi S.S., Venkataram P.
Title: Multiagent system based multimedia product-information presentations in E-trading
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Electrical Communication Engineering Department, Protocol Engineering and Technology Unit, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore 560 012, India
Authors with affiliations: Manvi, S.S., Electrical Communication Engineering Department, Protocol Engineering and Technology Unit, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore 560 012, India; Venkataram, P., Electrical Communication Engineering Department, Protocol Engineering and Technology Unit, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore 560 012, India
Abstract: E-trading is one of the important application of Internet technologies, which will reshape the market places in near future, since it lowers cost of trading and improves trading efficiency. The electronic trading usability and profitability can be enhanced by providing multimedia. presentations to the trading site visitors. Since several issues arise in providing multimedia presentations (Quality of service guarantees: bandwidth, delay, jitter, etc.), hence we need to resolve these issues. Agent technology is a promising solution to resolve these issues. In this paper we present a Multimedia Assistant for Communications, which is an intelligent multimedia assistant to facilitate multimedia presentations to the E-trading users. It comprises of static and mobile agents which perform certain autonomous tasks and coordinate with each other to make smooth and continuous multimedia presentations. The advantages of using agent technology are: flexibility, adaptability, customizability, maintainability and reusability. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Guru D.S., Nagendraswamy H.S.
Title: Matching and retrieval of distorted and occluded two dimensional shapes: An unconventional approach
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Michigan State University, East Lansing, MI 48824, United States; Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore -570006, India

Abstract: This paper presents an approach for matching distorted and partially occluded shapes using a novel fuzzy-symbolic approach. The proposed method represents a binary shape using symbolic (multiple interval valued) features. The representation scheme is based on the landmark points (dominant points) of the shape and the concept of fuzzy triangle membership functions. A novel symbolic similarity measure to estimate the degree of similarity for shape matching is proposed. The proposed method is shown to be invariant to image transformations and the results of the experiments conducted on real images of varying complexity of a reasonably large database of shapes have established the robustness of the method. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Shivakumara P., Manjunath A.V.N., Hemantha K.G.
Title: An accurate and efficient skew estimation technique based on moment of inertia for binary document images
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, APS College of Engineering, Kanakapura Road, Somanahalli, Bangalore -82, India; Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, Kamataka, India
Authors with affiliations: Shivakumara, P., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, APS College of Engineering, Kanakapura Road, Somanahalli, Bangalore -82, India; Manjunath, A.V.N., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, Kamataka, India; Hemantha, K.G., Department of Studies in Computer Science, University of Mysore, Mysore, Kamataka, India
Abstract: Now day's skew angle estimation becomes essential for improving accuracy of Optical Character Recognition (OCR) systems and Document Analysis Systems (DAS). In this paper, a new and an efficient method to estimate the skew angle of a scanned document image is proposed. The proposed method has two stages. In the first stage, using boundary-growing approach, words containing characters of the scanned document image are extracted. Words are extracted and coordinates of the positions of the characters are obtained, hi the second stage, the obtained coordinates are subjected to moments of inertial (second order moments) for the purpose of computation of skew angle. Several experiments have been conducted on various types of documents such as documents containing different language texts, document with different fonts and documents with noise to reveal the robustness of the proposed method. A comparative study with the well-known methods is presented to show that the proposed method is superior in terms of accuracy and computational efficiency. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Kanungo D.P., Arora M.K., Gupta R.P., Sarkar S.
Title: GIS based landslide hazard zonation using neuro-fuzzy weighting
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Geotechnical Engineering Division, Central Building Research Institute, Roorkee 247 667, India; Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee, Roorkee 247 667, India; Department of Earth Sciences, Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee, Roorkee 247 667, India
Authors with affiliations: Kanungo, D.P., Geotechnical Engineering Division, Central Building Research Institute, Roorkee 247 667, India; Arora, M.K., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee, Roorkee 247 667, India; Gupta, R.P., Department of Earth Sciences, Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee, Roorkee 247 667, India; Sarkar, S., Geotechnical Engineering Division, Central Building Research Institute, Roorkee 247 667, India
Abstract: Landslides are one of the most frightening and destructive phenomena of nature that cause damage to both property and life every7 year, especially in the Himalayas. Landslide Hazard Zonation (LHZ) is therefore necessary for planning future developmental activities and implementation of disaster management programmes in mountainous terrains. A number of qualitative and quantitative methods have been used for the LHZ studies. The conventional approaches for LHZ suffer from the subjective weighting system where weights are assigned to causative factors responsible for landslide activity based on the experience of experts. In this study, an objective weighting approach based on neuro-fiizzy technique has been implemented for LHZ in a part of the Darjeeling Himalayas. This is considered to be a distribution free approach. Relevant thematic layers pertaining to the causative factors related to landslide activity have been generated using remote sensing and Geographic Information System (GIS) techniques. The membership values for each category7 of the thematic layers have been determined using the cosine amplitude method (similarity method) and are used as ratings for each category of the thematic layer. Artificial neural networks (ANNs) have been applied to determine the weights for each causative factor represented by a thematic layer. The integration of these weights and ratings, determined through a combined neuro-fiizzy approach in GIS environment led to the generation of LHZ map of acceptable accuracy in terms of areas estimated for each landslide hazard zone. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Abstract: In this paper, an attempt is made to sum up the work done by us, on design and development of optimal fuzzy logic controllers (PLCs). PLCs have been developed based on both Mamdani Approach as well as Takagi and Sugeno's Approach, to solve a variety of problems related to motion planning for different types of robots, medical diagnosis, expert system in manufacturing process, and others. Some of these applications are discussed in short, in the present write-up. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Roy K., Pal U., Kimura F.
Title: Bangla handwritten character recognition
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition Unit, Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata-108, India; Faculty of Engineering, Mie University, 1577 Kurimamachiya-cho, Mie 514-8504, Japan
Authors with affiliations: Roy, K., Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition Unit, Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata-108, India; Pal, U., Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition Unit, Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata-108, India; Kimura, F., Faculty of Engineering, Mie University, 1577 Kurimamachiya-cho, Mie 514-8504, Japan
Abstract: Recognition of handwritten characters is difficult because of variability involved in the writing style of different individuals. This paper deals with recognition of off-line Bangla handwritten characters using quadratic classifier based on the features obtained from directional chain code histogram. Here the bounding box of a character is segmented into blocks and chain code histogram is computed in each of the blocks. This chain code features are fed to the quadratic classifier for recognition. We tested the result on 14879 characters and we obtained 90.53% accuracy with 0.81% rejection and 8.66% error, when 50 classes are considered. From 35 classes we obtained 93.90% accuracy with 0.91% rejection and 5.19% error rate. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
