Authors: Kapil A., Gudi R.D., Noronha S.B.
Title: Projection and fuzzy classification methods gene expression profile analysis
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Chemical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Bombay, Powai, Mumbai- 400076, India
Authors with affiliations: Kapil, A., Department of Chemical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Bombay, Powai, Mumbai- 400076, India; Gudi, R.D., Department of Chemical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Bombay, Powai, Mumbai- 400076, India; Noronha, S.B., Department of Chemical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Bombay, Powai, Mumbai- 400076, India
Abstract: The high dimensionality of microarray data, impedes the identification of biologically meaningful clusters. Here, to reduce this problem of irrelevant dimensions, we consider three different projection methods viz. Principal Components Analysis (PCA), Correspondence Analysis (CA) and Multiple Discriminant Analysis (DA). To account for the possibility of pleiotropy, where the expression of certain genes may be related to more than one phenotypical condition, we use fuzzy clustering on the lower dimensional space generated by PC A, CA, and DA. To determine the optimum number of clusters, we evaluate various validity indices. In this paper, we compare these methodologies, when applied to the data generated by a genetic network simulator (expatgen) and to actual micro array data available for the yeast S. cerevisiae. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Title: Modeling and analysis of reliability parameters of repairable systems using artificial neural networks and genetic algorithms
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005

Abstract: The present study deals with the analysis and optimization of repairable systems based upon twin objectives of reliability and cost. The proposed model utilizes Artificial Neural Networks (ANN) and a multi- objective genetic algorithm (MOGA) to locate Pareto-optimal solutions. The resulting sets of solutions are used to draw inferences and develop scenarios for efficient utilization of the system. The approach has been applied to a helicopter unit. Results demonstrate the power and importance of ANN and MOGA for reliability-based optimization of repairable systems. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Krishnanand K.N., Ghose D.
Title: Multimodal function optimization using a glowworm metaphor with applications to collective robotics
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Aerospace Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore 560 012, India
Authors with affiliations: Krishnanand, K.N., Department of Aerospace Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore 560 012, India; Ghose, D., Department of Aerospace Engineering, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore 560 012, India
Abstract: This paper presents a novel glowworm swarm optimization (GSO) algorithm that finds solutions to multiple optima of multimodal functions. The algorithm is in the same spirit as the ant-colony optimization (ACO) algorithms, but with several significant differences. Similar to how each moving region in the ACO technique is associated with a pheromone value, the agents in our algorithm carry a luminescence quantity called luciferin along with them. Agents are thought of as glowworms that emit a light whose intensity is proportional to the associated luciferin and have a circular sensor range. The glowworms depend on a local-decision domain to compute their movements. Simulations demonstrate the efficacy of the proposed glowworm based algorithm in capturing multiple optima of a series of standard multimodal test functions. The above optimization scenario can be implemented in a collection of mobile robots to address the problem of detecting multiple radiating sources (e.g., nuclear/hazardous chemical spills) spread on a two-dimensional landscape. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors with affiliations: Angira, R., Department of Chemical Engineering, Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani, Rajasthan -333 031, India; Babu, B.V., Department of Chemical Engineering, Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani, Rajasthan -333 031, India
Abstract: Most of the real world optimization problems are multi-objective in nature. Recently, Evolutionary algorithms are gaining popularity for solving Multi-Objective Optimization Problems (MOOPs) due to their inherent advantages over traditional methods. In this paper. Differential Evolution (an evolutionary algorithm that is significantly faster and robust for optimization prob-lems over continuous domain) is extended for solving MOOPs and we call this extended algorithm as Non-dominated Sorting Differential Evolution (NSDE). The proposed algorithm is applied successfully to two different benchmark test problems. Also, the effect of various key parameters on the performance of NSDE is studied. A high value of crossover constant (≅ 1) and a value of 0.5 for scaling factor are found suitable for both the problems. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Benchmark test problem; Continuous domain; Differential Evolution; Key parameters; Multi objective; Multi objective optimizations (MOO); Multi-objective optimization problem; Non-dominated Sorting; Real-world optimization; Scaling factors; Artificial intelligence; Benchmarking; Multiobjective optimization; Evolutionary algorithms

Authors: Bhattacharya U., Parui S.K., Sridhar M., Kimura F.
Title: Two-stage recognition of handwritten bangla alphanumeric characters using neural classifiers
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition Unit, Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata, India; Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Michigan-Dearborn, United States; Faculty of Engineering, Mie University, Japan
Authors with affiliations: Bhattacharya, U., Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition Unit, Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata, India; Parui, S.K., Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition Unit, Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata, India; Sridhar, M., Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Michigan-Dearborn, United States; Kimura, F., Faculty of Engineering, Mie University, Japan
Abstract: No significant research work towards recognition of handwritten Bangla characters has yet been done. Only a few works in this area are found in the literature which are based on small databases col-lected in laboratory environments. Recently, a large and representative database of Bangla character images [1] has been developed. The first part of this article is devoted to shape analysis of samples of this database vis-a-vis shapes of the respective printed characters. The next part describes a two-stage scheme for recognition of handwritten Bangla alphanumeric characters. This is a 57 class problem (shapes of 3 numerals are not distinguishable from shapes of 3 basic characters among 10 numerals and 50 basic characters). In the first stage of this recognition scheme, an input character is identified in one of 11 smaller groups of characters. In the second stage, classification is performed within the particular smaller group as determined by the first stage. In both the stages of the proposed approach, local chain code histograms of character skeleton are used as the feature vector and multilayer perceptron (MLP) as the classifier. Recognition accuracies obtained by the proposed approach on the training and test sets of the present handwritten Bangla alphanumeric character database are respectively 91.45% and 84.65%. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Panja A., Bandyopadhyay S.
Title: Design and implementation of a natural language interface to a database (Bengali as a case study)
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, Kolkata, India
Authors with affiliations: Panja, A., Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, Kolkata, India; Bandyopadhyay, S., Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, Kolkata, India
Abstract: Two Natural Language Interface to Database Systems have been developed, one using a Template Grammar based approach and the other using Keyword based approach. Both the systems accept queries in Bengali language. In both the approaches the user query is analyzed and translated to a SQL statement that is used to retrieve information from the database. Both the systems have been evaluated based on precision and recall. The NLIDB system based on Keyword based approach has been observed to perform better. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Mohan S., Bhanot S.
Title: A comparative study of few conventional and adaptive control algorithms for manipulator control
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Computer Science Group, Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani, India; Instrumentation Group, Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani, India
Authors with affiliations: Mohan, S., Computer Science Group, Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani, India; Bhanot, S., Instrumentation Group, Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani, India
Abstract: The problem of manipulator control is a highly complex problem of controlling a system which is multi-input, multi-output, non-linear and time variant. A number of different approaches presently followed for the control of manipulator vary from simple PID to very complex intelligent, self-learning control algorithms. This paper presents a comparative study of simulated per-formance of some control algorithms, like the simple PID. Computed Torque Control, Feed Forward Inverse Dynamics Control and some versions of Adaptive Control. The algorithms are compared for different trajectories with the manipulator picking up an unknown load sometime during its motion. Various performance indices like the RMS error, steady state error and Maximum error are used for comparison. The study concludes that the adaptive algorithms in general perform better than the rest of algorithms, particularly when the uncertainty of the system increases. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Kumar P., Kar I., Behera L.
Title: Intelligent control schemes for a redundant manipulator
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur 208 016, UP, India
Authors with affiliations: Kumar, P., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur 208 016, UP, India; Kar, I., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur 208 016, UP, India; Behera, L., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur 208 016, UP, India
Abstract: Redundancy is introduced in manipulator, to avoid singularities and obstacles in the task space. However, the control problem gets complicated since the inverse kinematic relationships are not unique. This paper discusses about the implementation of different fuzzy control strategies on two link planar redundant manipulators. The first approach uses the T-S fuzzy model of the system to derive a stabilizing controller. The second approach uses fuzzy Lyapunov synthesis to design rule base of fuzzy logic controller. The controller performance are tested on two link planar redundant manipulators. The configuration control scheme [1] has been used for effective utilization of redundancy. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Madhava Krishna K., Kalra P.K.
Title: Fuzzy clustering with m-estimators
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad - 500 019, India; Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur, India
Authors with affiliations: Madhava Krishna, K., International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad - 500 019, India; Kalra, P.K., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur, India
Abstract: We present an extension of the FCM over the loss functions used in the M-estimators of robust statistics akin to the generalization of the fuzzy-C-means algorithms over the norm distances [1]. The effect of these estimators in reducing the bias of the outliers while estimating the cluster prototypes are studied and compared. The comparisons have been done over synthetic data as well as simulated data consisting of range sensor readings representative of the objects in the neighborhood of a navigating mobile robot. For the synthetic data set the comparison is attempted over the popular FCM algorithm. For the sensory data set the Adaptive Fuzzy Clustering (AFC) algorithm [2] has been employed and extended over the loss functions of robust statistics. The AFC is utilized considering the shape of the objects encountered by the robot in a typical indoor environment. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Kaushik S., Lutlira P.
Title: Automatic text summarization
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, New Delhi, India; Lexington Towers, Oracle India Private Limited, #18. 2nd Cross Road, Chikka Audugodi, Bangalore - 560 029, India
Authors with affiliations: Kaushik, S., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, New Delhi, India; Lutlira, P., Lexington Towers, Oracle India Private Limited, #18. 2nd Cross Road, Chikka Audugodi, Bangalore - 560 029, India
Abstract: The world of text is increasing considerably. Hence, a successful summarization technology has a key role to play in the future of computing. This paper presents an efficient method of intelligently generating summaries, which uses operations derived from an analysis of human written abstracts. The algorithm uses both statistical and semantic based heuristics to produce cohesive extracts. In the proposed system, an efficient method for evaluating lexical chains as an intermediate step has been used. We have also introduced a method for finding text cohesion and implemented the same in the summarizer. The proposed summarizer also edits long extracted sentences, using reduction to remove non essential phrases. The system has been implemented using JAVA standard Development kit. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Automatic text summarization; Lexical Chain; Non essential; Standard development; Text cohesion; Artificial intelligence; Semantics; Text processing

Authors: Dhavachelvan P., Sivakumar N., Cailassame N.S.N., Sampath Kumar S., Venkatachalapathy V.S.K.
Title: Software complexity assessment using statistical technique: Towards software testing effort estimation
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Information Technology and Computer Science and Engineering, Sri Manakula Vinayagar Engineering College, Pondicherry, India; Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Vellore Institute of Technology, Tamilnadu, India; Department of Mechanical Engineering, Sri Manakula Vinayagar Engineering College, Pondicherry, India
Authors with affiliations: Dhavachelvan, P., Department of Information Technology and Computer Science and Engineering, Sri Manakula Vinayagar Engineering College, Pondicherry, India; Sivakumar, N., Department of Information Technology and Computer Science and Engineering, Sri Manakula Vinayagar Engineering College, Pondicherry, India; Cailassame, N.S.N., Department of Information Technology and Computer Science and Engineering, Sri Manakula Vinayagar Engineering College, Pondicherry, India; Sampath Kumar, S., Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Vellore Institute of Technology, Tamilnadu, India; Venkatachalapathy, V.S.K., Department of Mechanical Engineering, Sri Manakula Vinayagar Engineering College, Pondicherry, India
Abstract: Although there are an increasing number of deployed software com plexity estimation methodologies, there is no systematic analysis precisely what makes the complexity assessment paradigm effective, when to use it and what type of applications can get use of it. The informal interpretations of qualitative and quantitative complexity theories are not sufficient to quantify the testing complexity of the software. On looking towards a single metric of complexity that will both fulfill all the properties of a desirable metric and still have practical utility in measuring software complexity, the research on the software complexity measure still in progress. A fuzzy-based statistical frame work is being developed for estimating the software complexity in a different approach, which has not previously done. The geometrical approach proposed here is to offer a definition for encompassing to cover the software testing complexity issues, based on agents, at the preliminary level, yet sufficiently tight that it can rule out the complexity estimation methodologies that are clearly not mathematical model-based. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Complexity estimation; Complexity theory; Deployed software; Estimation methodologies; Frame-work; Software complexity; Statistical techniques; Systematic analysis; Testing complexity; Testing effort; Artificial intelligence; Estimation; Mathematical models; Software testing

Title: Mining fuzzy association rules from fuzzy databases

Authors with affiliations: Subramanyam, R.B.V., Department of Mathematics, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, 721 302, India; Goswami, A., Department of Mathematics, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, 721 302, India
Abstract: In this paper, a Fuzzy Pincer Search Algorithm is proposed. It generates fuzzy association rules by adopting combined top-down and bottom-up approaches. Fuzzy Grid representation is used to reduce the number of scans of the database and our algorithm trims down the number of candidate fuzz}' grids at each level. Almost all feasible types of fuzzy data are considered while developing the fuzzy database and techniques of handling such data are proposed. It has been observed that fuzzy association rules provide more realistic visualization to the knowledge extracted from fuzzy databases. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Madhava Krishna K., Hexmoor H.
Title: A constrained optimal multi-sensor based target tracking algorithm for surveillance systems
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India; Computer Science and Engineering Department, University of Arkansas, Favetteville, AR, United States
Authors with affiliations: Madhava Krishna, K., International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India; Hexmoor, H., Computer Science and Engineering Department, University of Arkansas, Favetteville, AR, United States
Abstract: We present a methodology for constrained optimal target detection in a multi sensor surveillance system that consists of mobile sensors guarding a rectangular surveillance zone crisscrossed by moving targets. Under the assumption of Poisson arrival statistics for targets a motion strategy is presented for each sensor such that it maximizes target detection for the next T time-steps under the constraint that motion strategies of sensors with higher priorities are fixed. This constrained optimization is resorted to avoid an exhaustive search in the joint space of all the sensors. A coordination mechanism among sensors ensures that overlapping and overlooked regions of observation among sensors are minimized. This coordination mechanism is interleaved with the motion strategy computation to reduce detections of the same target by more than one sensor for the same time-step. The coordination mechanism constrains the search by assigning priorities to the sensors and thereby arbitrating among sensory tasks. An extension of this approach to a globally optimal target detection scheme without involving the entire joint space of sensors towards the search is also presented. A comparison of this methodology with other multi target tracking schemes verifies its efficacy in maximizing detections. A tabulation of these comparisons is reported in the results section of this paper. "Sample" and "time-step" are used equivalently and interchangeably in this paper. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Coordination mechanisms; Exhaustive search; Joint space; Mobile sensors; Motion strategy; Moving targets; Multi sensor; Multi-target tracking; Multisensor surveillance; Surveillance systems; Target tracking algorithm; Time step; Artificial intelligence; Constrained optimization; Security systems; Sensors
Correspondence Address: Madhava Krishna, K.; International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India

Authors: Kodali J., Gupta A.K., Barai S.V.
Title: Artificial neural networks based ozone forecast using moving window modelling
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, Kharagpur - 721 302, India
Authors with affiliations: Kodali, J., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, Kharagpur - 721 302, India; Gupta, A.K., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, Kharagpur - 721 302, India; Barai, S.V., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, Kharagpur - 721 302, India
Abstract: A new concept named, moving window modelling concept is used in combination with Artificial Neural Networks (ANN) for developing ozone concentration forecast models. The models are developed with different sets of inputs to each model. The effects of different input combinations on ozone forecast are evaluated. The data of Maidstone from 16/04/2000 (midnight) to 31/12/2001 (11:00 P.M.) is used for the model development. The model is trained with 13480 training examples and tested at 1496 independent test points. The models' performances are evaluated with wide variety of statistical parameters. The index of agreement (W?) is found to be in the range of 0.88 and 0.9883 with mean percentage absolute error (MPAE) varying between 14.7% and 46.56%, respectively. Historical concentrations of NOx, CO did not improve the models' performance much in terms of index of agreement {d2) but has shown considerable effect on mean percentage absolute error (MPAE). The historical values of ozone concentration proved to be most important input and historical values of N02 concentration proved to be the second most important input parameter in ozone forecasting. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Title: Support vector identification of light induced genes from microarray data incorporating motif information
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: National Chemical Laboratory, Chemical Engineering and Process Development Division, Pune 411008, India
Authors with affiliations: Vigneshwar, R., National Chemical Laboratory, Chemical Engineering and Process Development Division, Pune 411008, India; Kulkarni, O.C., National Chemical Laboratory, Chemical Engineering and Process Development Division, Pune 411008, India; Jayaramail, V.K., National Chemical Laboratory, Chemical Engineering and Process Development Division, Pune 411008, India; Kulkarni, B.D., National Chemical Laboratory, Chemical Engineering and Process Development Division, Pune 411008, India
Abstract: Support Vector Machines (SVMs) find extensive applications in biological sciences. This work is an attempt towards identifying light induced genes in the Arabidopsis genome using microarray expression data. To increase the classification performance of the Support Vector Machines, upstream regulatory motif information was included as features in addition to the expression profile. Thus the work demonstrates that domain specific information increases the classification performance of SVMs. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Raghuwanshi M.M., Kakde O.G.
Title: Real-code self-adaptive genetic algorithm
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Research and Technology, Rajiv Gandhi College of Engineering, Pin: 442403, Chandrapur, M.S., India; Visvesvaraya National Institute of Technology, Nagpur, M.S., India
Authors with affiliations: Raghuwanshi, M.M., Research and Technology, Rajiv Gandhi College of Engineering, Pin: 442403, Chandrapur, M.S., India; Kakde, O.G., Visvesvaraya National Institute of Technology, Nagpur, M.S., India
Abstract: Genetic algorithm (GA) implements the idea of evolution: it is natural to expect adaptation to be used not only for finding solutions to a problem, but also tuning the algorithm for the particular problem. The purpose of dynamic operator adaptation is to exploit information gained, either implicitly or explicitly. This paper presents real-coded self-adaptive GA (RAGA), which is a robust steady-state GA. It uses two multi-parent parent- centric recombination operators: multi-parent recombination operator with polynomial distribution (MPX) and multi-parent recombination operator with lognormal distribution (MLX). We introduce a mechanism of adapting operator probabilities according the landscapes of a given function. The probability of operator used for recombination operation depends upon its ability to produce good offspring. Replacement plan rewards the operator that produces a good offspring. Performance of RAGA is investigated 011 commonly used unimodal and multi-modal test functions. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Dynamic operators; Log-normal distribution; Multi-modal; Real-coded; Recombination operators; Self adaptive genetic algorithm; Self-adaptive; Steady-state GA; Test functions; Unimodal; Artificial intelligence; Modal analysis; Genetic algorithms

Authors: Ramesh D., Ghosh D.
Title: Background modeling and target tracking in video surveillance
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati, India
Authors with affiliations: Ramesh, D., Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati, India; Ghosh, D., Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati, India
Abstract: In this paper, we present a method for tracking human in a multiple uncalibrated moving camera surveillance system. The cameras are uncalibrated in the sense that the correspondence between the camera fields of view are not known a priori and hence stereo-vision analysis can not be applied for extracting depth information. Moreover, the cameras make pan-tilt-zoom motion independent of each other making the task still more difficult. In our method, we first apply image mosaic technique to obtain the reference background for each camera. Next, the camera scene is registered with respect to this reference background to compensate for camera motion. During training, an individual is artificially positioned at all locations within the area of coverage and his projections onto the reference backgrounds are determined. The 3D coordinates for all the positions of the individual in real world and the corresponding 2D coordinates of the projections form the look-up-table containing artificial position data (APD). During surveillance, the 3D location of an individual is obtained by a quick check through the APD table. Experimental results show that our method is capable of tracking people with an accuracy rate of about 90% in an indoor environment. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: 2D coordinates; 3D coordinates; Accuracy rate; Background modeling; Camera fields; Camera motions; Camera scenes; Depth information; Image mosaic; Indoor environment; Look-up-table; Moving cameras; Position data; Video surveillance; Artificial intelligence; Cameras; Stereo vision; Target tracking; Security systems

Authors: Singh N.G., Singh S.R., Mahanta A.K.
Title: CloseMiner: A new algorithm for discovering frequent closed itemsets
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, Manipur University, Imphal-795003, Manipur, India; Manipur University, India; Department of Computer Science, Gauhati University, Guwahati-781014, Assam, India
Authors with affiliations: Singh, N.G., Department of Computer Science, Manipur University, Imphal-795003, Manipur, India; Singh, S.R., Manipur University, India; Mahanta, A.K., Department of Computer Science, Gauhati University, Guwahati-781014, Assam, India
Abstract: The problem of discovering complete set of frequent itemsets in a large database can be reduced to the problem of discovering frequent closed itemsets, which results in a much smaller set of itemsets without information loss. In this paper, we present CloseMiner. a new algorithm for discovering all frequent closed itemsets by grouping the complete set of itemsets into non- overlapping clusters identified by a closed ticket. Each cluster has only one closed itemset and is the superset of all itemsets in the cluster. Number of closed itemsets is identical to the number of clusters. Therefore, the problem of discovering closed itemsets can be considered as the problem of clustering the complete set of itemsets by closed tidset. An extensive experimental evaluation on a number of real and synthetic databases shows that CloseMiner outperforms Apriori and CHARM. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Deshmukh S.M., Joshi S.
Title: Video-album- The home video summary extraction system
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Bharati Vidyapeeth Deemed University, Katraj, Pune 411 043, India
Authors with affiliations: Deshmukh, S.M., Bharati Vidyapeeth Deemed University, Katraj, Pune 411 043, India; Joshi, S., Bharati Vidyapeeth Deemed University, Katraj, Pune 411 043, India
Abstract: In this paper we put forth a prototype system for video summary extraction, specially aimed towards the domestic videos captured by camcorders and web earns. The approach involves feature extraction and shot boundary detection. The features extracted for measurement are in YUV colour space. The robust YUV color histogram technique is used. The shot boundaries are detected based on the cosine similarity measure. A novel threshold setting mechanism is proposed based on the median value of the observed cosine dissimilarity measure, by which the manual role is completely eliminated. The key-frames are rendered in a standard story board format. The compact summary of video enhances user interaction. The proposed method has been validated experimentally on a small collection of AVI videos. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Sarkar K., Bandyopadhyay S.
Title: Generating short summary from a document set
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, Kolkata - 700 032, India
Authors with affiliations: Sarkar, K., Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, Kolkata - 700 032, India; Bandyopadhyay, S., Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, Kolkata - 700 032, India
Abstract: Short summaries are useful for users who only need information on the main topics in a set of documents. This paper discusses an approach to generating a short summary from a set of related documents by grouping the salient meaningful units smaller than sentences, which are automatically identified by an algorithm proposed by us. Generating short summary from a document is more challenging in the sense that it must take care of two important factors: (1) Identification of the most important topic central to all documents in the set. (2) Representing the central topic within a given summary length restriction. In this paper our approach addresses both of the above factors. We have also discussed a subject identification module, a knowledge poor named entity recognition module, shallower approach based cross-document co-reference resolution module as the parts of the preprocessing phase of our work. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Abdul Nazeer K.A., Abdul Haleem P.P.
Title: Standardization of unstructured textual data into semantic web format
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: National Institute of Technology, Calicut 673 601, India
Authors with affiliations: Abdul Nazeer, K.A., National Institute of Technology, Calicut 673 601, India; Abdul Haleem, P.P., National Institute of Technology, Calicut 673 601, India
Abstract: Analysis done on the nature of the data posted on the WWW (World Wide Web) reveal that more than 80% of the data over the WWW is in unstructured text format. Hence extracting information from text is of paramount importance both for academic and business purposes. Simultaneously, evolution of web technology led to the novel concept of Semantic Web, which is an extension of the current web in which information is given well-defined meaning, enabling computers and people to work in cooperation in a better way. Integration of voluminous, legacy text data that are unstructured and semistructured, into Semantic Web format is a challenging and daunting task for the research commu nity. This paper is an attempt to marry the concept of Semantic Web format with unstructured text, thus to enable the computers to discover the previously unknown information, by automatically extracting infor mation from different written resources. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Extracting information; Novel concept; Semi-structured; Text data; Text format; Textual data; Web technologies; World Wide Web; Artificial intelligence

Authors: Narayan A., Barai S.V.
Title: Parallel genetic algorithms for structural optimization
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, Kharagpur - 721 302, India
Authors with affiliations: Narayan, A., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, Kharagpur - 721 302, India; Barai, S.V., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, Kharagpur - 721 302, India
Abstract: With the use of computer aided search tools like genetic algorithms solutions to non-linear structural optimization problems can be obtained easily and efficiently. The ever-growing need for more powerful computational resources has led to the parallelization of conventional genetic algorithm. This paper presents two versions of genetic algorithms in parallel processing environment. The first version has independent populations thriving at each node. The second version further incorporates a migration scheme in which fitter elements migrate between the nodes after specified generations. Complete codes applicable to the parallel setup of PARAM 10000 have been developed, incorporating latest proposals for selection and constraint handling. A comparative study has been carried out for the singly reinforced beam cost optimization according to Indian Standards. An extension of the second version, which is independent from pre-specification of mutation and crossover rates, has also been discussed. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Comparative studies; Computational resources; Computer aided; Constraint handling; Cost optimization; Crossover rates; Migration scheme; Parallel genetic algorithms; Parallel processing; Parallelizations; Reinforced beams; Search tools; Structural optimization problems; Artificial intelligence; Structural optimization; Genetic algorithms

Authors: Suribabu C.R., Neelakantan T.R.
Title: Reliability constrained optimal design of water distribution networks by genetic algorithm
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: School of Civil Engineering, SASTRA Deemed University, Thanjavur 613 402, India
Authors with affiliations: Suribabu, C.R., School of Civil Engineering, SASTRA Deemed University, Thanjavur 613 402, India; Neelakantan, T.R., School of Civil Engineering, SASTRA Deemed University, Thanjavur 613 402, India
Abstract: Water distribution network is an important urban hydraulic infrastructure, which requires huge capital and maintenance costs. Selection of size of pipes, pumps and other components by trial and error method generally leads to poor uneconomical design. This kind of problem can be handled effectively by using optimization techniques like genetic algorithm (GA). Water distribution networks can fail to satisfy the intended mission due to pipe breakages. The probability of occurrence of link failure and capacity to supply the designed demand during link failure can be represented as a measure of reliability of the network at the planning stage and in optimal design. In the present work, a new reliability measure is proposed and demonstrated through a GA based optimization method for design of urban water distribution network with reliability constraints in the selection of size of the links. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Srinivasa K.G., Venugopal K.R., Patnaik L.M.
Title: A self-adaptive migration model genetic algorithms for data mining applications
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, University Visvesvaraya, Bangalore - 560001, India; Microprocessor Applications Laboratory, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore - 560012, India
Authors with affiliations: Srinivasa, K.G., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, University Visvesvaraya, Bangalore - 560001, India; Venugopal, K.R., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, University Visvesvaraya, Bangalore - 560001, India; Patnaik, L.M., Microprocessor Applications Laboratory, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore - 560012, India
Abstract: Data mining involves the process of extracting nontrivial knowledge or hidden patterns from large databases. Genetic Algorithms are efficient and robust searching and optimization methods that are used in data mining. In this paper we propose a Self-Adaptive Migration Model GA (SAMGA), where parameters of population size, the number of points of crossover and mutation rate for each population are adaptively fixed. Further, the migration of individuals between populations is decided dynamically. This paper gives a mathematical schema analysis of the method stating and showing that the algorithm exploits previously discovered knowledge for a more focused and concentrated search of heuristically high yielding regions while simultaneously per-forming a highly explorative search on the other regions of the search space. The effective performance of the algorithm is then shown using standard testbed functions and a set of actual classification problems. Michigan style of classifier was used to build the classifier and the system was tested with machine learning databases of Pima Indian Diabtese database, Wisconsin Breast Cancer database and few others. The performance of our algorithm is better than others. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Ramachandra Rao K., Saini N.
Title: Finding shortest paths in transportation networks using evolutionary algorithms
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, Hauz Khas, New Delhi-110 016, India
Authors with affiliations: Ramachandra Rao, K., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, Hauz Khas, New Delhi-110 016, India; Saini, N., Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, Hauz Khas, New Delhi-110 016, India
Abstract: Shortest path problems have been studied extensively in the context of transportation network applications. The nature of link costs often decides the type of problem. In situations where there are variations in the level of congestion during a certain time of the day in urban road networks, it is often the case that simple shortest paths are irrelevant. Path information will be useful in situations where route guidance is needed. In this paper, stochastic and time dependent link costs are considered. It is also well established that these types of problems are computationally intractable using the traditional shortest path algorithms. Also in this paper, the application of evolutionary algorithm is explored to overcome the computational intractability in finding the paths. Implementation of the algorithm on randomly generated networks of various sizes show that computing times are a bit high for their use in route guidance. However, the real life implementation of the algorithm needs to be explored further. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Link cost; Route guidance; Shortest path; Shortest path algorithms; Shortest path problem; Time dependent; Transportation network; Urban road networks; Artificial intelligence; Evolutionary algorithms; Transportation routes; Graph theory

Authors: Kolekar M.H., Sengupta S.
Title: A concept-oriented hierarchical framework for news video classification, indexing and browsing
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering Department, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur-721302, West Bengal, India
Authors with affiliations: Kolekar, M.H., Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering Department, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur-721302, West Bengal, India; Sengupta, S., Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering Department, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur-721302, West Bengal, India
Abstract: This paper presents a four-layered, event-driven hierarchical framework for generic news video classification. The news video classifications are based on a few popular audio and video content analysis techniques like short-time energy and Zero Crossing Rate (ZCR) for audio and Hidden Markov Model (HMM) based techniques for video, using color and motion as features. The proposed framework has been successfully tested with TV news video sequences. Our results are very promising. The proposed framework is well suited for video indexing and browsing. We have used top- down hierarchical approach, which permits us to avoid shot detection and clustering and consequently improves the classification performance. This has created the great opportunity for supporting more powerful video search engines. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Moura I., Sarma V.V.S.
Title: Multiagent system and imitative consciousness
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Automation, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore 560 094, India
Authors with affiliations: Moura, I., Department of Computer Science and Automation, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore 560 094, India; Sarma, V.V.S., Department of Computer Science and Automation, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore 560 094, India
Abstract: This paper aims to improve an existing framework for implementing agent consciousness exposing an introspection-based feature. We extend the framework to a multiagent platform and implement an imitation process based 011 a similar mechanism to the introspection. Both orthogonal approaches are then set together leading to a model where leader and follower reach optimal efficiency after a few runs. We then discuss the constraints and opportunities to merge both features in a single agent, and thus show how the framework could support a roadmap towards the implementation of the self. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Imitation process; Multi-agent platforms; Optimal efficiency; Roadmap; Single-agent; Artificial intelligence; Multi agent systems

Authors: Riba M., Deka J.K.
Title: Variable ordering of BDDs using genetic algorithm
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: IPolicy Networks Pvt. Ltd., Noida, U.P. - 201305, India; Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati, Assam - 781039, India
Authors with affiliations: Riba, M., IPolicy Networks Pvt. Ltd., Noida, U.P. - 201305, India; Deka, J.K., Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati, Assam - 781039, India
Abstract: Binary Decision Diagrams(BDDs) are very useful data structure for representing and manipulating Boolean functions. More specifically, they form a data structure with an associated set of algorithms which are very useful for formal specification and verification of digital circuits and other system that can be represented as a finite state transition system. However, the size of the BDD representing these functions is highly dependent on the choice of variable ordering of the function variables, and to find a good variable ordering is an NP-Complete problem. In this paper we present a Genetic Algorithm (GA) based approach, where we evaluate the fitness values of individuals parallely, as a possible solution towards finding good variable orderings that reduces the sizes of BDDs. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Finite-state transition systems; Fitness values; Formal specification and verification; Function variables; Good variables; Variable ordering; Artificial intelligence; Binary decision diagrams; Boolean functions; Computational complexity; Genetic algorithms

Authors: Verma V., Ghosh D.
Title: Hand gesture reconstruction and animation
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati, India
Authors with affiliations: Verma, V., Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati, India; Ghosh, D., Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati, India
Abstract: In case of deaf and dumb persons, hand gestures are generally used to convey message in the form of sign language. Therefore, to communicate with a deaf and dumb person, a normal human requires to have some knowledge about the sign language and should be able to make the sign language gestures. In this paper, we present a method for synthesizing hand gestures with the help of computer which may enable a normal person to convey message to a hearing impaired person more easily without any knowledge of sign language. The proposed technique requires to train the system prior to its operation. Training involves extraction of quantitative description for every sign in the dictionary from a typical gesture sequence representing the sign. The process includes hand parameter calculation for every pose in a gesture sequence which is obtained using information like position of fingers, location of metacarpophalangeal joints of fingers and the bent angles of the fingers. Once trained, the system is now ready for gesture synthesis during which a desired sign is created by animating the corresponding gesture sequence using the information obtained in training. In our experiment, we demonstrate gesture animation with hand pose exactly same as the real gesture. Thus, our proposed technique for hand gesture animation will provide a platform for interaction between normal persons and deaf and dumb persons. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Bent angle; Gesture animation; Hand gesture; Hand pose; Hearing-impaired persons; Metacarpophalangeal joints; Parameter calculation; Quantitative description; Sign language; Artificial intelligence; Audition; Information use; Animation

Title: A novel optimal regulator: Neural network based computational intelligence
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005

Authors with affiliations: Murthy, G.R., International Institute of Information Technology, Gachibowli, Hyderabad 500019, AP, India
Abstract: A novel optimal regulator problem associated with a time varying linear system is formulated. A novel method of solving the two point boundary value problem that commonly arises is discovered and formalized. It is shown that the optimal control vectors constitute the stable states of a neural network. Utilizing the relationship between neural networks and error correcting codes [1], by treating a time varying communication channel as a linear filter, optimal signals code-words are shown to constitute the stable states of associated neural network. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors with affiliations: Shahid, M., Aeronautical Development Establishment, Bangalore-560093, India; Gupta, S., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur-208016, India
Abstract: Multisensor Image registration is needed in large number of Applications. Image registration is basically establishing correspondence between images of the same scene. In this paper, we are exploiting Mutual information based statistical measure for fine image registration of surveillance Images. Images are coarse registered using sensor parameters. For multisensor surveillance images contour based image registration can not be applied,since contour information is not preserved. In addition to image registration, we propose objective evaluation of image fusion quality using image fusion quality performance measures. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Title: Artificial neural network model for pressure gradient gas-liquid pipe flow
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Chemical Engineering Division, Institute of Chemical Technology, University of Miunbai, Matimga, Miunbai (Bombay) - 400019, India
Authors with affiliations: Mankar, J., Chemical Engineering Division, Institute of Chemical Technology, University of Miunbai, Matimga, Miunbai (Bombay) - 400019, India; Bhagwat, S., Chemical Engineering Division, Institute of Chemical Technology, University of Miunbai, Matimga, Miunbai (Bombay) - 400019, India
Abstract: Artificial neural network was used to develop a model for the pressure gradient based on published data. Reynolds number of gas phase (ReG). Reynolds number of liquid phase (ReL) and the liquid hold-up (£L) were used as input parameters. The optimum topology of artificial neural network was found to be 3-5-1 i.e. 3 input neurons. 5 hidden layer neurons and 1 output neuron. The average quadratic error (AQE). mean squared error (MSE) and mean absolute relative residual (MARR) for the optimum architecture were found to be 0.000083. 0.0001 and 1.2% respectively. The proposed artificial neural network model fail's better than most of the available models. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Poleswara Rao K. V.N., Ghosh D.
Title: Facial expression recognition using hidden markov models
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati, India
Authors with affiliations: Poleswara Rao K., V.N., Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati, India; Ghosh, D., Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati, India
Abstract: Perceptual interface plays an important role in Human Com puter Interaction (HCI) and its aim is to develop computer systems ca pable of interacting with humans in an intelligent way. Recognizing facial expressions from video is one of the challenging research topics in this area. In this paper, we present a real time approach to emotion recogni tion from a video sequence by determining facial expression parameters from motion of few selected key points in the whole face. We propose to employ Kanade Lukas Tomasi feature point tracker to track the motion of these key points in the video sequence. The parameters derived from facial feature point displacements are used as input to a Hidden Markov Model (HMM) based pattern classifier. This approach for facial gesture recognition is person independent as demonstrated in our experiment. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Narasimhan S., Sen S., Konar A.
Title: Application of neural networks to biological data mining for automatic species identification
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Jadavpur University, Kolkata - 700032, India
Authors with affiliations: Narasimhan, S., Jadavpur University, Kolkata - 700032, India; Sen, S., Jadavpur University, Kolkata - 700032, India; Konar, A., Jadavpur University, Kolkata - 700032, India
Abstract: The paper aims at designing a scheme for automatic identification of a species from its genome sequence. A set of 64 three-tuple keywords is first generated using the four types of bases: A. T, C and G. These keywords are searched on N randomly sampled genome sequences, each of a given length (10,000 elements) and the frequency count for each of the 43=64 keywords is performed to obtain a DNA-descriptor for each sample. Principal Component analysis is then employed on the DNA-descriptors for N sampled instances. The principal component analysis yields a unique feature descriptor for identifying the species from its genome sequence. The variance of the descriptors for a given genome sequence being negligible, the proposed scheme finds extensive applications in automatic species identification. Next, a computational map is trained by the Self-Organizing Feature Map algorithm using the DNA- descriptors from different species as the training inputs. The map is shown to provide an easier technique for recognition and classification of a species based on its genomic data. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Automatic identification; Biological data mining; Descriptors; Frequency counts; Genome sequences; Genomic data; Self-organizing feature map; Species identification; Unique features; Artificial intelligence; Automation; Conformal mapping; DNA; Principal component analysis; Self organizing maps; Genetic engineering

Authors: Biswas J., Saha D., Chowdhury N.
Title: A method for secure query processing in mobile databases
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, Jadavpur, Kolkata -32, India
Authors with affiliations: Biswas, J., Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, Jadavpur, Kolkata -32, India; Saha, D., Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, Jadavpur, Kolkata -32, India; Chowdhury, N., Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, Jadavpur, Kolkata -32, India
Abstract: A method for secure query processing in mobile databases has been presented in this paper. Mobile devices send queries to the server via point-to- point channels. The mobile database server computes the superset of results of several similar queries, which is broadcast on a large bandwidth broadcast channel. The mobile devices tune to that channel to retrieve their necessary in- formation. Here the senders of all the said queries can view not only the result of their own query but also the results of others5 queries in the same group. This is not desirable, since some user can maliciously view the results of queries sent by some other user. In this paper, we have proposed a method that would not allow any user to do so, although the results of multiple queries are being sent in the same broadcast channel which is accessible to all users. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Broadcast channels; Mobile database; Multiple queries; Artificial intelligence; Broadcasting; Mobile devices; Query processing; Query languages

Title: Text-dependent writer identification using word length analysis
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, North Guwahati, Guwaliati-781039, Assam, India
Authors with affiliations: Mahadeva Prasanna, S., Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, North Guwahati, Guwaliati-781039, Assam, India; Goel, A., Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, North Guwahati, Guwaliati-781039, Assam, India; Samant, A., Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, North Guwahati, Guwaliati-781039, Assam, India
Abstract: Tins paper proposes a method for person authentication using hand-writing as a biometric feature. The present study focuses on text-dependent writer identification. Length of written words is used as a feature for building the writer identification system. A method is proposed for finding the word lengths from the handwritten data. The proposed method is then used for segmenting the handwritten data into words. The comparison of word lengths is made for the training and test data. The writer of the training data for whom the comparison error is least is identified as the writer of the test data. Hie proposed method works well when the number of writers in the database is less and shows a graceful degradation as the number of writers increases. Further, the data collected in different sessions seem to give poor performance. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Abstract: A fuzzy logic controller (FLC) has been designed to predict material removal rate and surface roughness of the components machined by the electro chemical process. To establish logical relationship between antecedent and consequent variables of the process, experiments were performed using a dual pole tool and results of these experiments were used to prepare the rule base for the FLC. Initial design of FLC was fine- tuned using genetic algorithms (GA) and results from optimized FLC were compared with experimental observations. It was found that predictions from GA optimized FLC were more close to experimental results than the simple FLC. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Verma B., Jain S.
Title: A spatial domain robust non-oblivious watermarking scheme for image database
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005

Authors with affiliations: Verma, B., Department of Information Technology, Samrat Ashok Technological Institute, Vidisha, M.P., India; Jain, S., Department of Information Technology, Samrat Ashok Technological Institute, Vidisha, M.P., India
Abstract: A robust spatial domain non-oblivious digital image watermarking technique for Image databases is proposed in this paper. The watermark is embedded in image database without affecting its perceptual quality. The proposed method considers the whole image database as a single entity to watermark instead of watermarking individual images. Watermark is divided into equal size partitions and each partition is embedded in one image of the database. Whenever possible the watermark fragment is embedded repeatedly into an image and on the receiver side most likely among decoded value of repeated watermark fragment is chosen. This gives added security against noise. The method is robust to various image processing operations such as median filtering, low-pass filtering, lossy JEPG image compression, and various geometrical attack such as rotation, scaling, cropping. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Digital image watermarking; Equal sizes; Geometrical attacks; Image database; Low-pass filtering; Median filtering; Perceptual quality; Processing operations; Spatial domains; Watermarking schemes; Artificial intelligence; Image compression; Median filters; Watermarking; Image watermarking

Title: Virtual enterprise over COBMAF: A CORBA based multi agent framework

Abstract: The paper proposes COBMAF: A new framework for a heterogeneous multi agent system using CORBA. This framework offers programming interfaces, performatives and messaging primitives to application developers and also allows encapsulation of agents into CORBA application objects, share heterogeneous databases and locate agents. The agents build using the framework interact using performatives based 011 standard FIPA ACL. This interaction can be competitive or cooperative depending 011 the nature of the distributed application. The framework allows interoperation between systems both at application and at semantic and knowledge levels. The proposal is demonstrated with an example of a Virtual Enterprise called Virtual Automobile Manufacturing Enterprise (VAME) as multi agent distributed application. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Vishnuvardhan P., Ghosh D.
Title: Semiautomatic technique for semantic video object extraction using watershed algorithm and motion tracking
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati, India
Authors with affiliations: Vishnuvardhan, P., Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati, India; Ghosh, D., Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati, India
Abstract: Semantic Video Object (SVO) extraction is an essential part in content based video processing. In this paper, we present a novel semiautomatic technique for semantic video object extraction that of fers high computational efficiency. First, supervised spatial segmenta tion technique is employed to extract the SVO boundary from the initial frame. The algorithm used is user interactable, efficient and less com plex due to the proposed simple region assignment procedure. The SVO boundary obtained in the first frame is tracked in subsequent frames us ing motion estimation and warping procedures. A boundary adjustment step is also proposed to deal with nonrigid motion of the SVO. Visual inspection of experimental results shows that the extracted video objects are of good quality. Thus, our proposed modified video object extraction algorithm may be useful in real time processing for many real world video applications. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Title: Application of artificial neural network for form finding of tensegrity structures
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005

Abstract: 'Tensegrity' is a relatively new concept, which has led to the creation of amazing lightweight and adaptable structures, giving the impression of a cluster of struts floating in the air. This paper presents application of neural network for form finding of a simplex type tensegrity structure. A software programme is developed in MATLAB to obtain form finding of the same structure using force density method. The results are compared and found same in both the cases. But, it is observed that computer program needs a lot of iterations and becomes inefficient and time consuming where as use of neural network makes the whole process efficient and time saving. Authors: Bedi P., Kaur H.
Title: Using fuzzy clustering to determine trust based recommendations
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, University of Delhi, Delhi - 110007, India; Department of Computer Science, Hans Raj College, University of Delhi, Delhi - 110007, India
Authors with affiliations: Bedi, P., Department of Computer Science, University of Delhi, Delhi - 110007, India; Kaur, H., Department of Computer Science, Hans Raj College, University of Delhi, Delhi - 110007, India
Abstract: Recommender systems have come into existence to help users identify information or products most likely to be interesting to them. These systems use the similarity between user and recommenders or between items to form recommendation list for user without taking social trust network into consideration. We have proposed a model where a trust network exists between peer agents and recommendations are generated on basis of these trust relationships as well as similarity. The peer agents give recommendations in form of an Intuitionistic Fuzzy Set, using which they can specify the extent to which they are satisfied with product, not satisfied and how much uncertainty is there in their recommendation. Then, rather than taking all the recommendations into consideration, clustering technique is used to select the representative recommendations, which reduces the number of recommendations to be processed in order to arrive at products list that may be of interest to user. Copyright © IICAI 2005.
Index Keywords: Clustering techniques; Intuitionistic fuzzy sets; Peer agents; Trust networks; Trust relationship; Artificial intelligence; Fuzzy sets

Title: Real time vision-based control of a carom playing robot
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Electronics and Communication, College of Engineering, Guindy Aima University, Chennai (Madias), India

Abstract: Visual perception is being used increasingly in mobile robot naviga tion and the control of robot manipulators. This paper discusses the system de sign aspects of a carom playing robot using visual perception. Images of the carom board are captured using a low cost camera. These images are processed to identify the features of the carom board and the positions of the corns hi pixel coordinates. These coordinates are given as inputs for an algorithm that by exhaustively computing straight line paths determines the position and ori entation required for the robot to execute the shot. Control signals are accord ingly generated to acmate an ami with 4 Degrees of Freedom. The whole sys-tem has been built around low cost components. After integrating the complete system, detailed trials were earned out to determine performance and the re sults have been presented. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Attarwala A., Chidambaram M.
Title: Artificial neural networks based model predictive control of unstable systems
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Chemical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai (Madras) - 600036, India
Authors with affiliations: Attarwala, A., Department of Chemical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai (Madras) - 600036, India; Chidambaram, M., Department of Chemical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai (Madras) - 600036, India
Abstract: A non linear Model Predictive Controller (MPC) based on Artificial Neural Networks (ANN) is proposed for the control of a non linear open loop unstable SISO process. The system considered is an exothermic CSTR having multiple steady states. A non linear MPC is used for controlling the reactor at one of the steady states, which is unstable. For the desisn of non linear MPC. ANN is developed by obtaining input output data from the plant model equations. For this purpose a suitable artificial neural network (ANN) architecture is selected and is trained to compute one step-ahead predictions of plant's output. Further, a linear MPC based on the transfer function of the plant is developed. This controller stabilizes the linearized plant model but is unable to control the actual plant characterized by the non linear equations. In final analysis, results obtained for simulation of the non linear MPC and PID controllers demonstrate the superiority of non linear MPC control law. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Title: An efficient fuzzy based neuro - Genetic algorithm for stock market prediction
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, College of Engineering, University Visvesvaraya, Bangalore - 560001, India; Microprocessor Applications Laboratory, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore - 560012, India

Abstract: Stock market prediction is a complex and tedious task that involves the processing of large amounts of data, that are stored in ever growing databases. The vacillating nature of the stock market requires the use of data mining techniques like clustering for stock market analysis and prediction. Genetic algorithms and neural networks have the ability to handle complex data and are immune to noise in the input. In this paper, we propose a fuzzy based neuro-genetic algorithm - Fuzzy based Evolutionary Approach to Self Organizing Map(FEASOM) to cluster stock market data. Genetic algorithms are used to train the Kohonen network for better and effective prediction. The algorithm was tested on real stock market data of companies like Intel, General Motors, Infosys, Wipro, Microsoft, IBM, etc. The algorithm consistently outperformed regression model, backpropagation algorithm and Kohonen network in predicting the stock market values. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Singh V., Agrawal T., Singh V.
Title: An intelligent approach for prediction of refractory life in steel plant
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: T-301 Sarkeys Energy Center, Mewbourne School of Petroleum and Geological Engineerin, University of Oklahoma, 100 E. Boyd St., Norman, OK 73019-1003, United States; GT Hostel, Tata Steel, RoomNo.-19, Jamshedpur, Jharkhand, India

Abstract: The changing trend in world steel making scenario, from an open hearth type to LD (Lenz and Donawitz) steel making coupled with the increasing demand for cleaner and better steel, saw the introduction of more and more secondary steel processes. Tata Steel being the one of the global leaders in steel making has installed world's most modern secondary steel making units. In the run of improving technology, the major threat posed, was the cost of consumables. The present project is a successful effort of reducing cost of refractory by predicting life through intelligent methods. This study is about refractory losses in RH (Ruhrstahi Heraus) vessel at Tata Steel that is one of the most important units at the steel plant. On first stage, twenty-five most relevant parameters were identified which were supposed to affect the life of refractory in the RH vessel. These parameters were continuously observed for one year and data was collected. Different types of statistical analysis were performed to find out the co-relation between the parameters and the refractory life. Finally, Artificial Neural Network and Fuzzy methods were applied. After comparing different intelligent algorithms, a Neuro-fuzzv model has been suggested. This WW J WW model has successfully predicted the life of refractor}7 in the RH vessel. This work is a unique interfacing of metallurgy and refractory7 engineering and can be helpful in improving the refractor}7 performance in the Steel and other metallurgical plants worldwide. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Abstract: This paper browses through some well-known meta-heuristic search strategies, and briefly discusses some of their recent applications to the VLSI layout design process. It starts with very brief description of the different phases of VLSI layout design, and a brief overview of Meta-Heuristic search strategies. Since most of the VLSI layout design problems are hard optimization problems, the concept of NP-hardness for such problems is next explained along with the various algorithmic frame-works to solve them. Four selected well-known meta-heuristic strategies, namely, Simulated Annealing, Genetic Algorithm, Tabu Search and Ant Colony Optimization are next explained, followed a comparison of these methods. Next, selected applications of these meta-heuristics to VLSI layout design are discussed. Some of their advanced variants and different hybridization techniques, adopted for superior result, are also discussed to highlight the recent research trends in meta-heuristics. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Sajja P.
Title: Multi layer knowledge based system: A multi agent approach
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005

Authors with affiliations: Sajja, P., GH Patel PG Department of Computer Science and Technology, Sardar Patel University, Vallabh Vidyanagar 388 120, India
Abstract: Modern Database Management System (DBMS) with its rich semantics supports multimedia representation, handles complex data & transactions, offers user friendliness and is widely applicable but it can support only precise and unambiguous data. Knowledge Based System (KBS) can process weak implications and behave in an intelligent manner. The KBS besides its typical advantages may be aided with the proper inference to create, use and maintain knowledge for future purposes and documentation. This article proposes a hybrid model combining desirable features of DBMS and KBS in layered systems. The proposed model considers independent detachable agents as one/more layers into a Multi layer structure of a KBS to achieve advantages of intelligent behavior and advantages offered by DBMS. At the end, a multi layer multi agent business advisory system for small-scale industries to increase employment in rural area is discussed. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Title: Web search using personalized user conceptual index
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005

Abstract: The Web is a large collection of semi-structured and structured information sources. Web users often suffer from information overload. To alleviate this problem, personalization becomes a popular remedy to customize the Web environment for users and help them search their information need easily. To improve user searching in the World Wide Web, we have proposed a system that supports user searches by learning about user preferences and by observing responses to prior search experiences aided by a new index called the User conceptual index or User co-ordination index (UCI). The initial set of work explained in this paper is directly focused on how to develop an effective personalized profile of a user's search goals in order to aid future search with the help of the UCI. Authors: Sharma R., Gopal M.
Title: A safe and consistent game-theoretic controller for nonlinear systems
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, Hauz Khas, New Delhi-110016, India; Netaji Subhas Institute of Teclmology, Azad Hind Fauz Marg, Dwarka, New Delhi-110045, India
Authors with affiliations: Sharma, R., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, Hauz Khas, New Delhi-110016, India, Netaji Subhas Institute of Teclmology, Azad Hind Fauz Marg, Dwarka, New Delhi-110045, India; Gopal, M., Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, Hauz Khas, New Delhi-110016, India
Abstract: The paper presents a novel algorithm based on game theory for optimizing controllers in presence of additive exogenous disturbances and parametric uncertainties of the controlled plant. The problem of controller design has been framed as a zero-sum Markov game between the controller and the disturber (disturbances). The proposed algorithm employs an 'annealed1 combination, of a variation of the 'cautious fictitious play' approach and the 'min-max5 solution methodology, for generating an optimal policy via a simple linear program. In Reinforcement Learning (RL) paradigm, controller optimization is done either in the Markov Decision Process (MDP) framework that assumes not only a stationary environment but is also inadequate for modeling noise and disturbances or the solution approach, which is computationally demanding and at times, even infeasible. The proposed approach generates a 'safe' and 'universally consistent' controller, by using a hybridization of the min-max strategy and a variation of cautious fictitious play. We empirically evaluate the approach on (i) Inverted Pendulum swing-up and, (ii) Non-holonomic Mobile Robot control tasks and compare its performance against standard O learning. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Authors: Iyer P., Singh A.
Title: Document similarity analysis for a plagiarism detection system
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd Indian International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, IICAI 2005
Affiliations: Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad, India
Authors with affiliations: Iyer, P., Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad, India; Singh, A., Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad, India
Abstract: Plagiarism is the act of assuming credit for work not composed by one. Plagiarism is on the rise in academic institutions, facilitated by the easy access to assignments and research papers on the Internet. Preventing plagiarism is possible only through the formulation of appropriate academic policies, since the law protects only copyright the expression of ideas, and not the ideas themselves. We studied the plagiarism detection tools commonly employed by various universities. We altered the existing techniques to detect document similarity to make our system robust to minor semantic modifications at the sentence level. We also developed an efficient implementation of the same. Preliminary experiments have revealed that our system is able to reasonably identify cases of true plagiarism and also distinguish these from cases of incidental document overlap. Copyright © IICAI 2005.

Title: Some studies on camera calibration and image processing for mobile robot navigation
